Reviews: The office is very clean. The staff is very friendly and I was seen in a timely manner. The nurse practitioner, Stephanie that saw me was kind and very helpful. She answered listened to all my concerns and answered all the questions I had.
Everyone is so nice and caring. I had 2 horrible experiences with 2 other doctors offices so I was really scared but they treated me with kindness and they were very gentle. Love this place.

Dr Valenzuela is amazing, I highly recommend her. She made me feel comfortable and gave me honest feedback when other doctors in the past gave me the run around or not enough information. I've mainly been to the Chino Hills location , the entire staff has been friendly since day 1!

I HATE THIS PLACE. Â I really do. The facility is nice, and they're able to get you in in a timely fashion. Â The staff is nice.. Those are the pros.The receptionist had my insurance information but wanted to see the physical card rather than actually just verifying my name. She has more information about my insurance than my insurance card would have had. Asked my husband to email the card while I was there: it was in vein. I was there to remove an arm implant for birth control. They wanted a urine sample to determine if I was pregnant. They never told me they needed a sample.. I just voided my bladder 10 minutes prior. What's the point? I'm here to REMOVE BC. If I was pregnant were they going to leave it in my arm? Of course not. If I'm not pregnant, you're still going to remove it. Just say you want a reason to bill my insurance for extra items. I would have respected that. Then their consent form that clearly no one reads, including them. I disagreed because I didn't want to be video taped or photographed. One of the Dr's said I don't have permission to record in the office. I told her that's NOT at all what this says. It said "I agree to be video taped, photographed or filmed...." Â this is the 3rd and final time I'm dealing with their incompetence.*previous appointment was they needed to test my breast milk. The sample collected was insufficient and I never received the results I needed. That was a waste of time, breast milk, and lab testing. *** 1st appointment with them was when I was pregnant. I had several questions. They were giving me answers, but not answering my questions. I even re-worded my questions, and she would say the same thing. Â I immediately left and found a midwife for my prenatal care.I don't need nice staff if you're unable to address my concerns and questions to my satisfaction about my health. At this point I wouldn't trust them with a mosquitoe bite.

I am currently 32 Â weeks pregnant. My husband and I switched to Care for Women after moving to the area. I was already half way through my pregnancy. I have been seen by Dr. Vu for all my appointments so far. She is always so positive. She is very attentive and not in any rush. She answers any questions that I had and makes sure to ease any concerns I had.

I was checked out NP Cynthia Raymond & a student (didnt get a name) and they were both angels! They made me feel very comfortable and seen, especially for my first time going. I voiced my concerns or any questions I had and Raymond didn't hesitate to answer or make me feel dumb about it at all! They were the best experiences i've had with any doctor.
Not the best experience. Called them ten times and no answer. When i got my appointment, it was 30 minutes waiting for less than five minutes with the doctor.

Great service from checking in to follow up calls. I appreciate the gentle warmth during such a heart breaking season. Thank you for your kindness and time. I didn't feel rushed at my appointment or on my follow up call. Blessings to the staff and medical providers.
Almost no wait time! Incredible! Unheard of any place else. Love meeting my new Obgyn. Their staff is very professional and can be friendly. Thanks for the good first impression.

I've been to this facility several times, all have been fantastic. I wanted to give a shout-out to Lori for all of the care she's given me over the past several months.I got an IUD at this facility and had an anxiety attack prior to the procedure - with severe anxiety disorder, I don't do well with change, and came into this office in shambles. Lori was extremely patient and comforting, throughly walking through all of the steps and benefits from this procedure. She took the time to listen to my concerns and provided a logical and empathetic response. I was the last appointment of the day, and drove myself there. She offered to help me get home if I wasn't feeling well post-procedure. It's obvious that she cares about me/her patients and I hope I can continue to see her for years to come. Big thank you to Lori for being awesome and for the front desk staff for being so thorough and timely.

On balance, this seems to me to be a better way to deliver primary care for several reasons:1. Â appointment and wait times. Â A pet peeve of mine is that a very common experience is to wait for a half hour or more past your appointment time, even though one might make a special effort, as I do, to arrive 15 minutes prior to the scheduled time. Â At the Americana location, I arrived a little over 10 minutes before the appointment, signed in, and was immediately welcomed and checked in.2. Â As with any physician's office, a technician will get some minimal basic information (weight, temperature, pulse, O2 sat.) Â Well, that last one is kinda newish, but standard now in the age of the corona virus. Â They have a fancy kind of gimmicky way of doing that (there's a smartscreen that takes your temp, an electronic scale, and a built-in pulse oximeter, but whatever, it works, and links to your file).3. Â You're taken to an exam room next, where this visit a very skilled (always appreciated) phlebotomist did a blood draw and BP. Â And pulse ox because the fancy gizmo didn't work because my hands were cold from walking from the parking garage. Â The exam room is nice, because it's set up like a comfortable office, not the usual 1960's vibe stainless steel and black pleather look that somehow became the standard.4. Â The killer big screen is kind of a gimmick, but was cool because it did allow Â a more direct interaction with the doctor, without the distracted mediation of the now-ubiquitous iPad. Â So, good on Forward for that.5. Â The interaction with the doctor (I think it was like his first day at Forward, but he was cool) was great. Â Good questions about "wellness", and because of my age, a check for esophageal cancer signs/symptoms (he was cool, and didn't let on that was what he was looking for, so, fine.)Big plusses are we got "quick" bloodwork results during the visit. Â Great to discuss while everything was fresh, and when the glucose level looked a little high, he sent out to Quest for a more accurate test. Â The most amazing part? Â I got an update on that ON THE APP later that day. Â I can't say how much better it is to have that level of transparency and immediate feedback.Well, from the length of this review you can tell that I'm positive about Forward, and look forward (heh) to seeing how it goes for the next year or so. Â I have high expectations, and hope that this does indeed live Â up to its promise as a better way to deliver primary care both for patients and physicians.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I have had many, and i mean many doctors over the past decade. I have never ever received the personalized attention and care as the one I received in my first baseline visit! I was super blown away by the flexibility and the in depth assistance! So efficient, they immediately had results and my assigned doctor, Dr. Tully was informative and caring. Post visit, the app is incredible. You can access results of all tests and can make appointments easily. They have care team online to respond via chat 24hr. They are SO helpful and full of resources. I just got my fiancÃ© to sign up as well as the advantages and benefits are incomparable! Hands down the best doctor experience I've had.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I had a great first baseline visit and was impressed with the amount of time and attention I received. Â Place was clean, I was the only patient scheduled so the Covid risk seemed minimal, all staff were dressed with layers of PPE, I was bedazzled by the equipment, and my assigned doctor, Dr Becketti seemed competent and caring, giving me 45 minutes of undivided attention. Â I got quick responses from my updates through the APP. Â I don't know if I'm speaking too soon, since I read some of the one-star ratings, but so far Forward has exceeded my expectations
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: The staff at the location are really nice and helpful. Even the doctors are great when you actually see them.My issue with them is their App and the service they provide. Their failure to help me secure my medication took over a week and require my constantly following up to make sure it took place.Someone will say they'll send thru a prescription but then you call pharmacy and they don't have it. This went on for DAYS. Â Don't waste your money here. I'm looking into other options like One Medical.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: My baseline visit was great. Â Dr. Lam was warm, engaged, attentive, and informative. Â I am delighted to be working with him and at Forward.Donna P
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I have been floored by the care I have received in just my first 2 visits at Forward in Glendale. Â The care team from reception to the doctors all expressed genuinet joy in being in the business of taking care of people's health. Â From a technology and speed point, Forward is the leading edge offering testing onsite and displayed on touch screens that make it easy to digest and are visually stunning. Â I can't speak highly enough about Dr. Becketti. Â Many thanks to the entire team. I can't recommend Forward Health enough!
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I am not a review leaver, but I tried Forward on a whim and am so glad I have them. I use my HSA to pay for it and it is the best doctor experience I've ever had. Also they just go the extra mile to be sort of a health "assistant" which is really worth it.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Why Forward is so afraid of you reading honest feedback is what you should wonder. This review was flagged and removed and since Forward has a very efficient "social media team", they managed to rip down my reviews of them and I have been asked to elaborate further for the reviews to stay. So here it goes....My ONE star review still stands, and I hope this company don't have magic powers to falsely remove everything negative about them with contacts "higher up". They are a perfect example of a medical practice built by excellent marketers with a complete lack of customer service skills. Take your money and run mentality.I saw their ads everywhere, I got their pamphlet in the mail... I spoke to their scripted salesperson who sounded very much like a scary car-salesman who tried to dodge every one of my questions with canned responses.When speaking to their sales team I continuously asked why I would need Forward when I have PPO and a GP already and all I got was non-specified answers.After trying to push for answers several times about what the membership was actually worth for me the salesperson quickly just turned around and said:"It sounds to me that Forward is not the best solution for you at the moment. It was a pleasure speaking with you and sorry for taking up your time".So, they don't want you to ask questions. They don't want to give you any real straight answers. And if you push for answers, they hang up. Just like one of those robocallers who light up your phone every day.This is not the solution to health care....This is the usual tech-startup charlatans with a sexy webpage, aggressive Facebook / Instagram advertising and canned response sales scripts. They are waiting to grab your money for nothing else than digital snake oil in return.Like many others, these guys will not be around for more than a couple of years.....
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I've been going to forward for a couple months and love it so far. It's so convenient. I can get fast covid tests and antibody tests. I was having skin issues and they were able to diagnosis me on the app and send me prescriptions that way. Very personalized care. This is honestly how medicine should be.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Ok. I see that others have had a positive experience with this company - but we have not! Â WE HAVE MORE THAN HAD IT WITH WHAT WE CAN ONLY ASSUME IS Total INCOMPETENCE. We have tried to contact Forward for 6 months to follow up up on my husband's one and only visit to the Glendale office. At the appointment, their single most important measurement machine WAS NOT WORKING so he did not get the info he signed up and went there in the first place. They never bothered to contact us - and we cannot contact them DIRECTLY because the company can be reached ONLY through a buggy app that DOES NOT WORK FOR US though we downloaded it directly from them; their phone number is NEVER answered. We have phoned and phoned - leaving numerous messages to say that we need their help using their app so we can follow up to get the assessment my husband most needs. After each request for help there is a MESSAGE back saying they called back and left a message, which cannot be: They have two CEL numbers and our land line and there is no record of an incoming call from Forward EVER and our email address - all of which was filled out in detail in the treatment application papers. We signed a six-month contract to pay $149 a month for their 'caring services and personal attention.' Accordingly, my husband has been charged $149 every month FOR NO SERVICE AT ALL. This includes the first visit when their 'machine is broken.' Forward has nullified the contract by failing to provide the service they promised to provide. We have been more than patient with them. I am prepared now to go to file a complaint with the California Consumer Protection Agency for return of the fees we have been charged, report them to the BBB, and anywhere else I can go to file a complaint and perhaps a lawsuit against Forward. I expect that they will answer my review saying that they tried calling us back and left messages. PLEASE KNOW IN ADVANCE YELPERS THAT THEIR ASSERTIONS ARE UNTRUE!
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: If your anything like me you never wanna go for a check up but for the past 5 years dr Andreh Carapiet is the best , he actually cares about his patients and takes the time to listen He will never push you to take medications or do things you will not be happy doing he will listen and give his professional advice and help you come out with a plan to make you feel better and get to goals you have as far as health goes I definitely would recommend him to all my family and friendsI can not forget about the staff they are so personal and helpful with everything thank you
Practice: Internal Medicine, IV Hydration, Urgent Care

Reviews: Dr Garen and the Elevate Health Group are absolutely exceptional. I felt immediately welcome by Ana after entering who was super helpful in getting me setup. Â She was knowledgeable and even notified me of parking behind the facility so I didn't have to pay for the meter! Serj was down to earth and personable. He did a fantastic job of getting me into my screening room where I felt comfortable and excited to meet the Dr (which is a first for me). Dr Garen was amazing. He clearly went over everything we wanted to check to make sure my health was in the most amazing shape possible and did an great job talking me through each physical check he was making and why. That level of transparency made me feel super comfortable and when we took my blood pressure the second time, I was way more relaxed and at ease. Rounding off the team was Valentina. It's clear she is there to make the patients feel comfortable with returning because that's exactly what I plan to do. Even through a mask she was charming and funny, and I appreciate how open she was to just make me and every guest there as comfortable as possible. It didn't end with just the few i mentioned, everyone there is was like a well oiled machine helping each other. You can see and feel the team chemistry and connection. If you are looking for a great doctor, engaging team, and modern tech in a clean environment, Elevate Health Group Glendale is the place to be!!
Practice: Internal Medicine, IV Hydration, Urgent Care

Reviews: Honestly, I was very surprised to find health care providers, especially in Glendale, to be so professional and considerate! I am definitely one of those patients that likes to ask several questions beforehand, and the staff was extremely patient and forthcoming with me, throughout ALLLLL of my inquiries. When I arrived, I was very kindly greeted by the receptionist, and filled out my paperwork. Initially, I was a bit nervous when I saw the number of people waiting in the waiting room, because I just assumed I would be waiting for a lot longer past my appointment time, given my past experiences with other healthcare providers. To my surprise, very shortly after submitting my initial paperwork, I was called back into the evaluation rooms. I was immediately attended to by the nurse, and then within moments, the doctor arrived. Dr. Arazin Minasian was very knowledgable and competent. Â He was diligent and ensured that all my concerns were acknwoledged.Everyone was so professional and helpful. This place is very clean, up-to-date and current, with very knowledgeable staff. Importantly, they DO NOT unnecessarily keep you in the waiting room for hours to be seen (pet peeve). Â They ensure that you are scene shortly after your check-in time. Â I highly recommend anyone looking for new healthcare professionals to check this place out. Thank you, Elevate!
Practice: Internal Medicine, IV Hydration, Urgent Care

Reviews: Amazing service and super clean office! The staff was extremely professional, efficient, and friendly. They were knowledgeable and took the time to answer all my questions. Overall great experience. I highly recommend Elevate Health Group.
Practice: Internal Medicine, IV Hydration, Urgent Care

Reviews: I have battled with finding a good doctor and good office staff for a primary care physician for years. Just when I thought I had found one, my doctor left the state and closed his practice. I didn't know what to do. So, I started my research process. A friend recommended Elevate. I did a little more research and loved their new facility. State of the art, new technology driven sign-up, portal, and get this, a human picks up my phone call! Ha! I was sold. I did research on the multiple providers I could see, and finally choose one, Dr. Carapeit. Dr. Carapeit was amazing and answered all my questions and reviewed labs in detail. I love working in the portal system because I can email my doctor anytime and I get a quick reply. Besides the doctors, the nursing staff is amazing. My favorite nurse, nurse Alina always takes good care of me during my visit. She has been so nice to me, and so sweet. The world should have more nurses who care for their patients, just like Nurse Alina. This place is a one stop shop wellness center. I've even tried their ivy therapy when I wasn't feeling well and it honesty saved the day. Scheduling the ivy therapy was easy as well. I'm so tired of "press option 2 for blah blah blah". I finally have an office that has real kind people to speak with and a doctor and nurse staff that is exceptional. If you're in the market for a new wellness center and physician, just call elevate. Trust me!
Practice: Internal Medicine, IV Hydration, Urgent Care

Reviews: I've been seen at Elevate Health Group a few times now and I've have had only the best experiences. My work requires clearance notes and insurance audits for days off and they have delivered timely and efficiently to not cause any issues with my employer. I was so impressed with their new facility, staff and organization. Given covid times there's plenty of space and proper precautions taken. Ive always been brought into my appointment right on time and had the best experiences with Dr. Tovmassian. Takes his time and makes sure you leave taken care of. My lab work has been done same day painlessly which is a huge plus! Also, found out they have x-ray in office as well as IV vitamin infusions. Very convenient. Â Overall I would recommend this office to my family and friends without a doubt.
Practice: Internal Medicine, IV Hydration, Urgent Care

Reviews: Elite 2021
Practice: Internal Medicine, IV Hydration, Urgent Care

Reviews: Just want to write this review for Leah (Nurse Practitioner). She's been wonderful and communication is amazing, informing you of your health is very important. She follows up on your lab results and refers you to specialist when necessary. If you call her, she will call you back the same day. I would highly recommend her!!!! Thank you Leah! You're the best
Practice: Internal Medicine, IV Hydration, Urgent Care

Reviews: I had a Â surgical procedure scheduled for 2/17. I contacted Elevate and let them know I had all of my labs done and I needed clearance from a doctor to Â fax to my surgeons office. They assured me it was no issue and they could easily take care of it for me and scheduled me to come in for their next available appt.The office is very lovely and the doctor that I saw was incredibly nice. I regrettably had an issue with the front desk however once she was made aware of it the manager, Katia, went above and beyond to apologize and quickly resolve it. I understand that in business sometimes mistakes happen and how we choose to deal with them is what's important. Thank you Elevate for a positive experience! I will be back in the future for any of my needs.
Practice: Internal Medicine, IV Hydration, Urgent Care

Reviews: My primary care physician that I love retired... so I asked my doctor friends for referral. Â Dr. Arazin Minasian came in highly recommended. Â Went to see him & loved him. Â He's young, knowledgeable, thorough & non-judgemental. Â Easy to talk to, and he takes his time to address all my questions & concerns. Â I've referred several of my friends who were seeing the same doctor that retired... and everybody only had positive things to say about Dr. Â Minasian
Practice: Internal Medicine, IV Hydration, Urgent Care

Reviews: I'm such a fan of Carbon Health, and the 55 Pacific Ave is where I go for my primary care. Love the app and love the people! I feel totally cared for and listened to :)

I had Â fifteen minute telehealth consult with a NURSE in February. I just got the bill: $830.00. Â My insurance, which is very good insurance, says they will pay half of it, but $2,500 per HOUR for a nurse consult? OH MY GOD!

My experience at the Carbon Health clinic itself was very good when it came to the medical staff, who were professional and friendly. Â However, I cannot say the same for the front of office people. I came to the clinic to get a COVID test, which was required by my doctor prior to a medical procedure. I filled out and signed a release form for my test result to be sent to my doctor's office in order to be cleared for the procedure to go forward as was scheduled (in less than a week's time.). My doctor never heard from Carbon, so I had to spend time tracking things down between the parties, finally getting Carbon to send the result to my doctor. This isn't the sort of thing for a medical facility to be negligent about. Again, good medical staff. Front office, not so good.

Cool concept, very poor execution. Services went fine, but they are greedy and will attempt to bill you twice like they are currently doing to me. Insurance paid them off long ago (along with my FSA). But they now want another $250 out of pocket for some reason for a regular physician visit and a flu shot? Scammy practice.

Wen there at 4:50 on 11/21 to have tested. They said too late to take walk in and advised to come back next day from 9-11. Cam back next day at 10:40. No one in line. Staffs were watching device but was told that I am too late for walk in. Terrible.

It was my first time going to Carbon Health and I am pleasantly surprised. I absolutely hate making doctors appointments, and haven't had a yearly exam for over 10yrs. I didn't have high hopes coming here, but decided to give it a try after spending hours looking through my providers list. Making an appointment was really easy, you don't have to deal with phone calls, just a quick booking through the app and your done, it is very convenient, quick and easy. Walking through the door you automatically feel welcomed, everyone is super nice and helpful. I went for a yearly exam with Dr. Neeru Singh and she was very knowledgeable, and attentive. Despite the fact that they were running behind on some appointments due to power outages, I never felt rushed. One thing I think they could improve on is making the location easier to find, it's on the side of a building and kind of hidden (trees). Some signs up front on Pacific Ave pointing to where you need to go would be nice. I got lost looking for the location and almost went the wrong way. Overall I am pleased and would definitely comeback, I would recommend.

I LOVE carbon health! I visit the clinic for covid testing or any urgent needs and see Jenny as my primary care in FiDi.Every time I have a health concern I can depend on carbon. Their app is so easy to use and seamless. And I truelly feel they are going above and beyond to meet my needs even through the pandemic! I

I came here to get a medical clearance. This place is nice and clean inside and everyone was so nice. If you are paying out of pocket the prices here are very affordable and costs are listed on the website so you know exactly what you're paying for. I will be using this place again in the future

Avoid using Carbon Health if you want to prevent surprise bills after your visit.I booked an appointment with Carbon (SF) for a routine physical exam. In order to make sure that my lab tests will be fully covered. I confirmed with the receptionist as well as the nurse that my lab tests would be 100% covered as they come under preventive care. But to my surprise, I received a 60$ bill from Quest Labs for some tests that I did not even ask for. Upon contacting the billing department at Carbon, I was told that since some tests were not available at Carbon they sent it to Quest Labs that charged me this bill for a simple lab test which is usually free of cost. BEWARE if you want to avoid being cheated.
Elite 2021

Carlsbad Event Lead for the Covid testing site, Joel Griesbach, should get a bonus and high recognition from Carbon Health! His customer service is off-the-charts amazing and we are incredibly grateful for his support with our safe travels Hawaii testing we completed in Carlsbad. Joel is an outstanding employee who goes above and beyond to give exceptional customer service. Thank you! You are amazing!
Elite 2021

I saw Esther for a routine check up and she was wonderful. I went over my medical history, including my anxiety and mental health, and she was non judgmental and supportive. She took care of me and seemed genuinely interested in my health and well-being. Louise was also soooo nice and funny, what a bright light! Finally, Sabrina is super responsive and helpful, and filled my prescriptions so quickly. Not sure why more people in SF don't realize that carbon health is such a great alternative to One Medical. Carbon Health has all the good attributes with none of the bad!

Easily the worst experience I've had with a doctor. The scheduling part is great - the app is easy to use and getting the appointment wasn't the problem. But don't go here if you want a doctor that cares. The clinician was extremely dispassionate, told me that what I had originally come in for was incorrect but did not proceed to tell me anything else that could help the diagnosis. Just gave me the most generic answer that I could have found on Google. Wouldn't run any other tests. I felt incredibly bad speaking with her, she made me feel worse, and I left almost in tears. They said they would refer me to a specialist but they don't even check which specialists are open and the lady at the front desk had no idea that she had to refer me.

Dr Burrell has been great. Had my first appointment in October where everything was super smooth. Easy to talk with and with the easy to use application, great to see my testing results.Then came the moment where they really shined, when away on an international trip, with a few hours before a scuba trip, Dr Burrell was quick to respond in a matter of hours (after business hours) to get me the needed medical clearance for the trip. Amazing service which I'm super appreciative for and sure that many other doctors offices would of fell short on. Thank you so much!

Elizabeth is awesome! Â She is honestly so caring, attentive and knowledgable. Â She takes the time to listen to every one of your concerns and addresses each in one depth. Â After each visit, she makes sure to check up on you using the Carbon app and sends relevant additional information for you to read. Â I love how non-existent the wait times to see a practitioner are here. Â Scheduling an appointment is also very easy with the Carbon app. I'd highly recommend anyone coming here whether for a quick check-up or for serious issues.

Hella convenient and easy to get in and out. Short stroll in beautiful embarcaero area. Â I love the app and the wonderful group of women that run this soon to be thriving practice. Takes my insurance and pretty much covered everything I asked about... including a wide range of topics around women's health.

Great tech-enabled service. I was in the beta tester group. Onboarding with the app is unbelievably smooth. They found my insurance info automatically, signed the notice with my finger.Â Â I was scheduling my wellness check in 2 minutes.The staff in the clinic and my doctor, Greg Burrell, were all very friendly. The waiting room and the exam room are clean, but not that different than a traditional private practice. Being able to manage everything from your phone is the killer feauture.

Absolute disaster. Travel through public transportation over an hour sick on my only day off for the week, for the office to cancel less than half an hour before my visit. When I explained my circumstances, I was told: "Well idk what to tell you... go to Castro or the Emergency Room." Entire week ruined and still sick and uncomfortable.

Created an account just to write a review.Yikes. Between a delay on submitting to insurance, an awkward interaction in the room, taking care of the patient, and just general courtesy, save your time and money and go somewhere else.Let's start at the beginning: Walked in and checked in all fine and dandy. A nurse came out to get me to do the basics on getting my vitals and asking about shots which I agreed to getting (more on that later). The nurse felt almost unsure of herself in what she was doing which you can only imagine what it made me feel. After that, Mr. Burrell came into the room and let me tell you, it was one of the most distant, disconnected, and uninteresting conversations I've ever had with a doctor. I felt like instead of wanting to get to know me and my habits to better evaluate my health, the questions had a feel of "this-is-what-I-learned-to-ask-in-medical-school-and-I-won't-deviate." The discussion was so shallow, I feel like I got absolutely nothing out of it. Nothing.After a less than stellar interaction with the doc, the nurse came back in to do the shots. Usually nurses ask if you're right- or left-hand dominant and do the shot in the opposite arm so you can write and go on about your life with minimal impact. Well, not this time. I'm left-handed but thank you for assuming that I'm right-handed like the majority of the world. I wasn't able to write let alone type for a day and a half. Wonderful...As if that wasn't already enough, once the appointment was over (finally) the nurse had left the room with not so much as waiting for me to gather my things or AT LEAST giving directions to the exit. So I spent a good few minutes wandering around the office until I found the exit. It's such a small thing but it greatly impacts the appointment.The next part is my partially bad and I 100% take accountability for my side of it. Because I got NOTHING from this interaction, I decided to go elsewhere for checkups. However, because Carbon is so slow, the other office submitted their claim first and thus got the insurance. I find a nice little invoice from Carbon saying that I'm being charged $200. Okay, I understand if it isn't covered by insurance it's $200 and I wouldn't be mad if I actually got something out of it. However, as stated earlier, I didn't get anything out of if and now I'm stuck for paying $200 for one of the worst experiences I've ever had in a doctor's office.Wow, wow, wow.

I was seen on 2/25/2020 after experiencing dizziness and not feeling well in a manner that I just could not really describe. What I was going through sort of came in waves of feeling ok and then feeling strange with my heart racing/pounding, dizziness and temporal head pain. The LVN, Louise was absolutely amazing in her awareness that she knew something was just not right. She did everything she could to ensure that I was as comfortable as possible. She was sweet and nurturing. She consulted with the clinician, Esther who was equally as wonderful in ensuring I was comfortable, while keeping me calm. They both showed compassion and concern for my well being, they were also calm in their demeanor, which helped me do my best to remain calm, while my blood pressure readings were all over the map. Dr. Caesar Djavaherian monitored me for approximately an hour. During that time, he was absolutely amazing in his kindness, attentiveness and medical decision making. He ran all of the tests that are available within the scope of an urgent care clinic and then recommended that I go to an ER. He talked with me about the pros and cons of going or not going to the ER and together we made the decision that it was better for my safety to go to the ER. I can not say enough good things about the team at Carbon Health that consulted together and demonstrated true teamwork to ensure that my safety mattered more than anything else. THANK YOU to Louise, Esther and Dr. Djavaherian for being so compassionate in providing such amazing care!

I never thought I could a visit to urgent care, but My experience here was just fabulous! I made an appointment after a flare up of some chronic post surgery knee pain that was preventing me from walking. Not only was the appointment extremely easy to make, the online paperwork and questionnaire were so simple. On day of my appointment ( next day btw) I got right in, and the doctor was already up to speed on my problem. He asked a few relevant questions gave me some real useful and non judgmental advice and recommended me to an ortho doctor. I made an appointment at the Ortho for that afternoon and the ortho doctor treated the micro fascia around my knees and like magic I can stand and bend without pain. Dr EJ and Fletcher, you guys have changed my life. I am going to be a happier healthier person because of your amazing care, Thank you!! I have always felt like medicine in the US was horrible for actual preventive care but not here. I can not recommend this place enough.

Da best! Thank you Carbon Health for everything. 5 star experience: ease of booking, office staff, follow up before and after appointment, Dr. Burrell!, communications, referrals to other doctors.Really made healthcare enjoyable and felt like I was in great hands. Dr. Burrell took his time to understand what was going on with me and to help me understand our potential options. I had such peace of mind after visiting him. And plan to see him whenever needed going forward :)Thank you!
Put in all my information including my insurance. Â Appointment was canceled twice. When I went for my appointment turns out my insurance coverage is for urgent care only.

Between the incorrect referrals, the long response times, and the sour attitudes, dealing with Carbon had been a nightmare. It really takes some skill to turn a minor injury into a week long headache, and Carbon has that skill down 100%. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

be mindful of what the patient needs and their situation, needed a referral for an xray for a possible broken foot, and they made me go all the way to their office for a consultation just to get the referral, went to a consultation room and was asked a bunch of questions irrelevant to the reason i went there, then I get the wrong referral! I try contacting them through the app and calling the office and nothing, then when finally a person answers the phone, she had an attitude! very unprofessional! that's not the way to handle an angry customer that you just wasted her time and made her walk on an injured foot to an imaging facility "nearby" that has a broken xray machine!!! very very disappointed in your services. no one even apologized for the mistakes! And it is not the first time they show poor customer service!

This is probably the most painless experience with a doctor's office I have ever had.We were done with a routine physical in well under an hour. Dr. Burrell was great and went over all the major potential risk factors for me. Felt like I got a full work up personalized to me. Had to come back to do a blood test after I had fasted and they didn't even need me to make an appointment. I just walked right in to get the work done. I would HIGHLY recommend Carbon Health if you are looking for a physician.

I love this place. I have seen Dr. Burrell, Jenny Choo NP and Louise Barron LVN and all of them are fantastic. A special shout out to Louise who treats me like family and has never missed a vein. The service is fast and efficient. The facilities are clean and modern. Highly highly recommmend...best Drs. office I have ever been to.

Finally healthcare that has joined the 21st century. I just had my first appointment here and I loved it! Everything was streamlined before the appointment making check in a breeze. I never sat alone in the room for than a minute alone and Dr. Sadarangani was extremely polite and professional.

I was so happy to realize that I could have all of my medical needs met by Carbon. Dr. Sadarangani was really helpful and efficient with the process and made me feel at ease with this new process of medical care. Their location is incredibly convenient and I'm always able to connect with them via the phone app. My needs feel 100% met. Thanks!

Nice concept but way too inefficient. Booked appointment at 12 but had to wait 30 mins for my turn. Was left in the room for another 20 minutes while nurse went to get results for my test. Doctor was kinda indifferent and wasn't super helpful.

I had a great experience with all of the doctors and nurses at Carbon Health. Being able to communicate directly with the doctor (like a text chain), schedule a same day appointment, track my prescriptions, and more through their app was convenient and easy.I went to my appointment, got my prescription, and was able to communicate my progress with Dr Burrell directly through the app instead of having to schedule another appointment. Saved me a ton of time and actually got me to follow up with the doctor because it was not such a hassle!Looking forward to having Carbon be my primary care physician.

The best doctor experience I've ever had.I have been using Carbon for a few months now and it is the best!! Why? I can see everything on the app; my treatment plans, prescriptions, lab results, follow ups. I can also text my doctor if I have a question or when I am not sure whether it is worth to a trip to office. When I had to go to office, it wasn't like any other doctor office experiences. I didn't need to fill any paper forms, wait for minutes to see the doctor and explain the same things to two other people before I finally saw my doctor. The doctor answered all my questions and never seemed like he was in rush. And when I was done, everything was on the app.I highly recommend Carbon if you want to have an amazing, high-tech doctor experience. I wish all my specialists use Carbon app..:)

Carbon Health is amazing! I've used their app many times to talk with their doctors, and have been to the clinic as well. All of my experiences with their team have been fantastic! The biggest difference between their clinic and others I've been to is that it's truly centered around you. You can chat with their doctors through their app (I also heard you can do video calls, although I have not used that), and only need to go into the clinic when it's really necessary, which is super helpful and very convenient for working with your schedule. The doctors are really on top of following up with you, and all of my info is stored directly in the app which means I can always access it (helpful for showing other doctors, etc). Overall both the in-person and in-app experiences are really highly recommended.

NP. McKoy is amazing! She really took the time to listen to my needs, had a very calming presence and gave me very thorough feedback and suggestions. I feel like I can go to her if I think of any questions later and will definitely be back and tell my friends!

I work for a tech startup and always wondered why doctors were so far behind in technology. After downloading the Carbon app from itunes I was able to quickly signup and book an appointment. No phone calls with the reception and when I arrived there were no paper forms to fill out!The office is the nicest doctors office I've been to. Everything is new and modern. Dr greg was a great doctor. My previous doctor was always late to my appointments and seemed like he was in a rush. Very different experience with Dr Greg. After my appointment, everything was available in the app including my prescription. Finally, a doctor with cool technology! Highly recommend.

Super quick and easy. You schedule everything and answer all the preliminary questions on the app, so when you have your appointment you're in and out, no problem. Very modern and very efficient, definitely coming here from now on.

This clinic is fantastic, I've made several visits already and whoever I've come across were awesome. I had an accident and had injuries to my leg and arm and Tatiana (she is a nurse) took a great care of wounds and applying antibiotic creams. The whole process was smooth and could be more painful if she was not that caring and experienced. Their app is really helpful and handy for making appointments and chats with your doctor and staff. This is my to-go clinic in SF. I highly recommend this clinic.

Everything abut my first appointment at CH yesterday was great. SO much better than the clinics and doctors I had been seeing. CH staff, nurses, and Dr. Burrell were all genuinely friendly, helpful, and responsive to my questions and concerns. I also very much like the app and fast and complete digital communication. Finally, the short walk from Embarcadero BART was easy and pleasant. I'm delighted to have found CH.

The staff at Carbon Health make scheduling and communicating with your doctor so much easier. The app allows you to schedule an appointment, communication with your doctor and even view lab results all on your phone!My experience at the office was great and they make it very easy to not only see a doctor but also they will conduct any lab draws in-office without having to go offsite to another facility. Dr. Burrell and Elizabeth are very through and take the time to meet with you. Louise their LVN is very welcoming and makes the whole process very painless.

My doctor's appointment with Dr. Burrell, by far, has been the BEST experience ever. Â He reviewed my medical history, any existing issues, and recommended next steps. Â I just felt at home, where it didn't even feel that I was at a doctor's office. Â Dr. Burrell and Louise were beyond AWESOME.

Favorite doctors office by far. The app was dope and allowed me to handle everything with my phone, from scheduling to messaging the office to getting scrips delivered. Super convenient way for a busy professional to see the doctor when needed. And Dr Burrell was the man and made sure he answered all of my questions. Everyone should visit if they want an easier doctors office experience

I saw the reply from this office so here's my response to that. Â The request was sent to your office early Friday. Tuesday late afternoon is not 48 hours. And that was after I kept calling and sending messages on your app. Â Additionally, it's also how RUDE some of the people in your office are over the phone. "I don't know" "I don't know" "I don't know" is pretty much what everyone at your office seems to say every time I call to ask for help. Basically I don't want to go and find out and deal with it so leave me alone attitude. And this wasn't the first time. _____________________________________________________I gotta say, I'm pretty disappointed with my experience with Elizabeth and Dr. Burrell. I had to interact with them both twice at Carbon. And both times, it was clear that she was not the right nurse for me or the right doctor for that matter. Elizabeth doesn't communicate well, isn't a very good listener and does not respond to messages sent through the app. In fact, she recommended some testing during my first visit and when I needed the prescription, she asked me a bunch of questions which I answered, and then she just went dark on me without a reply. After calling the office a number of times, I was told I'd get it taken care of today. Waited all day and it didn't happen. Called back and then I was told I'd get a response from her. Her response? I'm busy and I need to look at the chart. That's AFTER waiting all day for her already. I understand you're busy. Everyone is busy if you work full-time . This was a very basic request but apparently she's too busy to even spend 5-10 mins to help a patient out. Additionally, Burrell is apparently too busy, so busy in fact that OptumRX has put in the mail order request for the scripts on FRIDAY and as of TUESDAY, nobody had responded to them. When I called the office, apparently nobody can do anything until the doctor responds. This place is definitely the worst medical office I've ever had to deal with.I will say Louise was amazing to work with every time. Very responsive with a great attitude.It's unfortunate because I'm most likely going to find another primary care office in the near future because of my experience with Elizabeth and Burrell after they finally get the optumRX situation figured out.

I went to the clinic on short notice while visiting my boyfriend who lives in SF. Great experience at a doctors office that puts the patient first! The staff was super nice, the office was spotless and Dr Greg was solely focused on making sure I was comfortable, taking the time to make sure he answered all of my questions in depth. Being able to set up the appointment, pay, and get my results and prescriptions through their mobile app made it the easiest experience to get convenient care on the go. Best doctor visit I've had in my life! Would 100% recommend to all friends.
Great concept, great app and great doctor! Friendly staff, modern and sparkly clean clinic. If you write in on the app with questions you'll get immediate responses. I would highly recommend Carbon.

Great experience at a clinic that focuses on a great patient experience! Dr. Linda was very focused on making me comfortable and took her time to make sure my questions were covered. Being able to do it all from the app, from setting up my appt to getting my results and prescriptions was the easiest its been to get healthy in my life! 10/10 would recommend.

Best doctors experience I've had! Was able to manage everything through the mobile app and Dr. Dubins was patient and helpful with every question I had. Would definitely recommend to friends and family!

I have been twice to this location and I have to say the process of setting up you first visit and the paperwork is easy on the app, and so are the different convenient ways of setting up appointments. The location is nice and airy and my experience with Elizabeth, Julie (I think?) and others there have been amazing. I went for what ended up being strep throat and they took the time to listen to what I was feeling, did a rapid text to confirm it and sent me home with lots of instructions in the app and a prescription that you can send by email to your pharmacy. They also text back through the app if you have questions so overall, I totally recommend this location. I don't like doctors and going to them stresses me out but you feel cared for here.

Felt like a doctor's office for the 21st century. Very impressed with their app integration and ease of use in providing patient information, setting up appointments, and follow-up. I arrived on time for my appointment and only had to wait approximately 30 seconds before I could see my doctor. Using an app as their main method of communication is the right way to go and made the whole process very smooth and professional.

Who ever thought a doctors office experience could actually be great? The whole system is just so easy and personal, their app and technology is great, and the staff go above and beyond to make the patients life easier. I absolutely recommend.

Best doctor experience ever! I made an appointment same day on the app and can enter all my info on the app. They communicate well through the app and there is never a wait when I go. They're all so nice there I love it and told all my friends to go there too!

I don't write reviews often, but Carbon exceeded my expectations. Signing up was a breeze, just took photo of my insurance card and voila! Starting a conversation is as easy as following suggestions. Greg was really swift, helpful and accommodating about my questions and made great suggestions. This saved me a lot of time, money and a visit to a hospital. Looking forward and excited to see where this is going. Highly recommended.

This is the best primary care practice in San Francisco. I've never heard of medical practice where I can directly text my physician, who is responsive to my needs, without paying a monthly fee. I've been waiting for months to try this service after continual recommendations from my friends - and now after the Android app came out today I understand all the praise. If you're looking for individualized, prompt, expert care, look no further.

Carbon Health is by far the family practice doctor experience I've ever had. Â Linda Dubins is a great doctor! She's very professional, thoughtful and genuinely cares about her patients. With that said, the best part is the app. Â There are no forms and all of my medical information (lab tests, vaccination, visit summaries, etc.) are stored in the app so I dont have to hunt down and find medical info ever again. Scheduling appointments is all done in the app and my prescriptions were delivered to my work in less than 3 hours.

Saw the previous reviews and had to try Carbon for myself. Couldn't be more pleased with the decision! Everyone who worked there was welcoming and down to Earth. The app is incredible, and I'd encourage everyone to download it to see the patient friendly future of healthcare. Try it, you won't regret it!
Editing review, TBD, gonna give em a 2nd chance I guess based on the reply to my previous comment. Don't totally understand since it was literally one action followed by another but there ya go.

I used the App in San Francisco. It was very good, in scheduling appointment (most General Hospital has now). I went for yearly physical. So i had a 9 o clock appointment. The hospital in Pacific avenue, opened exactly at 9. so i had to wait for few minutes. The nurse Louise was very good. Met Dr.Burrell. He was so nice. He spoke to me about all the issues i had. He suggested me natural supplements, etc. The test reports came in 2-3 days. It is so good to try. Since i didnt have to pay yet. So I cannot comment on that. Overall very good experience.

10/10 would recommend to everyone I know! In about 45 minutes I downloaded the app, went to my appointment, saw the doctor and my prescription was sent to the pharmacy. The staff and doctors were extremely friendly and helpful and the office was clean and cute!

Carbon Clinic is so convenient! The team is incredibly friendly and knowledgeable (Dr. Greg had been awesome). It's easy to get appointments and the app is really intuitive and user-friendly. Even setting up a patient profile is simple. I love being able to message a doctor and know whether or not I should schedule an appointment, and not have to take half a day off work just to get some basic blood work done.

Forward is ridiculous with their legal forms/contracts. I have probably signed over four or five contracts with them in approximately two yrs. It couldn't have been more than 30 days ago I signed the last one. I sat in a Forward exam room for nearly half an hour reading their new terms and conditions. I asked if they had future documents to sign that they email me when they are released, not drop them on me at the last minute right when I arrive at the Forward Office for a quick weigh in, vitals or even a doctor's appointment. Today, I used the Forward messaging app to confirm I could walk in and check my weight and oxygen level--simple, less than 3 minutes. The Forward Rep thru the app mention I needed to sign a contract. I informed the rep I signed one last month. The rep did not clarify if it was a new contract or not. Â It was not made clear until I walked into the Forward office nearly four hours later that Forward yet again updated their contract. Without signing it, I could not check my weigh and oxygen level. I walked out. I asked Forward to email the new contract. I asked them to indicate exactly what provisions or sections have been updated to their contract. Forward Is it too difficult to email a new contract when it is released to your existing patients? Â Unless you prefer sandbagging patients with your contracts.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I have very few reviews but this one I felt was a must. Loved the experience, medicine should be like this. The communication is key and they deliver. I think this is the future and if it isn't then we are too far behind.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Unacceptable delay with Covid results.... a week and counting!!!! instead of being of help you are confusing people. I wish I went somewhere else to be tested instead of trusting you and letting you play with my life and time. Â Shame on you!!! You are putting more stress in my shoulders!!! And no word from you more than excuses when I ask for my results or update my symptoms. Is this heath care??? :( ..... rapid results with a swab test????
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Dr Lam is the BEST! Â I have been with Forward now for 6 months and have already corrected multiple long standing health issues including pre-diabetes, uncontrolled high blood pressure, and nagging allergies, plus improved my diet and overall wellness, all under the care of the best doctor I have ever had, Dr Lam! Â The Forward model works so much better than my previous HMO model, Dr Lam works on prevention and the "why" than just prescribing meds for every problem I encounter. Â He and the team truly take the time to explain and get it right, such a refreshing experience not having a doctor itching to run to the patient after two minutes... Â Do yourself and your family a favor and join Forward and Dr Lam, you won't regret it!
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I spent over 8 years working in the medical field and I left it to do marketing because I felt like healthcare became a way to make money rather than a way to treat and care for people. There were too many Doctors and Nurses with a God complex and they didn't really care about the well-being of their patients. With that said, I have always had really high expectations from my Doctors. I have spent my life only going to the best; but one thing was always lacking, preventative and 1:1 care. Doctors, no matter how amazing they are at their jobs prescribe medications for a symptom rather than helping to prevent that symptom. And worse, Â they spend less than 15 minutes with you when you just spent 30 minutes driving there, 30 minutes in their waiting room, 30 minutes in the patient room and 30 minutes to drive home. Forward was a completely different experience. The doctors are all Ivy League graduates. When you walk in, you feel like you've walked into an apple store, and all of their machines and tech is of the newest technology. You don't wait in a waiting room, and your doctor actually spends time with you to learn about whats going on with your body as well as what your goals are. They work with you to come up with a treatment and game plan and look deep into your body and genetics to know whats going on. My blood was drawn for my baseline visit (first visit) within 5 minutes of walking in. I was immediately given a Gluten Free, Allergen Free, Vegan, Non GMO snack and juice after the blood draw (had to fast). The Doctor walked in within 2 minutes of the lab tech walking out and she spent over an hour with me. Their app monitors my HR, Blood Pressure, Weight, and countless other things. They check in with you when something seems off and someone is there in their chat (within the app) 24/7 for any questions I have. I also thought it was really cool that the Doctor talks to you rather than looking down at the computer and charting. They have someone that is listening in that transcribes for the doctor so that the Doctor has 100% of your attention while they are with you the full hour. It would take me too long to go into all the specific details, but this is well worth the monthly cost considering every visit (no Â matter how many I need), every in-house lab and prescription and every skype call or message I send with questions is 100% covered. My genealogy testing, health and fitness plans are also covered.This is how healthcare should be. I highly suggest giving it a shot.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: This is how healthcare should be. Where it's customized to me and my needs and I'm meeting with people who care deeply to help. It's way more futuristic than I've ever seen a doctors office. I don't think I've seen the Apple store like this much less a doctor office tech wise lol.The fact that every part of our conversation was noted and added to my Forward profile in my app with book recommendations and health links is AMAZING. I don't have to feel pressure to memorize everything my doctor said or DIDN'T SAY while staring at a clipboard that they never show me lol. Also I can text the office through my app whenever. Even if I get in an injury and it's not serious enough to come in I can send a pic/message and get a response same day with instructions and recommendations! Makes you feel like even after you leave you are still important to them.My doctor is young and beautiful inside/out and beyond knowledgeable. She broke down each and every part of my test results. Did I mention they took blood and literally 10 min later all the results were on a touchscreen in my room? I needed an EKG and I got it right there and caught up on my shots. All included!Then upon leaving my first set of medications came for free in a dope gift bag that didn't look like I was carrying medication walking out of the building. No embarrassing eye stares from strangers for me lol.I've put so many people onto Forward and if you refer you get a month free for every person you refer! I think healthcare is moving into a new direction and I'm super here for it.Lastly, any additional testing that they can't do there they will send you out to get it done and that is additional but just to KNOW where my health is, SO important. For 99 a month you just can't beat that! I'm a Forward advocate if they need one! Lol
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Dr. Belyeu and the staff are the definition of professional. The office is a glimpse into the future! Technology is second to none. I was about 10 minutes early and was greeted, Â seated, and seen by my doctor before my scheduled time (since they don't over book). My expectations were surpassed by a mile. Can't wait for my follow up appointment.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Elite 2021
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Wow! Â My visit was absolutely great! Â I had all the time I needed. Â The doctor went over all of my blood results line by line explaining each item. Â It was way better than going to my primary doctor. Â I'm leaving for out of the country for 7 weeks and I asked for, and received, antibiotics in case I needed them.A really cool experience and I'm am MORE than satisfied and I'm so glad I enrolled. Check it out!
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I'm new to Forward. I had a great visit with Dr. Brittany at the Glendale location. The facility was clean, the nurse and the doctor were both attentive and personable. It was nice to be able to include lab results in the initial appointment since there is a lab on site for quick processing. I was able to discuss my primary areas of concern, get some over the counter medication, and resources/apps to help track some of my other healthcare needs. I received information about vaccinations I should look into for different travel plans and I have been able to communicate via text about my progress with the medication and typically receive a response back within an hour. I even got a follow up message asking how I was feeling, which was comforting. So far I've been happy with the accessibility and the experience. I'd recommend giving them a try!
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I'm happy about my initial visit to Forward. Â Forward really did live up to my expectations.My intent with Forward was not to diagnose me and cure me of something Â but rather to help me in what I can do better in terms and wellness and fitness and I feel that Forward is a great fit for what I'm trying to accomplish.From the cool advanced medical technological diagnostic devices, quick on-site lab panel results, wholistic informative presentation of various health data, genetic sampling, std panels, and most importantly a physician I can connect to and listened, I strongly feel Forward is a good choice for augmenting your healthcare provider.Unlike my traditional healthcare provider, the whole experience was great and left me looking forward to my next visit.Standout pros: judgement free zone and completely understood my sexuality and provides positive, supportive suggestions and based on my activities and behaviors, unlimited STD testing, onsite meds built in to program, almost immediate lab/panel results, telemedicine right from your phone almost anytime and immediately.Con: perhaps the price tag, maybe the wait time for the initial baseline visit (but that may be due to a surge in popularity and sign-ups), or possibly the 12-hour fasting.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I love forward. Especially Dr. Brittany Â she helped me figure out how I can feel better and prevent future illness.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I was just telling my husband, "I am tired of trying to improve my health but feeling lost with all the conflicting information out there. I really need a blueprint, a guide, a plan for better health based on science and my biological make up" and BOOM! There was a YouTube ad for Forward. I signed up and the first visit with Dr. Lam was exactly what I expected and then some. They have been so supportive and so on top of my health, it has been exactly what I needed. I am about a week into the health changes I have been instructed to make and I'm already feeling so much better. I also have insurance with Kaiser and I am comforted knowing I have convential hospital care if I need it but the very best preventative care, using the most advanced technology in the industry. Living in 2020, a holistic approach to health is what will ensure we are strong and able to survive.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: What a really cool experience. I feel like I had all the time I needed with the doctor. She did not mind going back over things & I can always look at the app to remember what to do. The process is so easy & complete. Just press a button on the app to send your prescriptions to the pharmacy of your choosing. Â Love it !!!!
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I can't believe how incredible this place is.Technology, professionalism, cleanliness, Dr. Lam is honest and helpful and encouraging and intelligent.The affordability on this is crazy as well I received a tetanus shot 3 vials of my blood was drawn, from which results were done in under an hour.We then went over everything on where I'm at and what my goals are.There's a huge monitor on the wall that was recording everything and updating everything as we talked I believe and there was no charts or any writing down it was like watching Iron Man with the technology. Anyways highly recommended.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Amazing most awesome experience!This place is great! Full blood panel done on the premises no waiting for results. Doctor Brianna is very caring and spent time explaining the details.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Truly knowledgeable world class doctor's who gives you personal attention and a plan for healing. Â The team is always available for all things medical. Wish I could have conceived this idea because it works.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: After hopping from doctor to doctor, I landed at Forward where Dr. Lam has been my main physician for almost a year. Not only has Dr. Lam done more for my health in the last year than any other doctor has in my entire life, I am more motivated to live a healthier lifestyle. The app is easy to use with your questions being answered quickly, prescriptions ordered immediately and all your information you need in a clean and organized format. I plan on staying with forward forever.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: My experience at Forward was *fine*, but it was expensive and the appointments are booked about a month out so you're constantly needing to wait. I wanted to cancel and figured since it was a subscription service and we paid for the whole month they would tell me the date it was cancelled...NOPE. They cancelled my account immediately, mid month, and wouldn't refund the rest of the month or allow me to use my account through the month we paid for. Ridiculous.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: So far the service has been pretty straightforward and legit! Everything the promo video said has basically come through. The staff is very kind and professional. The payment plan is very affordable considering that I don't have insurance, the plan covers doctors visits and that's also including basic medications like inhalers and antibiotics. They ran my blood test and also a urine test. Covered! I'm grateful that a company like this exist. I pray that it sticks around for a long time. Thank you for whomever came up with this idea! This business model helps people that are in dire need of safe and reliable healthcare.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: What a great experience. Not your normal Dr Office. They take the time t go through every detail of your health. Discuss it and create a plan. I finally feel like I can have all my information in one place. Plus, if I need a specialist they can refer me. What an amazing place. Technology and medicine together.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I've been going to Dr. Lam since mid-January of 2019. Â He is without question the best and most caring doctor I've had in my life. Â The quality of care is amazing - not just from the doctors but from the tech's. Â And I love the app, and the regular communication through it to check up on me.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I kept seeing the ADs for this company everywhere, from my facebook feed, to my instagram updates and even started seeing them on youtube. So I decided to check out their site and see what this FORWARD is all about.To my surprise, there was a special for $99 for the first 3 months and I could book my first appointment the following Tuesday, (Monday was a holiday). So I figured I give this a try.It exceeded my expectations:PARKING: there is a lot just across the street that is free to park for 90 minutes. PERFECT amount of time since there really is NO WAIT time when you arrive. LOCATION: it is within The Americana but is located on Brand in between Frida and the coffee bean.EXPERIENCE: As soon as you walk in there is someone there to greet you. Since it was my first time there are a few disclosures and agreements that I needed to review and sign - digitally, of course, no more paper! You tap on your initials and your profile pops up on the big screen, you get your oxygen levels, weight and several other vitals measured and then you go into your room. There you see a very clean and slick room with a large touch screen on the wall. The nurse comes in breaks down what is going to happen takes blood samples and in walks the doctor, you talk about your history/concerns and just like that your blood results are on the screen! I swear it was like 5-10 minutes for the results to show up. The Doctor was very knowledgable and very caring, truly made me feel comfortable and made me truly believe she cared. I am glad I made the switch from my old primary (I would have to book at least a month in advance to see him). Now I can just walk in and boom I can update my profile, also you get everything you discussed on your app! and you can chat with your doctor if any concerns arise. RESULTS: I'm keeping my membership!
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I had my baseline appointment on Monday. Â I was questioning whether this was a good fit for me and I was so impressed with the way Forward is run. Hopefully one day all doctors offices will be doing business this way. I love the way it seems to be all based on preventative. Â That's the way I live. Â Keep your body in good shape by exercising. Eating right and something good for the brain too. I think I've found the right place with Forward! The staff are all so friendly. For the first time in my life I didn't mind having blood drawn. Â I think We all just get used to being treated like a number by the medical field. Â Now I feel like a person who matters Such a great feeling.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: First of all, the reception staff was EXCELLENT! The ladies were very welcoming and explained the process thoroughly.The intake process by the nurse was very pleasant in putting me to ease especially right before the blood test. Â Water and delicious energy bars were offered while waiting for the doctor, which was not too long of a wait.Dr. Richard Lim was my assigned doctor, and I was extremely pleased to have him. Â My visit with him was exceptionally outstanding. Â This is the first time in my life to have a very candid, open and extensive conversation with a medical doctor. Â Usually doctors can't wait to finish with you and get you out so the next patient comes in. Â My time with Dr. Lim was definitely time well-spent. Â He is very thorough in his explanation and I can see how caring and sincere he was with the time he spent with me. Â Can't wait for my next visit.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I had my first appointment last week. I have SO many great things to say. This is everything a doctor's visit and preventative healthcare should be!- First, I love that they're located in malls. Parking is a breeze and usually free (or way cheaper than parking at a doctor's office)- NO WAITING. I walked in 5 minutes early, and everything was ready to go. They offered me water, and it wasn't crappy water either - still or sparkling options!- The nurse was so sweet, very attentive, gave me a Spiderman band-aid after taking blood. There was also a choice of Frozen band-aids! Since I was fasting due to blood tests, I was even offered snacks. Talk about going above and beyond with their customer service- The doctor was incredibly talented in many different ways. Not only did he really care about my health priorities and understand them medically, but he was tech-savvy, and I really appreciated that. It made the decision-making process about what I should change or optimize a breeze. This approach was also less anxiety-inducing because he had information and support at his fingertips- Testing turn-around time is nothing like I've ever seen. Even when they had to do further testing, I was notified in the app in just under 24 hours- The membership includes so much. The doc and I decided to change a prescription. Since they had the new medication on-site, I walked away WITH that medication. No charge for it and future refills. Usually, I'd have to take more time out of my day to visit the pharmacy- Follow-up messaging and test results were posted in the app within hours. I love having this data easily and readily accessible. They also included supplemental reading and clear plans to follow for health optimizationAs an entrepreneur, the time I saved using Forward helps me immensely. Getting coverage as a self-employed person is expensive and finding the time to do it comprehensively is challenging. I may even downgrade my health insurance and save a few bucks because the Forward membership has so many great benefits.If I could change anything, it would be the genetic testing. I wish there was another way to do it without having to go through 23andMe. I just have my concerns about that company.Otherwise, no complaints. Looking forward to my next visit and feeling positive about my health.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I'm very healthy but in between insurance provided by my employer. Â I wanted to make sure I had access to basic bloodworm, weight loss suggestions, and overall health. Â My baseline information and testing was excellent and quick. Everyone was intelligent and informative. Â It's not a clinic or doctor's office. Â I've received healthcare in other countries but this was a new experience. Â It's more streamline and efficient, while friendly and professional.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: completely different experience i have ever imagined. top notch, SUPER clean, and dr. brittaney took as much time as we needed to review everything. she was thorough, kind and patient. also got my blood results within 10 minutes. everything was shown to me on a large touch screen in different categories, whilst a scribe was listening and taking notes! it was truly incredible...and i can't stress enough the cleanliness and efficiency of this establishment. i am honestly in awe. you can connect to the app as well for 24/7 interaction and any questions and concerns you may have. this is how healthcare should be. i am super pleased with my visit.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Traditional & Conventional General Hospital & Medical Centers are now a thing of the pass with this fresh new way of getting to know whats really going on in the inside of you. If you care about your general health and well being you will put away all thoughts of traditional Doctors and fear of Â extensive Hospital bills and you will book an appointment today. Not tomorrow, TODAY!!!!! FORWARD: Before Disease Occurs, Not After. That's Forward Thinking, and Forward progress. Take care of yourself, there is only one you.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: My first visit was great. Â My Dr. was easy to talk to, addressed my questions and created a plan for me that I think is achievable. Â Preventative medicine has to be the future otherwise the current medical system will bankrupt the country. Â The amount of information that you receive on your first visit is amazing. Â I am looking forward to my next visit to discover more about how to maximize science and technology to improve the quality of my life.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: At the Americana - phlebotomist very talented, Dr. Lam is extremely thorough and competent. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. Note that for referrals you will have to see your regular other doctor unless you're Some HMO etc.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I just started with Forward, and I'm blown away. I've never Â experienced such thorough, responsive, and proactive health care. Dr. Lam took the time to go through my entire medical history, my lab results, and my goals. He then helped me come up with a comprehensive, preventative healthcare plan. All the notes, results, and action items were helpfully summarize in my app, and the Forward team is FAST in dealing with referrals, record requests, and other items doctors offices typically take ages to take care of. I was skeptical, but this really does fee like how healthcare should be.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Forward is just incredible. It's like walking into the future of healthcare. Only just did my baseline exam but my first impressions are blown away with the level of service. Dr. Lam is excellent and extremely thoughtful. Hopefully it continues like this
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Signed up not knowing what to expect but I'm a big fan of preventing disease rather than getting treated after you get sick. Andrew, my doc, was great. Listened to all my concerns even my skin tags. Love that u could text or call 24/7 for medical support. Great staff and professionals.
