Very high tech and love the focus of the clinic which is health and not money. Very excited for my dna test and future exams. Even my wife is sold on this clinic. Highly recommend.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: When it comes to medical care, I set the bar really high so when I arrived at Forward Glendale for my baseline I questioned how this high tech approach would measure up. My 1st impression was surprise- no waiting! Â There was a cool easy check in process before I got onto the body scanner. Â I was amazed at the information collected from the scan and painless blood draw! Â Dr. Richard went Â through these results and my health concerns until ALL of my questions were answered. Â dr Richard! Â The follow up from Forward through the app for specialty referrals and when I had a horrible stomach fluwas immediate and on point. Â Love Forward- there's nothing like it! Make sure you ask for Alexis and Maxine who get you set up, they're so positive, Â and give an absolutely painless flu shot!!!
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Wow. This is a place where you actually feel like the future is now. Sure, there's a lot of technology to impress, but really what makes it an excellent service is the data set that you review with the doctor and can use in the app. Having a reminder of actionable items specific to the tests is a key to successfully co-opting a more healthy lifestyle. Dr. Belyeu is warm and caring and thoughtful. The initial appointment didn't feel rushed and having blood test results in like 15 minutes is mind blowing. Â Response of questions in the app is immediate. With health, from a mental perspective - waiting for answers is usually the worst part. Truly an example where the current way of doing things is outmoded and it's time for change. Bravo.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I'm happy with my choice to sign up with Forward! It was the first time I actually looked forward to going to the doctors! I'm confident I will be getting very thorough screenings for many areas that are sure to help me continue staying heathy.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: From what I can tell so far Forward is a total scam! Baseline appointments are available only during week days and for very limited periods of the day, 8-2 for some reason. Only x2 doctors at this location and I see them aggressively advertising on Social Media so I can only assume they are over selling their services given the long wait times for appointments. After waiting for almost two months to have my baseline appointment I get a notice that it's canceled because apparently they let 50% of their staff just randomly not come to work! So, far a horrible experience. Highly NOT Recommended!
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: What a great choice I made!!! High tech, personalized and all bases covered with this company! Dr.Lam personable, educated, compassionate and thorough! The reviews on here from others is NO JOKE! THIS is how health care should be! I too had results in no time and things scheduled for me snd continous 24/7 communication if needed. This IS the right choice for health care that is for YOU personally!
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Absolutely impressed with their set up and use of technology. Amazing how much was revealed & taken care in just one visit. I really liked Doctor Richard Lam and I look forward to returning.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: This is the greatest medical experience of my life! First of all this is not your ordinary doctors office. Everything is so advanced and all the technology used is very modern. For the first time in my life I feel like the doctor ACTUALLY CARES! Who would've know they're supposed to care right? Dr. Lam is the way all doctors should be. Caring, has patience and understanding! I've never felt rushed, the first visit was well over an hour when your "traditional" doctor visit rushes you in and out as fast as possible to keep charging everyones insurance i guess. You get what you pay for right? They offer different types of water, got a health monitoring watch for free just so my health could be tracked 24/7 ohhh and let me not forget the fact that I could literally be in contact with someone 24/7 should i need someone at 4am! This is how all doctor visits should be. Forward and Dr. Lam are the best choices I could've made for my health! I cant thank and recommend you and your staff enough!
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I'm so done with the cookie cutter doctors offices that just want to medicate you for everything and send you on your way. Enter Forward! At Forward I finally experienced doctors that listen to my complaints, stories and jokes with compassion to come up with solutions for healing.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: I have to start out by noting two things a) I am a visual learner and b) I love my doctor who has done right by me for 25 years. This was a 10-star experience. It is a sleek, clean, comfortable environment that feels futuristic but familiar. A welcoming young woman met me at the door, introduced herself, talked to me about what to expect and helped me check in - which consisted of tapping my initials on a pad. No lines, no wait - next was the body scan with my information populating a forward facing screen. A nurse appeared and took me to a room straight away. I had typed up a list of my surgeries with dates, including meds, family history and current topics to discuss. The nurse ran a handheld machine up my arm to expose my veins with ultraviolet light, then took blood and gave me an amazing healthy bar and some water ("We know you are hungry after fasting"). She gave me a comfy t-shirt and I saw that there were exercise shorts that apparently took the place of a clingy plastic gown. I know that these things are inconsequential - but they typified the entire experience and that's why I choose to add them. Immediately, Dr. Richard Lam entered the room, relaxed and patient, asking questions and overlooking the intake that I prepared. I can't really explain it but I guess the oversized monitor on the wall was picking up key medical terms as he was chatting with me. When I said that I was having a problem he responded and the ailment popped up on the screen with sub context. My labs were on screen as well. We went over every part of my body and documented all issues regardless of how incidental they were. Reassuringly, he called my attention to the screen to show me my levels from the full panel within a graphic that enabled me to assess where I was on the spectrum for diabetes etc. It was very different than, "Yeah, you blood sugar is a little high," - on the bar I saw how high and what my ranges were. Preliminary diagnoses' populated and he would dictate to the computer what the goals were without breaking eye contact with me - layer after layer of information was visible. At this point I felt like I was "cheating" on my doctor because I was connected to this doctor, this experience, the feeling of being understood and having a grasp and taking control of my health. I was assured that FORWARD was a program that worked in tandem with my GP. It's collaborative. We made goals and plans and he asked me for my phone to get a baseline of how many steps that I took. No cheating there! I pushed back on some action items that I wasn't up to at the moment and he was encouraging and nonjudgmental and worked with me to formulate a workable plan that I was confident that I could successfully execute. Toward the end of the visit he asked two questions - having nothing to do with anything that we had talked about. Â He asked if family and friends had noticed very specific visual change in my appearance - and I shared that they had. There is NO WAY that he would know to ask those questions. We ended up with a plan that includes a regiment of daily fasting, titrating off medication that isn't intended to be a long-term treatment plan and he listened (without judgment or any sign of disbelief) when I said that I use chocolate for medicinal Â purposes as a sleep aid. He worked chocolate into my plan - I mean seriously - that's really subscribing to the fact that we know our bodies. Â Within days, he chatted with me via the app, uploaded my full blood panel results with explanations and helped me navigate what the results meant. We confirmed our goals which contained our action plan taking into consideration the descriptions of every diagnosis and my profile. Because he will study my progress it motivates me to find excuses to walk more, give my body a rest by fasting, cut down on my pills and eradicate certain foods from my diet in moderation. The bottom line is that it was an incredible experience. Not one that is easily described. This doctor is exceptional. The facility is extraordinary, the staff, knowledgeable and gentle. I give this facility my highest recommendation and I plan reap the benefits of having a team of experienced doctors (+ my GP) help me with my preventative approach to healthy living.
Practice: Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Preventive Medicine

Reviews: Since our regular doctor was out of town, her assistant referred us to Doctors Kim and Savant when my wife was ill. Â Dealing with Dr. Savant was a pleasant surprise from the beginning. Â His receptionist said she would fit us in around 2PM the day we called. Â Check-in was very easy and we were promptly seen by Dr. Savant. Â What a fine gentleman he is, and he has a great bedside manner, and sense of humor. Â Most importantly, he listened to the patient and then quickly went about examining my wife and identified the cause of her problem. Â He emailed a prescription to our pharmacy and my wife is much better now. Â I have rarely had a visit with a new doctor that went so smoothly!
Dr. Kim is kind and knowledgeable, but the receptionists are often rude and forgetful.
Best doctor I have ever had. Amazing bedside manner, extremely knowledgeable, kind, and accommodating. i cannot recommend him enough.

Dr. Gene Kim is my favorite Doctor period! He's extremely understanding and knowledgeable. He still cares about his patients and if very accessible via email or phone. I highly recommend him for any general practice needs.
I recently changed Primary Physicians. Â Dr. Gene Kim is very attentive and spends as much time as you need.

Dr. Savant is very technical and thorough, as well as a great listener. Â He never pushes drugs or surgery needlessly and is always on top of developments in medicine. Â I've been going to him almost 10 years and would really miss him if I left the Bay Area.

So I have to say - LOVE LOVE LOVE Dr. Savant. Â He was my doctor since 2005 when I moved here from Chicago. Â  Sadly we now do need to part ways because of this whole annual fee deal. I just can't afford him after I pay for my insurance. Â And sadly, while I did think to go to Dr. Kim, I've noticed a decline in the great customer service I used to receive before this whole annual fee. Â Now when trying to get perscriptions, leaving messages, or at times when I actually talked to the receptionist - it's like pulling teet to get a response. Â Because of the lack of response from the front desk I've decided to just find another doctor.It comes down to this - if you can afford to pay the additional fee, Dr. Savant is a great doctor and I can't say enough. Â If like me, you can't - just move on to another doctor's office. Â Even though I assume Dr. Kim is good - you have to deal with the front desk which has sadly declined in it's service.

I've been with Dr. Gene Kim at the Savant Medical Group and he is absolutely amazing! Super friendly, funny, and genuinely cares about his patients. He always remembers my name and things that I told him last time I was there about my life, asking about work and family and so on. He makes you feel comfortable and makes jokes, super funny! He also makes sure to be cautious with prescribing medications and is very thorough in explaining what it is, what it does, symptoms to look out for, as well as dosage. Best doctor I've ever had, by far! Also, the location of the office is perfect and easy to find.

It's 8 years later and I haven't seen Dr. Savant because I changed my primary care doctor, not because I was dissatisfied but because my health coverage changed. My husband recently needed a new primary care doctor and the first person I thought of was Dr. Savant. My husband has had a couple of visits with Dr. Savant and had nothing but great things to say. Although his health report isn't the greatest, Dr. Savant thoroughly went over every lab result explaining the possible causes and what are some steps he can take to improve those numbers in his diet. He just simply took his time to make sure that my husband understood everything so that he has control over his health. It's also rare these days that you can just call in and get an appointment within 24 hours let alone the same day. It's been an overall comforting experience to know my husband is in good hands.

This review is over due.....I saw Dr Savant in 2009After reading amazing reviews, I made an appointment with Dr Savant for stomach issues. I was dealing with chronic digestion problem since a long time. He asked me get some tests done, once the tests came back and everything came normal, he sent me back saying that it will get better with time and prescribed me some medication.The medication didn't help me at all. Currently I am seeing a Naturopathic doctor and with the help of herbs and vitamins she has been able to help me with my issues.

Dr. Gene Kim is awesome. (I haven't met Dr. S but the "medical group" in general isn't listed). Dr. Kim is on time, friendly and engaged. His kindness and presence equal his smarts. The man even auscultates a blood pressure... who does that? Someone who takes the time to evaluate his patients, listen to them and care for them. If only all doctors were so good.

I feel the need to chime in here. Â Dr. Savant is hands down the best doctor I have ever seen in my life. Â Now, for me that says a lot because I recently went through a major life changing illness. I won't elaborate on the details of my condition but suffice it to say that I ended up receiving a stem cell transplant which required intensive after care. Â With luck, I found Dr. Savant and after 3 years of illness and treatment, he became my primary care physician.What a relief. Â To find a doctor that is not only brilliant medically, but also compassionate and one who never, I mean never, rushes the visit. Â We all know that some visits to your doctor are quickies and others require a bit more time, depending upon what is going on.Prior to becoming so ill, I had always been healthy, never sick. Â Suddenly, Â my life changed dramatically as I had lost the membership of Â someone considered "healthy." Â  Â Dr. Savant was attentive, in touch and astute to the entire experience. Â I could not have asked for a better physician for my aftercare. Â Eventually, I regained my health but continue to deal with the after effects of those years of illness as well as the aggressive treatment I had. Â Again, Dr. Savant skillfully and kindly led me through the painful long months of healing and escorted me back to heath and subsequently work, as a full duty police officer.Then, at the beginning of 2012, we received a Savant Wellness Package in the mail-- it require us to pay a lump some, yearly, to belong to his practice and continue to see Dr. Savant. Â It ranged but I think my cost, and my partner's, was in the ballpark of $2000.00 annually for each of us. Â At first we were shocked, even a bit indignant. Â My initial reaction was: Â Okay, he's great but that is way too much money. Â Let's look around for another doctor, one that doesn't ask for a Â fee to see him. Â We found ourselves back in the rat-race of hurried doctors that didn't even bother to ascertain our medical history from the simplest things like whether we smoked to my major recent illness. Â Sigh... Â We missed good medicine, we missed Dr. Savant.My partner and I talked about the annual fee and searched online about physicians charging fees. Â We realized that the best doctors are moving towards this practice and evaluated for ourselves what we wanted, for our own healthcare. Â After careful consideration, we decided that excellent medicine--Dr. Savant-- was worth it. Â After all, I had long since experienced the contrary and after having been extremely ill, our decision became a no brainer. Â We paid. Â And you know what? Â I'm glad we did. Â In short, there is no price on health, good health. Â Unfortunately, we often don't realize it until it is something we have lost...Dr. Savant is an amazing physician. Â If you can afford to pay his fees, I highly encourage you to do so. Â Nothing is more important than your health even if that is hard to fathom when you have it.

Trying to find a doctor. Called last week. Asked the receptionist the usual simple questions about bloodwork and physical assessments that are performed there. Got no useful answer. Left my number but did not get a call back.Checked his "Savant MD" website and found videos that aren't informative; just more marketing.

Unfortunately, this office has questionable ethics standards. I strongly recommend reviewing the bill and discussing the charges with the doctor - the front desk won't cooperate much post factum.I was looking for an OBGYN, and, by mistake, I ended up in this office. I waited for 35 minutes in the waiting room just to find out that I came to the wrong doctor. The doctor did manage to ask me if I smoked, drank, and did drugs. He also asked if my parents had any health issues. And that's when we got to the mistaken OBGYN part. We shook hands and wished each other a good day. Imagine my surprise when I got a bill for a complete (!!) physical exam. When I called to clarify the situation, the front desk said that it was their policy to charge people (I think as soon as they schedule or enter the office). She would not correct the charge!I suggest they should have a credit card machine at the door by the door knob because, apparently, sitting in their waiting room is not free!Also, I am a CPA, and my billing rate is $280. I sat in their office for 35 minutes. I think they owe me $163! They got as much of my accounting services as much I got of the physical exam, but I had to pay. However, I would be happy to give them the first time 10% off.Very disappointing and outrageous.

Quite possibly the best doctor's experience I have ever had in my life. Actually, scratch that. Not possibly, definitely THE best doctor's experience I have ever had.So a few months ago, I had this terrible cough. It was so embarrassing. I'd be at the club, talking to some boy, and then boom. I start coughing all over his face. Not cute. Something had to be done.In the four years that I have lived in the Bay Area, I never really had any reason to go to the doctor so I didn't really have one.Turned to Yelp and originally wanted to make an appointment with Dr Savant. Nothing available for a few weeks. Oh noes! I had to stop coughing. So I was thinking that, you know, good doctors, work with good doctors. So I asked if there was anyone else that could take me. They offered Dr Kim for a same day appointment. I was in.Went in, saw Dr Kim and was amazed. I was so used to doctors, sticking a swab down my throat, asking me like 2 questions, and be out of there in 5 minutes with a prescription. Dr Kim actually talked to me for a good 30 minutes about my symptoms what kind of activities I do, all kinds of stuff to help fix this incredibly annoying issue I was having.So yeah, a week later, cough all gone. Dream.THANK YOU DR KIM.Talking to people at the bars is so much easier now thanks to you.

The Short: Compassionate, timely, efficient.The Long:I made my appointment about 4 weeks ago, showed up on time, waited about 3 minutes to be seen, and had Dr. Savant's uninterrupted attention for about an hour. Â He brought his laptop into our session, and was taking copious notes about everything. Â I had brought a few pieces of paper from my last appointment, and he efficiently scanned them in to my file. Â There was almost no paperwork, except for the notes and prescriptions he printed out.Personally, Dr. Savant is awesome. Â He was a classics major, and then became a doctor. Â He is funny, compassionate, and probably the best doctor I've ever seen. Â I hope his practice thrives enough that he knows he is loved, but not so much that making an appointment is impossible.

I have been a patient of Dr. Savant since about 2001. Â He's hands down the best doctor I've ever seen. Â It's not even close. Â There's Dr. Savant, then there's everyone else.Mark spends a lot of time actually talking to you. Â He's interested in what's going on in your life, and how it impacts your health. Â He's designed his entire practice to be able to spend that time with his patients. Â He's also extremely knowledgable and will ensure you get the treatment you need.For a brief period sometime during 2011-2012, his practice ended up taking on more patients than it could handle (thanks to the awesome Yelp reviews). Â As a result, he expanded his practice to include Dr. Kim, who is also a great doctor. Â So yes, during that transition, I noticed longer wait times and it being harder to get in to see Dr. Savant. Â During this time Mark added a concierge service so people who wanted him 24/7 could have it. Â Obviously nothing comes for free, so there is an annual charge. Â I would love to do it, but I decided I couldn't afford it. RECENT Experiences: I have been 4 times in the last six months, and I will tell you that each time I have arrived early. Â Each and every time I have been taken to an exam room within 10 minutes of arrival. Â Each and every time Mark has come in to see me in that room within 5 to 10 minutes (twice immediately!).If you're looking for the best doctor on the planet, you've found him. Â His name is Dr. Mark Savant.

I hadn't been to the doctor in a LONG time. Â The "current" complaints I came up with during my new patient/pysical were all at least 6 months old. Â I was terrified to go in there but knew it had to be done. Â Dr. Savant is the coolest! Â Young, up-to-date, down-to-earth, and totally caring. Â No lengthy questionaire to go over your life story--he asks the questions himself. Â Talks about options and concerns, not pushy about his own opinions or agendas.Doris is really sweet. Â Zora is a new assistant and really a bright, young face in the office. Â Dr. Savant told me that he likes to run the kind of practice you can call and say, "Hey, I need to be seen today," and they'll fit you in. Â I like a doctor like that. Â But after all the response from Yelp, he's had to bring in Dr. Kim to help him keep running his practice that way. Â Hey, that's not a bad thing!I've never walked away from a doctor's appointment and raved about it. Â I've ranted plenty of times but raved? Â I can't think of one. Â I love this guy.Oh, and I totally agree with what Clover Dan said--"a doctor you won't hate talking to, no matter what the hell you did to end up there." Â Well put and spot on!

Wow, holy cow, a medical office with an actual person I can talk to? Â You mean, I don't have to listen to a voice recording and push numbers and cross my fingers that it brings me to the right place? I appreciate that there's a human on the other line, and I appreciate that they were able to give me an appointment in the next two days. Â I mean, when you're sick and you think you've got a sinus infection, the last thing you want to do is keep the phone by your ear and hope you don't miss the doctor's office when they call back. Â So pleasant that I could speak to someone, and make my appointment.

I waited almost 4 weeks for my appointment with Dr. Savant for a non-urgent but bothersome issue, so I was ready to rip Yelp another one if he was just another competent but over-hyped person.Sitting in his dimly lit waiting room for 40 minutes next to a pharmaceutical drug rep and listening to elevator music, I was really considering that idea. Â But tout au contraire, Dr. Savant lived up to the raves. Â His Q Q Q Q A A A Â format, versus Q A Q A Q A (question-answer etc.), initially threw me off and made me wonder whether he was listening or caring, but he had truly excellent bedside manner and asked that rare "Is there anything else?" question at the end. Â No wonder he runs late. Â The only thing that disappointed was when he told me over the phone that my allergy test results indicated I had allergies to "some kind of weed" and "I think it's wheat grass". Â I requested a copy and googled the scientific names, and it turned out the "weed" (D. pteronyssinus) is the European house dust mite and "wheat grass" (D. farinae) is the American house dust mite.Oh well. Â Dr. Savant's no zoologist, that's for sure.

yay. yay yay yay.A painless doctor's visit!Hardly any wait, easy street parking, I think insurance pays for all of it, friendly staff, and Dr. Savant is personable and answered all my silly questions. He even referred me to another doctor who is located close by.Thank you!

Thank you to Yelp and to all of the Yelpers for helping me find my new PCP. Â My last PCP was GREAT, but she left practice and I was left wondering how I would EVER find another physician who I would be able to trust , as much. Â Well, I found him.My prerequisites for a Primary Care Physician and his/her practice are very clear:1) The practice should accept my insurance.2) The reception staff should be friendly and efficient.3) The MD should be PROFESSIONAL and KNOWLEDGEABLE4) I should not be left waiting for HOURS....for a consultation5) The consultation should be thorough.6) There should be NO JUDGMENT tied to my revelation of any of my "habits", perhaps only recommendations on how I can improve my health by abstaining from those listed "habits".7) There should be open dialogue and a confirmation of confidentiality to create a safe environment to build a true Physician-Patient relationship.8) The invasive diagnostic procedures should be kept to a minimum, if possible, and the MD should be thoughtful about the repercussions of such diagnostics.9) Billing should be spot on.10) I should be able to call in an urgent situation (not a 911 situation) and be fit into the schedule, if possible.I've been to Dr. Savant's practice twice now and have been pleased. Â Once was to establish myself as a patient and to have a routine, preventative care examination. Â He was thorough and sensitive to my needs and my questions. Â He was easy to talk to and not intimidating (like some physicians can be). Luckily, I'm pretty healthy, so it was not a chore of a visit.The second visit was for an upper respiratory infection. For that visit, I did see Dr. Kim. Â Dr. Kim was extremely professional and very cognizant of my concerns. Â He seems very young, but he is professional and I felt that my health issues were addressed appropriately. Â Plus, I was VERY happy that the staff was able to fit me in QUICKLY (on the SAME DAY of my call)!!!!THANKS SO MUCH!!!!

So you move to a new city and start over, besides food and drink there are certain other necessities you need, a doctor and dentist being two.After much procrastinated physicals,my wife and I went to yelp and found him, made new patient appts and got in there pretty quickly.He's pretty chill (I bet he puffs a bit on the side) and sits with you with his apple notebook.Bedside manner makes you feel comfortable and he gave me all the referrals you could ask for (since our HMO, Aetna, requires referrals for specialists)There was a bit of a wait, I had a 2pm appt, showed up at 205, got seen at 245, my chagrin as I shoulda showed up 15mins early to fill out paperwork.(Was also bit sweaty, rode bicycle there, many hills on Fulton, not the best idea, take Fell or the bus or drive)There is cheap parking in the builidng itself, which is on top of a hillThere's something to be said about giant medical complexes in general, it's nice to have a 1 stop shopAfter his visit, I walked downstairs and had blood work 15mins laterBooked an apt w/ Dr Murray (in same office for the next day) and made 2 more apts for Fri for other stuff, so that's 5 medical appts knocked out in 3 days, Â not too shabby

I feel like I have to chime in here to counteract some of the negatives I've read. Â Dr. Mark Savant is a great doctor. Â I can see how people are upset with the direction he's moved in with his concierge practice but the reality is that he's responding to a demand for it. Reviews: If like to spend your own time so your provider can cut costs and maximize utilization of call center resources to improve margins, this may be a service for you! One Medical is akin to having your healthcare provider stuck behind a tech support help desk complete with a queue that will regularly leave you waiting on hold for over an hour to reach a human for even small asks. The hold music provides a single 15 second loop of the non-offensive music interrupted only by a recording that tells you how much they appreciate your patience so at least you know they care.I've had a membership for several years for my family and the experience has been really awful lately. My wife has had primary care providers swapped 6x as they leave and she gets assigned a new one on a regular basis. If you want a consistent provider who knows you, this isn't the spot. Again, think tech startup with people coming and going frequently.We had to wait 2 months for a referral because they were so slow at responding and didn't respond to in-app requests (see screenshots). When she finally got a referral, she made an appointment for a specialist and then.... Surprise! Someone from One Medical called and cancelled her appt with the specialist the night before without telling her about it. So she drove to the specialist for an 8PM appointment that wasn't on the books anymore and spent an hour there with the front desk trying to sort out what happened before having to go home with no answers (see point about insanely long call queue). This all is despite them having called her 2x the day before to confirm the appointment.She made a new appointment after going through the insane call queue again, having to wait 2 more weeks to reschedule because the specialist was already booked. The day before the appointment, the specialist's office called to say the referral is messed up and the specialist hasn't been able to get anyone from One Medical to respond to fix it (yet again, the long call queue is a killer). After waiting on hold for over an hour, the person from One Medical said that "It's approved and totally fine". Well, turns out, it's still messed up and so this appointment was again cancelled and she's now stuck for 3 MONTHS without being able to see a specialist for an actual health problem. To add insult to injury, we've now wasted double digit hours on hold with One Medical and driving to non-existent appointments.They've now managed to give her a new phone number to call to make an appointment but.... that number is completely wrong and goes to a different provider. I'm on my 81st minute on hold just to try to get someone to give me the correct number. Good bye to all those hours of my life I could have done something more useful with.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: The prices here are not reasonable and customary. They will squeeze every penny of out claims. They also submitted claims to insurance incorrectly. At least now I've met my deductible in case of another emergency. What the heck is $200 membership for if there are no office visit co-pays and their in-network caregivers are independent contractors at $1080.00/hr. Billing scheme. Will not renew.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Similar to other reviewers, the billing is not clear and support was inadequate. Expected for healthcare in general but customer service is supposedly what paying an additional membership fee covers for OneMedical. On their website, they say that telehealth and video sessions are included in the membership fee (screenshot below) - because they save OneMedical time and money and should incentivize their patients to use the service. Instead, I was charged $540 for a short telehealth visit where I had simply asked for a referral to a specialist doctor. Not asking for a diagnosis at all, just a specific referral. No support in reconciling the billing. Instead they said this was a "complex visit." It would be cheaper to go to urgent care or ER or simply google doctors. Yikes.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Elite 2021
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: It's interesting to see all the bad reviews here - and good to know that I'm not alone. I've had an absolutely terrible experience with One Medical. The specifics of my exact issue are kind of neither here nor there but it's hard to know how they justify having a person pay extra for medical treatment here ("Concierge" treatment, my a$$). I would have been better off, by far, not paying extra and just getting a regular doctor. I complained and was refunded, and the person that I spoke with during that phase of the experience was nice and apologetic - but I've been a patient for three years and they never requested my medical records from my previous provider, or even (in all this time) ran routine labs. According to UCSF I'm behind on my Tetanus booster, etc. Honestly, this place is a scam. Just go to a doctor.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: My suggestion is try to find a real doctor's office that cares. I know that maybe be hard to do, but this turn and burn techie office is so incompetent it should be illegal. The doctors themselves maybe just ok, but the Administration side is absolutely terrible. They don't return insurance company request forms, they fill out the forms wrong, order the wrong tests, don't return your phone calls, don't reply to emails, act as if your stupid because they are the expert and don't really listen to what you are saying. Ive had multiple doctors talk to me in a mocking way. There is no way to call the front desk. in stead they put you on hold for :45 minutes to talk to someone across the country if they don't hang up on you once they answer. They say you can do everything through their online app. In fact they don't reply to your messages. They don't reply to request of any kind. The doctor says he's going to put in a referral for you. The information doesnt show in the app and of coarse you cant call the office to ask for the referral phone number or any other issue. The doctor never remembers who I am or why I'm there. They pack thier schedules so tight they cant take 5 minutes to read your chart or add to your chart. They really seem to just be maximizing the number credit cards they can run in a day. If anyone can recommend another GP please DM me. I've got to get out of this scam.Also, I prefer my doctors and their staff to keep their activism private and perform in a professional manor. Don't assume that every male that "looks" straight is homophobic. Ive been living in SF since the 90's and the majority of my friends are LGBTQ , I find it super offensive when the front desk gives me that attitude like I'm a Trump supporter or something. They literally know nothing about me even with my chart right in front of them. It outrageous!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Elite 2021
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Scam. Was duped into signing up with them on the assertion that they can schedule Covid vaccine. After registration and uploading documents, it turns out there is no availability. Clicks on every date from yesterday to July of 2021.Don't bother, it's a scam.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I have been a customer of One Medical for 10 years. Â Initially the service and doctors were very good. Â The quality of the service has steadily deteriorated. Â Calling One Medical is stressful. Â You are placed on hold for more than an hour. Â They had a year to adjust the size of the call center to accommodate for the number of patients calling for assistance.My current issue with One Medical is in attempting to get a blood draw. Â I need one every two weeks. Â One medical won't provide a phlebotomist on a regular basis at its Valencia facility. Â Since they don't answer their phones you never know if a phlebotomist is available until you go to their clinic.While the location is convenient, the service is so bad it is simply not worth the $150 annual membership fee. Â I may have to move to another primary care institution.I would suggest avoiding One Medical and their $150 fee. Â They are clearly more interested in profit vs. service and care for their patients.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I've been a One Medical member for about two years now, and my overall experience has been meh to poor.Pros:- usually able to get an appointment nearby- in-app communication (hey, I'm a millennial)- clean, modern offices (a lot of doctors' offices in SF are dingy and look like they haven't been updated since the 80s)The cons are basically everything else, unfortunately. I don't mind paying an annual fee if I feel like I'm receiving some elevated level of service. That might have been when I first joined, but it certainly hasn't been for the last year.It's impossible to speak with anyone. Over the last year, I've seen messages to the med team and the admin team within the app, which advertises a one day response time from the med team and 3 days from the admin team. I have messages from October that no one answered. A recent message to the med team had not received a response after 6 days, so I finally had to schedule a virtual visit to get an answer. You used to be able to call the office directly - now you get directed to a phone bank where you'll wait on hold for at least an hour. I've lived in a lot of countries and areas of the US, and had doctors where I _didn't_ pay an annual fee, and I've never experienced such terrible customer service.In 2019, I had a health event, and when I was released from the hospital, I was advised to go to my primary care provider for follow up care. My doctor was dismissive, misread my records multiple times, and seemed completely disinterested in coming up with a long term care plan for me. I contacted OM to help me find a new provider in the network who might be more attuned to my concerns, and they were not helpful.Due to the aforementioned health event, as well as the fact that I play a few sports, I do have to go to the doctor with some frequency. More often than not, the doctors brush me off and tell me to take an NSAID (which I can't take, and it says this in my chart).At this point, One Medical is basically glorified urgent care, _not_ a "concierge" medical provider.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Elite 2021
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Avoid this group of Amateurs.Almost impossible to reach them by telephone and the walnut creek location has only two MDs and they are seldom available so you are referred to some other city.I canceled my membership and they agreed to return $127.00. Â Now they said they paid it and there is no record in my books or in the bank's records. Â I have asked them to send proof that the check was canceled, but I have not heard from them and the time on hold with them is unbelievable. I hate to take the small claim court's time for only $127.00.Their propaganda is untrue. Â No service.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Buyer beware. Â If you only need to go for regular check ups it might be okay. But a $100+ membership? Â Nah. Â I have been a member for 3 years and each year have wanted to give them another try..and another..and another. Â Until now. Â I had to see two different doctors for the same issue in a two week period. An ongoing infection which is also in my medical report. Â Each doctor (one was actually a PA) prescribed two different medications with nothing but a 7 day remedy. Â This infection takes more than 7 days to clear up; and clearly that is the case because I had to go back. Â $300 per visit for something the first visit should have just taken care of. Â I will be cancelling my membership ASAP.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: One medical ran out of supply for COVID vaccine- pfizer AFTER my first dose. Didn't know this could happen. So l've had to scramble, call around for a second dose. Many vaccinators will not just do one dose. One Medical has not help me at all. It's actually very hard to get someone from there on the phone. This is the first time I've felt they had no regard for me; however, this is still very disappointing and stressful.

Reviews: I've been a patient at One Medical for 5 years. Â Customer service has gone progressively south since I initially signed up. Â The docs are great, which is why I stay. Â But, it's getting to not be worth the incredibly long hold times and lack of follow-up from the administrative teams.

Reviews: This whole thing is such a scam. I got charged 300+ for a 10 minutes VIRTUAL visit for a humble headache, only to receive the "care" - advice to drink water, sleep well, keep a diary, etc. - that you could get from a google search for free. STAY AWAY FROM ONE MEDICAL!!!

Reviews: UPDATE: disingenuous corporate shill 'Diana R' reached out to me, to tell me that i was lying and that they do answer their emails!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Like others, my experience with One Medical has been horrendous. They market themselves as an app based service with stellar ease of use, but it's been anything but that.I had a 20 minute online consultation with a doctor where she basically told me to drink more water. I then find I've been billed $540 for this. $540. I've been to orthopedic surgeons where my in office visits were half this price...In trying to follow up and get clarity on the cost, I've gotten absolute radio silence. They try to direct all communication through their app, where all messages go unanswered. I contacted the Billing department on 11/20, and only got a message on 12/8 after I'd made numerous phone calls and sent 5 follow up messages. Cecile C. on their admin team tried to explain to me that they are "very busy, because of a pandemic." I understand, and have sympathy for that. But if you can't support basic admin functions, then what are you doing? "Concierge" service should not involved countless messages that go unanswered, me having to follow up with my insurance and learn esoteric medical billing codes, and exorbitant fees for what I could find on WebMD. I will NOT be renewing my membership.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Still waiting for a call back from One Medical regarding my membership THEY let lapse. I've emailed, I've called. The first time I called was a month ago to discuss my membership: I was told they Â couldn't discuss it until closer to when it expires. OK. That's strange. So I called three days before my membership was due and they said NO ONE in membership was available that day to help me and I'd get a call back. It's been 5 days since. Nothing. You get put on hold for 15-20 mins when you call. It takes THREE DAYS at minimum to hear back from Admin (if at all). My doctor (who I like) took a week to respond to a simple message. They are either understaffed or just don't care. If I was sick right now I wouldn't be able to see my doctor (who I had before they joined One Medical). This during a pandemic! I give up. A couple years ago the service was good; over the last year it's steadily declined and every year the price goes up. Now it's $199 for WHAT? They say it's "faster, easier, and more enjoyable." So very untrue.I see on the app they sent me a message: can't read it since membership lapsed.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: DO NOT waste your money on OneMedical. Their concierge services are a scam! They will respond back and tell you to take Tylenol and if it gets worse to go to Urgent Care or come in for an appointment in which case they will assess you and just send you to a real doctor that can help anyway. If it's the weekend forget it!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: This is the absolute worst service I've ever experienced. I mean, really really bad. Total garbage concierge service. Good luck trying to get a response via the app within 48hrs. Good luck trying to get through by phone. The practitioners do not communicate with each other so it's a crapshoot that'll you'll get consistent information or followup. FIrst time using them and they didn't check my insurance, miscoded my visit and I was charged $850. Avoid this at all costs. Zero stars. Shit, negative stars if it was possible.

Reviews: Tried to schedule a COVID vaccination. The website repeatedly would show an available appointment but when I tried to confirm the message was either that there had been some error or that another patient was already booking that appointment. Even when I refreshed the screen repeatedly as fast as I could, the same thing happened. So, apparently the website is dysfunctional. This site is not worth the $200 annual membership fee.

Reviews: *YELP REMOVED MY REVIEW *I am posting my review and also sharing why Yelp removed my previous review. Per Yelp's email, my review was removed because "I posted similar content to multiple branches of the business". However, I interacted with BOTH of these businesses - One Medical has over 5+ branches in SF and I only posted for the 110 Montgomery and 220 Sutter locations because they were the Fidi locations which was near me + my work. I had a similar experience with both locations because they share a centralized customer service. I've contacted the California Insurance Commissioner's Office so if you've also had a bad experience with One Medical, please call to tell your side of the story. This is their number: 800-927-4357.Yelp moderator that is seeing this - please do not remove. I have NOT re-posted this review to the 220 location because I think it is important that my review be seen to show my experience. I am an avid Yelp user and use it to find great restaurants and services (as well as avoid poor experiences) Review below-----I'll start with the headline YOU DO NOT NEED TO PAY MEMBERSHIP FEES TO LEVERAGE THEIR SERVICES. I REPEAT. YOU DO NOT NEED TO PAY MEMBERSHIP FEES.-----One medical is essentially a wraparound service on top of your insurance. I found them because I was searching for a primary care physician and they gave me this super strong pitch on their services. When I said I just want primary services for my in network physician and that I shouldn't have to pay a fee, the membership associate was very rude and said "I have to go over the membership in details with you" even though I indicated over and over that I want access to care within network.This type of practice is quite predatory because they make think that you need to pay the membership fees to use the services. That's untrue. Without a membership fee, you just have to call in for an appointment and you don't get the online booking / rescheduling. That's what you get for $199/year? No thank you.TLDR: Predatory services, membership not required, rude customer service, will be reporting to DA
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: SCAM- Similar to other reviewers, the billing is not clear and support is inadequate. Expected for healthcare in general but customer service is supposedly what paying an additional membership fee covers for OneMedical

Reviews: My insurance at work changed so I needed to find a new doctor to get my prescriptions refilled. Unknowingly I chose a provider, Dr. Julie Loewen, who is a part of the One Medical network. When I called to schedule a new patient appointment, I was told by One Medical staff that in order to even get my name into the system, I would need to pay a $200 annual fee to be registered in their system. This would be in addition to my $20 office visit co-pay.In order for me to get my $10 prescriptions, I have to pay $220. $200 of that just to even exist in their computer system. Unconscionable.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Doctor here is ok but not great. Would not waste extra dollars to purchase membership.

Reviews: This place is an absolute joke.When I have first used this service it went well went to see a doctor a one medical facility. Making the appointment. and speaking with the N.P. was great she was very nice. Although I have tried for the last two hours to see a physician online to discuss a dull pain I have been having for weeks where I believe is my kidney. But I am not a doctor. Anyway tried to call customer service only to be hung up on and all my future calls forwarded to voicemail.This service along with Lyra mental health is designed for convenience which is what attracted me to the service, but this entire experience with this and my "mental health professionals" is just a joke. Honestly this review is for the medical professionals that work for this service...Please find a better way to serve your community because these people who run the company do not care about the patients only the bottom line.Thank you.Sincerely,-Adam Cooter

Reviews: Went here for a 30min visit last month with a general practitioner. He asked me some questions and did some basic checks like listening to my breathing etc, and just found out that they're calling it a "moderate to complex" office visit and charging me $400. Called their customer support and they told me that even though they're in-network, if I expect to do 2-3 office visits per year then I should get different insurance. This is nuts since they're basically saying that I just shouldn't go there for anything other than my annual physical, and if I have any small problems that come up that I'm worried about I should just tough it out instead of asking the doctors. It's basically just useless.I've been on the same insurance plan for 3 years. I've used Zocdoc and dignity health with this plan to see both general practitioners and specialists, in-network and out of network, I had never once been charged $400 for 30min. I asked One Medical about their billing policies and all they would tell me is that they're comparable to the other providers â

Reviews: For some reason my updated review was 1 star when I meant it to be 5 stars. So I am just updating again to make clear that I love one medical and have been a client for a very long time as a result.

Reviews: Do not go here, they charged me over $500 for a 15 minute visit with a doctor. Although the staff was kind and friendly, this was not worth the price.

Reviews: I've been a member of One Medical for 3 years. I used to like them a lot, but since the beginning of the pandemic, they no longer answer their phones, and they don't give you the option of leaving s message. I sent an email with a question to them 8 days ago, and I have not yet received a reply. The only thing I like about One Medical now is that you can easily schedule an appointment with a doctor or nurse practitioner on their site or by using their app. You can see any practitioner that you'd like to see, so you can get an appointment quickly if you need one. In addition, the doctors and nurses practitioners seem very good to me.

They have a messaging system that is suppose to allow you to communicate with them at your convenience but they don't respond and if they do, they selectively answer your questions and respond with bland pleasantries like " let me know how things are going" which mean nothing if they don't even read what you're sending. Steer clear of this and find a doctor that knows what they are talking about and don't charge $500 for every 15 minutes.

Reviews: One Medical is an unethical business. They have repeatedly been non-transparent about the charges. The company will try to exploit the pandemic to make profit coding visits in a way that will results I. The highest charge. The public should be aware of the way they do business. I am not planning to renew my membership. There are many options for healthcare and institutions that are upfront about the charges.

Reviews: This is premium cost with less than sub par service. I would give no stars if I could. Not worth it!My membership was up for renewal. I got an email saying they couldn't process my payment - not sure why as my card hadn't changed - and that I needed to go to my account and check it and/or make a manual payment. I did so the next day when I saw the email but was informed by the system that my deadline had passed and I would need to call one medical. I tried to call three times and left a message each time but did not hear back. The fourth time I left a message expressing my disappointment and frustration and finally got a call back. I was informed that because I missed my deadline my membership cost had increased (by 33%) and there was nothing they could do about that. Again, I expressed my disappointment and frustration, outlined the order of events, and asked for the situation to be escalated for further consideration. I was told it would be and I should expect to hear from someone the next day. I never heard back. And quite frankly I've just given up on them. The service was never that good and this is the straw that broke the camels back.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Simply Awful. Â I needed an MRI and the doctor made the referral. After a week in pain I'd heard nothing. Â So I started messaging them to find out what was happening. Â They never replied. Â I eventually got someone on the phone and they hadn't even bothered to call my insurance company after a week. Â  Do not trust these people with your health.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Do not go here. Go to a real Doctor- UCLA has online scheduling and Q&A. onsite phelbolotomy- so what- you will not be helped if a serious medical condition arises. I went here during a health crisis and was all but tossed out. Luckily, St John's recognized the medical emergency and I was quickly admitted and treated. I followed up with ONE Medical management and they supported their medical staff in dismissing my issue. Urgent care is MUCH higher quality then the level of treatment you can expect here.

I have spent months of back and forth and 4+ hours trying to sort our insurance claims that they messed up and can't seem to fix. It is their sole job and they can't seem to figure it out. Reviews: Well Its now 24 hours and Im still waiting to hear from you Mikayla...see how they treat there members people. Â And you get the privilege of paying $199.00 for horrible service and lies.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Horrible communication of medical billing. This medical group is only worth it if its free at your company (some tech firms do this), but if you have to sign up for the $200 membership on your own, FORGET IT. Don't be lazy. Go find a medical group and doctor that fits your needs. In their portal, they give you action items. This can be anything from the physician sending you a survey or their bogus system asking you if you need a flu shot AND IT MAY ALSO SEND AN ACTION ITEM IF YOU OWE A BILL. They have a 3rd party lab work company that can communicate with you separately. Beware of lapcorp. They will send you a bill without codes reasoning why your insurance denied the claim. On that note, one medical won't give you an itemized invoice about what part of your claim was denied unless asked. And if the source of the denial is lab Corp, they will claim they can't help you because they can't see their data. THIS PLACE IS A BOOK KEEPING NIGHTMARE. watch out for their use of lab corp america. They'll send your past due bill(which was never communicated well) to a collection agency without warning. WHY NOT WRITE WHAT THE ACTION ITEM IS IN PLAIN TEXT IN THE EMAIL?! (Action item - Bill , action item - message). None of that violates hippa
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Complete scam.Heard One Medical was good from a roommate, so made a same day appointment for a brief visit. (1) didn't realize you could receive care without paying the annual membership. Website is unclear and front desk administrator told me I would not receive confidential messages unless I did. I'll definitely be asking for that back.(2) for a fifteen minute appointment with my in-network insurance, I was billed $500. Absolutely insane. I could've gone to the ER and paid the same amount.Care was okay, but nothing the doctor did would indicate that the appointment would cost me $500... he wasn't using golden q-tips or anything.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I was a member with one medical for 2 years and I really can't recommend it to anybody.Pros:Same day appointments, lab on site so that's very convenientCons:If you're the type of person who only goes to the doctor occasionally then this is perfect for you. For anything beyond a cold, the staff here is just ... bad. Don't get me wrong, there are definitely some good doctors here. But the experience I've had here is just terrible.Examples:1. I got my annual checkup done and it seems like they're just perplexed as to why I want one. Well hello I just want to take care of myself??? To top it off, they seemed to dismiss any concerns I had about my health.2. Some of the staff here doesn't seem to understand women's health care and can be very rude and condescending.And because of that, I will never come back to one medical. I have another doctor now and I can say that the level of care is exceptional!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I really don't have high expectations for a PCP. Treat minor conditions and refer me to a specialist if what you are treating me for does not improve or requires a specialist. That's really all I expect but somehow even those low expectations were not met.By the time I got to one medical I had already been in the ER and been prescribed something so the doctor told me to just proceed with that medication. Great, makes sense. A week and a half later my symptoms are flaring up again so I decide to email the doctor on their app. I told her the situation and asked her do you think it is caused by "x". She responds no but offers no other alternative. Does not suggest I come back, we try a different medication, or I go see a specialist. Weird, but I guess I didn't ask the question. So this time I ask her "ok what do you suggest I do?" She says "well you could go see an x specialist but I don't think it's that." Great so if you don't think it's that why would you suggest that? She also said she didn't need to refer me to anyone because I have a PPO insurance.So at this point I've wasted 3 days emailing and gotten zero useful recommendations. I can google things on my own but the reason I'm asking her opinion is because she went to med school and I did not.After doing my own research and realizing the doctor is not going to help me I decide that I should see a gastroenterologist and not the other doctor she said probably won't help (thanks for the tip on who not to see LOL WTF) I find a place that takes my insurance and call them. They tell me I need a referral because they don't take people without them regardless of PPO insurance. At this point I want to bang my head against the wall because I have to go back and talk to Dr Helpful. She agrees to give me a referral after I'm the one that did all the research. How nice of her.Honestly I feel like I should get my $20 copay back. All she did was tell me to follow the ER doctors instructions and when I went to her for guidance she did not provide any and I had to manage my own care anyways so I wasted a few hours of my life and $20 when I could have just booked my own appointment with gastroenterology and had someone at the ER refer me.I called one medical to try to speed up the referral and a nice receptionist suggested I go try a new doctor while my referral goes through so I don't have to manage my own care. That's nice of her but I'm probably just going to throw away another hour and another 20 bucks.I just feel bad for all the people who need medical help worse than I do and have to navigate through this BS. It's easier to feel sick and just give up. Steer clear everyone!!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: There is a lack of responsiveness and responsibility that borders on the negligent during a public health crisis. As evidenced by it taking one medical a day to do something that takes other health clinics minutes to sort out, and an inability to see how and where the service is lacking followed by an attempt to sift responsibility onto the member.I called on Saturday to make an appointment for a COVID19 test and I asked if a test could be provided for my wife who was a member previously. I was told that there is a way to for her to get the test as well and that someone from membership would call us on Monday.Alley from membership sent us an email over the weekend and called Monday morning. A call that we missed. We were unable to speak to her for the rest of Monday.We called back and spoke to Peaches in membership who told us it could not be done without my wife being a member. We asked why we were told otherwise by Alley. Peaches said we would have to ask her, but she was in a meeting and that she'd call us in 40 min. Then Peaches hung up on us.2 hours later-We called again and spoke to Jay who told us that Alley went to lunch because it was the law that she had to take a lunch break. This seemed needlessly defensive as if reprimanding me for infringing on Alley's right to lunch, when I simply wanted to know when I was going to get the answer. Â Jay then proceeded to try to dodge providing service by asking for a release form from my wife. Luckily she was right there and could speak to him directly. Jay past us to Simon who works in admin to do "triage and screening" words we are unfamiliar with in a medical context and that the customer service team could not take the time to explain. Simon said someone will have to call us back and when we said we would hold on the line because Alley had still not returned the call till then, that was when he hung up on us. At this point in the process we had had to explain the story to Alley, Peaches, Jay and Simon for a total of 98 min on the phone, with nothing to show for it. My wife has insurance she was even a member before and they made us feel like we were asking this big favor to allow her to be included in this privileged experience that is one medical. In case this all seems acceptable to the reader let me juxtapose the one medical experience with what we eventually did. We went online and found a local clinic called All Care at 3:15 pm (while I was still on hold with Jay). We scheduled a phone consultation within an hour. Sent them our insurance card via email. Spoke to a pleasant doctor at 4:20 and scheduled a drive through COVID test at 6 pm.Why am I paying $200 a year? I completely understand if One medical does not want to test non members, however promising a member that it could be done and then passing them from one agent to another for an entire day, is not the way I would like to be treated. I've been a member since 2014 and I'm sorry to see this end on such acrimonious terms, but it must end after this experience, Â because I value my time and health I will no longer be member.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Very disappointed with the billing, with no consistency on how they work their pricing. I had a general visit of 15 mins for a cough/cold. Was happy to get in the same day appointment. They 'accept' my insurance, and when I get the bill in my email it's $359?! With my co-pay of $159. Just doesn't add up! I checked the pricing structure in their website, and there is no single fee close it my $359 billing. Something is really wrong. I get the service and ambience part, but they have to be upfront with what they are charging their patients for. Who pays $359 for cold and cough! Never would have gotten the membership for $159 had I known this scam. Soo disappointed!Update- didn't have an option but pay the bill. They called me back, made zero sense on what they were trying to explain on why a general visit bill at a place that accepts your insurance would come to $159. I have requested a refund on my annual membership of $150, as I obviously don't want to visit them again!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: So far I have not had the best experience. I had to switch from Kaiser a few months ago and had no clue where to go, so I signed up with One Medical.They just can't do much at their locations and refer to you to a ton of other places to get care. They feel just like a match maker, which feels like an extra step. I also seem to only be able to get appointments with nurse practitioners. Their responsiveness over email hasn't been helpful in my experience either.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I've had positive experiences with One Medical - until now. I pay the $200 a year to be able to get quality care quickly from top notch doctors, but for the last week I've continued to struggle to get care following an ER visit. Â Don't want to call anyone out, but I do want other patients to know what they're getting/not getting. Â I got ill while out of town and ended up in the ER. Â I was advised to follow up with my primary as soon as I returned home which I tried to do but she was unavailable so I saw someone else at One Medical. I was experiencing extreme vertigo and nausea and the doctor agreed it was urgent so he immediately referred me to a physical therapist who could do a manuever to relieve the vertigo and allow me to walk without assistance.Obviously nobody checked to see if the physical therapists actually do this maneuver because when I called they say they don't. Â Definitely something the doctor could have checked on ahead of time vs. leaving it up to the very ill patient to arrange. Â Then I got a referral from One Medical to an ENT doctor for the following day. Â While I was able to see that doctor, there was yet another barrier to care - a hearing test they need to do to rule out another cause of the vertigo. Since no one notified me that was necessary, I had a very inconclusive visit with that doctor. One Medical set me up with an appointment today with my primary, almost a week after the ER visit. Â I went to that appointment at which time I was advised, "oh you didn't get a message? The doctor is out this week" Apparently they had called an hour before my appointment to cancel. I've now been scheduled for another appointment with my primary next week. I hope that appointment happens. Â In the meantime, I've been online finding videos of maneuvers I can do to relieve the vertigo. It's the only relief I've gotten post- ER... the help I gave myself. Super disappointing experience that would make any patient feel helpless and alone.I've asked for a full refund on the $200 membership fee since One Medical is not providing the service they describe. Will update this post with whether I get it.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: No parking and no accessible. This is health care for able bodied people that don't need much support. Not for people that have real health issues. Offices don't have parking and are impossible to get to.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: This is in response to OM's completely delusional response: Â Their "virtual" hotline is absolutely useless because all they tell you is to make an appointment as everything needs to be seen by a doctor. Â Then when you try to make an appointment, you have to wait 2-3 months for availability. My husband couldn't even get a regular physical before having to pay a copay for a separate "initial meet and greet". Â This is AFTER they switched his doctor on him. So, each appointment has its own copay, so they stretch everything out to multiple appointments, which are months apart. People will die before getting the full treatment they need from OM. STAY AWAY.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I'd been with Kaiser for years and started a job where it was not offered. I muddled through what was a really awful search for a new provider until a coworker recommended One Medical. This location is literally across the street from my office and I was able to make an appointment to meet immediately with the NP I chose. The office is clean and well maintained and very well decorated. A boutique feel. I was impressed by the care I received from the NP, the lab techs were REALLY on top of their game, and the ability to make a video appointment and have a prescription filled while I was traveling was incredible. During open enrollment, my employer was able to switch me back to Kaiser and I pretty much resigned myself to writing off the $200 annual subscription I paid to OM. I sent a simple email to member services to inquire and received a nearly immediate response that included a generous prorated refund for the remaining subscription period. MIND-BLOWING!!! If I were not so embedded in the Kaise ecosystem and I did not get so much from it, I'd definitely consider defecting to OM. I really commend the level of care and service I received from this location, from the Castro location, and from member services. Thank you for taking great care of me!!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I am a prone fainter when I get my blood drawn. JULIE! Is incredible. So sweet, so kind, amazingly quick! I didn't faint for the first time in my life. I am so happy that I am a member of One Medical. Thank you for the great and painless experience. Thank you JULIE!! See you hopefully not for awhile but I will always come back just for you.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Chic over medical qualityThey have a lot of nice conveniences (cool office, sleek website) but when I came to select a doctor the only doctor on the list was "waitlisted". Â All the other available providers were nurse practitioners. Â But I want to see a doctor, not a nurse practitioner.One Medical seems like a profit-seeking machine, rather than providing top notch care to its members. Â They charges an annual fee while not providing a enough doctors, just nurse practitioners.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: This location of One Medical was great - the front desk folks were super friendly and helpful, my dr. was timely, had great bedside manner and was so sweet (thanks Dr. Ashiku!), and best of all, they have the lab onsite and are so fast! The woman doing my blood work was great and I got my results back less than 24 hours later?! One Medical is fantastic and highly recommend!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: The first time I enrolled (paid) the service failed me. I contacted immediately and was assured I would get both a REFUND and Cancellation. Now I get a cheery email in which they announce they are taking the annual fee AGAIN fom my credit card. What does it take to quit this group?
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I won't go into detail, but I will say I was extremely disappointed with a doctor at this One Medical. They came highly regarded and were the sole reason I signed up for One Medical, so I had high hopes. Unfortunately, this crumbled. I'm lucky to have been referred out, this time to probably the best doctor I've ever had in my life, so that makes this experience worth it to me. In this case, the destination was better than the journey, but I'm grateful for where I am now.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: My new employer insurance policy gives me access to One Medical membership for free. However, when I tried to sign up online I wasn't able to figure out how to bypass the registration system so that I do not have to pay the membership fee. I emailed one of their offices and Frankie responded. She insisted that there is no such thing as a membership fee waiver unless you're under extreme financial hardship. I explained to her that it should be covered under my plan but she refused to acknowledge anything I said. She left a voicemail and was very smug about it too. I am not sure why she was so hostile. I went back to my insurance provider and they guided me to the One Medical website where I can register without paying a fee. I got signed up without a fee. I am not sure why Frankie Â would not try to help me properly. She might be paid on a commission?
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Great until you actually get sick. Â Then you're stuck constantly jumping between people with absolutely 0 clue about what is going on. Â Also, their 24/7 contact line is not 24/7, and you will be forced to leave a voicemail. Â Then they will call you back an hour later, leave a message telling you to call the same line, which leads right back to another voicemail, to be answered by another clueless person who leaves a message telling you to repeat the process all over again. Â What the heck is that? Â How does that happen? Â They are literally just playing phone tag with you.Sure, the doctors and staff are all really nice, but the organizational structure is an absolute mess, and they don't even give you the contact information for any of the doctors they might randomly ship you off to unless you change them to your PCP.Absolute nightmare to work with, and I'm convinced if I had been using a real doctor and not scam medical, that my pneumonia wouldn't have had the time to progress to the point where I needed to go to the hospital. Â I might as well have not even bothered to use One Medical at that point. Â What a joke. Â I mean just look at all the more or less copy+paste replies to all the negative reviews. Â They all say they take feedback seriously, but despite all the reviews leaving all the same feedback, you can clearly see literally nothing has changed and in fact, it's probably gotten worse.If you value your life, avoid. Â Seriously,EDIT: Â 3 days later, still playing phone tag while I choke. Â Literally nobody at all responding on the 24 hour care phone line or service in the app. Â One medical is an absolute scam at this point. Â I'll probably be doing a chargeback for the membership fees soon. Â Just look at this BS reply from cookie below. Â 100% crocodile tears. Â I've tried to contact One Medical about this very issue and they don't even answer their phones or respond to emails, at least not with any respectable punctuality, as I've literally not heard back yet.edit 2: Â These clowns keep getting better. Â This is a direct quote from one of their agents about their "24/7 on call" service.  "We are available 24/7, however we are not always available immediately. Typically, our phone turn around time may be up to 2-4 hours and our email turn around time may be up to 24 hours. Â If you have urgent concerns, you're always welcome to give us a call back."Keep in mind that call back number is the one that takes 2-4 hours to respond to, you know, that immediate 24/7 always on call service.The cognitive dissonance is insane. Â At least they've officially admitted to false advertising.edit 3: Finally got in touch with somebody named Carrie who said (without actually seeing me, hearing my lungs or anything) that all me previous doctors were wrong, though she can't say way, and that she knows best and that I just need more steroids to clear the "pneumonia" that all the other doctors say I don't have out of my lungs.STAY AWAY FROM THESE CROOKS.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Elite 2021
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: About 95% of the primary care physicians on my insurance plan work in One Medical offices. I tried to call and book and an appointment and was told I would have to apply for a financial hardship waiver - in order to see my doctor without the privilege of paying $150 for One Medical. I called my insurance company and was informed that signing up for One Medical is optional. After two unsuccessful attempts to make an appointment without subscribing, I had someone from my insurance company call and connect me with the one person who acknowledged that the subscription optional. That person still tried to coerce me into a Â One Medical plan but did eventually make an appointment for me with my doctor - for 6 weeks from now :| With these tactics, I don't trust this business.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I really do like the physicians, NPs, PA-Cs, etc. that I have seen through One Medical, and I do appreciate the fact that I can make or cancel an appointment the same day. Â But what I initially thought was a fluke in their prescription authorization system turns out to be a consistent problem. Â I take a medication that is a controlled substance. Â I go through one bottle of 30 tablets at a very low dose in about 3-4 months because the prescription is "as needed." Â I used to be a member at Kaiser and while Kaiser had the same, no-refills policy regarding controlled medications, I could always go online and request a refill and be assured that it would be ready for pickup within 24 hours. Â With One Medical, I waited a full week for my prescription to be authorized the first time I requested a refill.This is now the second time I've requested a refill, and the second time that the pharmacist and I have had to call multiple times after several days to get someone at One Medical to authorize the new prescription. Â I requested the prescription on Sunday and it is now mid-day Thursday. Â It's frustrating because I really do need this medication on occasion, and I have a 15-year documented history (there's some kind of controlled substance database) of not abusing this medication. Â Isn't this exactly the kind of thing paying $150/year for a "concierge medical service" is supposed to prevent? Â Kaiser does this better.
