Somebody cared!Perhaps I WILL make it to week two after all...------------Part of 1Life Healthcare, the practice is "designed to be accessible, responsive, reliable, convenient, trusted, education-oriented, and holistic and integrative." There is an annual fee of $79, which provides you with access to a network of MDs, nutritionists, acupuncturists, etc.Their website is awesome in that they tell you where the cheapest parking garage nearby is - Stockton/Sutter Garage!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: This is by far the worst quality of care that I've had since I was in an HMO network (Kaiser) over 10 years ago. I will not return. I called early Friday morning, after learning of the group's promise to get you in to see a doctor for a same-day visit. I was told that the group could not see me until Saturday at 5:45pm. So much for guaranteed same day appointments (a primary reason the group requires a $150 annual membership fee). Later on Friday, I was called and told that an opening was available for Friday at 5pm. When I got to the practice, I was seen by a Physician's Assistant, not a doctor. During the visit, I explained my condition. The PA asked to send in some lab work. The website says the offices can do lab work on site, which is another reason to pay the $150 membership fee. One Medical sends lab work out to Lab Corp. It takes 5 to 9 business days to get the results back (if you ever get a doctor to call you with the results, that is). It is also debatable whether it is 7 business days maximum or 9 days, it depends on which nurse is telling you, since I was told both.When I told the PA that I was recently on a prescription for the same condition (only a month earlier), and could not recall the name of the antibiotic, she could not name a few of the common antibiotics generally prescribed for the condition. She actually took out her smartphone and tried to google for the name. She then told me, "I don't have time for this. I have to see another patient." One Medical claims to require the $150 membership fee so that you get extra time with your doctor and quality care. I did not receive this.Fifteen minutes after I left One Medical's office, I called back with the name of the antibiotic. By Saturday at noon, I tried calling One Medical because I had not heard anything from them and had expected a prescription to be called in to a local pharmacy. When I called in, I was transferred to a voiceline and put on hold for over 20 minutes. When I finally spoke to someone, I was told that no one was available to speak with me at that time and that "someone would call me." Nearly two hours later, when I still had not heard back, I called again. I was again told by an automatic system that all lines were busy and I was placed on hold for nearly 25 minutes. When I did finally get through, I was placed on the line with a nurse who was unfamiliar with my case. She said that the PA had written in the file that I was going to "pursue holistic options" rather than an antibiotic. While I understand the benefits of "holistic options," and believe these are valuable, when I have a persistent bacterial infection that requires an antibiotic after more than a month-long bout with the infection (and twice before on an antibiotic that didn't rid me of the infection), I expect to be put on a stronger antibiotic, and maybe add to this the benefits of "holistic options." I in no way would walk out of the medical office with the intention of ignoring the need for an antibiotic.The prescription was finally called in about 6pm on Saturday, more than 36 hours after I had initially called about the condition.On Wed, after not hearing from anyone at the medical office about lab results, I called to speak to someone. Again, I was placed on hold. Again, I was eventually connected to someone that had no clue about my file. I was told that lab results would take 5 to 7 business days and that someone from One Medical would call me before the end of the day Thursday. By 5pm Thursday, I had not heard from anyone. I called One Medical. I was again placed on the phone with yet another new person who was unfamiliar with my history, poor and frustrating experience to-date, Â and was clueless about what was going on and asking me again from the beginning what was happening. Additionally, she told me that no records were in my file about my email communications with the nurse from Saturday. Another "benefit" that One Medical claims is worthy of the $150 membership fee is email communication with a doctor. I have yet to speak with a doctor. And, even after I emailed the nurse, no mention of that communication was put in my medical file.The nurse I spoke to today (Thursday 5:20pm) said that she doesn't even see a record of my tests being sent to the lab. So I'm waiting for nothing. They didn't even send out the samples to a lab on a persistent bacterial infection that is now on a third round of antibiotics?! This place is incompetent, at best, and at worst, could lead to a malpractice suit. I would avoid it at all costs.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I'm a substitute teacher and I have to update my TB test every year and to get to my regular doctor is a kind of a hike, so I thought why not sign up with this new group that is super close to my house - I live downtown. Â  So I pay the $100.00 and I fill out all of the info. online just so I can go have Â a TB test done and read. Â So, I make an appt. with a Physician's Assistant (PA), named Jennie, and she takes me into her office and gives me the test. Â My first reaction was that I felt like I was the first person she had ever given the test to, and in my mind I was wondering if the way she had administered the test was going to leave a lump, which reads like a false positive. Â That is EXACTLY what happened 2 days later when I returned to have Jennie read the test. Â So, she sent me for a chest x-ray - O.K. - she's just doing her job, but it was a big pain in my - you know what, but I did it. Â I asked the technician who did the x-ray if he could send them that day, because it was a Friday, Â and he said that he would and he did. I know this because I called the office and spoke with Stephanie, a different PA, and she emailed me a copy of the x-ray and the results and they were negative - they were normal - I did not have TB. Â Nonetheless, I didn't hear from Jennie, so I was still stuck. Â  I can't file to be a substitute in the city w/out the proof of a negative TB test. Â  On Monday morning I call in to see if I can finally get the proof I need and once again, every time I call they have no idea who I am or how to spell my name (just annoying). Â  The girl on the phone had no idea what to do so I said just have Jennie call me or send me proof of a negative TB test. Â By 1pm I had heard nothing, so I decide to walk over and not leave without this .... well, that didn't happen. When I arrive, the girl at the front desk still doesn't know who I am or how to spell my name - ANNOYING!!!!! Â is it the same girl or not I wonder? Â So I explain my long story to the girl, with a blank expression on her face, and end it once again by asking to speak with Jennie. In the meantime another woman comes out - Â and comes to the conclusion that I need an appointment - UGH!!!!!Finally I catch sight of Jennie and I grab her and plead my case and she says she doesn't even know if the results have come in yet :( I was crushed.  I tell her that the results are in and that I have a copy that I received on Friday morning and that they're normal. Â  This ends with her telling me Â she has to get back to me, because she's busy with patients and will ahve to look at the x-rays later :(Who knew getting a TB test was so difficult.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: With a new job, came a new city, and with a new city and job, came new insurance and new doctors. We already had our health insurance, so I was a little uneasy when they told me I would need to pay a $149 membership fee annually to use my chosen PCP as my.. PCP. I asked, before committing, if I could request a refund should I dislike whatever I was about to go through. With a refund happily promised, and an appointment made for three hours after I became their patient, off I went.The clean and quiet office had its own floor, and the receptionist was pleasant and skipped any sort of meaningless questions or chitchat, as I had taken advantage of their online health information forms. They knew what they needed to, and that I was there, and, perhaps most refreshing of all, I didn't need to pay yet. Not until I had been seen and was happy.My doctor got me five minutes late, but she had had to run to another floor to help someone with something urgent. I believed this, because I watched her go and return. Anyone else who entered the office was seen exactly on time, so I didn't mind waiting a few minutes, and I wouldn't mind waiting again. Come on, five minutes. Five minutes, past the actual scheduled time, and then I'm with my actual doctor.. not just seated in yet another room by a nurse to wait fifteen more minutes.My appointment itself was pleasant, and covered way more ground than I ever thought possible in the thirty or so minutes I was there. I got medicine! and tests! and referrals! and!.. she was happy to do all of them! She was friendly, honest, straightforward, helpful.. the list goes on.This was my first visit, and I was thoroughly impressed. I'd been extremely mistreated for higher prices up until now. I can't believe I hadn't been shown this place sooner. $149?I know this how the business -should- be, but if you factor in how much time you'll save here, versus elsewhere, and how much more convenient it is.. well, hey. My last doctor prescribed a medication to me that I was allergic to. Twice. Once after I called him and asked him if he was sure that's what he meant to prescribe. It took me three weeks to receive one of three referrals from him, and it was to the wrong doctor. After coming here instead, well.. I'm still alive, I feel better, and my needed referral was in my inbox before I left the office. Take my money. I'm sold.Oh, I hope it stays this good.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I always had great experiences with these guys until I ran out of a critical medication. I called for a refill mid-day and got an email at 6PM that night that I needed to come in for an appointment before they would do so. At that point it was too late to come in and too late to go anywhere else. I called back and explained the situation - that I was out of a critical medication that I need to take as a result of treatment for Thyroid cancer. I should add that this medication is available over the counter in most countries outside the US. They ended up calling in the wrong dose to a pharmacy that was nowhere near my location once it was ready. I called back the next day and they were unwilling to do anything. This is exactly the kind of BS you use a service like this to avoid. Zero effort to work with me on a realistic solution for the problem other than come in for appointment which I don't have time to do in the middle of my work day. Just another medical group abusing an utterly broken American health care system. One Medical Group? I hope you fall on a bag of AIDS needles.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: So sad. Â I loved this place before, but I've had three really troubling experiences in the last two weeks that have convinced me that I have to look elsewhere for care -- which is a huge hassle! Â I was really trying to avoid it, but: - First, I needed to talk to a doctor on a Saturday, to get an opinion on whether I needed an antibiotic. Â The receptionist told me, I kid you not, that my only option was to go to an unaffiliated urgent care facility. Â She would not put me in touch with a doctor. Â Amazing, given the amount of money one pays to be a patient here, but I was willing to give it another shot given the huge hassle involved in switching.- A week later, I asked for a prescription to be refilled -- a prescription that I have been on the entire three years I've been a patient at One Medical, without interruption -- and a physician's assistant writes an email to me with a bunch of questions and calls their records on my prescription history "mysterious."- Then, I pick up the prescription, and it was called in wrong. Â Overall, it's like a bunch of kids who have no idea what they are doing are running the show at One Medical these days. Â Because I like my health, I am switching doctors.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: The service is convenient but watch out for the billing. Last year I was billed for an appointment that I never scheduled, and this year I was twice billed for a doctor's time when I saw a nurse practitioner. To me it doesn't't matter if insurance is paying, it still seems like a rip off if you are not watchful. Most of the practitioners seem competent and caring, but I am wary of the business side.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Love these guys! Heather is hands down the best general practitioner I've ever seen. She's relaxed, caring, attentive, and AWESOME. I love that emailing my doc is an option, I work 50 hours a week, and don't always have time for phone calls or office visits, so this feature is huge. Highly recommend.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: After several visits to the Metropolitan I've learned that it operates in the same manner as most of the medical folks that I've seen in the past. This disappoints me. Given the positive tone of the yelp reviews I was hoping for more. Like the others, the Metropolitan will force you into the role of aggressive self-advocate. Two examples I encountered: *Doctor Temperament* I visited a Doctor who has a shame-based approach to medicine. You have condition x..are 20 pounds overweight..require a prescription? What kind of woman..San Francisco native..human being are you? So, no, I will not do the right thing and schedule another appointment with you to follow-up on my issue. On the other hand, I've visited professionals at the Metropolitan who are perfectly professional and pleasant. The burden is on all of us to separate the wheat from the chaff. Â *Billing* The cost of visiting Doctor A at the Metropolitan is the co-pay, thanks to in-work insurance. The cost of visiting Doctor B at the Metropolitan is a substantial fee plus co-pay. Why? After 30 minutes on the horn, I was told that the ministry of insurance has never heard of Doctor B. Back on the horn to the Metropolitan for a "re-bill" and around we go... I've been grappling with the ministry of insurance and ornery surgeons for quite a while so I've adjusted to the conflict but I was hoping for a reprieve.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I was a patient of this office over a year ago, and found them to be friendly, helpful, but very ho-hum as far as a doctor's office. Very average. They aren't connected to a larger medical group, so tests and other work needs to be sent out. I felt like they were OK for those in their 20s and 30s who need general care and have no big health issues. I felt like I needed more comprehensive care than this office offered.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: One Medical is supposed to provide premium service and so far I have NOT found that to be the case. Â The people on the phone are typically not helpful. Â There is a long response time when you email your doctor for questions. Â Most importantly, this is an outpatient general care practice only. Â They hire mostly nurses and have few doctors. Â That means they are constantly referring you out for the most minor issues. Â  A waste of time and money.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I went to this place for a year before deciding to get primary care elsewhere becuase i wasn't satisfied with the caliber of the doctors on staff. I think the embarcadero center location is a bit better.The good-Annual membership fee isn't that expensive (something in the order of $115 or so) -Any time i've called i've gotten an appointment within a day-Can do everything online through their website-They prescribe directly to your pharmacy (which i suppose everyone does these days)-When you travel, they send you a list of all the shots you need for the location you are going and any medsThey misdiagnosed me twice and it was two different doctors on two different things which is basically why i stopped coming. I feel like if you are coming here for getting basic shots and whatnot they are fine. Â I'm sure many of people have had good experiences with the doctors here, i just didn't. Would recommend if you want to come here, don't just pick any doctor they give you, ask for their bios or whatever measure you want to use (i.e. board certified etc)
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I'm sure this is a review I'll come back to update after more visits, but I had to throw down a 5-star review after my first experience. Â I had some urgent medical issues recently (not lopped-off-my-toe urgent, but also not something I wanted to wait even 24 hours to investigate), so started Yelping around for a doctor. Â I called a few places all of which were either 1. closed or 2. booked for days or longer. Â Then I called Metropolitan Medical Group. Â I was initially turned off by this whole "boutique" practice concept. Â It felt elitist and unreasonably expensive. Â But really, it's neither. Â It's $99 annually which for the time and hassle I was saved is an insane bargain. Â So here's my experience in a nutshell: I called the office and they said I could come in pretty much any time that day. I scheduled the appointment for an hour from my call. Â They emailed me a confirmation message and a link to fill out all that annoying first-visit paperwork online. Â 10 minutes later the form was filled out. Â 45 minutes after that, I was in the waiting room. Â One minute after that, I was in Dr. Timothy Chen's office. Â After a calming, helpful 20 minutes with the doctor, I was done. Â And on my way out, he gave me his business card and said "call or email me anytime with questions." Â So about an hour and a half from having a lot of stress and no doctor, I was virtually stress-free and had a doctor I could contact anytime. Â If that's not worth $99 a year, I don't know what is.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I am so glad I found and signed up for the membership at this doctor's office! Â It is so amazing. Â I can log on to my account online and see the status of specific needs, communicate via email with my doctor's and call anytime I need something - the staff is so attentive.When I joined I had all my files transferred from my other doctor's offices. Â One Medical Group was completely on top of repeatedly requesting my files from my others doctor's and were nice enough to keep me in the loop.This is completely worth the money and I plan on renewing my membership next year. Â I recommend this to EVERYONE!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Dr Lee and the entire staff was fantastic. Got right in same day. I was in and out quickly and am better off now. One Medical for Life.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I pay enough in health premiums that paying another $100 annually to get access to the medical group seems a bit much for me. Â The other thing that has put me off is that I have yet to see a real doctor each time I've visited. Â Granted a physician's assistant is a step up from a nurse practitioner, but it's still not a medical doctor. Â I'd rather pay $100 to see a real doctor.On the plus side, you can get same day appointments rather easily. Â I haven't had some of the problems that other one-star reviewers have mentioned like waiting in lines out by the elevators. Â I did, however, experience some of the billing craziness mentioned by at least two other reviewers. Â I got double billed for my co-pay. Â I paid while I was in the office and received a bill again from their office after my insurance paid. Â I called their accountant who is offsite (most likely a freelance bookkeeper) who told me that "oh they sometimes 'forget' to credit your account for copays." Â That's pretty irresponsible in my mind. Â The other issue is that after paying a copay, I only have an electronic credit card receipt. Â They don't offer written receipts for copays that one might use if you have a 457b plan, for example, and want to get that paid through your pre-tax medical payment system. Â Instead I have to wait for the bill to come (30-60 days later) to submit it to my 457b plan.Overall I don't feel as if the service is worth $100 and I don't plan to return.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: This place rocks.I came back from a road trip to LA this past week and the next day, I felt pretty off. Â My throat was feeling funny and my sinuses felt drippy. Â I just felt drained. Â Plus it didn't help that I ran errands in the rain on Sunday without being properly bundled up, so whatcha gonna do. Â I went to work the next day and still felt off. Â Grr.Today I got up and didn't feel worse, but was like what the hell is going on. Â I hope it wasn't the swine flu!!!! Â I mean there are 4 cases now in SF. Â So I opted to stay home and sleep because my sleep was thrown off too. Â I rang the doctor's office after my additional 4 hour nap to see what they said.I told the person who answered the phone what was going on and she asked if I wanted to speak to a nurse practitioner. Â I said sure and she transferred me to Tiki. Â Or at least that's what I think she said. Â Either way, it wasn't your average name. Â I spoke with her and she asked me the usual swine flu stuff, like had I been to Mexico or been around anyone who had, did I have any vomiting, diarrhea, fever, etc. Â I said no. Â Phew!She said it sounded like my body was just adjusting to having traveled, especially after doing a road trip for 7 hours. Â She said it sounded like an a slight upper respiratory infection and just to take a day off or 2 to rest up. Â She suggested to just take some ibuprofen, drink lots of fluids, do sinus rinsing, rest and chicken noodle soup!If my symptoms changed or I got worse to give them a call. Â So I'm swine flu free!!! Â Now, I'm yelping, just had a bowl (er, can) of Campbells tomato soup, a big bottle of H20 and the TV on a marathon of the Real Housewives of New York. Â I'm pretty much set for the afternoon.It's pretty awesome to bypass having to get dressed, on Muni and go to the office when I could just talk to them on the phone. Â How nice!Always stellar service and worth every penny!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Is it worth it to pay $100 annually to belong to a medical practice?Yes.Isn't that elitist?No, if the $100 is a hardship, it's my understanding they'll waive the fee.Am I delighted that I can call today and get an appointment today, which is what I thought I'd be able to do anywhere when I upped the ante and went for the PPO?Yes.Did I really just email my doctor and get a phone call 15 minutes later answering my question?Yes.Will I renew for next year?Damn straight I will.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I almost don't want to write them too good of a review because I don't want the MMG to get crazy crowded and I'll never be able to get an appointment! :) But this place was great. Â So happy with my first visit here. Â I saw Dr. Singh today for a physical, hep B shot, and DM51 form filled out. Â He was patient, thorough, and kind. Â Really took his time going through my detailed and lengthy family history as well as giving me a complete examination. Â I felt he truly did have compassion for me as a patient and was dialed in to my concerns. Â Also, that (government, ugh!) form I needed completed was a 6-page bear, and he went through it very tediously and ensured each section was filled in properly. Â I felt very well looked after, and also was pleased to note how friendly and helpful the reception staff was. Â They found the two forms I needed for school and faxed them for me, in addition to making sure they were filled out properly. Â Overall, what a great experience! Â It is such a pleasure to find a nice family practitioner in the city. Â We moved from NYC and I have had some AWFUL, rushed, impersonal and just plain bad dr.'s visits where you truly feel just like a number and a $$. Â This was the complete opposite and therefore was very refreshing! Would recommend the Metropolitan Medical Group to all, they were a breath of fresh air!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I picked Dr. Lee out of a hat (or a physician directory) when I started my health insurance plan, but I never had any dealings with him or his office until I had an unfortunate incident with the Caltrain tracks on Townsend and my bike. Â I was worried about my nasty swollen wrist, so I went to the Acute Care center at UCSF. Â Long story short (and for another review), I ended up seeing one of Dr. Lee's partners, Dr. Jade Schechter, at the Metropolitan Medical office.The receptionist in the office was super nice and patient with me, even though I was less than nice, frustrated, and crying for much of our phone conversation. Â They gave me an appointment for a few hours later, and Dr. Schechter was really, really great -- she checked out my arm, sent me for x-rays, and everyone was on top of the insurance situation and told me the info I needed to know.Since then, I've been back for annual checkups with the PA-Cs that work with Dr. Schechter, and they are both really great. Â I've also been able to email them for prescription refills and non-emergency questions, which is incredibly convenient.I'll admit that I was a bit wary of the "annual service fee", but honestly, the office is really nice and conveniently accessible via BART and MUNI, the Internet/email compatibility is cool, the same-day appointments are great, and the doctors are friendly and knowledgeable. Â And I'm kind of into the whole vision behind their group. Â So, just this once, I'll abandon my cheapskate ways. . .after all, it is my health, and it also just might mean I'll never have to go to "Acute Care" again -- which is a very good thing.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Why this practice is worth $149/year on top of what you already pay for your insurance and your co-pays?How about: Â same day appointments? Â Email and phone access to your regular medical staff which saves you unneeded trips in? Â Several office locations and excellent care at all of them?I've been to this place for everything from regular check-ups to muscle to bone to infections to flu to you-name-it. Â I've gotten referrals on a number of serious issues including my PA insisting on making me an appointment with a specialist (in a case where 95% of medical practitioners would have been dismissive of my symptoms to begin with) - it turned out to be something unlikely but serious (I'm 100% cured now!).They ask me about my experience with doctors they refer me to so they can update their notes!They spend the time with each patient to actually treat the person, not the symptoms you happen to remember to mumble to the doc in 3 minutes you get elsewhere. Â They seem to enjoy what they do. Â They actually have meetings where they discuss interesting/educational cases with each other - imagine that!I'm home with a fever and a bunch of prescriptions today, feeling better after a weekend from hell and here is how I got an appointment: Â I emailed around 9pm last night asking for a first available appointment and to call me whenever they got the message. Â They phoned me as asked at 7am offering me 8:30, 9 or 9:30am times. Â Then about half an hour later a nurse called me to get detailed symptom list to see if I can be spared coming in given the bad weather (I couldn't be). Â So I saw my usual PA at 8:30.This place rocks. Â It's not a throw a dart at it in your HMO directory kind of place. Â They do charge extra. Â If you can afford it, it's is totally worth it.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I love the concept!At this point, I've been through 3 PCPs, four gynecologists and an ENT specialist, who all pass the buck to one another.Perhaps, with many specialists in one group, I'll have better luck. Â I'll be sure to update my review.UPDATE: Â I was able to get a same-day appointment, it was on time and the doctor spent quite a bit of time listening to my concerns. Â He was able to do what the other doctors before him could not - get me pain-free. Â So far, so good. Â I hope this lasts!UPDATE: Â As with most things about your healthcare, you will want to follow up the next business day if there is any business left pending, for example., prescriptions. Â Be sure to ask your reliable pharmacy (mine is) to indicate the name of the person at the doc's office who is handling the authorization. Â This way, you can follow up if things haven't moved in a day or more. Â The staff at OMG are very responsive.UPDATE: I am not able to obtain same day visits - online or by calling - however, they have a set of nurse practitioners on hand who can answer calls. Â It's a better, cheaper alternative to availing oneself of an emergency room for quick care.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: My brief, yet unfortunate, experience with One Medical Group has left me crawling back to Kaiser. Ironically enough, my main issues are the exact items they seem to dote themselves on as being "different".Sutter location:Upon joining One Medical, I was told that email is the preferred method of communication with the providers, yet don't receive responses to emails until about a week or more after my emails- and when they do respond, they simply are saying to "feel free to keep increasing the dosage" of medication. I'm wondering if they simply have email response templates. I've had prompter responses and more personalized care from both La Clinica and the Berkeley Free Clinic.While the delayed response and lack of addressing my specific issues were disturbing, I was not ready to quit them just yet...until this morning. I emailed Dr. Mary Lowen yesterday, letting her know I thought I had a sinus infection. Given the week or more response time to my previous emails, I thought I would call as well to follow up. When I called, I spoke to a very informative and courteous member admin, Brandon. Brandon let me know someone would be calling me to prescribe antibiotics and confirmed my preferred pharmacy.I received an email from them instead, with links to blogs about sinus infections. I responded to the email saying I am requesting antibiotics, not links to blogs. I was told by Phebe Kiryk that they would not call in the meds. She went on to cite recent trends in treating individual symptoms of sinus infections. I let her know that I was already sick, going on 2 weeks, and need MEDS, not data points. She told me that I would need to make an appointment to come in and be qualified for meds. I let her know I had gone home sick from work, and would not be schlepping out into the city to pay a co-pay, be seen, and MAYBE be given meds. My concerns were met with more robotic responses: Research shows that antibiotics don't always work as well as we used to think Â they did!!! No sense of urgency was expressed at all, and my concerns to advocate for my own health were discredited by Ms. Kiyrk's seemingly ambivalent coined responses. Â You will be better off waiting for the mobile clinic truck. One Medical delivers their promise of a "different experience", but fail to mention that it won't be good-different.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I used to love this place. I paid the membership fee, but let it lapse as I haven't been to the doctor in a year. When I went to make an appointment, I was pressed for the membership fee. I said no. Then I was transferred to a membership associate to "answer my questions." I was then cajoled and shamed to pay the fee, or sign the waiver. I was asked how much I make a year. // Â I had seen an incredible doctor there who recently left OM. Now I'm wondering if their new policies are what pushed her out. When I asked the new doctor a question, she said, "That's no longer in our current model of offerings." Sounds a lot like corporate speak to me. I guess this is what happens when a for-profit company gets into the medical care business. Â I understand that they offer technology which is current to modern standards, but shouldn't this be the norm?? They said the membership fee pays for that. I countered that "Why didn't the $475 charged for my 20-minute visit cover that and a nice profit margin. Â It's a shame because I have really liked the service up until now. Why not charge a one-time membership fee and a nominal copay each visit? Not everyone sees a doctor every year. I hope they can work this out.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: This is a boutique medical practice. And its well worth the $150 membership fee. Every member of the staff at both locations has always treated me GREAT! And when I'm seeing them, I'm sick and cranky. I love the fact that I don't have to plan 6 months ahead, to not feel well. They are as close to paperless as it comes. Big Pluss. My doctor e-mails me information that he feels I need to know about in-between appointments, He remembers me. That's important.Also, You can get almost everything done in the one office. Primary Care Doc's, Naturopaths, Acupuncture, Nutrition, & Labs, All in the same office and all in the same visit. Big time saver for me. Thank you for making it so easy for me to take charge of my health care needs.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: If all it takes is $150 bucks a year to have my interaction with doctors be hassle free, organized, and with same day availability and weekend emergencies Â availability (ladies two words "UTI Hotline"), I call that a deal. Â Everything is is digitized, streamline, and the staff and doctors are knowledgeable and polite. Â I finally feel like my medical care with really CARE for me.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: So worth the $150 a year!Believe the other yelpers - this place is great!Everything is seamless when you get to the office for a visit - even on your first visit.Front desk staff are very nice - there are not large folders of paper around carrying your records, everything is electronic.Same day appointments are a PLUS as well as being able to email the doctor and get an email back!Love this place, everyone takes the time to help you out. Â My initial call to the office to inquire about doctors, etc. the front desk staff spent 15 minutes with me on the phone whereas other offices I would have been 15 minutes on hold.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I found them on Yelp- thanks folks! I like how easy it is to get appointments. Most of the time my appointments have started on time, even early. They started doing more lab work in their office, which is awesome, no more treks to that other dismal place to get blood drawn. They make it really easy to get referals if you have an HMO. They also have naturopaths in the office - I'm wondering if they are covered by my HMO.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Today I met Valerie Sobel, NP. Â I am pleased to report that I feel that I have found a practice that I can work with indefinitely after a terrible set of experiences with my former physician.I went in with an allergic rash and a whole slew of other symptoms. Â Valerie is friendly, knowledgeable, provided me with a lot of information. Â She was very responsive to all of my concerns, and ordered exactly the blood work I needed to rule out a genetic condition that has recently shown up in my family.I could not be more pleased. Â The receptionist was very polite and professional as well, the office is beautiful, and as weird as it may sound, I'm actually looking forward to going back to the doctor's office!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: First of all, as a new massage therapist in private practice, I do not have medical insurance. Â I wanted to join the One Medical Group as everything seemed so convenient, but could not afford the 150 dollar membership fee. Â I applied for the waiver, and I got it! Â  So I quickly made an appointment.Doctor Maxwell Â was great- She saved me additional money by speaking to one of her specialist colleagues so I could get a prescription filled without having to make an additional appointment with a specialist. Â  She reminded me by email that I needed to get my blood work done, and then two days later, she sent me my exam results also via email! Â How cool is that?This Group is great. Â And if you were like me and not sure if you could afford the membership dues, try asking for a waiver...
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I scheduled appointment with them before my trip because of the problem with lymph nodes. Â I was kind .. in hurry - had no time for regular hospital visits which usually takes 2-3 weeks all together.. They charged me around $110 for membership which was upsetting and unexpected. Â  But Â later I understood it worth it. Â The service was quick, relaxing.The doctor determined that one lymph node was slightly bigger and it's due to stress (she was absolutely right). After my trip I visited other doctors who couldn't determine or advice me anything...and the hospital cost was much higher that $100 for all procedures even if I have insurance :(So if you are in rush and need to do a quick check for some reason & money is not your big problem - One Medical Â  Group is the right place to go. Â Otherwise better have good insurance !!! and find your doctor /hospital.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I am a professional, collaborating with the professionals at One Medical Group, and have found both them and the staff to be so responsive and willing to give me much needed medical information, it has been a great pleasure to work with them.Deborah Brenner-Liss, Ph.D.Association of Professionals Treating Eating Disorders ClinicLaurel Heights Psychotherapy Associates Clinicprivate practice
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Metropolitan Medical is awesome. Everyone there has been so great to get services from. I took a long time looking for a doctor. I scoured Yelp and found them. I have always been able to get appointments within the same day or when I wanted the appointment. When I got really sick last month one of the providers saw me within two hours of when I called for the appointment. When I called for advice when I felt even more sick the followed up with me to make sure I got to urgent care ok and that I got all the meds I needed to get better. I was even able to reach a doctor by e-mail and get a response within 24 hours. Just super service from a super medical group.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I was seeking a general practice / sports medicine doctor about a year ago to check out a skiing injury and get a standard checkup.One Medical Group got me in the same day and I met with Dan Dinenberg - cool guy; made me feel better about my (non)injury.Still... the annual fee increased from $99 to $150 and I've only been once in two years... it is hard to justify. I just emailed the office to see if a cancellation and refund was possible. According to the time stamp, it took them about 8 minutes to refund my credit card. Nice! This place definitely has good service, but maybe it is only worthwhile if you get sick or otherwise check in with doctors frequently.I may reactivate my membership and pay up if I ever get sick or hurt again, just because I have confidence in the staff here.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Hands down, worth every penny. After a frustrating two years of using the regular general practitioners around the city, I finally gave in and paid the (minimal) membership fee. The convenience of being able to get same day appointments and EMAIL? amazing. Email especially, so many times it's just a simple quesiton to the doc but in other places you just don't have that kind of access. To top it off, the doctors actually care about you and spend time really thinking through what the right solution is instead of just shuttling you out the door to take the next person. I don't think I can ever go back to the old way.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I really can't rave about One Medical Group enough. They really make a trip to the doctor as pleasant as possible. Appointments are easy and fast to make, the offices are in great locations and very tasteful (the office in the Embarcadero Center is particularily spiffy), and the doctors are all very kind and helpful.Here is an example of how wonderful they are: I emailed Dr. Singh with a question, and it took him EIGHT MINUTES to respond. I was so impressed with his quick, concerned, response, thick wavy hair and dimples that I proceeded to email him a whole bunch of questions. And you know what? He replied to every one of them.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I like this place. Â First of all, it's very convenient for appointments during working hours as it's right in the financial district. Â And most times I'm able to get last-minute appointments with no problem. Â I have only seen Dr. Reid, but he is friendly and professional. Â What really impressed me a few years ago was the fact that they are internet-savvy. Â They use email! Â I was able to ask my doctor a simple question via email and he answered right away. Â Another big plus----a couple of years ago I suddenly came down with a nasty sinus infection and needed antibiotics quickly. Â I called Dr. Reid's office and talked to his assistant. Â She advised that he was on vacation but could be in touch if needed. Â She got in touch with him and we had a phone conversation and talked about my symptoms. Â Not that I want my doctor to rush to my side while he's on vacation or anything, but I was very impressed (and relieved) that I was able to take care of it sooner rather than later. I generally don't need a regular doctor, as I'm pretty healthy. Â For exceptions, I will always go back to Metropolitan Medical Group.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: My bf recommended this place after finding it on Yelp. It is def hard finding a good physician when you move to SF I would def recommend Metro Medical Group to anyone esp young professionals who are on the go, like making appoints and talking to your doc via email, and need flexible and last minute appointments.Great mix of traditional and non trad medicine I have been to diff doctors here and they are all great. Always listen to your issues, provide you with a lot of background and info, and use hardcore medication as a last resort.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Having been a relatively sickly child, teen, and college student, I've seen my share of doctors. Â I can safely say that One Medical Group is the best set of doctors I have ever had the privilege of seeing, hands down.Fortunately, since I've moved to San Francisco, I haven't had any extended illnesses. Â Which, I admit somewhat guiltily, is kind of a shame because I finally have a place I know I can go to get speedily diagnosed and treated. Â I want to watch them do their thang!I had a routine checkup with Dr. Margit Djikstra several months ago, in which she was friendly, informative, approachable, and frank - all things I really appreciate in a doctor. Â She gave me a handful of ways to improve my health without making me feel like I was probably about to die if I didn't take her advice, and I left with all of my questions answered.There's also an OB/GYN in house, making One Medical a fantastic source of one-stop shopping for the ladies. Â Oh, and nutritionists. Â And acupuncturists, if you're into that kind of thing. Â That's not even the best part, though! Â Though the doctors I've met do stand out as being wonderfully friendly and competent, I've had some good doctors in my life. Â What really continues to blow me away, however, are the staff. Â They're the nicest, most helpful staff for a doctor's office I've ever encountered. Â When I had trouble with my insurance company, they helped me out with a smile. Â When I showed up for some tests I didn't end up needing, they waived my copay. Â They're really outstanding people, and I kind of want to give them some kind of medal.And I guess what it comes down to is that One Medical Group makes doctors' appointments easy. Â They make renewing prescriptions easy. Â  They make scheduling easy. Â They make billing easy. Â They make finding a location easy. Â And on top of that, they make it downright pleasant! Â So as glad as I am that I don't get sick that often anymore, it's a huge relief to know that if I ever find my health compromised, there's an easy and pleasant way to get myself back up to snuff.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I really like One Medical Group. I have had a recent string of medical issues and they have been on top of my case every step of the way. I have been referred to a number of specialists and where they lack, One Medical has picked up the slack. For instance, filling out family medical leave forms. I needed them filled out and turned into my HR department by a certain time and my Vascular doctor was taking FOREVER. I emailed my doc at One Medical and she had it done and faxed to my HR that afternoon. I also had a bit of an emergency with some meds where the same doctor lagged to send the authorization to my insurance and once again i emailed my doc at one medical for help and she was on it and got my meds in time. I really like the accessibility to the doctors, you can call or email them any questions or concerns you might have and they get back to you soon. They are general medicine docs and can refer you to great specialists. I really like that fact that they care about what happens to you and your health. I also like the fact that their administrative staff is smart, nice and totally competent. I've been to a few offices where the administrative staff is lazy, dumb and just don't care. That's not the case here. In my opinion it's totally worth the $150 annual fee. I've been with them for about 4 years and really have no complaints. I recommend them to anyone looking for a new doctors office.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I love how you can book appointments the very same day, and choose your doctor. They make the entire process really easy. With locations around the city, it's really convenient to slip out during work for appointments, too. Thanks One One Medical!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I usually don't write a review unless it's of the two extremes that I feel so compelled to leave one. So here's my extremely negative review with One Medical GroupI had an appointment with Sean Dunn (I think he was a MPH or something, not MD) at 5:40 pm. I was sick and had a major headache and booked for a "brief visit". I admit that I was late to the appointment so I showed up at 5:51 pm ( yes, I checked the clock). I don't see a single patient in the office so I thought I was going to be their last patient. Well...guess again. I walked to the counter and the clerk proceeds to tell me that "the remaining time is not enough to diagnose a headache", which puzzles me more because it took him another 4-5 minutes to have Sean Dunn to come out and repeated the same thing " sorry, we think headache needs a complete diagnosis so we don't have enough time for it today".Out of curiosity, I asked him if he really needs to take off at 6 pm or is there another patient coming in, he then replied " yeah we are just trying to wrap everything up and go" and then he said "usually headaches diagnosis needs AT LEAST 20 minutes (does it or does this count as Â a "brief" visit I scheduled for I don't know)."So here you have it, I was turned away by a healthcare professional who needs to "wrap everything and go" when there are no other patients waiting and leave the ONLY patient he has in the office with the big headache he comes in with.I am not sure if this was in their code of ethics or what, but I believe doctors were educated to help patients and to save lives? How can you turn away a patient when there's obviously no other emergencies (as evident by the chit chatting I heard from the office and Sean came out 5 minutes later) and he was only late by 11 minutes when you are still in the office?
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Despite the fact you have to pay an annual service fee, Metropolitan Mecial Group is very convenient for busy working people like myself. Â It's really easy to make an appointment via email or phone, and you're able to update your medical info online. Â Plus, the medical staff is great at following up via email - no question too big or small for them to answer within a few hours. The best part is last minute (sometimes even SAME DAY) appointments. Â I always hated hearing other receptionists say the next available appointment is some day six months down the road. Â Yeah, okay - I'll just let this cellulitis keep growing til then until my arm has to be amputated from an overgrowth of bacteria. Â (This almost happened to me - no lie). Â And now that they've moved on up into their larger, newer, swankier office on the 6th floor at 110 Sutter and opened up an office in the financial district, the convience factor has doubled. Â Minus one star just because I feel they are still a baby business that may need to work out a few bugs.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I LOVE this Medical Group!These folks are on top of everything. Â I appreciate the warm, casual atmosphere and friendly communicative staff. My new PCP spent 25 minutes chatting with me to get my medical history and was not even checking her watch! The 2 offices near me- Sutter and Embarcadero are both convenient to my work and home. Â Also nice: The lack of lab coats cuts down on my anxiety at visiting a doctor. They partially validate parking at the Embarcadero office and do lab tests on site---no appt. is needed. Â I got results emailed to me as well as their newsletter and a personal note from my new Doc. Â WOW! Â Love It!Turns out I do need surgery on my foot...my doc gave me 2 great referrals for foot specialists and followed up with me.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I've been going to Metropolitan for a while now and am pretty darned happy with them. Â I first went to a wine and cheese reception, when did Kaiser ever do that?All the people from the front desk to the professional staff are friendly and seem happy to be practicing medicine. Â I never have a problem getting in to see my doc, Dr. Lee (who calls me dude). Â But if I do need same day I can always get an appointment, just maybe not with him. Â Seems realistic to think he might be booked for the entire day. Â Fact is I will see someone.The lab thing was pretty disgusting, those folks over on Polk run something out of the third world, but when I discussed this my doctor they started having "in house" lab work.All in all this a great place with great people. Â I have a lot of confidence in their abiltiies.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: By far the best doctors office ive been to. Modern, clean, organized, friendly, up to date with technology and bills instead of getting typewriter stuff in the mail. My doctor was amazing, appts are easy to make, blood work done in office (didnt feel a thing!), and they are very flexible and professional. I guess i found my new general practitioner.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Metropolitan Medical Group is great. Â I Googled looking for a internal medical doctor/family doctor and found them. Â At first I was a bit skeptical because they had fees and I thought why pay these fees if I have health insurance... It was worth it. Â The facility as a hole is very nice. Clean and everyone was/is very friendly. Â I really enjoyed my experience here. Â Metropolitan Medical Group is a boutique practice so they provide you with more then some other doctors can. Â While on my visit, I saw Gabriella Cardi, PA-C, MHS. Â She was very friendly and nice. Â She listened to every single thing I had to say. Â She was very concerned and wanted to make sure I got the best care. Â She wanted to make sure that every question I had was answered. Â Gabriella spent her time getting to know me. Â I felt very comfortable with her.I highly recommend the Metropolitan Medical Group for friends and family. Â Especially if you work in the financial district. Â It is convenient and easy to find. Â They also have several locations to serve you which is very convenient as well. Â All in all, a great experience!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: One of the best doctor's clinic experiences I've had in ages. The offices are bright and clean. The front desk staff were helpful, upbeat and welcoming. My appointment started right on time with Dr. Singh and he took his time getting to know my detailed medical history and prescription medication history before jumping into any diagnosis (a problem with so many poor doctors). He suggested several forms of treatment from conservative to aggressive and listened and considered my input into the options. He was thorough, efficient and super friendly.I've also been to the clinic for acupuncture and again the service and experience was top-notch. Jeannie ensured she understood everything about me before starting treatment.I'd recommend Dr. Singh and Jeannie Bianchi without question. Both are caring, compassionate and highly skilled (things that are increasingly hard to find in medical professionals).I really appreciate and love the ability to make, change or cancel appointments and refill prescriptions online. Plus you can visit any one of their locations, which is great as one is near my apartment and another is near my office!One Medical is more than worth the $150 a year. Highly recommended.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I've been a member at One Medical for three years. Â But no longer. Â Yes, they have same day appointments. Â Yes, they have water and nice chairs and current magazines. Â What they seem to lack is the ability to appropriately diagnose illness. Â I have been misdiagnosed no fewer than three times by three separate providers since I've been a member. Â Yes, I had to wait two months to get a proper diagnosis with another medical provider but after four months of run around at One Medical, I'm still ahead there. Â My most recent misdiagnosis lead to a four month recovery for a finger injury that should have taken 6 weeks with proper diagnosis and treatment. Â Convenience doesn't beat out actual medical care.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I was a little wary of the membership fee at first, but those feelings have completely vanished after experiencing their high level of service. Â It is definitely worth it. I have made multiple last minute appointments and they always manage to squeeze me in. Â They're always Â punctual, which is a definite plus since I'm limited to short trips out of my office. Â The service is always friendly and helpful, even when I have tons of annoying questions. Â  Â Plus, my doc responds to my email questions, which saves me the hassle of making unnecessary appointments. Â The service is great for busy people like me. Â The time that I save over the course of a year is definitely worth the fee. Â Highly recommend!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I'm the sort of guy who typically despises going to the doctor's office: Â the struggle to get an appointment, the long wait in the waiting room while filling out a mountain of paperwork only to be transferred to another waiting room while a nurse intermittently prods at me over a long period of time. Â One Medical is a vastly different experience. Â The online appointments make them super convenient and I was able to get an appointment on short notice without hassle. Â When I got there the people were super-friendly and I was seen without delay. Â The doctor was professional and efficient --- he listened to what I had to say, checked me out, and within a few minutes he had a prescription faxed off and some natural remedies printed out. Â  All in all, the service was great and I didn't feel like anybody's time was being wasted.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Been here twice now after trying to find somewhere convenient and having it recommended to me by co-workers. I find the American medical system confusing, but these guys are awesome - personable and efficient and generally recommendable. And they're awesomely accessible online, which is nice.If you can afford the yearly fee, well worth it.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: There's not much I fear more in life than needles and blood. Â Add to that the antiquated medical system, and "going to the doctors" is NOT on my list of top 1,000,000 things to do.Now bring in Metropolitan Medical Group and their wonderful staff, especially Jade & Sarah. Â Imagine clean, comfortable waiting rooms. Â AND... brace yourself.... they use EMAIL to communicate! You can actually arrange visits via the interweb. Â And after I was released from the hospital in May after an emergency, my PA-c actually emailed me every day to check in.To top it off, you can make an appointment for the next day, ensuring that you won't have time to psych yourself out.Just perfect for impatient patients.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Ever since I began competitive motorcycle roadracing , I've been finding the need to see a Dr. more often. Â Go figure.Dr. Bowler is great, and I've always been able to get same day appointments.Friendly staff, great Doctors.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Going to a regular doctor will never be the same! Â The Metropolitan Medical Group is worth the $99 annual fee. Â $99 is cheap considering what you get in return. Â You get to set up apts next day via email with a doctor who takes the time to listen and answer your questions all in a clean & convienent office. Â  The wait time to see the doctor isn't an hour like other medical groups and they are awesome! Â I am such a loyal patient -- never again will I go back to subpar medical groups!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Amazing.I'm a teacher, and I experience a lot of UTIs. Â Hazard of not being able to leave the room to go to the bathroom. Â Ever. Â And I have no time to run to the doctor's office only to have them confirm what I already know and then run to the pharmacy to pick up my prescription.This is why I love this place-I simply e-mail them, tell them I need an order of Bactrum stat, and they call it in for me! Â With an extra refill, so I have at least another month before I have to e-mail them again! Â I love them so very much. Â Busy teachers who can never take bathroom breaks, take note.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Same day appointment had never happened to me as they promise. Probably, at least three weeks waiting to see any available doctor. Awful experience with billing. If you want to sell member service, you should first learn what customer service is.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: This office is great- well worth the added fee to become a member of the Metropolitan Medical Group. They are always well staffed and the reception is well-informed. I have had several same-day visits and never felt like I was "in the way". Thumbs up to the services they provide and the team work they have going in that office!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I chose to go here due to highly recommended reviews on yelp, and also because it was around the corner from my office. Â It's worth the $100 annually. After my initial visit, I was able to get my shots, prescription, and a reference forwarded to a specialist doctor at ucsf within the week. Â Now that's efficiency that I'm willing to pay for. Â And you can renew your prescriptions online, and within 2 days!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Q: What doctor's office in the world can you make a same day appointment? A: Metropolitan Medical Group. Q: When does a doctor ever take their time with you during an appointment? A: When you go to Metropolitan Medical Group This "boutique" medical office is well worth their annual fee that is under $100. Most boutique offices charge HUNDREDS! They have three locations and their offices are very nice; not your typical white walled doctor's office. Ive been a member for a year now and I highly recommend trying them out!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Like a number of the other posters, initially I was a bit leery of the membership fee (I believe its $150). But I will say that the service I have gotten from One Medical (formerly Metropolitan MD) has been 1st rate. The facilities are clean and its awesome to have access to your doctor via email. Other pluses include the ability to schedule same day appointments and almost everything is paperless. Recently they have introduced a few extra on site services like lab testing which makes things really easy. And if you arent able to get your test done after your doctor's appointment, you can just walk-in and get it taken care of anytime, without the need for another appointment. They will either call or email you with the results, depending on your request.Lastly, my main reason for recommending this group is that my doctor kicks serious a$$. He is on his game in terms of knowledge about treatment, prescribing drugs etc. As the son of a medical professional, I know what separates a doctor from a good one and a great one. Â My doctor here is great. Not to mention he also knows who I am and takes notes during the appointments and re-visits any issues that I've had/asked about from prior appointments. If you are in the market for a doctor and live/work near the financial district, this place is definitely worth checking out.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I've been to this office a couple of times now and it's terrific. I've seen Dr. Charlie Burns, who has been attentive, thorough, friendly, and who definitely put me at ease. He also shared my lab work via email and has been accessible this way, which for me is a huge plus.Their online appointment process is terrific; I've been able to make a same-day appointment and one for several weeks in advance (why don't all doctors do it this way!?). The office atmosphere is calm, professional, and efficient. The *only* reason I don't give them 5 stars is that their phlebotomist had a very difficult time drawing my blood, which is unusual. I'm not sure he was that experienced, and as a result I was left with bruises and two sore arms. But really that's a minor thing overall. Several of my co-workers recommended One Medical, and they're right -- after the first visit here I was completely glad I'd paid the annual fee, if only not to have to endure another noisy, unfriendly, pack-em-in doctor's office where I only saw PAs and LPNs, never an actual doctor. That's been the opposite of my overall terrific experience at One Medical.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I cannot say enough good things about this office. Â I've lived in the city for 4 years, going from dr to dr trying to find someone that I clicked with. Â After settling for a horrible clinic on Davis St. that smelled of cigarette smoke (in a dr's office?) and urine where the dr. yelled at me for not remembering the dosage for my previous migrain perscription, I was MORE than happy to find a medical establishment that could 1) see me the same day I called (I like to get over my sickness as soon as possible) and 2) treated me with...what?... RESPECT.I found this office through all the great feedback from Yelp. Â After dealing for years with terrible dr's, I felt I deserved the best (weird that we settle for anything less when it comes to our livelihood)).I saw a PA, Angela Powlen, for some random pain near my liver. Â She sat there and listened to me and actually made EYE CONTACT with me (instead of staring at the chart their writing on). Â She wanted me to get an ultra sound and when I couldn't get an appt with the radiologist through reception, she called my office desk to tell me to go to the hospital. Â After spending an afternoon in ER, I came home to find, not 1, not 2, but 3 messages on my cell phone from her, calling to see how I wasw doing. Â She called the next day as well. Â I don't think there has EVER been a time where a dr followed up on me!!I've seen a number of different dr's at this office and every single one of them have been amazing. Â The rooms that you go into aren't stark cold, scary and intimidating. Â They are warm, comforting and inviting...and get this, the DR actually comes out to the waiting room to pick you up. Â And they TALK to you. Â Like, I mean, they listen and they ask really good questions and they tell you what their thinking so, together, you can work it out to figure what is truly the source of the illness.All of these dr's are amazing, this establishment it where all medical offices SHOULD be heading towards.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: After arriving from a country with a very different medical system, it took me months to find a GP through my insurance. Every time I thought I had found one in the neighborhood that I wanted, it would turn out that they no longer existed or were actually dermatologists. Finally, I happened upon One Medical Group (Metropolitan at the time). I was so thankful just to find regular doctors who could help me with all my complaints or refer me to specialists. I'm not that bothered about which doctor I see as I believe them all to be competent but I always get to see one of two doctors anyway. I am happy to pay the annual fee if it means I have a doctor on hand as and when I need one. The medical and insurance world are scary places in this country so $100ish a year seems a small price to pay (as someone who can afford it, I know for others it may not seem small) for a little piece of mind. The only reason I have knocked off a star is that I have had a couple of insurance gaffs with them. Everything was sorted out promptly and politely though.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I have used one Medical group for two years now, both the Embarcadero office and the new California street office. Â Over the two years I have only had one positive experience. The rest has been terrible! Yes you can get same day appointments without any waiting but is it worth it? NO! I once went in about a back problem so sever I could not sit down when I saw the doctor, they messed up the physical therapy referral so badly and over and over again until I had waited two weeks for a referral. Just a few weeks ago I saw a NP at the California office and she was on her iPhone the entire conversation, she did not even try to hide it. The doctors and NP's are unprofessional and unhelpful! Don't waste your time here!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Having grown cynical about the healthcare profession in general after years of missed diagnoses, lack of compassion, hyper-specialization and antiquated administrative processes, I was thrilled to find One Medical Group.Dr. Milo challenged me to lower my cholesterol and gave me a diet and exercise plan that brought my level down 56 points. Â When I scratched my cornea, they had the equipment and expertise to diagnose and deal with the problem on the spot. Â They don't send you to a random clinic to get a blood test - it's all done on-site. Â I can send health-related questions to Dr. Milo by e-mail and he responds the same day. Â They're open-minded about alternative, holistic solutions to medical problems.In short, One Medical Group has changed my attitude toward the medical profession and made me a healthier person in the process. Â Can you think of a better reason to give a business five stars?
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Love this place. I had an incredibly easy and stress-less experience.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: This is my second review of OneMedical. I wish I could have a single positive thing to say about them! The first review I wrote in March was about how they did not have a doctor see me during my well care visit, instead had a trainee attend me. Things got worse since then. Here is how.. I filed a complaint in their office about that visit and they asked me to go for a second time. They said they will waive the second visit. When I went, this time a real doctor saw me. She said the well care lab work done earlier (given by the trainee and done at OneMedical facility in San Francisco) was incomplete as some of the routine tests were not done. So she gave a second round of lab work and I went to the same lab facility within oneMedical office. The nurse wasnt able to find a blood vessel with 3 pokes so she asked me to come back another day. Apparently a nurse is not allowed to poke more than 3 times at one go. So I went back a third day and got the blood work done. Now OneMedical has sent me a bill saying the lab work was done out of network and I have to pay the out of network charges. So, OneMedical who is in network for me has a lab within their office where I went first time and was covered as in network. But the second time it became out of network! If they had changed lab partners, they did not notify me and I am getting dinged for that! Â I have already lost 1 work day because of a severe allergic reaction to a shot given to me by the trainee during my first visit. I lost another half day of work in total for all the 3 times I went there and now I have to pay out of network charges!! This is beyond ridiculous! This is criminal!
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Very satisfactory! Â The office is very clean, the staff is friendly and the doctor made me feel as comfortable as possible in a very uncomfortable situation. Â She took a lot consideration into how to deal with my problem, and presented me with all the options, not criticizing the one I chose.Although there is a $99 annual fee, it's totally worth it in a day and age where it's so hard to find a good doctor. Â They also do same day appointments, and call to see how you're doing.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Horrble experience.I booked a Saturday appointment at the Pac Heights clinic in February, with dizziness, presumably from a cold, and breast tenderness. Â The "doctor", a man who's profile I have yet to see on their website, diagnosed with clogged ears (no big deal), but then refused to do a breast exam where I experienced the soreness, mumbling something about it being Saturday and he's "chilling out", having worked at a homeless clinic in SF during the week. He also couldn't clean my ears because he didn't have the appropriate equipment. SO, I left the office halfway diagnosed but pretty much untreated. Unhappy with the care I received and looking for relief, I then spent $100 on a professional ear cleaning from an ear specialist (they actually have tools to do this that doesn't involve spraying your ear with water.. why didn't the doctor tell me that?)AND went to California Pacific, where a GYNECOLOGIST was able to do a breast exam for me - also questioning the practices of a doctor who out-sources a breast exam- finding nothing (thank God) but urging me to have my breasts checked whenever I feel necessary (I am 34).AND I get charged $291 for my office visit, through my insurance plan. That's $150 to join a medical practice where I can be treated by a doctor who must out-source me to another more qualified doctor + $291 for the One Medical physician visit + $100 for the ear doctor (which I found on my own) + co-payments and CPMC Gynecologist fees (only $59 through my insurance). Can someone explain to me what the value is here?I was hoping One Medical would truly stand as exemplary in San Francisco. I am unimpressed. People see the doctor when they are sick. Not to 'hang out' in a high-design space and "chill" with their care providers. Unprofessional and poorly managed.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: One Medical has added a lot of health professionals. They have also added a lot of patients. It may take several weeks to see your primary physician. Same day appointments with a physician assistant may precude seeing an actual DR. There haver also been some issues with billing errors. I have been with One for several years and don't expect to change; however, I wish they would improve access by hiring more DRs and limiting Â the number of patients per.
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: I've been to One Medical Group since 2008 when I started my job in San Francisco. The same day appointment is awesome, but I get billed at a higher rate than if I made my appointment several days in advance. My primary doctor is Anand Singh, and he's knowledgable, friendly, and answers my questions well. I've also seen other doctors when he was unavailable. The office also has a lab on the 2nd floor. I wished that the lab hours started earlier (say 7 AM) and ended later (say 6 PM).
Practice: Family Practice, Internal Medicine, Concierge Medicine

Reviews: Dr. Dinenberg, if you can get him, is the only doctor worth visiting One Medical for, and I've seen all of them. Â Charming, funny, smart as hell, and he remembers you.Everyone is nice, and the office is super clean, but I feel the knowledge is very lacking. Â I've had three separate incidents where doctors screwed up the treatments:-One doctor didn't know how to use a liquid nitrogen gun to remove a wart, and I spent a half hour while he kept refilling it wrong, and then when he was done, he said the wart would come off on its own. Â But it never did. Â -One doctor jammed a q-tip inside my penis during a routine STD test, and caused a tear in my urethra. Â -One doctor tried to remove a SCALP STAPLE with an office staple remover. Â I ended up needing to go to the hospital over that one...thanks.They don't keep track of what you're doing. Â You go back for a followup, it's with a different doctor, and they haven't reviewed the file. Â There doesn't appear to even be a file to speak of, because they are 'paperless'. Â You end up explaining the whole story again, instead of the doctor reviewing the file electronically.You pay $150 for the 'luxury' of same day appointments, doctor email, and Rx fax without an appt. Â But you don't really receive that. Â Doctors take sometimes 2 days to get back to you, and sometimes I've not received any response to my emails. Â Guess what? Â Many doctors have email now, take same day appointments, and can fax the Rx for you without a doctor visit...and no boutique fees. Â Do the homework, and find a better doctor that won't rip you off. Â My guess is that people comfort themselves paying extra, so that they feel they won't have to share the office with people who can't afford that, as in, poor or undesirable people. Â I think that's what's being catered to by groups like this.Oh, and another purported reason for the membership fee: Â you can be seen on a Saturday. Â But I actually needed that once, and I was told that the visit would not be insured, and I would have to pay out of pocket, even though I have PPO coverage. Â They couldn't explain why. Â They said it's a different system on the weekends, is all.Another story, I needed a chest x-ray, and One Medical produced an order for it to be filled at UCSF...where Brown & Toland (the group that is contracted by One Medical) no longer have a contract. Â So, UCSF told me that they could do the x-ray, but it wouldn't be insured. Â I got on the phone with One Medical, and they couldn't figure out why UCSF would say that. Â They never once informed me that the HMO level of care would be rejected, but my PPO level of care is still good for UCSF. Â I have both PPO and HMO coverage through HealthNet (confusing, right, and no not One Medical's fault). Â But your doctor should be able to look at your coverage, and figure out the issue, and tell you what to do, and also the office staff should be skilled at that too. Â To boot, One Medical also is contracted by another medical group, Hill Group, who DOES have a contract with UCSF. Â I'm sorry, but for the extra $150, I would expect that somebody there could've explained the nuances of their business, and how they bill insurance and the many outsourcing schemes...and let me know that I had other options than going to another hospital for the x-ray.Then if there's a billing issue, you get to deal with Apollo Medical Group in Novato...who never knows what's going on. Â Somehow One Medical told Apollo that my birthdate was 8 years prior to my actual date, and it caused a denial of coverage by HealthNet...which took months to figure out the issue on, and clear up.And if you don't pay the $150 membership fee, you don't get care. Â That's a denial of medical care. Â Isn't that illegal?So let me get this straight, they charge this money, deny care, can't do their own billing, and can't hire people who know the insurance system, or even their own business? Â Where is this money going? Â Rent?So, after 4 years of trying my best with this group, I have to leave.
