Reviews: The hospital is fine..I expect to wait anytime i go to ANY hospital....The cafeteria on the other hand should be shit DOWN! It's disgusting how they let homeless loiter throughout the entire cafeteria and they STINK! I'm PISSED I Spent my hard earned money here!Do better SF GENERAL!!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Now that the bill is here, I am able to speak about the horrible service rendered to me at this hospital. Service being the treatment of my condition within the hospital. Let's take a moment to be open to interpretation before going straight to hammering away at others. I entered and was processed rather quickly and had very friendly staff interactions; From intake, verification of sir you're gonna get a huge bill, to waiting room entertainment. Now the problem that I have with this hospital visit came from the detailed exam room. I came from San Francisco State University with a note from the nurse practitioner there. He said take the note to SFGH and they'll take you seriously. Upon entering the exam room, more information taken as well as a correction. The staff had mistakenly placed the wrong birthdate on my "gold card" issued at the beginning of the service. After that error was corrected, I was asked in various ways, along the lines of... Do you take any illegal drugs, on drugs when you got into the accident,What drugs are you on now,Finally, do you want more drugs.In my head I said to myself, y'all don't even know what's going on and want to immediately throw drugs at me to shut me up and leave. So I refused treatment and left. After waiting an extra 30 minutes for a follow up appointment.Failed terribly at making the appointment. Failed. When the nurse got back, I requested my documents and exited.Stopped by the billing and asked if I get any documents or records of the service provided and was told no. So I left. Empty handed with a lame corrected SFGH gold card worth the value of this visit; $913. Let's also remember that there are several signs mentioning that if you can't pay your bill there are options; I wrote those at the end of this review. But good luck SFGH! Enjoy the writing and I hope y'all correct some of the procedures within this fine institution. Where's the option... Medi-CalCharityDiscount Payment ProgramsThanks for attempting to service me; I can make my own appointments and save my own time.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: The eye clinic (4M) needs to work on their booking schedule (ie: OVERBOOKED). Â We arrived at 8:45 am for my mother in law's 9:15 am appointment. Â Mil had her eye exam plus eye pressure checked at 9:15 am by a LVN. Â Then was told to go out to the waiting room and wait to be seen by the doctor. Â Right now it is 12:10 pm and still waiting to be seen by the doctor. Â If there is only one doctor in the clinic then maybe they should inform patients how long they have to wait. Â This eye clinic has no respect of people's time. Â I sure hope the doctor is NOT having lunch. Â I asked the receptionist 3 times as to the status of mil's eye appointment. Â Excuse is there is only one doctor on the floor and and tomorrow is 4th of July. Â In my opinion, basically poor management and scheduling. Â So if you come to this eye clinic, expect to wait 2-3 hours. Â This is not the first time we had to wait beyond 2 hours. Â Better ask in advance how long you have to wait.RIDICULOUS X100
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: The Urgent Care team probably doesn't know what URGENT means.we have been there for about 3 hours in a super dirty waiting room which was FULL of sick ppl and loads of virus without any ventilation! If you want to get all possible illnesses because of lack of hygiene and wait hours to get to a NURSE practitioner and not a Doctor then this is the place to go. I get easily sick when I'm close to ppl with contagious diseases and I wanted to wait in the empty hallway, a nurse came and said "have a seat, we don't want to block the hallway!"And after we went through long unnecessary processes we were kept in a tiny room without window and ventilation/ac and we kept requesting the doctor to come, after 40 min finally sb came. And she was not a doctor but a nurse practitioner! It was such a waste of time and nerves...
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Avoid unless homeless or you have severe trauma.I cut my finger with a kitchen knife and went there because it was the nearest ER. Big mistake. I waited for 3 hours in a waiting room where many of the regulars were known to the staff by first names and kind of went in for a checkup to clear up their intoxication. The waiting room was very dirty. Later, a janitor came by with a broom. The smell was bad.Once inside the treatment area the treatment was good and professional, clinical staff courteous.Since then, about 6 months ago, my insurance and SFG are fighting about the price and I get to hold the bag for 90% of the billed cost or so. They are not done yet. I get a monthly bill asking me to pay $0.0. Eventually, they'll ask for the balance and the fee for the physician, which didn't bill yet. I'll have to dig in deep for a short treatment.SF General is good if you have no insurance. This is paid for by fleecing those who have, even though they are not in network in any insurance and insurance companies don't pay very much of your bill. The pricing is between ridiculous and outrageous. Insurance companies only pay for sensible costs. You, as a San Franciscan, are being sc____d.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Love Sfgh but came in to emergency care unit and encountered the rudest Asian nurse in the front next to the medal detector police tonight/Morning. Rude rude rude. Â General hospital the best but this bitch needs to go back to customer service school !!!!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This morning I tried to call the Cardiac Diagnostics Lab to reschedule my appointment. After almost 5 minutes of no one answering my call, nor an answering machine kicking in, I had to hang up. I called back a couple hours later and again had to wait 4 minutes before someone finally picked up the phone. After determining that I was calling the wrong department they transferred me to a very harried sounding man. He (I think) was able to cancel my appointment, but said he had to transfer me to someone else to reschedule. That lady also seemed harried and after a few terse questions tried to transfer me somewhere else. Desperate to avoid this downward spiral of doom, I asked if she could look up my medical record number to see what my appointment was for, in her department, so that she could help me to reschedule it. However she refused, first saying I should call back in half an hour, then saying she is "too busy". Too busy to help a patient on the phone? Wow.Thank you Cardiac Diagnostic Department, While as a team you were spectacularly unhelpful, at least the stress of that phone call was enough to get my blood pumping from rage, which I assume is another of your department's methods for increasing a patient's blood circulation.Let's do it again sometime, yes? Love ya, by now...
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Injured myself in a accident and someone drove me to nearest hospital which was Zuckerberg sat there in ER for hours and no matter how injured I was I went to another hospital. Why mark Zuckerberg would you want your name associated with such a horrible horrible group of people
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Literally named after Mark Zuckerberg for his substantial financing of the hospital, yet somehow this place gets away with charging outrageous amounts of money to users - this isn't a hospital, it's a business. Â My bill was exorbitantly high for a very basic appointment and they did NOT tell me the estimated cost in advance. Â Imagine getting charge $750 for an eye exam that would cost you $75-$150 other places. Â Yeah - f'ed up. Â AND not only are they out-of-network for ALL insurance carriers, they don't even bother to attempt to recover the copayment for insurers that do cover a portion of costs for out-of-network providers (like mine). Â If you're looking to get scammed, go right ahead, make an appointment. Â The doctor wasn't even that good. Â UCSF Medical is MUCH better - better doctors, accept and recover insurance costs, and far nicer facilities.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Prepare yourself for bad treatment at the Infusion Center at ZSFGH... The staff can be condescending and ethnically insensitive. I'm an Asian American who has a European last name. At my last appointment, the nurse demanded to know if I was Chinese, and if I was, why I didn't have a Chinese name. As if I owe them an explanation! I complained about this behavior to the supervisor. I was then told that the nurse was trying to determine if I needed a translator; what does this have to do with my last name? I am fluent in English and it says so in my medical record. I came in for treatment not an interrogation about my ethnicity.Many of the staff rush to judgment and don't listen to their patients. You have to be your own advocate and speak up every time. Bring another person with you so you have a witness and another voice in the room with you. If you go on your own, beware. The staff will try to push you around like this and avoid responsibility for their bad behavior.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Thank you for taking such wonderful care of my brother in ICU. Â Shout out to Mehli, she was wonderful.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I had a freak accident fall Monday night heading down steps to pick up takeout that was being delivered. I fell hard and thought I could have broken some ribs. I white knuckled it Monday night and Tuesday when my friend and Boyfriend convinced me to come in. I was hedging because I recently lost my job and had no insurance. Thank God I did. Sfgh got me right away to see a number of their top of their game (and incredibly caring) nurses and doctors about what happened. After examination, they ordered a CT scan and an MRI. Thank you God because it turns out I had FIVE broken ribs and a collapsed lung. The immediately did the surgery under local anesthesia to get the air out of my chest and get my lung functioning again.I am currently in the ER where I stayed the night where the wonderful nurses checked on me every hour or so to make sure I was doing ok - big should out Marisa and Dan who are truly Angels.I will be here a few days and am not looking forward to PT, but I could have died. What a great and effective team at General. Turned the worst experience of my life into a tolerable one and lesson learned.Bonus points! The wonderful woman in front got emergency medical for me!!!!!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Outrageously overpriced services (billed 3x higher than max expected nationally for similar services rendered). Finance department recommended I do an audit of the bill but they have been completely unresponsive. Zoila Monvon (supervisor) never picks up the phone and her voice mailbox is full so you can't leave a message. I even showed up in person and she wasn't in the office. I filed a complaint with the "Patient Experience" department and they said they'd follow up but nothing happened. Now they aren't responding to my emails either. I've spent 6 months asking them to do something simple that Â THEY SUGGESTED I do (just check the amount they billed is correct) and still they do nothing. That doesn't stop them from sending me bills and threatening to send it to collections. I am planning on getting a lawyer and filing a law suit and reaching out to local media channels to expose this. Avoid this hospital like the plague.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

They give me it but later on I have to go to the er because my inhaler wasn't working. 11 pm I arrive 3 am I walk out with only a nasal test conforming the flu. OK fast forward to today Tuesday went back to see if I'm still contagious cause I want to work another 2 hours then the nurse says well come around 1 and it'll be better like no it won't be better HIRE MORE STAFF chicken head. I could be developing pneumonia but I wouldn't know because I can't even get to a fucking doctor I have asthma.

Reviews: Constant delay, denials, and negligence for me getting the care I need when I am a cancer survivor with symptoms of a recurring tumor and a cancer-related degenerative disease. Even after four months of me endlessly, tirelessly trying to see doctors, I NEVER got the care I needed; I eventually gave up and switched to Kaiser. They had to intern me as a patient in the hospital through the emergency room just to get basic tests done (an MRI, CT Scan, and Spinal Tap), and even after TWO DAYS they didn't finish! Even once they discovered the tumor, which they neglected to tell me could never be eliminated, they did not get me the radiotherapy I needed. I will now live with permanent, debilitating damage to my face and body instead of a minor eye problem due to their ineptitude.

Everyone was incredibly kind and helpful.

Reviews: THE WORST WORST WORST WORST place to go! NEVER GO to that place if you need anything! They treat you like shit and they don't care about you. If u need a doctor or even someone to help you out, that's not the place! I went there to get a ultra and they just didn't care about a shit, they are the worst people. Reviews: Several years ago, I had the worst bout of food poisoning I'd ever had in my life. I was unable to eat or even drink anything as innocuous as water for nearly 72 hours as everything would immediately come back up. I got so feverish, shriveled, and dehydrated that I lost around 15lbs within that 72 hour time period, and at around 48 hours, I had started vomiting up greenish stomach bile as there was really nothing else left for my body to expel. I was unable to stand on my own without any support. I had not urinated in slightly more than 2 days.It was around this point that my roommate, concerned about my risk for severe dehydration, drove me to the SF General's ER room. Once there, the lady checking us in basically waved us off, blamed us for making too big of a deal over nothing, and made some crack about me potentially drinking too much. When my roommate pushed back, the lady sighed, rolled her eyes, and told us there would be an 8 hour wait. We looked at her in shock and my roommate made the call that I would probably be better off at our place away from the grim and somewhat filthy waiting room. I'm honestly surprised that this place has any positive reviews -- that was perhaps the most callous and dispassionate healthcare experience I've ever faced, and I sometimes seriously wonder what would have happened had my illness not taken a turn for the better after around 72 hours. I understand that food poisoning/severe dehydration probably doesn't take priority over any of the trauma cases they specialize in, but even a referral to an urgent care facility (reading reviews today, it's only now that I realize that they even had urgent care facilities!) or another healthcare provider would have been much appreciated. Or at the very least, not having a healthcare worker roll her eyes at you and when it's clear that you can barely stand yourself up.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Ok. Â This review is based on today. I was here 5 years ago first time. Last time it was very bad service Â  I was waiting with a broken leg 6 hrs for X-ray. Â To the point that I run away with a broken foot and went home. This time. I just tear few muscle playing sport. Â And omg. The service change 900%. The first girl was so nice. Â 5 min after first nurse come to do a check up. And I done it all in 1 hour. Â Amazing. I am very surprised. Â And very happy they change and providing amazing service. Â  Well done

Reviews: Rip-off artists! They charge as much as 50,000% more than other General Hospital charge to cover those who cannot pay, and they don't take any insurance either. This place is criminal! They need to be shutdown under RICO statutes. This is the most expensive sh*thole on planet earth. If they charged $30,000 in services to do some very minor work like write a prescription while my car is in impound for a criminal investigation, where I am the victim, but it's ridiculous. No! IT'S LUDICROUS! I was offered a $24,000 settlement check, and had to rip it up and now I am asking for $54,000 to cover Zuckerturd's hospital. The level of care sucks ass, and their prices are astronomically insane. You can well bet your life you won't see Zuckerturd getting any medical care in that dump. Complete waste of my time. Dont call me and say everythings ready when its not.Nurse said a wheelchair should take 5 to 10 minutes and took 45!? Reviews: Don't come here . If I can choose none star, I will rate them zero. The service is terrible, the waiting time is long, the cost is tremendously overcharged. All of these staff just want money and good back home after work(lazy and not professional), their equipment is like third world country's equipment.I went there because of my pregnancy miscarriage the day before . I had been waiting for a room for about 3.5 hours. Then they got me a room and let me wait for 15 mins for the doctor who used fingers to touch my vaginal and made me so comfortably, the for about 2 hour waiting for ultrasound. The ultrasound machine is almost broken. The technicians use the almost broken controlling panel to monitor the screen. And when she did the ultrasound scanning, the control panel was broken and she fixed and continue the scanning test.They are really not busy. About 3ppl including the technician Â chatted in the ultrasound room for causal talk.Then I had 2 blood tests. Made me so tired of these unnecessary tests. It's useless to test so many times. Finally I came back with a bill of USD8600 which generally costs under USD1500 for only a ultrasound test and two blood test and one gynecology telescopic test by hand. I tried to call their billing centers for more than 30 times in few days. They never pick up one single call. Then I left message for them and one Spanish accent person call me rudely. I don't understand Spanish style of English and could not talk to her. Â I will never pay this bill unless they reduce to the reasonable price . Â I will not pay for the poor management and excess lazy staffs. Never ever come to this terrible place. Private gynecology center is much better. They have all the price and won't overcharged like this. Why don't you charge me 1 million for just waiting for crazy 5 hours. Crazy and wish you close down soon
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Exceptionally expensive, and don't expect your first bill to cover everything. After paying that, I'm still getting charged for 'new' things from one stay months ago.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: My mother took a nasty fall yesterday and was rushed to SF General's Emergency Department. All of the people who dealt with her - administrators, orderlies, nurses and doctors - were efficient, warm, caring and highly competent. She was in great hands during the entire day-long ordeal. I didn't have high expectations; the last time I was at SF General, many years ago, it was a very, very different place. Even though this hospital has always been excellent with trauma treatment, the bedside manner was often seriously lacking. But from what I saw yesterday, there is an entirely different culture at this venerable SF institution, and everyone there has good reason to be proud. A big thank you to the wonderful administrative and medical professionals at SF General ER; my family is very grateful to you.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: If I fell off the roof of this hospital and landed in front of the ER, I would use whatever functioning bones I have left to call a cab and go elsewhere.Problems on top of problems, mostly with billing though. Their billing 'department'/person answers the phone about one out of 5 times. Trying to get your insurance company to talk to them becomes this man-in-the-middle nightmare since neither party benefits from putting in the effort (which means calling many times a day to finally get through). A little escalation to the higher-ups was SUCH a relief, though.In my case, they were charging too much. There are many companies that determine fair market prices for services in a given area. These guys charged about 25% more than local competitors, like the world class UCSF hospital. Really upsetting. It's water under the bridge at this point, but if anybody knows how to negotiate/work around this I would be thrilled to know about it.I think the fact that they predominantly deal with down-and-out people (homeless and low-income) puts them in sour moods. The employees had these weird surprised and relieved looks when they saw me, a regular dude, walk in and speak clearly and concisely about why I was there.Seriously, consider elsewhere.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I was bring my father last night at ER, I still don't believe I don't need to wait at all compared to before I expect to wait for at least a night. I even bring snacks and blanket with me. This time we just walk in to the door and straight to check in and to the room. All the check in girls are super nice and the Doctors, Â nurses are efficiency and professional. ER was at a new building now that was I park my car in the parking lot it was a bit to far to walk as a Ill person. Other than that everything are perfect. Once again thanks all the administrative and whoever been with care for Father.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Poorly managed, terribly gross bathrooms, non-attentive employee, cannot believe a hospital with such horrible conditions is allowed to operate...do not come here for your green card medical exam.

Reviews: Horrible place , looks nice , give you dope no real service , can't fix no one's problem. Very disrespectful , went for tooth pain . Was told I smoke crack or Crystal meth that's why my teeth is horrible .I said I never did these things .she said you need to take care of your self better I told her I'm broke I can feed my kid's or pay for new teeth I pick my kids .she said no excuses . Â Not having money being broke is not a good feeling is what she didn't understand .I want to look good I hate the way I look she was there to make me feel lower than life because I can't afford dental care I hate this place . They allowed the Mayor'sâ Ed Lee to die . The old General wasn't like this.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: If I could give zero stars, I would. My husband went there at 5pm on a Friday straight from work with chest pain only because it was the nearest hospital to his work. They took him back and did an EKG, which seemed ok, and they sent him back to the waiting room. Where he waited for 3 hours. No one came. There was no communication. There was no indication he'd ever be called. Meantime, there was an abusive boyfriend berating his girlfriend over and over and over again, using the F word loudly the entire time, telling her she was a b#tch and that she should leave and he'd have his other girlfriend come and get him. There was a 7 year old girl sitting 5 feet away, listening to this guy abuse someone. I went to security to have them do something, but they barely got in the room and he would briefly stop...only to start right up again immediately when they were out of site. This happened twice, and then they just stopped coming in after I complained. They were incredibly ineffective. They never even talked to the guy, I think they were afraid to. What are they there for, again? Also, when I came through security, I walked through the metal detector, but they didn't even peek into my two substantial bags I had with me. Guess because I am white and female I wouldn't have a weapon? I didn't, of course, but they assumed a lot. There was a homeless person in the waiting room as well and I gagged, the smell was so overpowering. All the while my husband is sitting there with chest pain. Multiple times an employee came out and called someone's name, only to have them not respond. How about calling someone's name who is actually PRESENT? So, after waiting three hours and them not doing a damn thing, we left. We drove over an hour to a hospital near our home in the East Bay where my husband was taken back immediately, given a bed, IV, drugs to combat the chest pain, given an x-ray, etc., and we saw a nurse and a doctor within the first 20 minutes of being put in a bed. He was eventually admitted. THAT'S how an ER should work. Later, SF friends told me NEVER to go to SF General unless you are unconscious or bleeding and can't go anywhere else. PREACH.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Did anyone have experience with PES? My boyfriend was taken there on Friday and I told 3 nurses there about my boyfriend's situation. It seems they don't care about but only want you to go. Â I was given a business card to call them if I have any questions. My boyfriend told me he felt headache and painful on his feet. He called me to come to visit him and interpreted for him since he can't speak English. I told the nurse about his condition and hopefully they could do something about it. Today I want to find out about how he is feeling. The person answering the phone told me there is no this person by that name. I got very annoyed. I just saw my boyfriend yesterday through the glass but two nurses there told me there is no this person.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: The worst ER ever super dirty smells like shit and unhelpful nurses. I have waited for almost 7hrs and still couldn't see the doctor even tho I was in really bad pain but I couldn't wait no more so I had to leave
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This is profoundly the WORST ER I have EVER been to. After having a seizure in a car park I was taken by Ambulance to this hospital. I was then 'Triaged' in the ER corridor and then put in a wheelchair, taken to the waiting area to 'Register' and then left in the waiting room for two hours practically vomiting on myself and pissing myself. I was too unstable to get up. i went to the counters several times, but the ladies attending it were practically idiots and were only attending to walkins. i needed help and medical care!Due to my condition, I left and took a Taxi to CPMC where I was seen immedately in their ER and spent four days in the ICU at the Davies Campus.I will be filing a Greavance against SF General. They are clearly flawed & compromised in their ER Operations.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: DO NOT GO TO ZSFGH ER UNLESS YOU ARE IN FRONT OF IT DYING AND HAVE NO CHOICE! After a 3 hour visit to the ER at ZSFGH, where I received a 1 hour of care and 2 hours of watching TV was followed by a $13000 bill. This hospital helps the poor and uninsured you may read on their website but in reality this is not quite the case. If you happen not to have an insurance, as I did not, due to some unfortunate circumstances, and are not really poor you are basically out of luck. This hospital will "blackmail" you and tell you that if you do not pay they will send you to a collection agency in 3 months and they cannot lower your bill because this is how the medical bills are! Essentially, you are at the mercy of their analyst who determines the level of ER care and therefore your bill. And you have no say or are not provided any explanation what justifies the cost or why you pay separately for each test and are then are billed lump sum of 10K called ER Level 5. They do not provide even an explanation what ER level 5 is supposed to be. Doing some research shows that the ER charges at ZSFGH ER are exponentially higher than any other major hospital in San Francisco. Below are the ER level pricing from OSHPD site for 2016. ER LEVEL 5; 4; 3; 2; 1ZSFGH - Â  Â $9854; $4882; $2963; $1385; $463UCSF - Â  Â  Â  $5077; $2458; $1320; $806; $738ST LUKE - $4488; $2811; $1707; $833; $334ST MARY -$6485; $3073; $2045; $1368; $868SUTTER PACIFIC - $4488; $2811; $1707; $833; $334KAISER - Â  $3384; $2890; $1574; $957; $509Even though ZSFGH is a public hospital it appears that it serves only a specific segment of society. But their employees are public servants aren't they!? Well it does not appear so even though your tax payers money pays for their salaries and everyone else who gets a free ride! So if you are not poor and/or homeless too bed you pay for your over-inflated health care because you were too stupid to go to a public hospital expecting to be cheaper. I fully support all social programs that aim at alleviating poverty and have no objections against using public funds to do so but certainly do not support public institutions taking advantage of people in unfortunate situations regardless of their income.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Elite 2021
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: If you're from out of town and on TRICARE -- don't even let yourself get taken here. Â  I checked -- they consider TRICARE out of network as well, and you'll get stuck paying the excess of the TRICARE maximum allowable charge. Â  (Sure TRICARE pays 3/4 out of network, but only up to the MAC - - then you're on your own for the excess. Â Catastrophic cap notwithstanding.)
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: AVOID THIS PLACE UNLESS YOU ARE DYING, and even then, probably go some place elseI had good insurance; they said they took that insurance and there would be no problem. Â So I made two appointments over the course of several months with their specialists.The actual doctors seemed reasonably knowledgeable... though at the end of each appointment I was told I'd get the results of my lab tests by phone. Â They NEVER followed up with my labwork results, so I called them several times myself. Â Months later, still in the dark about what the labwork may've revealed -- and still no follow-up, despite receptionists assuring me someone would get back to me with those results ASAP.Then the letters come, asking me to follow up with my insurance to get the insurance to pay out. Â I've NEVER had this problem before -- where the billing department of a medical center can't handle contacting the insurance providers themselves to process payment and need to rely on the patients following up. Â What the...???Turns out this hospital overbilled. Â Each appointment (30 minute appointment, with one blood/urine test) was billed for several thousands of dollars. Â No results were provided from these tests ever. Â My insurance provider ultimately decided to cover only a portion of these expenses. Â Not once was it ever explained to me the costs of the appointment, or of any tests done. Â I was never given any explanation of the costs, or warned that my insurance would consider it a scam to go here and not cover more of the expense billed. Â Walking out, no receipt was given (though most other providers I've been to give some form to document your visit/costs).Several thousand dollars of bills later, STILL NO LABWORK RESULTS. Â :'(SCAM SCAM SCAM AVOID AT ALL COSTS OTHERWISE YOU WILL HAVE NO ANSWERS AND MANY REGRETS, AND NEED TO GO SOME PLACE ELSE ANYWAY TO GET YOUR WORK DONE
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: There is a social worker on staff who should be avoided AT ALL COSTS. Katie Mason is a dishonest social worker. Katie Mason lies to parents and does not accurately represent what parent's rights are. Mason takes a punitive, 'guilty until proven innocent' approach, uses abusive language, and makes threats. Katie Mason has a LCSW license that is governed by the California Board of Behavioral Sciences, and this license dictates specific protocols she needs to follow. She needs to be closely supervised and watched at all times so that she does not lie or act out of the bounds of her job duties/profession.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: April 6th, 2015 Around 3:30pmDuring our Spring break drive up to SF, my niece's asthma started to take a turn for the worse. Â Before stopping at our hotel I took a frantic much needed emergency visit to SF General hospital. We first headed to the ER where, trying to maintain my calm, I Â told the intake that she was having trouble breathing and needed a breathing treatment ASAP! I had all her medical record numbers which I am sure helped the expediency. I hate to think what people go through who don't have insurance. :( Â They quickly assessed her and after 5 minutes had us go up to the 3rd floor pediatrics dept. since she is 15 and the regular ER was not the place for her. (The ER was luckily not that busy, but pretty intimidating.) I wanted to thank the wonderful staff in the emergency pediatric department for handling my niece's asthma attack with a great sense of urgency and professionalism. Â From the ER clerk who registered her in on the first floor, to the male nurse at pediatrics who took her vitals and was the initial person to push for a breathing treatment (tall white guy with glasses -I wish I took down your name). A very special thank you to Dr. Andrea Marmor for her professionalism, warmth, and attentiveness. Â She treated my niece with such genuine kindness and was very friendly. Â I can tell she really loves what she does. Â Also thank you to Dr. Stark who was working alongside Dr. Marmor. He was also very professional and nice. I know emergencies rooms can be awful places. It's comforting to know that the children's ER at San Fransisco General is a safe place to be.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: My wife had a severe case of sore throat after we landed Â in SF Airport, the office was located on our way home, was open in the evening, so we stopped by to get her throat checked. The bill for the simple service of few minutes of sore throat check is $1285.00 and our insurance does not cover $603.90 of it. Stay away, their prices are not reasonable.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Their emergency room is pretty useless. We waited for more than 3 hours for my friend's experiencing a severe headache. At the end, he was just told everything was normal, go to drink more water, get more sleep, and you'll be fine. Alright, I guess you all should just rest when you're sick, doctors' aren't gonna help.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: The GH is a very unique place, this review is based on the service provided on a daily basis and not special operations. Just to be fair to the Urgent care and Trauma surgeons, all I can say that they are the best and most talented personnel in the medical fields world wide. But when it comes to the after care from nursing staff to the facility here is what to expect, Nurses, most nurses carry a very heavy load of attitude which make you think you are to serve them and not vice versa, they are rude to patience, don't understand how crucial prompt response is especially when patiences are in pain. you would call them and they would be chatting with each other, won't respond until they finish their story. I mean they in the health care business where they should be pleasant and ensure you have comfortable stay during healing, I don't think they get that concept. you can tell they are miserable at their job and at home and they take it out on the poor patiences. They bend the rules whenever they feel like and they stick to them whenever they are in a good mood. You try to be nice to them, they take that as a weakness. You ask a legit questions, they roll their eyes. I seriously was disgusted and planing too raise the issue to the DPH. I saw some private bulletins which states their failing score during an audit and that's why they have partnered with UCSF to help them pass their audits. Now I know why and hope the DPH takes an immediate action to correct these problems in such an important facility that serves huge part Â of the bay area's population.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Emergency room. Do not come here, ever. The staff are generally careless, inattentive, and thoughtless; mindlessly serving an organization sick at its core.My most recent SF General story:Last August, I broke my arm and severely damaged my wrist and hand. I came into SF General after a referral from the clinic as the only place I could go with Healthy San Francisco. The diagnosis I got at SF General was careless, to say the least. They took x-rays, but did not notice the fracture in my arm. This was pretty bad, but not as bad as my prior referral here, where I saw Dr Chase. who misdiagnosed my torn ACL as "fine" (please see my prior review for details).This time, I had come in for a bad hand injury. That injury has not healed and has crippled me for the last six months.The doctor who saw me, Tina Vu, was very friendly right away, attentive, and attractive. I wasn't rude to her, but I was really there to figure out what was wrong with my hand and wrist. I just wanted to be treated. Tina left.I waited for hours after Tina left. I went to the cafe to get an afternoon breakfast (they were serving a disgusting lunch). And when I came back, I waited some more.I finally saw Tina. I noticed that she was following around blond male doctor, who seemed good-looking. Fantastic. I hope she can find some guy she really likes. But I wanted professional medical attention; I was badly injured. Eventually, an allegedly more experienced doc came to pour sterile water on the opening in my hand and look for debris inside, found none, and did nothing more.Fast forward to this year, and a recent x-ray revealed that I had indeed fractured my arm last year. I thought so!But when I was at SF General and they x-rayed, they said that it was fine; that I was fine; that nothing was broken. But actually, I wasn't fine, and I now have evidence that shows that they were wrong.They gave no indication that they thought my arm might be broken and they seemed to think that I was fine, and did not suggest that I should see an orthopedist.No one knows what's wrong with my hand now, and that hand is persistently painful and not very usable. I suspect that the carpals are misaligned and that I've torn my Palmaris longus. I am trying to pursue care elsewhere, without using Healthy San Francisco and SF General.SF General might be better off if it were completely dismantled from the top, with all business ties severed, and reorganized and restaffed from the bottom up. Fire them all, starting at the upper management, and open it up for a new system.Please read my previous review about the negligent Dr Chase who strongly and wrongly insisted that my ACL was intact and functional, when it was actually torn completely off the bone (and have since had the surgery and recovered 95%).
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: They used to be the best hospital around, not now, the doctor in er dr golbh, grey haired, thinks he is God's gift,treated my husband like he was making up the pain in his hip. Ive never felt like wanting to smack the stuffing outof someone so much!! Thank you SO much "dr" for making my Husband feel that much worse!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Don't go here if you have insurance!! Â The trauma center seems pretty good in and of itself but when you check in they don't tell you they don't take private insurance. Â I mean what hospital doesn't take insurance? Â I was there for 4 hours as I had fallen and was being looked at. Â They did 1 CT scan and a bunch of blood tests, but other than that a pretty standard visit; Â my bill was $22k!! Â For 4 hours, it's robbery plain and simple, and since they didn't take my Aetna insurance they charged me $22 thousand dollars, for 4 hours!! They wouldn't negotiate or lower the bill and demanded payment from me or I would be sent to collections. Â Honestly I feel very used by this hospital, and since I have a job and insurance I am not covered by Medicare or Medicaid. Â I feel I was penalized for having insurance. Â So bottom line, if you have a choice and you have insurance don't go here bcause they will send you a VERY large bill and you will have to pay it or risk ruining your credit.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I went in to the ER today because I have no insurance and because the clinics wouldn't see me for my UTI symptoms. I was in so much pain today that I said Fuck it I'm going to the ER. I went around 1 or 2pm and I think I left close to 5 pm. EVEN though it was a long wait everyone who helped me from the check in, to registry, to the nurses were lovely. Like SERIOUSLY LOVELY! I went in crying from pain and frustration. Frustration at how Fucked up the American medical system is. So I'm posting this 5 star because Jason (one of the ER nurses) was amazing and sweet and understanding. Like I said I went in crying and he put me at ease. While I waited Jason took it upon himself to call another nurse from another part of the hospital Â to help me get seen sooner since I was only in for a bladder infection and all I needed was antibiotics. Â So then I was seen by Bryan who was also super sweet and understanding and he quickly got me a priscription and before I left they gave me my first dose. Maybe it was a placebo effect I don't know but an hour later my symptoms subsided immensely. Â Overall the wait was long but considering this is SF I wasn't exactly surprised. Thank you Jason! And thank you Bryan! I feel so much better thank you.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: All for money not for community all for profits not for healing over charge too mach waist over spending tax payers money run by all white Management's and directors so mach racism at work place. Inexperienced management's keep moving and taking over jobs in house with no experience at all making over 6 figures. City never send under cover investigators to look after taxpayers money and fair work place.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I would give them NO stars if I could. Â If you are a recovering alcoholic like me, they think you are trash. Period. Â And that's how they treat you. Â Reading a lot of BAD reviews- they literally laughed at my pain as well, both in my face and to each other outside my door. Â (I'm a middle-aged special needs teacher, use proper hygiene, not homeless... a law-abiding citizen of SF.No disrespect to the homeless- I'm friends with lots of homeless people, and they deserve care and respect as much, if not more than, anyone.)Disrespect is one thing. Â Getting PUNCHED IN MY FACE by a NURSE is quite another. Â She thought I was asleep (I wasn't), and told me she had not hit me, but had "stroked (my) neck". Â She said it was an effective way to wake someone. Â And get this: 2 of her colleagues who witnessed this backed her up!! I told them I knew the difference between a soft stroke on the neck and a PUNCH IN THE FACE. We had seen this same so-called nurse enter a patient's room and the patient started screaming, "don't hit me!'' repeatedly. Â We requested the supervisor (not sure if she even was one), and filed a report. Â Never heard back.NEVER AGAIN
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: WORST phone services of any hospital I've heard of--they cut you off regularly and can't seem to transfer things properly. Â My best friend has been in trauma for 3 weeks and hasn't had access to his television, radio, etc because the whole system was BROKEN! Â The staff kept saying that they'd fix it, but it NEVER got fixed for him. Â The nurses say that they'll watch the patient 100% of the time, but end up not being in the room when I show up. Â Many, many issues with this place!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Basically, if you're going to SFGH it's because you have to, so writing a review is pretty pointless, but I'm doing it anyways because the employees may check out the reviews sometimes and I want them to know how much I love them.I've been going there for about 10 years, and can't go anymore because I got Kaiser insurance. I know I'm supposed to be excited that I'm insured now, but I was getting top notch medical care for free and I'm really going to miss that. Somehow San Francisco has managed to provide free healthcare for its impoverished residents, and that is the best thing ever. I spent most of my hours there in the GI clinic. There used to be epic waits, but they've improved a lot on that front, but there will still be a wait. But you know what? It's free, I don't mind waiting a bit. The docs, nurses, and support staff are awesome, I'm going to miss them a lot. I've also experienced the dermatology clinic, women's health clinic, emergency room, urgent care, rheumatology, infusion clinic, and radiology. Obviously the wait for urgent care or the ER sucks, but the clinicians are awesome. The infusion nurses are wonderful and caring. Dermatology probably left me with a bigger scar than necessary, but you know what? -Free.The thing is that it's a teaching hospital so a lot of your first contact clinicians are residents from UCSF. However, they always consult with an attending, who is also from UCSF, so you're being watched over by a really experienced doctor usually, even if you don't really see them.Anyways, instead of being annoyed at the zoo you have to go to, enjoy your free health care with complementary entertainment provided by the colorful clientele.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Needed to come to the ER, and called ahead to make sure they accepted my insurance. Was told "of course" instead of "yes but we don't contract with them". Long story short - SFGH doesn't contract with most major insurance and you're probably looking at several thousand dollars of additional out-of-pocket bills for the amounts that your insurance disallows.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: i was just recently involved in a roll over car crash last night while picking up my finance from the Sf airport..we didn't even make it three miles out of the airport before a lady didn't use her blinker; cut us off and made my car flip over a few times and slide for about 70 yards..i've seen many doctors and everything in between here..but i want to say that the nurse; Jane (med search) is absolutely wonderful, she's always making sure my fiancÃ© and i are okay, she talks to us as if we're humans/friends and not just a client, she responds in the fastest timely manner, and even went out of her way; investigated my case a little more to try and get me off the no food diet and prescriptions that for my needs..and that's exactly what she did, i'm not a fan of General Hospital nor have i even been a patient in one besides for bronchitis..but i truly admire Jane C. and her passion for what she does, i also had a night nurse whose name is Janice, she was the night nurse my first night in, and she was super kind and sweet, always checking up on me through out the night to make sure i'm okay bc i want able to go to sleep at all (have sleeping issues to being with) i've been to a fair share of General Hospital and this one by far has the best service, they truly care about your well being. and i want to give the recognition to the ones who deserve it..keep it up to those who treated me; the patient- Rachel Brown.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I never thought that SFGH experience could be anything but awful. I expected huge lines, long wait, inattentive staff - but I got just the opposite.I went to their 1M Clinic for regular care, vaccinations, blood work etc. - and was impressed. Everyone at the counters is very fast, efficient, knowledgeable. When I was lost initially, everyone showed me where to go. Appointments started right on time (unlike at other private clinics where I used to go), and no one said a word when I was late (unlike at other clinics), and they saw me immediately.Doctors were super friendly, attentive, listened actively, and talked informatively. Nurses and Advice Nurse - polite and professional. When I came for blood work (first come, first serve), I expected a wait, but was in and out in 7 minutes (and mind you, just "in" takes some time, as the hospital is huge). To compare, when I was going to Lab Works with appointment, it always took me more than half an hour.For a routine check-up appointment, you will only get one in a month, but when I needed to see a doctor urgently, but didn't want to deal with Urgent Care, they gave me an appointment first thing next morning.I am very impressed with SFGH, and somewhat proud that SF has such a great General Hospital.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: My 88 yrs-old mom had a fall at Safeway parking lot on Monterey past Sunday, and got a cut above her left eyes and was bleeding unstoppable. Â Took her to SF General emergency. Â They took good care of her and stopped the bleeding right away. Â Also took a cat-scan on her head and neck, and X-ray'd her left wrist to make sure she's alright to go. Â You folks at the 'Emergency & Trauma unit' are terrific. Â  Thank you!!! Â Please keep up with the good work!!!Best regards, Denis Y.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: If I could give this a negative rating I would I've been in the emergency room now for 5 hours. No one has addressed my issue. They continue to see me vomit but do not care to do anything. One of the dirties waiting areas ever I feel like I'm going to contract a bunch of diseases just sitting here, none of the seats are ever wiped down. The nurses are extremely rude and crabby I understand it's late and busy but why did they get into healthcare if they can't seem to CARE for anyone. I do get it's a trauma center but it shouldn't take a whole day just to see someone especially having chest and breathing problems. Don't even get me started with the cadets because they are just like a bunch of high school kids laughing and messing around with each other. Someone even got passed them wit a knife? I would definitely not trust any one of these cadets to become officers if anything it'd be a disgrace. Zuckerberg hospital fucking sucks!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I am sure the staff here do their best. It can't be easy working in a high stress environment as all General Hospital are. My understanding is that SFGH is pretty much where they take you when you have no insurance or are are low-income. Â Essentially, it's kind of the lowest of the low, budget-wise I imagine. But I could be wrong about that.This review is based on my mother's experience at the psychiatric ward a few years ago. Â She had insurance but it was crappy insurance and this is where they sent her for inpatient psychiatric treatment when she tried to do harm to herself while at another hospital.The environment at the psychiatric ward is naturally depressing. Â Lots of people brought in under duress. That's understandable. Also understandable is how some of the staff can be short or abrupt. Â Like I said, it must be incredibly hard to work in this kind of environment.My gripe is really with the psychologist who my mother saw there. My mother was admitted for depression and anxiety, combined with extreme, debilitating pain. Her mental illness had been building up for years but our family, having never experienced it, was not able to recognize the symptoms. Anyway, she was there at the hospital for 1-2 weeks. Â My father and I visited her every day. Â She seemed calmer, due to the number of drugs she was prescribed I'm sure. Â (I'm not complaining about that.)But after a few days, she would start calling me to tell me that one or more of the staff members were whispering about her, or had it in for her. Â I thought, what a terrible place. Â How unprofessional of the staff! Â 1-2 weeks later, her psychologist called me and said she was ready to go home. Â I was shocked that he said that because I really didn't see that they had done anything to improve her mental state. Â I asked him why he thought she was better. Â He said, literally, "She smiled." Â To me, that was weird because there wasn't much to smile about there and the fact that she smiled seemed insignificant at best and really odd behavior at worst.But what did I know? Â And what I could anyway? Â So we took her home (I don't live with my parents so she went home with father). Â That night, my mother kept telling my father that the police were coming for her. Â Over and over, she kept insisting it, saying she needed to pack because they were coming. Â Only later did I realize that while she was at General Hospital, not only did her depression and anxiety NOT get any better, but she had worsened to the point that she had actually become paranoid and was hearing things that weren't happening. Â The police thing for one, and I suspect, what she told me about the staff whispering about her.The next day, we went shopping for a new bed because she was still experiencing a lot of pain. While there, she tried to lock herself in the bathroom and proceeded to try to harm herself again. Â The ambulance was called and she was taken back to the hospital--this time NOT General Hospital thank god but one in Berkeley, since this time, I insisted on using a secondary insurance policy my mother was on (a better one) but which for some convoluted reasoning, my mother never wanted to use.Long story short (sort of), my mother did not get the help she needed whatsoever while at SFGH. Â I do think the dr who treated her was grossly incompetent and that perhaps the hospital was just too eager to get their patients out of there. Â I mean, even I, who had no knowledge or experience of mental illness thought it was strange that my mother was pronounced a-ok on the flimsy fact that "she smiled." Â Yeah, she smiled because she was in a psychotic state!We thank our lucky stars that she was treated the second time around by a much better psychologist at Alta Bates in Berkeley who had knowledge in treating mental illness as well as pain. Â My mother was there for months. I could see her getting better, both physically and mentally. When she was finally discharged, she was truly "better." Â Mental illness of course doesn't necessarily go away completely. My mother still sees a psychologist every 2 months, is still on medication (though only a fraction of what she started on), and is still prone to getting anxious over little things, but she is doing great for the most part. Â No thanks to SFGH!I know many people come here because they have no choice in General Hospital. But if you do have a choice, think twice please, at least when it comes to the psychiatric unit. And if you know anybody who is a patient here (or anywhere really), ask questions if things don't sound right. Â I shudder to think what would have happened to my mother had this been her only alternative.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Elite 2021
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I broke my hand the first week of the 2011 year and i was rushed to the ER @ general. I was taken care of but it took a whole 9 hours to get me into and splint and medicated! Granted, it was a busy Friday night with gun shot wounds and stabbings coming in so ill let it slide. Here's the cool part, My physician Dr. Strauss got me in to the hand clinic the following Tuesday and scheduled me for surgery within the next two days. Â On the day of the surgery I was taken care of by the nurses and i was in and out very fast and off to Roxie's after surgery. I was checked on the next day after surgery and Dr. Strauss is a very personable caring physician. The Occupational Therapist took care of me in the coming weeks to make sure my hand regained its strength.General Hospital Â serves everyone and gets the very best from all the General Hospital in the area. I saw doctors from UCSF, Kaiser, CPMC, and County Doctors treating patiences. Keep in mind everyone comes here to get treated so bring a book, gameboy Â something to entertain yourself while you wait for your appointment and yes, even in the ER (assuming you are not in for a gang related gun shot wound or stabbing)
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: My 12 year old son was in a bike accident this past weekend and we were taken to SF General's trauma center by ambulance. The team of doctors and nurses in the trauma center were extremely thorough and very professional. I was a complete wreck and they were very sensitive to this the entire time. My son was lucky - only a mild concussion, a broken arm and nose. He was admitted and stayed overnight. There was one nurse in the regular hospital I thought was clueless (couldn't figure out why the thermometer wouldn't stay under his tongue - because he was ASLEEP!). Other than that, I was really pleased with the care my son received. We haven't gotten the bill yet and I know it's going to be crazy but the important thing is my son is going to be okay.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This review is for the Emergency Department only. I can not rate the entire hospital. Worst ER I have ever been to. - FILTHY - the people who work there are EXTREMELY rude - they are not helpful at all- I came in around 2 am, so not busy, all the nurses and doctors were just sitting there talking about life and not checking up on me once (they even made me walk to the bathroom holding my own bag of IV fluids without offering to even help) - where I was placed, there wasn't even real walls in between me and the other patients so I could hear the man next to me his full name, social, all his medical, etc. Go to any other hospital if you can.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: SFGH,I recently visited SFGH to help a friend out. Â For the staff: I appreciate what you do and realize that you have a difficult customer base to satisfy. Â Some of the employees I met today were still passionate and caring, given what they put up with. Â And the S*&t they put up with would blow your mind. Â One employee went above and beyond, she exudes compassion. Â  This all said, there were two administrators (behind protective glass I noticed) that had given up. Â I can't say I blame you, probably made it farther in that position than many others would have, but your lazy B.S. was hard to put up with.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: first off, GET HEALTHY SF!if you have to be seen suddenly (but not an emergency) all Healthy SF patients are treated at the Urgent Care center (building 80 & 90 at 22nd & Potrero) free of charge. I went on a Friday afternoon and was there for about 3 hours. The staff were all great; warm, friendly, concerned. The waiting room has a DVD player, so while it may not be your first pick of flicks, its totally better than CNN or some kind of health-report-replay thingy that some drs offices have. The other patients were good, no one was loud annoying rude or acting afool.The nurse even faxed my script to my pharmacy (I am not even dealing with the SFGH pharm lines if i dont have to, ill pay out of pocket, thanks!) which I was super happy about.catching a cab home was a little tricky but eventually one came my way and i was able to get home to rest.no copay if youve got healthy sf!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This is a horrible place to ever find yourself. I was in the ER and I've had a couple bad experiences here. Today to be specific it took me over an hour to be seen. Only to be put on a bed in the hallway completely undressed with only an open robe Â where everyone is walking by. They asked me for a urine sample and the bathroom didn't even have toilet paper and there was paper stuck to the toilet. So when they asked me to change into the robe they escorted me to another restroom that was just a bit worse with urine on the floor and it smelled horrible!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Elite 2021
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: for a trama Hospital the care is great. Â Because it's a trama Hospital, there are certain things that you have to put up with that don't happen elsewhere. My issue with this Hospital is their Billing practices. I have Medicare and they have messed up a few bills, instead of fixing mistakes they try to collect from the customer. Â Medicare says this is illegal because they notified sfgh that it's the contractors obligation to submit a corrected invoice. hopefully they stop pushing the law and do their job.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Worst place they don't care if some one die waiting for 4 hours my wife is Â pregnant in pain still no help I m here since 2:45 rit now is 6:45... I know it's not 1st come but 4 hours and no one see her yet. I m editing this because my no. Came in at 10:30 at nit wait 8 hours. In pain...
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Any place that works so hard to ensure medical attention belongs to everyone deserves 5 stars. But the fact that if it wasn't for their blanket acceptance of healthy SF 1000s of people would be sickbor indebted for life.No matter how busy, annoying, or basic behavior of other patients I am always greatful to Generall...
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Wow - first visit there and something bad was happening, they locked the place down and cops everywhere. Unfortunately there was bad news for several families - very sad.But the staff was very friendly and helpful, even as they were under immense pressure. Kudos. They weren't able to help me in my situation, but thats another story.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This is the worst hospital i have ever attended. The staff is extremely rude and give very little explanations as to whats going on. The sherriffs in the buidling are no better and are angry because they have a lower education than the rest of the staff. I have been here for 3 hour and that was to put a stick of water Iv into my bloodstream after being struck by a car. Ive asked for multiple help and got absolutely nothing. Fuck this place
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: My daughter had a bad fall and the ambulance brought her here. She had a huge team of doctors here who worked hard on here. They made team decisions and communicated well with us and each other. They were very patient with my terrified two year old through exam, CT Scan, and eventual admission into the hospital for the night. She stayed in the ICU and had awesome care by nurses Cynthia and Adrian. They are phenomenal women and nurses. Our daughter ended up being the very last ICU patient discharged and the last pediatric patient to be admitted in the old hospital. The day she was discharged on the grand opening day of the new Zuckerberg hospital wing. We have Kaiser & have been through their emergency room several times. We have never received the level of care at Kaiser that we received at SF General. Â The building was old as hell, but the staff is top notch.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I had an emergency, ended up at SFGH. Pretty routine emergency room visit.Bill was over $18,000 for what any other emergency room would have charge $1500.My insurance ends up paying the $18,000. I get 3 bills saying I owe $0, and then suddenly I get a letter from a collection agency saying I owe another $434. Called SFGH 3 times and never reached anyone, just VM. Took them 2 weeks to call me back. After another 5 phone calls, I 3-wayed them with my insurance and it turns out they are using the wrong codes for billing. Instead of apologizing, they escalate it with the collection agency who now starts to harass me. Didn't want to damage my credit, so just went ahead and paid the collection agency the $434.A week later, I get another bill from $434. Time to contact an attorney and ask them to help me resolve the situation. I'd rather pay a competent attorney $5k, then give these incompetent thieves another $434.I don't understand how an organization so incompetent is allowed to manage billing for a major hospital and doctor's group.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Ended up at the ER after a bike accident. The resident was nice and did a good job.. My issues stem from the incompetent clowns that run the payment department, from the supervisor level down to the bitter woman with the charisma of The Grinch crossed with Mr. Scrooge. Feel free to call them during business hours to pay your bill, they won't pick up. Feel free to leave a message telling them that you want to pay, they may call back in three days at a really inconvenient hour while you are at work. Good luck finding a person to complain to, as their patient's advocate doesn't keep her voice mail empty. Good luck having them actually receive your mail with payment information provided, since that seems to conveniently get lost in the dark abyss known as "The Payment Department". If somehow you had no choice but to go to this hospital (as was the case with me), hope that they don't screw up your bill from the get -go (I apparently owed $0 for about 3 months), and then have them send letters to your door saying that you are delinquent soon after. SF General. Step your game up. In the 21st century, we have email, we have accounting departments that actually pick up their phones. Maybe asking for online payment is too much, but at the very least, be more responsive when you have someone who is actually trying to pay their bill.As for the average Joe or Jane, if you can choose to go to the ER, don't go here unless you want to be trapped in a Kafkaesque bureaucratic nightmare of being shuttled around to the voice mail of different people in different departments, only to never hear back once you leave the hospital. If you can't. Good luck to you.P.S.The one star is because the operators on their mainline are awesome. They actually listen and try to help out. As for everyone else
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Today I called my clinic Richard H. Fine People's Clinic and ask to speak to my doctor, I wanted some advice on what medication I should take for a cold since I'm Â breastfeeding. They transferred me to the nurse advised line and the nurse I spoke to did not say her name and was very rude. She ask about my symptoms and I told her I had a runny nose and I was coughing. She ask if thought maybe it was my allergies since I have seasonal allergies which I say no because when I do have allergies I have itchy eyes as well, then she say I'm not asking you details i was asking you a yes or no question?. She should it say from the beginning I'm going to ask you a few questions just say yes or no? But no she was extremely rude and did not help at all. It's been two weeks since I'm sick and last week when I called the nurse I spoke to say it was a cold and that I should let my body fight it but since it's been too long and I'm not getting better plus my baby has a cold too. All I wanted was some advice and this is how i get treated. I wish they could've just transfer me to my doctor or left her a message.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Waited in the ER for 2.5 hours. I would recommend any other hospital service in the Bay Area.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Do not come here under any circumstance! Â Their customer service is sub par. They do not return calls without multiple attempts to get a hold of them. Â It is their goal to charge you as much as possible. They will not take your insurance and do not accept the standard pricing insurance providers have with all other General Hospital. Overall very poor hospital.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: the trauma unit at place is frightening. Recently you may have seen in the news they found a dead body of a patient which had been there quite a while in the stairwell. Â Soak that in for a minute. Â Unless you don't have insurance, aren't homeless or don't have an injury critical enough for you not to make it to St Luke's or Mary's, don't go here. Â The trauma center is primary filled with homeless, addicts and mentally ill getting free treatment. Â I went in with a broken and severally lacerated big toe. At the very least they were nice enough to give me a private room right off the the hallway filled with homeless on cots, but then left me unattended for over ONE HOUR with no pain medication while i was in severe pain. After several complaints, I finally hobbled out and told them I'm leaving and they rushed and gave me a pain pill and a script i could fill. Â Not to mention I hear their rates are exorbitant to pay for all the free treatments. Â $5 aspirin anyone? It's great that this place exists for the uninsured but remember - nothing is free, the treatments are on the taxpayers back. Â The property and business owner's are paying for the homeless to receive free reoccurring treatment every time they fall ill due to substance abuse and malnutrition, or just want a warm cot and an IV.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I was admitted here after sustaining a 10ft fall. The hospital is new and very beautiful. However, the way things are done there didn't seem very efficient. I was in excruciating pain whenever rolled on my side and every doctor and nurse that came to see me needed to roll me over. Every new nurse and doctor asked me the same questions about my dob etc! No one shares notes in this place ? It took 14 hrs of laying in a gurney to get any water or food or proper pain medication. But after all the waiting and tests I was put in a beautiful single occupancy room with a giant window and a gorgeous view! The hospital food was pretty good also. So, besides the awful waiting time, it's a pretty nice place.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Great bedside manner and wonderful staff. They make the best of county funds and are inventive in a pinch! Nurse Michelle, Dr. Cobb and their crew kept me laughing through 20 stitches which is no small feat. Very clear and helpful all around. I'm more than greatful!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This review is for the ER. Even though I had a long wait time, I have never been treated better than I was treated at this ER. Everyone, from the doctors to the nurses were FANTASTIC, caring and attentive. I couldn't have asked for a better visit.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: The most atrocious hospital experience I've ever experienced. Orthopedic waiting room is filled with the worst customer service: rude staff, poor signage or instruction, and complete lack of organization. The facility itself is unkempt and uncomfortable, and it doesn't help that the staff is curt. I was referred to this division after a trip to the ER, which runs with a bit more organization. What a poor excuse for healthcare. I do not recommend this place to anyone.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This is my 4th day after I went to urgent care to check my right ear and the ear drops that the doctor prescribed me didnt have any effect, so I tried to make an appointment through the phone and nobody answer me my questions neither. It took me a long time to do it. Worst service through the phone, to get an appointment I had to call 5 times, nobody are willing to help, lack of training and knowledge. After that, I went to the appointment and the doctor was good, he explained to me what was going on with my ear, some staff do a correct work, some people just don't care at all. In general this hospital needs to improve a lot.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Elite 2021
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: The security to get in Emergency here rivals TSA at any airport. I came to see my elderly uncle that had sustained a head injury in a fall. I was sent back to my car with a tiny Swiss Army knife that was attached to my keychain. I had to take off my belt, as well as empty my pockets. I was told to wait in the waiting room, but an hour later still haven't heard anything.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: How can no one, NO ONE know where anything is around here? Walking around with a disabled woman on a walker and me with chest pains and NO ONE knows where the fuck to go. Signs lead into signs that lead you to nowhere. FUCK
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I'm writing on the behalf of my boyfriend whose experience has been unpleasant.Sure, they were able to perform the surgery he needed, and gave the pain medication they needed but the medical staff, practitioners and nurses NEED a lesson on how to treat their patients NICELY, WITH RESPECT.The following are the names of some fellows working who you need to watch out for:- Giselle, a Latino woman working as an assistant nurse working at 4D, DOES NOT know how to handle patients with sensitivity in touch- old lady in registration in room 3M has a lot of unresolved negative attitude, and sometimes she would blast her loud classical musical. The workers in the other window say the woman has been working in the hospital for years and that they have no control on how she performs her job- orthopedic Dr. Kandemir: super curt, short tempered, impatient and a dick. Not very caring towards his patients. Even bailed out for one of the appointments he was scheduled for to see my boyfriend.Now the argument for why some might say these low performances are acceptable since SF General Hospital is a public hospital and that they treat everyone THAT DOES NOT GIVE THEM ANY RIGHT TO ACT LIKE DICKWADS.Anyone who want to pursue a career in medical industry cannot just get into the industry because it pays a lot of bank. They actually have to be compassionate and sympathetic towards people.If I get sued for libel for posting openly on yelp (especially by someone loaded with money, ahem, the orthopedic) well that will absolutely prove my point that their attitudes are no doubt unacceptable. For yelpers reading my comment, I wish that you will be inspired to comment and review health practitioners because then we could share our experiences, compare which health care is the best and seek transparency. We have the right to do so because we pay for this expensive shit. Internet is our friend.(edited 05/25 for grammar/spelling errors - I wrote this review when I was in the hospital under great amount of nuisance kinda pressure)
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Last time I was at General I was at the ER and one of the attending nurses broke down in tears after having a string of difficult situations with patients. The ER as far as I know is the only trauma center in SF and the staff seem to do the best they can any given moment, at least when I was their laid out with a suspected abscessed tonsil. I have been a patient in other circumstances that landed me in a couple different wards. They did their jobs and were nice people by and large - no complaints.I really wanted to offer my gratitude to the woman who directs the traffic at the construction entrance - I walked past her everyday for two months going through a lot of painful stuff and I was horribly depressed. She always got me to smile by doing a little dance and flashing her grin & would say nearly singing-ly "heya heya!" - her kindness and awesome attitude helped me a lot and I hope I see her soon to thank her. Never got her name!The construction entrance is on Potrero, I recommend running into her!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: SF General is full of efficient, hard working, harried professionals who are sometimes a bit short with you, but are mostly really kind and compassionate. Â The hospital takes all comers so you do have to be prepared for some unusual sights.They performed two bits of surgery on me last summer. Â Both went very smoothly, follow up care was great, especially for my broken bone. Â Do not be afraid to go there, if my experience is anything to go by, they are very good at what they do. Â They seem to be very kind to people who live chaotic lives, as well as to those of us who don't.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Avoid at all costs. It's painfully slow. Admit, discharge, processing meds, every step of the way is slow as molasses. I suppose the staff are good but that should be expected considering half of them are from UCSF. It's the other half I question. Much better service at UCSF or CPMC.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: One star since the support staff was great. At Midnight on a Saturday night, I took my 81 year old father to ER for pain in his upper mouth. Â Check-in was timely and a nurse in the ER was attentive. Â We waited Â for 3 hours (Daylight Savings added an hour so it seemed like 4 hours). Â The ER doctor on that shift never came to my father's room. Â We left when my father decided to keep taking Tylenol from home and wait to see his dentist on the following Monday morning. Â Is this hospital operating an Emergency Center without a doctor? Â Is a doctor getting paid without showing up to work?
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital
