Reviews: Just had a slight health scare and went to the ER at General Hospital. Â They saw me immediately and treated me with great care. Â All the nurses and doctors were incredibly attentive.I'm knocking off a star because navigating that hospital is impossible! Â Even with all the signage and directions, I had a difficult time finding the emergency room reception.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: this place is huge! HUGE i tell you. I can see why patients get lost here. All the staff that I interacted with were very friendly and more than willing to show me where it is i need to go. It is a little confusing with all the construction but they do great work here.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I was rushed to emergency by paramedics yesterday they took very good care of me at the hospital from the time I got there till I was released. I can't remember the doctors name cause I was so out of it on morphine he was great. But I do remember my kiwi nurse Claire she was a sweetheart.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I was in the SOMA when I walked into a corner store asking for some papertowels and napkins to stop the waterfall of thick burgandy liquid squirting oh-so gracefully from my hand.I was drunk when I ate total shit on my bike, got a nice deep gash into the web of my right hand between my thumb and finger. Thought I broke the damn thing, it was hella numb. Fortunety I just bruised it and tore a nice amount of muscle, but no tendons (which is a good thing or else I woulda been in fucked-ville). I didnt feel like taking a cab to a hospital so I grew some balls and rode the bike to General. I got five stiches from the cute student to-be doctor at the E room. Everyone was super pleasant including the security guys. Got prescription for Vicodin and went home to Â work the next day.No vic's for me, man up!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Worst hospital ever! Â Over $30,000 for a chest ex ray and 4 hours in their care. Â Dirty, unprofessional, Â rude people.. Â they got $27,000 from my private insurance and sent the remainder to collections with not even a single attempt to contact me first. Â  I would rather die then spend one minute in the care of the d bags here.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Can on the Friday before Easter Sunday and SF General is packed to the gils. Relatively short line to checkin and I was processed early enough. However when I received my number in line for the lab I saw I had more than 30 people ahead of. Glad I brought a book.Took an hour to get into the lab. Upon arrival I saw the reason for the delay was they only had three technicians on. Meh. I kinda expected to hurry up and wait upon arrival. Now I know.Techs were quick, efficient, and nice. They just seem short staffed down there meeting the demands of many. Can't really fault them when they seem to be doing the best they can.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Elite 2021
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Beware SF General, they practice illegal balance billing. Go anywhere else if you have a choice.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: If you ever have the unfortunate chance of being in an ambulance, Â please demand that you get taken to UCSF instead of SF General if you can. I can relate to all the bad reviews here...After getting hit by a MUNI bus, I was taken to SF General and my memories from this hospital are almost as traumatic as the accident. Â There were patients that looked like they were about to die from drug overdose waiting in the hallways and after getting an x-ray, they left my hospital bed directly facing a guy whose face was gushing blood everywhere. When I saw the police in the hall ways, it kind of explained it all; this hospital seems to be primarily for homeless people and or gang members. I could go on about the things that I saw but I think you get the point. Next, they didn't give me a CT Scan because they believed the harm from the radiation was too grand. After getting dismissed, I started feeling dizzy and couldn't see so my friend took me straight to UCSF where they were absolutely shocked I hadn't had a CT Scan. UCSF is like heaven comparatively. Lastly, I just received a bill for $12k and the only thing I had done was a chest x-ray that costed less than $300. The other "miscellaneous" 11k+ of charges just listed "trauma".
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Checked in quickly for a groin strain on a Friday night. Was put on a stretcher next to a homeless person for 3 hours. Given norco and said that's all they could do. $5,000 bill 2 weeks later.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I haven't told many people about this, but San Francisco General Hospital honestly saved my life.If you noticed I didn't write many reviews this fall, it's because actually I was recuperating from a skull fracture. Â Someone attacked me on the sidewalk this August - luckily I don't remember it happening - but I woke up in a pool of blood with a broken skull...(not knowing the extent of my injury, I walked to the nearby police station and asked for a tissue). Â Once they called an ambulance, I went to the ER and had brain surgery in the morning. Â They took care of everything very quickly, they called my parents across the country, they also made me feel very relaxed. Â I don't recall a single moment of panic or fear. Â I am very grateful to the excellent neurosurgeons who pieced my head back together :)After the surgery I spent a week in the ICU, and the care was so wonderful I honestly didn't want to leave. Â I always had one or two nurses on call at any given time to help me with whatever I needed. Â The IVs in my arms were too painful for me, so they switched me over to pill medication. Â They really listen to what you need and try their best to eliminate your pain.I recovered amazingly quickly, and I owe a lot of that to the doctors and nurses at SF General. Â After less than a month I was well enough to haul my own luggage through SFO to catch my plane back to Boston. Â Now after four months, the scars are tiny and my hair covers them up completely. Â I'm so grateful that they did such a wonderful job stitching me up in the first place. Â I don't think any other hospital could have done a better job of healing such a bad injury.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: So this is usually the go to hospital they send you to in SF after various happenings... It definitely is a budget place and not the cleanest, best smelling place in the world.. but the health care professionals work with what they have, to serve you.The staff that I've encountered all have been pretty helpful and friendly.I've also heard a lot of horror stories from this establishment.. they have tons of people doing clinicals and apparently don't know what they are doing... so beware.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I made the mistake of going to the Acute Care Clinic, instead of the Emergency Room, one weekend after discovering the Lyme disease bulls-eye rash on my arm.For starters, the waiting room smelled so intensely of body odor and human urine that my boyfriend and I decided to wait in the hallway. Â When we were finally called in, I was seen by a Nurse Practitioner, who was friendly enough, but not entirely competent, and he spoke with me for less than one minute before writing me an Rx for some antibiotics and sending me on my way.You can understand my surprise, then, when the Explanation of Benefits arrived in the mail from my expensive PPO plan, indicating that the facility (SF General) was covered but not the provider (the Nurse Practitioner). Â This stuck me with a bill for $500.I called the hospital and told them that I was going to appeal the insurance company's decision, on the grounds that it didn't adhere to any form of logic. Â I asked them to HOLD OFF ON ANY FURTHER BILLS UNTIL I CONTACT THEM WITH THE RESULTS OF MY APPEAL, WHICH COULD TAKE ABOUT 6 WEEKS. Â They said, "Sure thing."Well, six weeks later, the insurance company approved my appeal and paid the "standard allowed amount" for the charges. Â My faith in the medical establishment was not restored, no, but it experienced a mild upswing. Â I called SF General to arrange to pay the bill, and they said, "Oh, we forwarded your debt to the City and County of San Francisco.""Oh," I said. "But I asked you to wait for my insurance company to respond to my appeal, and you said you would.""Hm," the person said in-between bites of donut. Â "Sorry.""Who do I call, then?" I asked, wanting to settle this stupid bill once and for all."You wait for them to call you," the person said.Well, the COLLECTIONS AGENCY called me in January 2009 -- more than one full year after that conversation -- implying, of course, that I'm a bill-ditching, socially irresponsible nitwit. Â Which is unfortunate, because I'm none of those things, and this series of pointless events would never have taken place if even ONE of the following had happened:(1) If after looking at and photocopying my insurance, SF General hadn't checked me in to their Acute Care Clinic and routed me to a provider that was not contracted with my insurance carrier.(2) If after agreeing to flag my account and wait for my insurance company to respond to my appeal, the billing person at SF General had actually done so.(3) If my insurance company didn't have such a nonsensical policy of contracting with a facility but not necessarily with its providers, especially given that patients do not have a choice of provider in an emergency or acute care setting.Anyway, don't go to SF General.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: First of all, let me say I'm definately blessed to be here! Â So onto the review. Â I was in a major car wreck only a week and a half ago. Â The fact that I'm typing on the computer is a testament to my good health and blessings. Â So after I hit the bullet ridden camero that was abandoned on the 101 in the slow lane, the paramedics took me to SFGH ER. Â Props to the paramedics who made it a funny ride. Â THey strapped me into the guerney with spike high heels, shiny clutch purse and all. Â They were pretty cute to, through my just hit with air bags, wrecked my car, eyes. Â I asked them why, when they rolled me in, there was a SF Sheriff station. Â They said "Alot of stuff goes down in here". Â Great, I thought. Â This is gonna be a fun experience. Â They put me in the aisle between an old man sleeping with his ass hanging out, making intermittant farting and snoring noises, and a homeless dude screaming for pain meds. (This dude kept screaming for someone to give him his fake leg so he could use the bathroom. Â No one helped him- and he ended up deficating on himself. Â Now thats F$% up!)The admission guy asked me if I was insured. Â Yes, through Kaiser. Â He proceeded to CALL KAISER to see if I was insured. Â What was the point of that!? Â IMO it was to limit the services they would provide me. Â I met with a doc that checked me out, but didn't give me a Cat scan or any x-rays. Â So- a week and a half later, I have all my bodily functions so I'm pretty sure my spine is not gravely injured. Â But come on! Â An x-ray or Cat scan is a totally appropriate test for someone who just hit an abandoned car in the middle of the freeway! Â I truely feel they didn't test further because they knew Kasier wouldn't pay them for those tests. Â My rant has more to do with the state of health care today than with SFGH, but still- SFGH has the charge of providing quality health care. Â I was totally in shock, and I think my fight or flight response was in full gear, so they shipped me out at 3 in the morning- high heels and all- and I took a cab home. Â So-did I get quality care? Not really. Â Is it cause SFGH is an inadequete medical institution? Not really. Â It's cause of the sorry ass state health care is in, and how medical care is based on the type of insurance you have and not your actual condition.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I have three experiences with this hospital. Â All vary in star rating.:-One morning, not so long a go (May,) I thought I was having a heart attack. Â I decided to go to the hospital. Â They were very nice to me at SFGHMC and informed me that I was actually having an ANXIETY attack. Â They gave me drugs and sent me home and didn't even charge me for the visit. Â Nor did I have to wait. Â That was a five star experiance: informed medical staff informs patient she is not dying, gives her happy pills and doesn't charge.-In 2004 I was in a play. Â In the play I didn't wear shoes. Â One night a thoughtless dude stepped on the instep of my foot backstage and basically crushed my poor little footie. Â It hurt and I couldn't walk after the shock wore off - my boyfriend at the time insisted we go to the ER - because I don't have insurance we went to General. Â I had to wait forever, the doctors manhandled my poor, injured foot and didn't even give me painkillers to dull the pain. Â The doctors were very cute and nice, though... so this was a three-star experiance. Â Really a two star experiance; but, their general cuteness and niceness earned them an extra star.-Today. Â Um. Â Okay - so a combination of dehydration, high fever and lingering illness caused me to pass out twice on Thursday. Â In the shower. Â I also slept about eighteen hours per day on Thursday and Friday; and have had a racking cough ever since. Â I have been hanging pretty close to home all weekend... yeah, I went out for a bit on Saturday night; but, in a remarkable display of good sense I actually only had one drink and then ate food and THEN went to bed at about 11:30 pm. Â I slept until noon yesterday. Â I am sick.So, this morning at 4am I wake up unable to breath. Â And, sweating like a mo-fo. Â And, shaking. Â Did I mention unable to breath?I am sick. Â Very sick. Â Very, very, very sick. Â Sick enough to think I might be dying.I call Yellow Cab (who comes faster at 4am than they do at 4pm, go figure) and have them take me to General. Â The waiting room is packed. Â When I was signing in at triage the individual I was talking to asked me why I was coming into the ER (you mean that my pale, sweaty, shaking self doesn't give you a clue? Â I'M SICK LADY.) Â I quietly - in between hacking up a lung every third word - gave her my symptoms and she said: "You have the flu, you'd be better off going home and just sleeping."Um. Â Okay - I *might* have the flu; but, I also have a *fever of 103.2 and I know (from my Mom scaring the shit out of me about it for years and years) that high fevers like that in adults are deadly... Â so, um, yeah I'd like to see a doctor, thanks!I tell her this and she ROLLS HER EYES AT ME.I sat down, angry - pulled out my book and pretended to read - couldn't focus on that due to feeling like I was on fire with anger and fever... pulled out my iPod and tried to listen to that... couldn't concentrate on Joey Ramone singing about chicken vindeloo because I was too angry and nauseous. Â Pulled out my earpods, huffed and puffed in discomfort and anger for a few minutes; and, then called Yellow Cab and came home.One star experiance. Â Totes one star. Â Actually, now that I think about it: NEGATIVE one star... because I spent about $40 on cabs roundtrip and didn't even get seen by a doctor or made to feel better in any way-shape-or-form.Meh.Average it out and I'd say General gets three stars.Sadly there is not much of a choice for the broke and uninsured in this city beyond them. *Note: high fevers make you hallucinate scarier shit than any drug I've ever tried. Â 'Scuse me now I have to go take a bath in ice water. Â Ugh.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I hated this place and sitting in it four six hours waiting for some x ray results, but i will mention the only reason this place gets and extra star is because 90% of the staff was SUPER HOT!totally weird and unexpected, but there are some serous babes working in that hospital!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I could write and write and write, but instead I'll try and make it short but perfectly clear that this institution absolutely positively saves lives... As it did mine.... The nurses, anesthesiologists, surgeons etc on 3F 16 are the best in the world. They love their jobs and it completely shows. Thank you for saving me SFGH.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Yesterday, on Saturday night, I hurt my elbow, and was afraid that it was broken, I went to ER. Everyone did so much to help me! I got to see first nurse who checked me in in 15 min, then in 20 got registered. Immediately after got X-ray done by really cute and nice x-ray specialist Then 6 people, Â involved in shooting were dropped off by ambulance...After just of 2 hours waiting doctor were able to look at my results and calmed me down that I am fine.Overall experience: incredible care, attentive people and waiting is just a part of ER. This time luckily I had season of Seinfeld on my Iphone - would recommend to everyone in cases like this :)
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: A talented surgeon at SF General saved my right index finger. (Kaiser had recommended amputating it). High 5 SFG!!!!!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Copied from my blog. Â I am new to town and poor, so I went to the 4th floor drop-in clinic for poor people.-----------------------I rarely have good health care experiences, so i avoid them unless it's important, this was one of the worst.My hearing half went in my left ear. I know why, it happened in the spring- just impacted stuff, maybe the fault of using earplugs to sleep. Fix it with a plain little irrigation. It's not a big deal but it's so annoying I wanted it done immediately. Â (Would you be happy about being half deaf?)No insurance = I thought "hmm the hospital is the closest place with drop-in service" so I went there.After 3 hrs. I thought "this is absolutely ridiculous but I'm way up in line so might as well not leave."I got kinda ill from having no food that day so I got some snacks, but just felt worse, and figured out it was because I had no coffee either. I bugged the desk people for an aspirin and they refused.Another hour went by and I was just about falling over from a splitting headache and they still couldn't help. They stuck me in a room and said someone would be right there.Another hour went by and someone finally showed up, by then I was immobile with pain, on the verge of puking. The person prescribed eardrops and wouldn't do an irrigation, told me to come back after using the drops. WTF? Â I got one right away last time I went looking for one, it did the job, and it's a 1-minute procedure using water and the simplest squirty tool. Â 5 hrs. wait for nothing, and I left with 2 problems instead of 1.Better now, I limped home and ate some advil.Arrgh, San Fran general is the worst. To be fair, they must have bumped me way down in priority (just for an ear thing) and the person who saw me was friendly. Â Filthy bathroom and waiting room, though... homeless people left trash all over. Â I will check out some of the numerous neighborhood clinics instead. Â And they say San Fran has one of the best safety nets of anywhere... at least there's a city plan to pay something for uninsured people.UPDATE Â At the drug store, I looked for something that might help my messed up ears. Yes, they sell a home ear-igation kit. For $8 I solved the problem that doctor wouldn't fix. Â From the experience, it sure did need a treatment, not any old q-tips. Â Ears are fixed now and it's like I was walking around with bad eyesight and got new glasses. Â I know what old people feel like and it sucks. Â Don't treat your ears badly, put some earplugs in if you go to a rock show. Â And don't go to SF Gen for routine things (though, I hear they're wonderful if you get your balls shot off or something drastic.)
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I have been here twice for motorcycle accidents and it is far from a pleasant experience. Â First, it is unbelievably expensive - if you do not have insurance then do not go here unless you are practically dead.Both my accidents were pretty minor so I have never actually been treated, just evaluated -x-rays and that sort of thing. Â Not even a prescription. Â Both bills, including ambulance, ER, x-rays and total came out to the $10,000 range. Â That is correct, no treatment, just evaluation $10,000 per visit.Additionally, they make it an all day affair and expect to lay in a bed in the HALL for at least several hours waiting to be released. Â When I was in the ER there were about 14 workers running around like chickens with their heads cut off - bullshitting with each other and pretty much ignoring the patient. Â I was asked the same series of questions about 8 times by 8 people. Â It seems like they are really jaded.Finally, good luck trying to get your bill or any sort of medical records. Â Expect to be on hold at least 30 minutes if you call needing any record - everyone is too busy.If you are in an accident at the very least just take a cab and save yourself $6,000 for the ambulance.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This review is for SFGH Dermatology: Â  Â Many wonderful people begin their teaching, nursing, or MD professions filled with ambition and hope; ready to change the world. Unfortunately, these types of public service positions can be very taxing on one's soul and before long many of these same bright eyed hopefuls become jaded and stagnant. Inspiring lectures become monotonous instructions and earnest guidance becomes standard prescription. General Hospital and the health care system in general have an even more difficult task given the higher rate of mentally challenged and drug addicted patients they encounter day after day. These doctors and nurses treat many of the same faces for the same issues time and time again yet they persevere because they understand that they are some of the most needed people on the planet. I can only imagine that with every wasted word of advice and rotation of that revolving door, a doctor's heartstrings must pull a bit tighter until eventually they snap... Â  Â  Well I'm glad to say that some souls refuse to break. I had been struggling with a very serious illness for more than two months and my various experiences with different doctors had left me feeling defeated and desperate. Although unemployed and uninsured at the time, I was scheduled to begin substitute teaching in autumn. Unfortunately, the onset of my sickness left me bed ridden, weak, and unable to begin work. Despite my current financial status and lack of insurance, I needed a doctor who would commit to finding the source of my sickness. I needed someone that would truly care. Â  Â  This is why I feel so fortunate to have met Dr. Misha Mutizwa and his exceptional team. The Dermatology Unit at SFGH is incredibly busy and their schedule was booked for the entire month but when Dr. Mutizwa heard about the severity of my condition he insisted on seeing me immediately. The first person I met in his department was Dr. Davina Wu, with one look she knew that I was in a fragile state. She saw the fear in my eyes and assured me that they would stand by me until we discovered the nature and cause of my perplexing illness. She asked an assortment of succinct questions and upon examination of my condition she was unflinching and extremely compassionate. After performing her evaluation, she briefly left the room and returned with Dr. Misha Mutizwa. My initial impression of him was very encouraging. His strong presence and reassuring demeanor brought a sense of hope into the room. For the first time in two months, I was convinced I would be ok. Dr. Mutizwa immediately recognized the seriousness of my situation and assured me that he was going to be with me every step of the way. This was something we would get through together. He gave me the support I needed and his unwavering voice (He makes Shadoe Stevens sound like Gilbert Gottfried) had my girlfriend in tears. Â  Â  I really can't stress enough how sincerely dedicated these doctors are. They had an entire team in the room within minutes. Despite it being close to closing time, they called several different departments and pulled every string necessary to get me the testing I needed. In less than an hour I had numerous biopsies, blood tests, and different cultures performed to finally get some answers. This man was a saint. He went above and beyond to ensure that I got the necessary prescriptions from the hospital pharmacy and made sure I did so in the most cost efficient way possible. And it doesn't stop there. The very same night we left the hospital Dr. Misha Mutizwa called my girlfriend on his drive home from work because he had thought of some ideas for foods that I might be able to swallow since he was concerned about my weight loss and inability to eat. Then, a few hours later he called again! I have difficulty taking painkillers so he had suggested a new brand for me to try and was calling to see how I was reacting to the medication. My eyes are literally tearing up as I write this. I picture Misha sitting in his living room unable to relax because he was worried about me. Up until that afternoon I was just another face in the crowd but since our meeting, Dr. Mutizwa has called everyday to make sure I am doing better and I have never felt more blessed. Â  Â  I am happy to say that I am on my way to a rapid recovery and feeling more optimistic than ever. Dr. Mutizwa and Dr. Wu are a dynamic team. Their perfect blend of empathy and strength gave me the will to push through one of the most difficult periods of my life. The genuine devotion that these doctors displayed is something that cannot be faked. They were born to help those in need and I wish there were more words to express the gratitude I feel towards them and the rest of the amazing staff at SFGH. Thank you all so so much...
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: So when I got the bill for the non-existent service (see the previous review), it's was $700 and I about fell on my ass. I was Ã¼ber-pissed.Yesterday I visited the billing department, ready for some negotiation and poised for a huge fight. Fortunately, I had enrolled in the Healthy San Francisco Health Access program a couple of days following my trip to Urgent Care. I spoke with Amanda in the financial counseling department, who...get this... actually listened and sympathized with me. How often does that happen? She was able to reduce the cost of service to $45 and gave me the option of disputing the charges further by referring me to a patient advocate, which was more trouble than it was worth. I never had to get crazy! While I will never return to Urgent Care at SFGH, and I am pleased to see the problem is probably department specific. The people in billing were great.For those of you who don't have health insurance, it is essential that you look into Healthy San Francisco. If you are an SF resident, there are two ways to enroll. You can either pay a modest monthly fee or have your employer contribute to the fund, which waives the cost to you altogether (any good employer should take care of their people). Â It's an unprecedented program and I'm thrilled to live in a city that offers such a service.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Oh SFGH, another trip to visit you and another 5 hours of my life taken away from me that I will never get back.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Before anyone gets mad, I do applaud the ER/Trauma units for their medical care.My 1-star is for the fact that even after that poor woman was allowed to be left in the stairwell to die, they have not implemented any measures to keep track of their patients.My dear friend went to SF General last year after a fall in which she sustained a neck fracture. Â I spoke to the ER nurse who was very helpful, and informative. Â I was told that my friend would be admitted to the hospital that afternoon. Â When I called the main number, they had no record of my friend in their system. Â I thought the worst, that she hadn't survived the ER. Â After many back and forth calls, I finally spoke to an ER nurse who looked into where my friend had gone, and she was alive and fairly well in their hospital!Early this morning, 3am, my friend was taken to SF General, I didn't know why. Â When I got the message in the morning, I called and spoke to the Eligibility worker who needed to know her secondary insurance. Â I gave her the information and asked if she knew what had happened, and she said that it was listed as a fall at home. Â She said that my friend was being admitted to the hospital, but as there were no rooms available, she was still in the ER. Â At around 11:30am a nurse called and I was able to speak to my friend, still in the ER. Â She said that she'd call as soon as they put her in a room. Â A couple of hours later, I got a call from a doctor at SF General who explained what had been done, and would be done. Â He said that my friend would be kept overnight for observation adn IV fluids, and most likely released tomorrow. Â At around 5:30pm she left me a voicemail (I was walking her dog), stating that she had a room- Ward A, Room 4. Â When I called, I was told that there was no such room, and that they had NO RECORD of my friend in the hospital. Â I was transferred to Unit 4A- they repeated the same story of no record of my friend, could she have a different last name, was I sure she was taken to SF General...I explained everything, and they said she might be in 4D because that's where the Trauma patients go. Â Same thing happened when I spoke to Unit 4D. Â I repeated my story, and was transferred to the ER unit. Â THEY HAD NO RECORD OF MY FRIEND IN THE COMPUTER!!!!! Â Finally, the nurse said she'd look in her "book," and came back telling me that my friend was initially registered as "Trauma Uniform" because she came via ambulance and that code expedites treatment. Â She said my friend was in Unit 5A, and would transfer me, but if I called back to ask for "Uniform."HUH?!?!?!? Â After finally speaking to my friend, she explained that her wallet was missing so she didn't have her drivers license with her...but since she had previously been a patient, they had a copy of her expired drivers license on file...this wasn't good enough for them to put her into the hospital computer under her given name!!!!!! Â i just faxed over a copy of her California ID. Â This is inexcusable. Â If someone goes into a hospital, and gives you her name, social security #...why would you not input that information into the computer registration system? Â Obviously they inputted it into the billing system because they called me to find out who besides Medicare they could get money from.This is unacceptable business practice, and puts undue stress on the family/friends who are trying to locate their loved ones.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I had a rash on my chest that I tried to cure by myself with Neosporin. Â It didn't work and so I changed it to antifungal powder. Â It got worse and it became severe. Â Also I developed a fever. Â I called St. Anthony's on call doctor and left a message. Â No one called me back. Â That was on Wednesday afternoon. On Thursday I called the Haight clinic. Â They referred me to the Mission clinic and scheduled a same day appt.. Â When I arrived, they said I that I didn't have an appt. there. Â I called the Haight clinic several times but they were not answering their phone. Â The Mission clinic referred me to a different clinic near 17th and Sanchez, and when I got there it was closed. Â They're not open on Thursdays. Â I called several clinics and kept getting turned away. Â Each receptionist I spoke to told me that her clinic is not accepting new patients, and they all referred me to a different clinic. Â I would call the ones they suggested, and those clinics were not accepting new patients either.Finally someone told me to visit the Urgent care dept. at the main hospital. Â On Friday I arrived at 10:30 am, and I asked the receptionist if I need to fill out eligibility forms for Healthy San Francisco before being seen. Â She told me to ask the nurse. Â I took a number and waited to be called. Â The nurse did a 5 minute triage, and then I returned to the waiting room.The receptionist said that my wait would be about an hour, and so I asked if I should fill out my eligibility forms. Â She said yes, and gave me instructions on what building and office to go to. Â She sent me to the wrong building, but after I finally found the right place, the eligibility receptionist told me their office was closed for lunch, and to return in an hour. Â I expected to be in an examining room then, and I would have to wait until after being examined by the doctor to return. Â I returned to the urgent care dept. At 2:30 pm, which was 4 hours after my arrival, I was finally taken to an examination room. Â A nurse practitioner came to see me sometime between 2:30 and 3 pm. Â She suspected that my rash was fungus and that I might have diabetes, and so someone else came and tested my blood sugar. Â It turned out to be perfect, and so the nurse prescribed anti fungal cream at the in house pharmacy.I took my prescription to the pharmacy, and they told me to pick it up in 3 days. Â Today is Friday, and they told me to pick it up on Monday. Â I insisted that I need it right away, and so they said to come back at 7:30 pm. Â In brief, it takes new patients 3 days to be seen for a severe rash and fever. Â Once they get accepted somewhere, it takes from 10:30 am until 7:30 to be examined and given a tube of antifungal cream.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I Â HAVE BEEN ROBED BY SFGH!April 30, 2011 at 11:15AM, I was walking out from stone town mall parking lot to the car and I was robed, knock down to the ground, black out, end up in General Hospital with bruises and a big bump on my forehead and the back of my head was bleeding badly and there are two staple on back of my head. Ever since I feel very dizzy even when I laid down on the bed and fell a lot's pain on my head.After that we received there bill's, which we did paid for and one of the bill was a duplicate bill, Â the first bill was paid by credit card on 9/24/11 and later they send another bill siding that the credit card did not go thought , but actually did went thought , so my husband send them out a check again for the same amount on 10/24/11.The billing dept. knew this was a duplicated payment and keep QUITE. Until I have Â to take my son to see a doctor on Nov.29,2011 and the credit card was declined (this is the Medical credit card not the regularly credit card) because the billing dept at SFGH did not credit back to the account.When I call SFGH on Nov.29,11 at 10:47AM and talk to one of the representative "ANA" and she had check the system which showed there were two payment one is by CC and one is by check and I have requested to credit back to the medical credit card, this is what she has said, it will take up to 4 to 8 WEEKS to get my credit back. They have my money all this time since Sept and Oct.2011 and they will not credit back at once. She also mentioned that when you need to paid the bills, you must paid fast, but when it come to credit it will take a long time. I feel like my have been Robed again but by SFGH !. I'm currently out of job, my Â husband have set a side these money so we can see the doctors and purchased medication, since the card is on hold that mean we can't use this card until SFGH have credit back to the account. My husband is the only person have a job and support a wife and 3 sons and two of them is in college.We do need the credit / money back ASAP.I AM VERY DIS-POINTED WITH SFGH SERVICES. What do we have to do to get our own money back ! MY GOD!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I really really really really want to like this place but I simply cant.A few years ago my ANGEL of a mother was involved in a car accident. It wasn't serious but it shook us all up. Here are some of the highlights:GH not recording that they had my mother as a patient when she'd been there for over an hour.Sticking us in a small room and ignoring my mothers pain so the nurses could talk about why they couldn't get their boyfriends to commit.They inmate from the jail hitting on me.Me yelling at the charge nurse and threatening to kick her ass.Me being removed from the ER.This past week my friend went into labor. Here are the highlights:24 shift changes and still no baby.No game plan, every nurse and doctor told her something different and switched up labor process.Midwife talking my friend out of the C-Section she wanted b/c Hey! you've dilated 4 cm in 6 days! Why waste all that! (She had a C-Section anyway)Nurses starting her on pitoson then as soon as she has a contraction they took her off.FUCK YOU GH.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Got in a bike accident yesterday on the Embarcadero.I was really lucky. Â Could have easily died.For the most part I was very happy with everyone I dealt with except ONE person ....She was an Irish woman with horrible bedside manner. Â She was constantly ripping shit off my body throwing towels around... meanwhile I'm sitting there with IVs in both of my arms and she's ripping ECG cables off my chest. Â It's frightening enough as it is to be in the emergency room without having this lunatic rushing through her job just because they are busy.This is why my accident happened.About 2 hours after I was there I needed to go to the bathroom. Â They KNOW I have a concussion... yet they let me to into the bathroom and stand up to urinate unsupervised.What happens? Â I FUCKING PASS OUT AND HIT MY HEAD AND LAND ON MY OTHER LEG!So HALF my damage from the entire day yesterday was caused by negligence on the part of the hospital staff.I can't think clearly.. I don't know if I'm about to pass out , how sick I am , etc.I didn't even really understand what was going on.... they asked me what year it was and I replied 2010 (it's Q1 2011 when I write this).So crashing through an intersection and being hit by a car (with bike safety equip) is about the same amount of damage as negligence caused by not watching a patient that has a concussion.Now I have a HUGE not on my left temple and BOTH my legs hurt when only one of my legs was injured when I arrived at the hospital.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: My wife had surgery scheduled at 9:30am on 12/5/14 but at 8am SFGH called us to come in right away because some people had canceled their early surgeries, so my wife told them that we couldn't make it there until 8:30-8:40am and SFGH said to get there ASAP to get started with her surgery Â so we came in at 8:40am...... it's 1pm and still waiting for her to have surgery, very very frustrating to see that people at SFGH don't give a damn about schedules, your kids (that have to be picked up at 2:40pm), your family, your time and most importantly YOU! Â All they care about it's money they collect from insurance, their coffee in the morning and most importantly their break time, because just like clock work they all come out for lunch, it's pretentiousness at it's worst!!!! If possible avoid coming here!!!!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Great trauma center. Â I came in breathing through my chin and I left with a general sense of well being, 12 hours and 3 gunshot victims later. Â I wouldn't go back for anything else, but trauma-wise, I highly recommend SFGH. Â If you are an EMT reading this in the ambulance, go to SFGH. Â Your patient will thank you. Â Insurance and billing (English, please?) is hard. Â Everything else (healing!) is awesome!Don't go back if you're conscious and have insurance.Followup: removing two stars because I just had to deal with the financial services people here. Â I was sent to collections because my payment plan was rounded up to the next dollar by "the system." Â Because I sent in the agreed amount each month, which was 21 cents less than "the system" thought I was supposed to pay, I was sent to collections! Â So now SFGH gets 10% or whatever meager portion they sold my debt for, and I get to deal with credit collections.. lose-lose-lose for everyone involved: the hospital, the no-income patients I was subsidizing, and me.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: had to get my ear cleaned yesterday because of a wax buildup from using earplugs (nasty, i know). So here I go to the Emergency Care on building 80 after phoning in on Friday night. The lady on the phone was a bit rushed and rude, but cool enough knowing that this is a free hospital afer all and I'm sure they get a lot of stupid and crazy phonecalls. So I get there at 8 am like they told me to. I was one of the few people there, to my surprise since my roommate and everyone I know told me I'd have to wait for hours on end just to see someone. I take a number and sit down to wait for my patient registration/intake, the cutest Chinese nurse was there working her butt off with a smile. Everyone in the waiting room was a nutcase or a weirdo or a crack addict, so it must have been a nice break for them to get a (sorry if i toot my own horn here) "regular" guy who had showered before coming in and whatnot. The doctors and nurses here are miracle workers. And this is the main point of my review. This hospital operates under really dire and budget-stricken conditions that force the employees to make-do with what they have, while keeping an optimistic attitude. Everyone was super nice and had a bit of humor sense (you have to have one if you work at this hospital with this kind of clients!). But the truth is that this is a hospital with fully capable employees that are just as trained and capable as the private hospital ones, if not more since they see a lot of crazy stuff and have to deal with a lack of resources (see uber-talented Cuban doctors for reference of what i'm talking about). Â My doctor brought the nurse in to see the procedure he was going to conduct on me (ear cleansing/flushing) and he was very helpful with her letting her look inside my ear and really understand what he was about to do. Doctors are working their butt off and training nurses are learning quite a lot! This hospital deserves a lot more credit than it gets, and double the amount of funding. A warm cyber hug to all the staff at the SF General Hospital~! Â ^^
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I was kinda unsure bout going here to the woman's option center on the 6floor G ward; but never fear they were Spectacular! From the beginning to the end the hole experience was great the woman who work in this department I would like to thank making my experience so Comforting I would recommend this place over Planned Parenthood any day!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This place is why SF is the bestest city on earth. They take care of everyone, from uninsured artists and college students to weathly trauma victims to that crazy guy that sits on the end of your block and smells like pee. That their commitment to UNIVERSAL health care, one that isn't shared by the majority of this country. Not only that but every doc there is affiliated with UCSF, one of the most prestigious medical centers in the US. Yes SFGH has its issues (it is as real as it gets) but it serves people no one else will see on a sliding scale. Including you. To those who whine about long ER waits I say this - Get over yourself! Being 15-35 and having a fever/body aches/cough is NOT a life threatening emergency! Having a bleeding wound is not (necessarily) a life threating emergency, trust me the bleeding will likely stop on its own and you'll get stitches in a few hours.You should be prepared to wait Â (HOURS) behind the 50-90 year olds who can't breathe, are actively having a heart attack or the gunshot victims who roll through. Â If you don't like the smell or over worked staff consider the alternative - no care. Thats what most uninsured people have outside of this fine city. Better yet, support bonds, taxes and other initiatives to increase funding to SFGH - like the snazzy new building that has been proposed to make the hospital earthquake safe and update the facilities.SFGH rocks my world.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Elite 2021
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: For a diverse and progressive community as San Francisco, SFGH is one of the worst care facilities I've experienced treatment at during the 25+ years I lived and worked in the city. To avoid any liability problems in detailing the specifics of what I experienced there and why, I'll avoid going into the genuine trauma I endured at a facility particularly set up for assisting in the healing of those enduring the side effects of medical/physical/domestic and social needs being either unmet or worsened as a result of the hospital's inability to properly attend the overload of patients and their needs ~ notably those without coverage, representation, friends, family or other Medical Professionals so as to provide essential personal and appropriate care, as well as, a staff comprised of clinicians, CNAs, RNs and MDs that are unable, unwilling, or otherwise prevented from securing the safety of their patients, communicating directly with those requiring their assistance (rather than defaulting to agencies and other professionals without access to nor education regarding the circumstances of the patient,) to make the best effort to administer the most befitting care. Regardless of the fact that the hospital - especially its more generalized departments - will almost always allow for care without the need for any insurance (even for Specialized treatment,) my experience (even during visits wherein I had Specialized PPO or similar coverage,) proved indifferent at best and pernicious at worst. I've experienced medical professionals assaulting patients, watched a clear recognition of a pattern of abuse via law enforcement, domestic partners and others by way of false allegations which, though proven untrue and thus bestowing establishing evidence in contrast with the type of abuse nearly always present within the facility, no action - to improve, modify, or set guidelines to prevent such circumstance from continuing - were ever put into action in the 20+ years I lived in San Francisco. At present, my personal experiences at SFGH's multiple departments include, but are not limited to: 1.) being involuntarily held against my will for over 72 hours, receiving involuntary ECT yet ultimately being released without any treatment - due to the fact that my Medical Representative, who was recognized by several MDs and RNs at the hospital as a cause for severe trauma va false information he knowingly supplied the clinicians there with incorrect information and/or generating malevolent conduct, direct impairment or incorrect diagnoses - any/all which lead to intensive and harmful damaging periods in my otherwise normal life,
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Well, since writing that review last June, I was diagnosed with thyroid cancer and spent four days at Â SFGH to have my thyroid gland and a bunch of lymph nodes removed (seven hours of surgery).. Â I got the best medical and nursing care I've ever Â had. Â Since my surgery, I've been cared for by the endocrinology clinic at General and it's been terrific. Â I see a UCSF endocrinologist every month, get blood drawn frequently and get my prescriptions filled all at General. Â SFGH is a great hospital, operating under terrific budgetary constraints. Â They are challenged every day to take care of of those of us who are poor, sick and abandoned by the health insurance industry, and they do it with kindness and class. Â They figure out what is wrong with us, they stitch up our wounds and they put up with a whole lot. Â We are so lucky to have SFGH and everyone who works there!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I ate at the Cafeteria the other day and I was pretty impressed. Â The food is by no means gourmet, but very well done and at affordable prices. Â I had a bacon cheese burger with a side of onion rings and it was pretty tasty. Â The patty's are partially pre-cooked and finished on a grill. Â It had a nice char to it and overall nice flavor. Â The onion rings are from a frozen bag but the portion is huge..even for a side... and had a nice crunch. Â All of this for about $7 with a drink. Â I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but if you are spending a lot of time here as I have been lately... It isn't a bad place to have a lunch or dinner here.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I was referred to General for a condition in October 2011. My appointment was set for January 23, 2012. Just called them to cancel the appointment because the problem I had already went away. It took sooooo long that my problemo couldn't wait any longer. lol Their receptionists are very quick and helpful though.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Well, after spending 8 hours here the other day only to walk out no more clear on my medical situation than I was when I hobbled in, I'm of mixed feelings. The staff here are incredible, particularly in the ER. They put up with some unbelievable cases and people, and do it with a smile and a gentle touch. Like the woman who was a shamed alcoholic when she came in, ready to readdress her life and stop drinking a pint an a half of vodka a day, but later turned sour and enraged - possibly, probably, when the vodka she'd had that morning wore off - and walked out Against Medical Advice rather than wait another 15 minutes for test results.The thing is, I know the staff deal with a lot of shit because I was there for 8 hours, and had plenty of time to watch the sideshow. And boy, did I wish I had remembered that I'm now an insured individual and don't really need to go there before I went, cause I'd have at least those 8 hours back. And that' why I give three stars - I can't really recommend you go there if you have any other available option, but I'm thankful as hell that you can go if you don't.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I've had two friends who had to stay at SF General during the past year. My visits to them were nothing short of shocking. One friends is currently dying in 5A, and he told me staying there is "torture." The nurses and people "caring" for him are rude and rough when they change his bedding. Where is the compassion? They did let me stay after hours one night, which was nice, but at 9:15 at night, his "room-mate" had the television on loud, a nurse had a flat-panel computer seven feet away and talking with another staff member about the computer system and its problems out loud, without any consideration that my friend is desperately trying to get some sleep. This place is something out of a nightmare. I appreciate the fact that it serves low-income folks, but how they serve them matters.....Update: Well, the I stopped by last night. The obnovious roommate is gone, replaced by an old man. Guess what, he's tied to his hospital bed! What a nightmare. I tried to ask the orderly stationed there about the condition of my friend, but he barely spoke English, so I had to find his nurse on my own.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: The worst hospital I have ever been to. I was seen for a crushed hand. I got checked in at 1120 am. My fingers were busted open bleeding. My skin was hanging off. They did not clean the blood or the gashes until 5pm. They just let me sit there bleeding. Through out the whole time there, the nurses and doctors came into my room looking for patients they had lost at least 8 times. As I was getting all the gashes stitched up, the orthopedic who was working on my hand told me I would've out of work for 6-8 weeks. After I was done getting stitched up and getting the cast on. It took another hour in a half for anyone to come see me. Finally I got my release papers with out seeing the doctor again. I was given nothing for pain or swelling. Also didn't receive anything about work. It was by far the worst treatment I've ever received.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This place is awesome. Â I've been to many General Hospital throughout the years, and when you're in pain, it's good to have caring and efficient people nearby. Â I've been to places where they make particular comments to me (asking if I understand English for one, after I just retell the doctor what my symptoms are in perfect English), to having disorganized workers, being looked down upon/judged/disbelieved...as well as random General Hospital that are unkempt, with an indifferent/superior/I'm too tired for this BS vibe. Â Yet, we are all human and seemingly underpaid and underappreciated, but maybe that's why this hospital experience stood out so much to me.This place is different. It is the only city hospital and yet, they were quick and responsive in the ER, versus making you wait for hours. Â I also know that in the cases of sexual assault, you can go in directly and not have to wait, and you have the option of having a victim/survivor advocate with you, which is super helpful to have (since you'll be questioned by several people once you enter). SFWAR helps with this, so join us in the 5K walk against rape on sat, april 25th btw!The workers collaborated really well, everyone knew what they were doing and the relationships shared amongst them seemed open and friendly. Â You know how you can just get a feel for people? Â It was all good from that experience. Â Thank you SFGH.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I was having unusual leg pain on New Year's Eve and hesitatingly went to the Urgent Care center at SFGH - I thought of trekking to UCSF, but knew I'd be spending a good chunk of time waiting and didn't want to lengthen the trip with a long commute on the bus. And SFGH is only two blocks from my house.Needlesstosay, I was very cautious about going here, but I must say I had a positive experience. I was in and out in three hours - longer than ideal, but much shorter than expected - and dealt with a very pleasant staff, despite it being a holiday, a couple crazies wandering about and several language barriers to deal with. There was obvious frustration in the faces of a couple nurses and in conversations I overheard, which I winced at because the last thing I wanted when it was my turn was bad service or bad attitudes (a lot to ask for at a public hospital, I know).The most negative aspect of my experience was...well, the other patients. They talked so loud amongst themselves, with no regard to those around them, that I didn't even hear the nurse call out my name at first. Once treatment finally began, I couldn't have asked for a friendlier bunch, full of smiles and laughs. Their bedside manner was great - especially when I ran into one of the nurses at a local lunch spot after I left. When she saw me, she got up from her table to come ask me what the assessment was, explained my diagnosis further, and offered me her suggestions for follow up with my own doctor. If only all doctors/nurses showed so much concern - my only regret is not getting her name so I could review or follow up with her!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I would NEVER ever send anyone here or even suggest it in any case.-I arrived to urgent care about 10 min. after they opened-sat across from a guy who wouldn't quit screaming the F word and was puking as well.-spent 8 hours in this little room-got another show from this psycho woman who was screaming at everyone that she was not crazy all while waiting to fill my prescription that they would later tell me would take 3 hours to fill. Sadly to say i made the trek 40 min. by BUS home and back.On the upside all the doctors who took care of me were GREAT.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Beware of the resident intern medical student that gave me an inappropriate BREAST exam!!!!!!!! Make sure that you are always with a woman in the room...nurse, secretary, assistant...whatever female that is closest. (Update: According to Montgomery 7-31-06 the place to complain is PATIENT RELATIONS; shout out to Montgomery...NOW I don't trust any MAN to touch me in a hospital setting!!!!)prices are better than any other hospital in the city. TRAUMA emergencies like gunshot victims are handled by the team here, including UNINSURED homeless with gangrene, HIV, Hepatitus, and flesh eating bacteria infectious diseases.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: On Sunday, Nov. 14th, I was hit by a car while crossing Market street. I went to the ER, obviously, and was in a lot of pain and scared out of my mind. Customer service was the last thing from my mind.The fact that the doctors and nurses were very proffesional and knew their jobs didn't surprise me. But I was shocked at how nice everyone was. I talked them out of cutting my jeans off (my favorite pair!) and they very gently worked them off. They told me everything they were doing ("this is an ultrasound, it will be a little cold," "these are for the EKG," etc.) and made sure I understood and was okay with everything. They were concerned about injuries to my pelvis, and needed to take my underpants off, and made a point to keep me covered. Small things I suppose, but it added up to mean a lot. Everyone, from the head doctor to the nurses to the administration guy, was friendly and helpful. They helped me file a police report (it was a hit and run) and although I declined pain medication for a while becasue I don't have insurance, they talked me into it when it was obvious I needed it. It was a wise choice.Once they knew I didn't have any life-threatening injuries, I kind of expected them to ignore me and discharge me. But they made sure I was comfortable (as comfortable as I could be,) and one nurse who's name I regretably forget kinda stayed with me, wheeled me out to a waiting car and made sure I was taken care of. To be fair, it was a slow night, but still, the genuineness was there.On a lighter note, I had never been to the ER before. Are all Emergency Rooms filled with doctors and nurses this attractive, male and female alike? I always thought the tv show ER was ridiculous because everyone was so hot, but this staff makes that show look like the cast of the muppets. Oh, and the police report? Why the hell do I have to wait 2 hours for Â an officer to arrive when there were no less than 5 cops standing around doing nothing? That is a yelp for another day, and it won't be nearly as positive.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: was admitted to the ER last week. Nurses Britney and Mona are the best in their field. NP Gabriel Westheimer is the best also!!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I would give this evil place a 0 rating if it were possible; alas, my I must give it star. Even one star gives me pain. I just want people to know they must never go to the Adult Urgent Care center here *ever*.I had a cold for a week, with a massive cold sore outbreak, and I was coughing up green phlegm. I couldn't sleep at night, I had bad headaches, I couldn't breathe from congestion. I was in hell, and I didn't know where to get medical attention in this new city.In short, I spent 6.5 hours sitting next to crackheads who were beaten by strangers and leather-pant-clad drunken dykes. I was miserable. My reward for my superhuman patience was a 6.5 minute analysis by a nurse, who told me to take Robitussin, and nothing was wrong with me at all.This was a dramatic, egregious farce. I was livid, but in too much pain to do anything. But hey, I didn't pay anything up front! Welcome to public shit medicine in the USA.I later went to a real doctor recommended by a friend. It turns out I had really bad bronchitis, and I needed an antibiotic, as well as a nasal steroid so I could breathe. I was so mistreated by these vermin at San Francisco General Hospital, that I wish nobody the horrible pain I suffered. Do NOT go to the Urgent Care facility there.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I had a relative who was in there for TB. The staff were great. Even though his doctor was wearing some very expensive threads, he still worked his ass off and didn't mind getting in there to do the dirty work that usually Docs leave to the nursing staff to take care. Everyone seemed very genuine, even if some were somewhat grumpy b/c of the extensive hours and 10 floor coffee machine being out again. Still, they helped my cousin recover and I'm grateful indeed. oh! plus i was born there. GO SF GENERAL! hahahha
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I was brought to SF General Hospital this morning by ambulance and was seen right away. The doctors, nurses and x-ray technician who helped me out were all so cool and friendly. It really restored my faith in humanity after I got hit on my bike. See, the guy who hit me got out of his car and accused me of being at fault saying that I ran the red light. He didnt even ask if I was ok. When when my witness came over and said that we DID have the green, he took off before the cops showed up. Its ok. I got his licence plate number.  Â  Â But the fine folks at SF general put me in a good mood through it all and for that I thank them. And if youre the guy who hit me and ran and you're reading this (which you arent because that behavior is so un-yelp)- dont think it put me in a good enough mood to not come after you.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I had a wonderful encounter when I broke my foot while on the job and had to visit the ER. Matter of fact, I believe the physician who treated me even sent a get-well message here. She was fantastic and so were all of the staff I encountered that night. Now? I won't go back unless my life literally depends on it. An orthopedist referred me to the 4M clinic for a neurology visit due to migraines that were exacerbating my foot. I waited a couple of months for any word that I'd get to see a neurologist, only to receive a letter in April telling me I'd missed an appointment. So I missed an appointment I never knew I had. Okay, busy staff, whatever, I called, got an appointment for two months later. That neurologist was useless. She was polite, yes, but at the end of the day if you're telling a patient with a history of migraines to just, you know, get over it while you take this preventative antidepressant even when you're in actual tears because you've had a crippling migraine for days, maybe reevaluate your job. I asked for the most basic of care, a common non-narcotic migraine treatment that has been proven to work. It's called Imitrex! It's sumatriptan! I can't sell it, get high, or get whacked out of my skull from a TRIPTAN. Are you kidding me? She told me to take the preventative and to come back in two months. In tears I left, yes, with a preventative prescription, but when I tried to schedule a new appointment in two months, I was told a letter would be sent. And yes, I high-tailed it over to the ER to get my migraine treated so I could start the preventative medication I was given. They gave me decent care and understood I was in pain. That was it. I have to make this short or I'll get an aneurysm but basically whoever prescribed the meds at Walgreen's were given incorrect instructions that didn't match what the doctor told me and WROTE ON PAPER THAT SHE GAVE ME. So I called 4M, left a message, left my name and MRN, all of that. Nothing. I think maybe 7 calls, including a fax I asked Walgreen's to send, and I didn't hear anything about a medication error. Are you kidding me? I realize I'm on Medi-Cal right now and we're all just garbage junkies, but if you could maybe do the very least thing possible to help me along with inexpensive treatment that is SAFE and non-narcotic, it would be great and I wouldn't have to keep going to the ER for help wasting literally thousands of dollars. Anyway, I received a letter in the mail today telling me, you guessed it! I've missed another valuable appointment at the 4M clinic at SFGH. I left a scathing (yet polite and professional) message to let them know because I don't want to be penalized for missing appointments. Yeah, I know, a poor garbage person like me understands insurance, who'da thunk it? Please get your act together, SFGH. You failed to correct and follow through a rather simple medication issue for me so I can't imagine how you treat patients with clotting disorders, chronic traumatic pain, diabetes, anything that requires communication or care. I was standing up for you guys and the ER care I received but now, I...I'm done. I have a GP who listens, is patient, and who treats me with dignity and respect, not just another piece of cattle with a Medi-Cal number.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This is just a review of the urgent care clinic where I was seen today. People have been super nice but there are a lot of little steps to be seen. Been here for 3.5hrs so far and got to see a movie but they need to fix the captioning since only the first row shows on the screen. A bit frustrating but your imagination gets a workout. Other problem is my phone battery is dying.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I would give 5 stars to the trauma, orthopedic, urology, anti-coagulant & IM teams.But the pharmacy situation here is so frustrating that I've been approached by a security guard twice for losing my shit.If you've got Healthy SF, I strongly advise making an appointment with your "home clinic", which can take weeks. It's the only way they will send your prescriptions to another pharmacy. You'll have to make a potentially bogus trip into your clinic, but otherwise it may take you 3 FULL DAYS or several trips to general (IF you live in the city,I don't) to get meds.One of the more frustrating periods of my life, thanks to their inefficient, zombie like pharmacy staff.It doesn't matter if you have your prescription faxed in, or if they tell you to come back after 5:00 to pick up something- its never ready.One day, they moved me to different lines 5 times. I was there for hours & they seemed totally inept. Avoid the SFGH pharmacy if you can.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I have never been to an ER in San Francisco, and wasn't sure what to expect. Â I sliced my toe last night pretty badly, and when the bleeding wouldn't stop with pressure, the first hospital I thought of was SFGH, as it's closest to my house. Â  In the car on the way over, I started to second-guess my decision, as I had this idea that I'd be waiting for 4 hours to be seen and that I'd sit in the waiting room bleeding the whole time.  Â  As it turns out, I waited 2.5 hours, but I was triaged immediately, so it was taped with gauze within minutes of my arrival. Â Every single person who helped me, from the guy who brought the wheelchair car-side, to the eligibility specialist, was so kind and friendly despite the noise and chaos going on in the background.  A flood of patients who'd been in on a Muni bus involved in a collision Â arrived shortly after I did, and while I know that Â my simple toe laceration wasn't a priority relative to that situation, both the doctor and head doctor who examined my cut took their time with me and did not make me feel like I was wasting anybody's time. Â  The nurse was funny and efficient, and Â brought me (and my girlfriend!) a warm blanket, and answered all of my questions. Â They left my cut open for a while and the cold air was bothering me, but my girlfriend was able to flag someone down who immediately put gauze back on it. I have insurance, and to be honest, I think if I had a similar injury in the future, I may try a different hospital just to avoid some of the chaos and overcrowding. Â All in all, not as bad as I was expecting. Â I'm sure I would have felt a lot worse if I didn't have my girlfriend with me, but the staff was fantastic and I can't believe everything that they have to deal with.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I'm cracking up SF General has a yelp page and people actually review it! Â I was trying to google SF General to see how to go about getting my medical records released and decide to take the time to write a review.First of all the care here is amazing because the doctors are UCSF doctors and as part of their rotation they come to General. Â The atmosphere is anything you would expect in a trauma center... traumatizing. Â However, compared to other ER experiences I've had this by far takes the cake.I was crying hysterically when a nurse heard me from the hallway, not even my nurse, and asked if I was ok and if she could do anything for me. Â I told her i was just upset and she stayed with me until my Doctor came back. Â Everyone was super nice and caring. Â Dr. Nick was the best, he was very caring and calmed me down, I even joked around a bit with him, the nurses, and even the Sheriff when all the scary stuff was said and done. Â Everyone there takes their jobs seriously and I don't envy the crap they have to put up with but boy was I glad they were there. Â I bet they were happy I wasn't one of the difficult people, I mean I saw a guy rip out his IV and make a run for it, only to be escorted back by the sheriff. Â If anything it was pure entertainment for me while I sat around.I don't remember a lot about that night but I remember the paramedic telling me they were taking me to general and asked if I knew anything about it. Â I told him I've only heard bad things and I take the 9 bus everyday and the most interesting drugged up people get on the bus. Â He started laughing and assured me that would not be my experience. Â That night definitely changed my opinion. I'm actually heading there now to take care of business and hopefully thank some of the people who helped me that night.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I was rushed to the trauma center after being hit on my motorcycle. The medical staff was good at identifying the more potentially life-threatening issues, but once ruled out my other issues were left addressed. As an example they were concerned about internal bleeding and did a great job of getting the Ultrasound / Scan, but when it came to all the road rash I suffered, they neither cleaned nor bandaged my open wounds. After the concern for serious issues had passed, they moved my bed to the hallway. I shared the hallway with a gentleman hand-cuffed to his bed with a Sheriff guarding him, a few homeless people yelling nonsense, and another inmate wearing a face mask because he was spitting on people. To top off the horrible experience, I had to give my statement to the police officer where he required my insurance information. My wife retrieved my leather jacket for the insurance info from a small waiting room located 5 feet from where my bed lay in the hospital. The jacket was stolen! I asked for help from some asian nurse with an eyebrow ring who only gave me attitude and proceeded to move my bed far away from her station. The doctor was fine and most of the ER staff. Really bothered they didn't clean my wounds. But hey, I guess all those people who aren't going to pay take precedence. Cant wait until Obamacare is in full swing.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Help! Â My son was taken to General SF he was intoxicated after a night in the clubs and he was also beat up by SF cops. Â They dropped him off at around 3 am at SF General, and I picked him up at 7 am. Â He received a bill for $25000! Â My son was drunk, and not conscious, how could this be. Â One simple blood test could have revealed his alcohol level.I am searching for some advice, shall I retain a lawyer. Â They sent a list of tests performed including a cat scan of $7k. Â This is barbaric, I guess my first step would be to request the results from all of the test they claim they performed on my son.OMG, disconcerted!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Last 2 years ago, i was the patient at this hospital. Without insurance during Â that time was painful for me, i didn't have much choices where to go when i really needed it, i had to stay there for a week and it was an unforgettable experience.First, I was in emergency room for 6 hrs waiting for the next available room. When they moved me in to the room ( i had to share with another 2 patients), it was fine at my first night cuz i was numb, but later it was nightmare. Some of the other patient visitors made so so Â much noise, hello did they forget me? and another Â were in the room. Even though i told them that i want to sleep, but it made them for being quite for a short time then here it's again. When i told the nurse they didn't do anything. It was horrible. And the restroom wasn't clean enough did someone forget to do the job, this is the hospital, should keep it clean, am i right?But i would gave the credit for all the other stuffs especially the doctors here, They treats people equally and be patient with everyone. I understand how much work they have to go through.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: They did a great job when I needed emergency health care.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: OK so you always hear all these horror stories about ERs and such, but my trip to SF General last Thursday was way better than I expected. The staff were super friendly, introducing themselves to me by name and of course there are some interesting wackos to keep things interesting. Once I was carted into the ER I was seen pretty much immediately by a cute medical intern from Duke. Â Then I got my x-rays, diagnosis and was on my way in a very efficient manner. Â Definitely was impressed when I went back to pick up my x-rays to bring to my specialist and that took only 15 minutes (most of that b/c I'm hobbling around on crutches).Great service, and very efficient!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Probably the worst ER experience of my Life. Â But maybe it's because i was so badly hurt. Â They left me in a room for 5 hours with out any way to contact anyone. Â Mind you my face was split open. Â Now I have some wicked awesome scars thanks to their retardedness. Â They should have stitched me up much sooner. Â I have gravel stuck in my face. Â I did get a real nice morphine drip though. Â They also lost the straps to my dress, and the bow that was in my hair and my bike lights. Â Oh and my bike. Â Well the cops might have left it at the scene, it's still a mystery.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: gh gets a lot of drunkards even at 9 am. One of them was like "hey baby what's wrong?" ... how nice and disturbing. the nurses were incredibly personable and humorous! that's why it get's four stars. i dont mind the un-fancy looking decor. I was attended to right away...most of the wait was for test results.it lost a star...cus i unnecessarily lost GOOD blood. one doctor walks out... machine starts sucking out my blood.second doc walks in.... "oh that's not suppose to happen..." Oh you know what doesn't hurt?... getting your blood drawn.BUt you know what does hurt?... getting your blood pushed back in! i dont want it no more... just throw it out.... im sure i can make more!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: THE only Trauma 1 hospital in the Bay Area...Crack heads, car crashes, and common colds...what can i say, it's a COUNTY HOSPITAL,and It's As Real As It Gets!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Seriously back in Â Manila where I spent most of my life at, my mom made it a point that we get the best care whenever we get sick. Best room (always Suite), best doctors, best care...best everything, thanks for her work's health insurance.When my mom was sick of cancer her hospital was UCSF and it reminded me of the hospital back home, when it comes to care. So I told everyone if I need to be taken to the Emergency Room it has to be at UCSF.I remember when we first visited SF when I was 10 years old and I got sick (symptoms of Apendicitis actually) I was brought here by my Grandfahter and as far as I can remember I had a pleasant experience...nothing traumatic.So this past Tuesday, TB was picking me up so we can get ready to watch Beauty and the Beast at Golden Gate Theater. Until I heard him on the otherline saying he got into an accident and told me to come down there as quick as I can and I did. Its a cliche to say everything was a blur since my only concern is, his safety. Im glad the Paramedics let me ride with them to SF Gen, apparently because its Trauma, he has to be broguht there.The Paramedics were awesome in calming me down, not that I am being histerical...its actually the opposite since I sort of kept quite and fell into some kind of a trance thinking the worse that could happen to my TB. They reassured me that is not that serious and that he is lucky.They did not even put the siren on.When we got to the ER, the nurses know what to do and made sure that TB is okay and so was I.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This is a place where people without medical insurance go.If you have an emergency and want to be checked out by a Doctor, you're in for a nerve wreck.The emergency room has a waiting room that is always crowded and badly ventilated. Half of the people there look like bums and smell. The average wait time is about two hours and you cannot make an appointment, so you just hav eto come early.
