When you Â are called you will be seen by a nurse ,not a doctor.Now, if you got directed to a specialist for a specific problem it is better. Tehre won't be any more lines and the Doctors should be qualified. I receive cancer treatment from General Hospital and the Oncology department is great and professional.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Last year I was really really really sick. Like I was coughing up blood sick. I was obsessively checking my temperature and looking up symptoms of bronchitis. I broke down and called my mom and asked her to take me to the doctor. One thing: I didn't have any insurance. So my mom took me to General Hospital and I sit there, trying not to pass out from my 110 degree fever. It took FOREVER. Hours pass by before I even see a nurse. There's another guy in the waiting room whose arm is wrapped in some bloody cloth. Perhaps he should be in the emergency room? It sucks. I can't say that it's entirely General Hospital's fault. It's the fact that this country is FUCKED up and we are beholden to private enterprises for health care. Now that's fucked up.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: It's funny how SFGH Pharmacy Department after standing after a hour waiting on a script for my brother SFGH has a love hate relationship with patrons when tempers rage it becomes a comedy show or a real live fighting ring cause the staff moves real slowly and the Chinese folks is making others tempers flares up because they can't read and sign they got the right jump others in line waiting for their medication is like waiting on the 30-Stockton bus in Chinatown like I said SFGH has a love hate relationship due to short staff in the hospital.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: So about a week ago I was casually walking down my stairs, much like I do every day. Only on this day I would miss the last 2 steps, twist my ankle and hear an unholy POP that made me swell up and resulted in an inability to walk and a LOT of pain. After consulting Yelp on where to go for the insurance-less (yeah, I know. Sign up for healthy SF sooner rather than later!) I decided on SF General. My boyfriend loaded me into the car and off we went.I was seen immediately by the triage nurse. Her bedside manner wasn't the best and she would later slam me injured-ankle-first into a wall while pushing my wheelchair, but all seemed well.While waiting in the waiting room we got to catch a glimpse of quite a few characters, offered drugs, etc, etc. I took xrays, then some more, then saw every single person working in the ER. And honestly, the nurses were fantastic. There were two in particular (Mia and Jocelyn..thanks ladies!) that really gave me great advice. The doctor on the other hand...eh. I know they were busy with drunk homeless people but really, she poked me twice, called it a sprain then said I didn't actually need xrays and that was that. Cut to a little over a week later and there's definitly something weird and ouchy going on..but I won't be back there!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: A large portion of the patients at SFGH are there for emergency trauma care. A friend of mine was hit by a car while crossing the street last December, so she spent a week here recovering. The several times that I was at SFGH, the emergency room was overflowing with automobile & bike accident victims and with victims of violent attacks (e.g. gang fights).My friend received prompt initial care from the doctors there, but spent about 12 hours in the ER while waiting for an inpatient room to become available upstairs. While waiting, we saw several pretty bad cases. The most memorable to me was a 17 year old kid who had been literally stabbed in the back by one guy while in a fistfight with another. He was already plotting his revenge against his attacker.Another memory from SFGH that stands out were several patients smoking and begging for money just outside the front door to the hospital. That was depressing. I've never seen that at a hospital.The upside is that the 3 doctors attending my friend during her week long stay were first rate. I could tell that these 3 surgeons were experts in their field, their professionalism and the reconstructive facial work they performed were both top notch. I'm not sure if people without health insurance would have access to these doctors though. They might, I just don't know.------------------------------------------The Cafeteria @ SFGH: This is one of only two options for a hot meal in the hospital. I ate at this cafeteria several times when a friend spent a week in the hospital. They pretty much just serve low-grade, but very cheap, cafeteria food. The "cuisine" here is exactly what I used to eat in public school cafeterias growing up, but with more options.For higher quality food in the hospital, try the soup & sandwich place right across the hall, if it's open. It's usually closed.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: God help you if you ever have to deal with their billing department. Â This place is the worst hospital I've ever had the misfortune of dealing with.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Elite 2021
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I got taken here by an ambulance after suffering a compound open fracture of my arm in a car accident (lady ran a red, I t-boned her). Â The staff was largely very good (except this one grumpy nurse that didn't find my painkiller-induced jokes as funny as I did). I got wheeled into surgery a few hours after arriving and woke up with a bunch of metal in my arm. Â I'm still recovering, but early indications are that they did as good a job patching me up as was possible. Â Kudos to the orthopedic surgery team!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Do not go to this Emergency Room!I went in for a cut finger that was bleeding, was put in a cubicle and told to go wash my hand in a sink, they put some antiseptic on my finger then a band aid and sent me on my way.I got the bill for $1400.00 later that month.NO I AM NOT KIDDING! I was in there for 20 minutes and they charged me $1400.00!I called them and told them this must be a mistake so they reviewed this charge and told me no, this was a justified charged amount and would not budge on the amount.I had a surgery in a private Dermatology office removing a skin cancer and it was less than half of this price.What a major rip-off.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I was brought here for trauma on a Friday night, at about 7pm; ultimately I was admitted and spent 11 days in the ortho ward. Â I was told (and have found out since) that for trauma SF Gen is the place to go from a quality standpoint - a view that many of the nurses on staff endorsed. Â ("If I got shot, I'd want them to take me here," one said.)My ER experience was good, from what I remember - everyone was prompt and professional and I really didn't notice that I wasn't admitted until 2am or so. Â Though I was very heavily medicated at the time. Â I do remember hearing a doctor ask another patient if he "was hearing the voices now" and another doctor ask another patient if he got hurt "before or after shooting up." Â Such is life in the trauma ward of a general hospital - it is what it is and my care did not suffer for it.I was surprised, pleasantly, by the quality of care that I got here after admission. Â I did not know that SF Gen shares faculty with UCSF and was pleased to find out that they did. Â I was well taken care of by my ortho surgical team - I had two surgeries while I was there - and felt the same way about all but one of the nurses that helped me while I was there.I shared a room, which was fine because my roommate was fine. Â But it could have been bad - I heard many screaming matches between patients and staff, nearly all of which were medication related (as in, patients wanting more of it, and nurses & doctors explaining why there was no more to be had). Â Word to the wise: they will discharge you if you're too much trouble - I heard it happen more than once to cranky neighbors. Â ("Mr. X, we feel that if you're able to wheel yourself out to smoke, you'll be more than capable at home, so it's time for you to leave.")The food is terrible, despite the efforts of the very nice people who make the menu happen, and several times they "forgot" to serve my meal. Â So do be aware of that and be sure to bring your friends food if you're going for a visit. Â Jamba juices are like currency there.My ongoing care has been more of a mixed bag, with Ortho continuing to shine and ENT crapping the bed on a few occasions. Â But all in all they exceeded my expectations, and sent me home fixed and happy. Â Which is what you want from a hospital, anyway.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Okay I went to the Urgent Care and had a really shitty experience. Being poor with no health insurance sucks!But coming to the Hospital was amazing. My doctor was wonderful. I had really HIGH sugar levels and the staff and doctor made sure that everything was done to me to keep me safe.I didn't expect, nor did I believe, I would get such great . . . -sorry to use a restaurant term- service! I'm currently looking of a job that has health insurance. Once this happens, I'm going to make sure to get Blue Cross because SF General does take Blue Cross.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Five stars for the trauma unit-- I was hit by a car as a pedestrian two weeks ago, and they were amazing. Â I must say I was pretty unhappy to hear the ambulance paramedics say we were going to General... but he said that's the best trauma unit in the city, and we had to go there. Â They were on it from the second we arrived; I was impressed by the professionalism and intensity of the care. Â Before the backboard and neck brace were ever removed I had been X-rayed and poured over by countless doctors. Â However...Once it became clear that my spine wasn't injured and that the copious amounts of blood were flowing from a head injury that had NOT resulted in brain swelling, I was put in a corner and left to bleed all over myself for the next four hours. Â Now, I understand the the stab wounds and gunshots that came after me were more important... but it took them 15 minutes to wash the blood out of my hair and stitch my wounds. Â Couldn't anyone have done that four hours earlier?
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I have had almost completely negative experiences with SF General. Â Let me start by saying that I think the doctors at SF General are at the top of their field. Â They are competent, kind, and altogether brilliant, and I'm thankful that they're there.That said, the remaining staff members range from mediocre to horrendous. Â I'll share a few stories:* I had an appointment in the morning and called the operators to find out what time it was at exactly. Â Like several other experiences I've had there, the phone operators were beyond unhelpful. Â I tried to explain to one woman that I had an appointment that morning and she told me that there were no morning appointments in the clinic. Â After asking her to check the computer, she got huffy with me and hung up! Â On several separate occasions, I have tried to ask the operators a specific question, and they will transfer me to an outside line well before I have even finished the question.* Â I went for a simple blood draw once, and was not even greeted by the medical staff. Â They never looked at me or gave me any kind of acknowledgment, just punctured my vein and let me go. Â I asked the woman who was drawing the blood if I could have a drink of water. Â She gave me a strange look so I repeated it, and she came back with A GLASS OF HOT WATER!! Â  Who are these people?? * Â I became sick one day and went to the Urgent Care to be treated. Â It was busy, so I had to wait for 4 hours before being seen. Â When I finally was seen, I was put into another room for 30 minutes. Â It really didn't help my throat problem to been left in a room with an open window on a chilly February night. Â The Nurse Practitioner was totally unfriendly with me when I finally was seen, and gave me some very glib medical advice. Â I was finished with her in less than 5 minutes. Â As a positive note, I had a very successful minor surgery on my hand there, and all of the doctors were tremendous. Â Thanks to all of the thoughtful, skilled, professional doctors and surgeons at SF General for balancing out all of the nutjobs.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I took a day off work hoping it will only get better, but by 5 PM my nightmares began. I had slept for almost 18 hours before I knew I had to go to the ER. Without insurance, I didn't care because my fever + upset stomach was off the hook. I drove myself to the General Hospital around 6 ish. I first wen to registration, then was directed to get screening first to see if I am even qualified to be in the ER. Waited for 15-20 mins then was screened by RN. My temperature was abnormal and heart rate was abnormal. Went to registration did bunch of paper work. Told them I didn't have insurance, but was working. Waited for another 30-45 mins. My name was finally called before everyone else in front of me. I guess my severity was high due to suspicion of appendicitis. Overall, the nurses and the nurse practitioners at the ER was very nice, attentive. They made my stay pleasant. Though I was not discharged until 12:30 AM, I walked out feeling relieved and thankful that I live just 5 minutes from SFGH. Within that 6 hours time frame I was screened, pelvic + rectal examniation, IV fluids, blood + urine test, and cat scanned. They tried their best to make sure I'm not in danger of any infection that needs to be treated immediately. I was sent home relieved knowing that all tests were normal. No major concern. I hope I don't have to pay for all those examination (blood + urine test, cat scan).
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: URGENT CARE BLDG 80: If you are going to go here you NEED to BE and APPEAR very sick. Otherwise they are going to give you a lot of crap, treat you like a low life.The first time I went here I had some strange pink eye, so they took me in. The Nurse Practitioner was thorough you would think you were in an ER unit. I mean she checked for 3 or 4 different possiblitiles. She knew her stuff. Gazzillion Bilion stars for her. However, the intake nurse had a big f****** attitude.Today I had another nightmare, condesending intake nurse. I was sent there by another faculty. I have been having a week of headaches/migranes/sinus headaces with nausea and vomiting but my vital signs did not indicate to her that this was urgent. Basically she was telling me that Urgent Care for me was a waste of her and their time. She spoke to me like I should know all this- like the system was common knowledge. I'm like "Rag on your counterpart nurses for sending me here, not to me. I don't need this shit in the morning."So I left. last thing I want is be seen by a "health practioner" who resents seeing me. If however something happens to me, that will be on her.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: So, this is a four am review of the emergency room.Heavy police presence coupled with an attentive staff.My buddy was having chest pains(turned out to be heartburn).Better safe than sorry.He was checked in very fast, but than we waited.After forty five minutes we figured out that we needed to go ask someone.They don't call off patient names at this er.(I've been to several different er's in my day).The hospital was clean enough, but had a weird smell.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Quite possibly the most ghetto hospital I've ever set foot in (at least in the US). The urgent care nurse in particular was the nastiest biatch I've ever encountered. Â She should not be in health care or really, anything involving work w/ the public. Â I had no idea this was a 'public hospital', whatever that's supposed to be. Â But at any price, one would be prudent to avoid this dump like the plague. Â & Yep, I'd rather takes chances w/ my health than come here again!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I came into emergency care because I was experiencing numbness on my left side and was helped within 10 minutes. The staff was very attentive and the doctors spent a lot of time explaining things to me as they worked to diagnose my issue. Granted I was there for a long time since I needed to get an MRI. so I took full advantage of their Â free wifi access to stay entertained!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This place is a festering wound of the city. Â Unless you are are on Medicaid or otherwise have no way or intention of paying your bills then avoid SFGH completely I beg you!If you set foot in the ER, your bill is already over $2500, that is just to get in the door - each treatment you receive is incremental. Â That amount is unheard of at any other hospital. Â If you don't believe me or need a good laugh, check out their price list online: sfdph.org/dph/comupg/oseâ¦The city is trying to close the budget gap solely through SFGH it would seem. Â Additionally, since SFGH is in-network for very few medical insurance providers you usually end up paying most of the bill out of pocket. Â Also, because they charge about twice the amount most insurance providers have as the maximum allowable charge you can expect to pay about 60% of your hospital bill. Â Trust me, I have been here and beg you not to make the same mistake. Â Go anywhere else, please!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: If you have private insurance, stay away fro SFGH, they will charge 3x as much as a private hospital/doctor. Â I had to go to the Acute Care on a Saturday as UC Med's walk-in clinic was closed. Â I didn't see a doctor but a NP. Â I waited 3 hours to see her and only 15-20 minutes with the NP. Â When I got the bill it was $800.00! I was shocked. Â How in the he** can that be. Â I had no tests done, no prescription. Â SFGH rips off people who have insurance. Â I guess insured people are paying for the illegals and uninsured who end up at SGH.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Had a run-in with a rope and winch on a blustery evening on the Bay and my pinkie lost. I had always heard that SF General was the only hospital to go to for Trauma so I instructed my driver to take me there pronto. Thank God! I was in the ER, x-rayed and sewn together (unfortunately sans 1/3 of my pinkie) within 1 1/2 hours. Â The staff was professional, compassionate and experienced. I cannot say enough good things about the nurses, attending physicians and the Hand Surgeon, Dr. Nicole Strauss. It was traumatic and painful but I was blown away by the sincerity of their concern for my well being. (The morphine definitely helped too.) I hopefully will not have to visit SF General in the near future but in my book it will remain the place to go for trauma.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: SF General is really something else. Reading reviews from being completely negative to praising this hospital to the high heavens, I totally get it. In my opinion, SFGH gets the job done. If you're coming here for a bloody nose or a cut finger, you're most likely going to hate it. After falling about 10 ft. from the roof onto marble, needless to say I needed medical attention. I was brought to St. Marys (which has an insanely caring staff), but because of the trauma I was required to be transferred to SFGH. The nurses at St. Marys warned me about the crowds at General but I had never been so I was oblivious. Everything that's been said about this place is true - it's insanely busy, bums accompanied by cops litter the hallways (although I heard this was true from my bf, since I didn't look past my gurney), you will WAIT for a lot of services, etc. But the good things are true too. Most of the staff I've encountered are impressively trained and caring. The surgeons who worked on me are top notch! If I need bloodwork or a prescription filled, I won't come here - but if I truly need emergency trauma care, SFGH is the place to go.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: It's a crap shoot when you go here. Sometimes your experience is ok or fine. Other times it is horrific. Once my boyfriend went in with strep throat and after waiting in urgent care for 6 hours the "doctor" sent him home with a prescription for Benadryl. That incident almost landed him in the ICU. It was obvious at the time he presented with a very red throat with white pustules. Classic strep. He was so sick by the time they did give him antibiotics that the infection had gone systemic. We have been intimately involved with SFGH for many years now because by boyfriend had severe hip degenerative hip disease and dual hip replacements as a result. It's funny because the first hip surgery went smooth and the nurses on the ward after surgery were very helpful and compassionate. The second surgery the opposite. He had a lot more pain and difficulty and the nurses on the post op ward were sadistic. Also the bathroom in his room was gas station filthy. Luckily I went to his room before he even got there and Lysoled the whole thing and did a total clean up on the bathroom when he got there and every day he was there. There were pubes all over the toilet and men's whisker shaving all over the sink and mirror shelf. The sad part is housekeeping had just been in the room earlier when a patient was discharged. Â I should've taken photos but I was gagging. Anyway like I said sometimes it's ok and sometimes it's horrid. Put it this way I wouldn't go here unless you have no choice. If you do have to go to general make sure that you bring a book, a crossword puzzle, or some other form of quiet entertainment because the waits can be brutal and a little patience can go a long way. If you bring a laptop or mp3 (etc.) be sure you bring headphones because the other patients will not tolerate the noise and neither will staff. Also if someone you love is admitted as a patient bring a can or bottle of Lysol and a couple of chubs of sanitary wipes and detail their room. Â Good luck and good health to you.PS: An earlier review by Garrett S. commented several times on the attractiveness of the attending physicians in the clinic. He seemed angry that his attractive female physician was "following around some blond physician..." The clinics are run by medical students and supervised by residents, etc.. Â So there will be a lot of one physician "following the others around". There is nothing at all an air of let's pick up on our doctor or patient or colleague. Frankly I don't see what a persons "attractiveness" has to do with anything quality of care related, but as an aside: No, do not go to general to date the staff, physicians or otherwise. It is not worth it.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: The fact that I am sitting here with a possible broken ankle all weekend, waiting for my local clinic for the uninsured to open Monday rather than go through the SF General treatment again says a lot. Pondering the decision brings tears to my eyes.  Once, I had injured my shoulder quite bad. When the pain was too much to breath, I went down to General. I handled the long wait, and the stress of filling out paper work while crying and trying to get in shallow breaths through the pain, but that aside, they just treated me as if I was some junkie trying to score pain pills and was mostly disregarded. They gave me an x-ray, said it was fine, and sent me home. Then I had to deal with the billing. They did not accept my poor and uninsured status and started billing me. I had to have roommates write letters stating I was poor. And many years, my shoulder still hurts and does not work the same. And this was nothing compared to when I had an outpatient surgical procedure. They numbed the area of the procedure, but I was awake throughout. The, I assume, Student they had performing the procedure did something that caused a sudden jolt of pain up my body. When I yelped and jumped, she looked at the supervising doctor who looked at her and they both rolled their eyes somewhat dramatically. They did not believe that I had felt any pain. When I went for my follow up, the doctor started to prep me for the procedure all over again. I informed him I already had it and was here to make sure it was healing okay, he deep sighed and said "you look fine. Still want me to check". "Yes. I assume that's why you made the appointment." He took just seconds and said "Your fine," and left the room. I still receive phone calls from his personal bill collector even though I sent to General by the free clinic and told I wouldn't have these costs because of my lack of income. Â  I was still quite young then and had no idea about anything about receiving medical treatment.Through the whole thing, I felt vulnerable and lost and ended up hurt and with years of bill collector harassment and what seems to be a lifetime of pain.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: You tell them personal information regarding your health and they started to make jokes after when you are done. I caught them talking about me when I forgotten something and went back after a few minutes of walking out of urgent care center. They were discussing my personal information that I gave to the nurse and doctor openly in the urgent care facility among themselves. It was very unprofessional and that makes them untrust worthy of your personal information.There were 5 people in the facility, doctors, assistants, Â nurses and other staff. I wanted to file a formal complaint but I was too sick to do that.ps. Every time when I go there, I have to wait at least 4 hours or more. Sometimes other people cut in line too. Sometimes I was there way earlier than other people and they get to go in first. I pay around $800 for each medical visit. It's never a speedy visit. Waiting for 8 or more hours to be seen isn't unusual.Some of those people shouldn't be in the medical field. The impression I got every time when I go there is that they are heartless. I think the doctors there that are making $100,000 a year are wasting resources along with other heartless medical personnel in the hospital. They walk around taking an easy as if they are just stalling time so their shifts can end. Â When they retire they'll get a nice pension. I personally think that part of the reason why the state/city is going broke is because of the government feeding/paying these useless people a lot of money for doing nothing.pps, if you want to live longer stay out of the hospital unless you are a important person that has a lot of money. My grandfather died in the hospital without the ability to say goodbye.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Went to the clubs with my buddies on New Year Eve/Day back in 2003, went out with my buddy for him to go out to smoke, left his water bottle just behind the curtain since we weren't allow to bring out bottles..... Went back in, grab his bottle, got thirsty, drank the water....30 minutes later according to friends, I drop in the middle of the dance floor and ended up here. Â  They told me I got a lot of GHB in my system and though not enough to kill me, was enough to knock me out for 6 hours. I was able to go home that night and they explained what I was going to experiencing for the next few days. Â I told them what happened and say there was a rash of those happening in the last couple of months that year. Â Needless to say I learned to never leave your water bottle from your sight or have someone you trust hold it for you. But the staff at SF General did take care of me and I am here now.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: If there was a way to give them negative 100, I would. I was told it might be a great idea to mention the way they treat people everywhere we can, so this is my input. Again, i have seen other people suffer unimaginable pain from the hands of these pricks, so I am not the only one. I have a long-standing diagnosed radiation-induced thyroid resistance (condition in which case your body rejects your own thyroid hormones, causing you to become severely and so far untreatably hypothyroid). On the course of a few years, your face and body gets deformed, you become permanently and seriously swollen, you go almost bald, your organs slowly fail, your body rejects nutrients, electrolytes, you are unable to walk, think, eat, function...I won't go into details but its as debilitating as it is dangerous. To prove the illness, a serious work-up of tests is done and a thyroid panel is not enough for diagnosis. Needless to say, with a complex and serious issue like this I was stupid enough to seek help a few years ago at SFGH-at that moment I had no support from anyone, (my family consisted of Â dead-beat parents who are absorbed in their artistic adventures somewhere overseas), and my ex who was not just unsupportive but abusive once I became disabled. With all this in tow, while working and struggling through illness and dealing with unlivable situation at home, i had to seek help from SFGH believing in the good nature of Â health professionals. And it did not go well. With diagnosis in hand, I spent a year begging to see an endocrinologist, i spent a year more being bounced between 'resident doctors" and students who refused to do any sort of work-up, refused to contact specialists or attributed my symptoms to 'rapid aging" (I am barely over 30), "depression" (especially 40-pound overnight swelling and hair loss), or 'she must be taking something because her thyroid tests look OK." On my feeble attempts to explain that they must do Â certain work-up and not "thyroid tests" as described all over the endocrinology magazines and books, I was laughed at, shoved out of doctor's offices (it's all one hospital so hence, one system) and eventually my perpetual begging for help and their adamant refusal to even investigate my illness ended up in them labeling me as "mental" or 'delusional" (on the grounds that "the illness I might have is rare") and slandered in SFGH medical records. Which, of course, I didn't know nothing about. When i finally after begging, crying and humiliating myself got to see a specialist, he read the slander and without even a slightest attempt at testing me slandered me as well. I was living with my current partner and we decided to go to all the appointments together. We managed to get to the "specialist"-an aggressive and moody jerk of a man-to finally do the proper bloodwork that, voala, came back ABNORMAL proving me right. It freaked him out, because he and the "primary care" provider had illegal, insulting psychiatric 'assumptions" scribbled all over my medical records. When the tests came, this dude at first avoided us. Â I Â was already permanently disabled, on advanced stages of disease. After Â us tracking him down we finally got to see him, and during our visit he told us avoiding eye contact that my blood tests are 'totally fine". Based on which information, he started to treat me with aggression, called me a liar and a faker in his office, in the face of visible and obvious symptoms (shocking to my poor boyfriend) tried to pin on me that I am taking something to make myself look this way (that is after me losing my home, favourite job, and health due to illness) and painfully yanked my hands after I tried to show him how my skin has changed and asked him why he never examined me in 6 months. My boyfriend got a bit perplexed and angry, but we left. After a month of pondering, we requested my records and the truth came out-not only this dude "misread" my blood tests in his chart, but he also could not do anything about the previous malpractice and perpetuated the slander and labeling in my records to appease the head of endocrine department and the person who called herself my 'primary". Neither of us liked what we have seen, to be honest, it drove me to tears. We started looking into legal advice, and ended up going to see this guy again. Of course, we had to POLITELY question him about his frivolous and offensive writing and intentional "errors" in my diagnosis. Which triggered him to lose his temper and AS I WAS SITTING IN A CHAIR WITH MY CANE, he lunged at me in an attempt to grab me by the throat. I screamed, my boyfriend quickly intercepted the man as the "doctor" kept trying to reach me, it took him good 10-15 minutes to give up on hurting me and then he looked at my boyfriend and thanked him for "being there, I don't know what I would have done". Â Needless to say, I have a different doctor now, and if I wasn't broke and disabled these people would have been in prison.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: We waited 3 hours, never saw a doctor, (well, the resident but not the attending). All they wanted to do was charge for a CT (get some quick cash from the insurance company and me) and then told me I had a migraine, even though I have never, ever, ever, ever, ever had a migraine and my symptoms (as my GP explained) did not match them... LAME!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: hope ur in the mood for crapy service cuz if u are ur in luck this is the perfect place `to get that mistreatment uve been looking for Â i came here and spent about 7 hours in a emergency situation Â and had the people here see Â me like fifteen different times Â i got x rays , and hooked Â up to one machine plus a small talk with the main doc all Â  together i spent no more than 1 1/2 hrs with staff they didnt even give me a room i was next to a desk Â in a hallway i had to move a bunch a times just to get out of the way !!wtf!! {the only cool thing about this place is that i was born here}
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I will be brief, If you are wealthy, I am not writing this for you. I have to say that my experience recently at SF general was beyond exemplary for this simple reason: i recieved actual compassion. I had a horrible viral infection, and no insurance, and yes, I had to go at 4 in the morning (I did so strategically to out-wait all the drunks. Nurse Marissa and her attending med students 'Kyle,' and 'Nicole,' I think (I could be wrong on the young lady's name), were so kind to me, and worked really diligently to determine the cause of my illness. I so appreciated these noble, under-appreciated soldiers. They work selflessly in a very challenging environment, and I just can't say thank you enough! So what that I will receive a ridiculous bill; I could be dead, and that's way more expensive. Simply - Thank You, Thank, You Thank You.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: My boyfriend cracked his head open and they gave him some pretty good care. Not horribly slow, and the nurses were awesome awesome awesome. As for the "atmosphere" take it or leave it.i think people who complain about how many gross people are in the waiting room here do so because they don't realize that the city is full of these same disgusting ass people. Just because you have to sit with them for a few hours doesn't mean it is a bad hospital . It means that you are seeing a true cross section of your fair city. So while you raise our rents and taking away our needle exchanges and forcing us out of our homes, remember this: The more we are down and out, the sicker we'll get. And when we're sicker, you'll have to share your hospital space with us more.So maybe instead of complaining about SF General, you should mind your own business and quit gentrifying the Mission and the inner city. That way, there wouldn't be quite as many sick people. Y'ever think about that?
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: On April 10th 2010 I was rushed to the San Francisco General Hospital because I was in a car accident and was not able to see nor use my legs. I was very pleased how fast and respectfully I was treated when I got to the hospital. The only concern is trying to get medical records of when I was there.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Although, I had an inordinately long wait in a nearly empty emergency room waiting area(three hours), the hospital is by most objective standards quite good.I was experiencing severe lower right abdominal pain btw. The nurses,residents and doctorswere all focused,considerate and professional in everyway.My only complaint is that the bathrooms were quite dirty and appeared never to have been cleaned in the triage area during my 10+ hour visit.I saw cleaning personnel,but they appeared unwilling to clean the bathrooms,which showed strong evidence of fecal and urine matter.They almost looked like highway restrooms.Another sour observation is that this city appears wholly unprepared for any sort of public health crisis.C'est la vie.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: i WISH i could give negative stars, but yelp seems to be the optimistic around here.i am STILL irate about how general hospital has treated my wife and i. in the past 3 months, we went thru finding out we're pregnant, to dealing with the miscarriage that just happened. throughout this whole time, general made me feel as tho i should be punished for being a father that wanted to be with his wife through the whole pregnancy. i was never allowed in the rooms with her regardless of her requesting it time and time again. even when she had an allergic reaction the the sedative they gave her, they would NOT let me come in to try to console her.the ONLY reason i was given, which was given to me sharply and without any eye contact, was that "males are not allowed in the rooms". my wife and i have decided that even tho we can't really afford it, we're going to have to try to find some sort of medical plan so that we NEVER have to deal with general ever again.i've had to deal with general way too many times where i felt like i was just another cow in the herd. i realize that they have to deal with the scum of the earth every day, all day. but not everyone who doesn't have a whole lot of money is a drug addict hood who's there only to try to score some vicodin. some people are there because they actually NEED a hospital, and maybe, just MAYBE, you treating them like a human being would be helpful.so really, NEG 4 stars for General Hospital. it would be -5, but i really liked the chai tea i bought out front at the stand.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This place sucks! Â I waited for at least three hours and went away with no diagnostic or any prescriptions.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: After reading a few reviews I want to say, this is a ratings place based on what was and not what should be or reasons why. I agree that the hospital could use better funding and a few more doctors, but it doesn't. that's the reason for the one star. i went in for neck pains and it took almost 8 hrs for the doctor to tell me "to give it a few days and come back" wtf?!?!? At first I though this was the way it was. over the weekend i went to Sacramento general and got all the right answers within 3 hours. why is this? no idea but general gets nothing from me anymore.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Yesterday, I enjoyed a 6 1/2 hour holiday at their fabulous emergency room resort. I really shouldn't have gone to work yesterday, I was jet-lagged and exhausted and what do you know? Â CHOP. . Â .. FUCK!!!I was also really lucky I didn't chop my finger off and I managed to chop myself between the nail bed and the knuckle. Had I hit either, it would have been much worse.Three Docs, at different points came in when I was finally seen. Â The first numbed my finger so they could clean out the entire cut painlessly. Â The second came in and wanted to take an X-ray to make sure I hadn't cut, or fractured the bone, since I couldn't bend the knuckle.The third gave me a prescription for pain and gave me a tetanus shot.In the end I didn't get any stitches because the newly changed blade was so sharp that my Wolverine-like healing abilities had already sealed the 1/2" deep cut.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: people think this is free hospital but it is not! Â lot of people are paying for all. money doesn't fall from the sky at all to pay the staff at that hospital.is it not public, it's paid, everyone there they have their pay by the end of the month.The staff at the front of dest at the ER are lazy, and ignorant all they do is eat and laugh behind of the sick people who come there for help.i saw it so many times in one visit.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: this review is for er situation my family explain to me last month. a few days ago my grandmother was diagnosed with cancer. if last month the er doctor have not sent her home and check her like a patient instead of saying she is old and fine. she would have a month notice of this cancer and might have not grown to giving her serve headaches to the point where she became delusional. does a tumor have to grow up to the size of a golf ball to be an emergency? she had suffer dizziness for 2 months added that she can't sit on a toilet like a normal person! that is not normal! I know my family is not able to speak English but that's just unacceptable due to the fact she suffer for months and the er doc sends her home without proper examination!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Was here for an emergency service. Â Stay away from this place! Â Gang hang out you are risking your life! Â Very poor service!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This hospital has more facilities open 24/7, 365 days per year, than any other medical facility in San Francisco that I am aware of. Â They have helped several people I know that had no insurance. Â There may be better specialists and facilities available at other locations, but you have to respect a place does not turn away anyone, is open all the time, and is just there, whether you need it or not -- 5 stars for that dedication and clarity of purpose, it overshadows any flaws of SFGH.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: So about a month ago I was hit by a car crossing the street....I was quickly put into an ambulance, the EMTs went to work on me and then the dreaded words came out of one of the EMT's, "We are taking you to the general."This is when the panic hit me. For some reason going to General Hospital made me more nervous then the thought of my possible injuries. This is when I Â started to scream at every EMT and ensure them that I do have insurance and that I will pay!! After my panic attack I have a slight memory of the main EMT getting real serious with me and telling me that getting hit by a car was a trauma and General Hospital has the only trauma unit in the city, so I had no choice. I could only think of the horrible stories I have heard about this place and was convinced that I was done.Once we got to the ER I was immediately yelled at by some big male nurse to get off the phone....OK so I was on the phone in the ER, but someone did need to know that I was in this place. I was immediately put into a private room, but because I was taped down I couldn't see the decor. When my mom got there shortly she looked around and asked me why I was in the pediatric unit?!?!?! Well...I didn't have my ID when I was hit, so hey I guess I look under 18?!?! One star just for that!!They ripped off all my clothes, including my skin tight skinny jeans. They almost cut them off, but I convinced the nurse to unstrap me and let me assist her in taking them off before she whipped out the scissors. I had a full body exam and was poked by many objects. I feel like every resident, nurse and doctor came into that room to look at me. I had x rays and an ultrasound and every test one could imagine. The nurses even acted as secretary for me and fielded phone calls from my room from frantic friends and family.I ended up walking out of this place 5/6 hours later, A OK. Everyone at the hospital was great and did everything very quickly and efficiently. The only time I saw any of the scary people I feared in the hospital is when I walked my sore ass out of there, (they keep all of those people in the hallway.)
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: if you get in the elevator, take a good look at all the people who get off on the 4th floor. if you have done this as many times as i have you'll see what i'm talking about...better yet, get off on the 4th floor. 7 times out of 10, you'll see or hear someone causing a huge ass scene.although general has a laudable mission, i take off 3 stars for the fact i shouldn't have to walk through lobbies and hallways that frequently smell like the concentrated urine of some fucker who thought it would be funny to piss in a corner.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: took my sister in and they fix her up quick... she was able to leave and go home next morning :)
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I've never had to go here because I try not to experience life threatening danger every day. However, the doctors here have saved at least 3 people I know from dying or being complete vegetables. I mean, there's not much they can do about the fact my friends are morons with a death wish, but they do good work with stitching and casting.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Having come from a state blessed with advanced and up-to-date health care (and fabulous hospital architecture), I had thought I wouldn't quite make it out of SF General alive. Â For the level 1 trauma center of the Bay Area, I was confused why San Franciscans would have left this place so decrepit and outdated. Â Then I was reminded that medicine isn't how plush the hospital bed is or how post-modern the lobby is. Â Medicine is about people saving your life, people who will give you all the attention and care that you need even if the walls are falling apart around them. Â Thank you SF General doctors and nurses who were so kind and interested in my predicament. Â My 16 hour stay was unforgettable for many other reasons but it certainly showed me that Northern Californians can be awesome people when put to the test.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I love the people here!! I was in Oakland and found myself in a bit of an emergency last week I made it a point to drive to SF General because I trust these people. Â I have had 3 major surgeries, 3 cat scans and several other treatments here. Â I understand that there are long lines at the pharmacy! However to me that is nothing... they have saved my life 3 times and I have spent some time here. I am truly grateful for them the nurses, surgeons, and staff members in general.. I can not thank them enough and I don't want to be seen anywhere else ever. Nobody takes care of me like they do :)
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Thank you for your amazing care last night! Adi was such a sweetheart- tackling tons of questions and an antsy patient. It's wonderful to see that no one is turned away from there and it makes for "an exotic crowd" (as the security guard himself put it). I was impressed by the friendly selfless staff and am very thankful for their service!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I got into a horrible bike accident and fractured my foot in a really bad place. Not only was I lucky enough to have a program like Healthy San Francisco (trust me you guys are lucky you live here), but was able to get such wonderful and caring treatment for a very low cost in addition to the HSF coverage. I had emergency surgery and every resident, nurse, etc. I interacted with was humane, friendly, and kind. Yes, I had to share a room and yes I had to wait in line for a million hours for blood drawing and xrays, but everyone was willing to help and all the assorted "characters" hanging out around the hospital were even nice to me when they saw I couldn't even walk or push the elevator button. Now, hopefully I will heal - only another four months of not walking with steel plates in my foot.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I'm now the proud father of a baby boy! Our experience at SF General was wonderful. We used the Midwives in 5M for our pre-natal visits and gave birth in the Birth Center in 6C. Everyone involved was supportive of our wishes to have a natural child birth, (SF General has the lowest C-Section rate in San Francisco and is the only SF hospital to be awarded "Baby Friendly" by the WHO), which was really nice. As the father, I was welcome at all of our appointments, classes, and certainly the birth itself. Our thanks go out to all of the Midwives, Student Midwives, Nurses, Student Nurses, Doulas, Lactation Specialists, and Pediatricians who helped us at every step!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: This is where "po" people like me go to get their uninsured ailments dealt with. This dinosaur is almost in ruins. It looks like out of an apocalyptic movie as one part of it is literally a giant hole in the ground. The clientele looks like a special episode of "Cops". I had to go to urgent care to get a gross oozing on my ankle looked at. BTW, they only take cash and have no ATM! So you have to go to another building to get money and return to pay before you are seen. You also should go early, not late. I went late, waited 3 hours and was turned away. Next day that I went I found out they have no doctors, just nurses. Hmmm, no doctors in a hospital??? I waited another excruciating 3 hours and was seen. I was misdiagnosed as having a fungal infection and then the nurse left for a bit and looked it up on the Internet. She came back with a printout. Oh, you have Lyme Disease!!! Yes, I was hiking and apparently had a tick bite. How insane was it if she had not looked that up? Fucking Lyme Disease!!! Google that shit. Yikes. To her credit I did get antibiotics and it did heal up and I got some good advice.Separately I had to go there to get an X-ray for a sprained foot. If you use Healthy San Francisco they send you there to get this done. It was better. No wait and a nice nurse helped me. They found no broken bones which was a relief.I give this 3 stars because it is good that it exists and they are trying to improve it. Â BTW-- on the SF Health Plan website it says they clean teeth but they don't.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Since I don't have insurance (I'm unemployed, and my unemployment benefits have run out), I went to the emergency room at "County," as one person called it. I ended up staying 7 hours, and the doctor made an appointment for me in February without telling me or getting my permission. I suspect that it will involve others, since there was a mention of "overbooking." I was told it involved educating people on how to avoid getting kidney stones. I'm already aware of how to do that. I need to get mine removed. Now.The nurse in the emergency room inserted a needle into my vein, telling me that "they" would want to hydrate me. "They" never did. I resent the unnecessary pain. Later, she struggled with the blood pressure monitor, at one point tightening it until I thought I was I was going to "lose it."Even though the doctor knew I had kidney stones, I had to ask for water. As fellow sufferers know, you're supposed to hydrate constantly.Conversely, when I finally had the CT, they wanted me to drink two bottles of barium to "get contrast." I was then given more water to drink. The CT tech's annoyance was obvious when I told her I needed to go to the bathroom (steel yourself for the experience).The report I got told me NOTHING about the stones themselves, i.e., how big they are now and where they're located. Urologists want that information.A doctor thought I should want to "get to know "my urologist. All I want to know, Doctor, is if he or she is competent. I don't want to be "friends." I don't care what that person has for dinner or what they like to do on weekends.Warning: the hospital is pushing a health plan they back. I've called that plan. They told me to hope that Â doctors were taking new patients or that someone who had an appoint ment would cancel it so that I could take their place.I believe that care of the derelicts in this city takes priority with "County." And always will.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I have to give a major shout out to the entire staff at 4M, the eye clinic at SFGH. Â From the people who do the scheduling, the staff at reception and the other support staff, give yourselves a pat on the back. Â I had surgery done on my right eye almost 2 years ago and just before New Years my left eye was repaired. Â For someone like me, who loves to read, the gift of sight is priceless. Â I was operated on this time by a young, petite female, Doctor Maanasa Indaram. Â I was told to return the next day, December 31st for the follow up visit where my bandage would be removed. Â When I got there, all the support staff both at the front desk and in the clinic were off. Â This young doctor was singlehandedly doing follow ups on her patients, some of whom had been on the operating table earlier that same day. Â Talk about dedication and caring for her fellow human beings. If there is a heaven, this lady is going, hopefully after a long and happy life. Â People like her make this world a better place.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: So this place is not exactly UCSF Medical or Pacific Medical, but they get 5 stars since they do save lives. If it's a non emergency, the staff (not doctors) can be slow. Not your regular hospital slow, but your 'I don't care or give a shit' slow with extra a two snaps up in up in a 'z' formation. Â I can never get prescription within the same day and multiple trips are a bitch. The waiting rooms can be very stinky with the multiple homeless dudes...and be prepared to wait for hours, even with an appointment. I always can't wait to get out of there. And each time I leave, I swear that I'll never be back.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I accompanied my bf to the urgent care clinic here and it was a complete nightmare. As everyone here seems to point out, SFGH is the place everyone who doesn't have a pot to piss in or a window to throw it out of ends up. And it shows. We waited for SIX HOURS to be seen (you take a number, a nurse sees you eventually, you get registered and then 500 hours later, a doctor or RN tends to you). Six hours. But at least the RN he saw was competent, friendly and took care of the problem.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I came in here due to extreme stomach/abdominal pain that I have been dealing with for months. I've come in there once before (with no insurance) due to this same pain and got pain medicine to reduce it and all went well, but this time, again with no insurance, came in for the same pain and was denied help. They led me out back to the waiting room and I asked to lay down because the pain went through my side as well and they said "nope". So I moved some chairs around and laid down on the floor while I waited for my friend to pick me up, the nurse I had talked to saw me and said "You can't lay on the ground" so I sat and started puking from the pain over and over again. I was driven to the Concord John Muir Medical Center and had to have emergency surgery to get my appendix removed, which they did the next morning. I would never recommend SF hospital to anyone, as they cannot deny patients without insurance (which I've been told by multiple people) and I've seen another review on this hospital about a patient who didn't have insurance but was treated. Avoid this place if you have an emergency at all cost!!!!!!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I was seen in SFGH's Wound Clinic for a finger infection after going to my primary care Dr and a couple of emergency room visits later. I am extremely happy to be treated with warmth and compassion by the nurses and the doctors in the clinic. They were all so accommodating. I saw Dr. Cambell first and he gave me the option to see the specialist the following day. He kept it real and he even made me laugh a bit. It was clear that they had to lance my finger and I was extremely anxious about the local anesthesia, but Joannie, a nurse held my hand and helped me breath through the process. Dr. Hansen, the specialist is all-pro and I recall him asking me to let him know when I was ready before the procedure. That made all the difference for me. He was the first Dr. to place control in my hands. I continued to go to the clinic for follow-up visits so they could clean and monitor the wound and change my dressing. I am healing nicely and I have new baby skin. Please note, the SFGH Wound Clinic works on a drop-in basis with specific hours and there are days that they are closed. However, I was able to call their number and leave a message. They answered me back right away and I was seen on the same day!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Updated: New bills appearing. We have finally worked out that if you are unfortunate enough to visit SFGH, you will be billed by the Hospital separately from any billing by SFGH Medical Group. Hospital is "facilities". Medical Group is physicians (surgeons and such). In this way the center frustrates and hampers efforts to understand your medical bills and in our case managed to hide an additional $4000 out-of-pocket billing that we're now working hard to recover from them. For the moment, I cannot even find a person to whom SFGH Medical Group reports, as an example of a billing obfuscation tactic.Summary: top medical staff and care, unfortunately brought down by the attitude of Â administrative staff and very grey-area processes that are well designed to take advantage of the "customers". Avoid if at all possible.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: If you get hit, stabbed, shot, or crash, you go to SFGH because it's the only Level 1 trauma center in SF. Even the president would be sent to this ER. The trauma staff is outstanding, they'll give you your best shot at surviving a bad accident.I know there's a lot to criticize. This definitely is not a boutique hotel, it's a county hospital. The ER staff can be tough (they have to be to deal with all the craziness that comes in) but they are dedicated. Yes, the waits can be agonizing, but they have limited staff so sicker people get priority. I know this sucks if you need stitches (as long as you're not bleeding out and you get sewn up in 12 hours after the cut, you'll be fine).SFGH is a shared community resource (like the fire department), so if you have ideas of how the hospital should be better (and it definitely should be better), let our officials know!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: so i finally felt the need to write my first review. funny how i'd write about a hospital instead of a restaurant. oh well. maybe it's because i've just recently moved to san francisco, but this place is something else. i spent the entire day there today for a non-life threatening emergency. it was the most fun i've had on a sunday in a while. i mean, this is no patch adams, it's just pure absurd urban fun. i crawl my way in, and the (two!) cops stationed at the door start cracking jokes about me and my miserable leg. the triage nurse is out of central casting, handsome young man with a constant smirk and a fair bit of hairgel. the priceless ones were my fellow emergencees... wow. i mean, half of them were actually referred to the psych ward before being seen by a doctor. and trust me, with good reason. so it took a while for my treatment to come through, and even though nobody had any idea what was wrong with me, they pumped me up with vicodine and i cheered up. in that regard, they were quite generous with everyone else, too. they were quite understanding when i had to take an hour-long conference call right in the corridor while ortho was trying to straighten my leg. and they spoke softly, too, so all that was coming out on the other hand was some crazy announcements ("puerto rican sue, page me on 12") and the noise of the shackled dudes pacing up and down with a couple of cops each. i did feel a little spooked when i overheard cops chatting about how a cop had gotten hurt and specifically asked to be taken elsewhere, and they said "with good reason". but hey, i had an amazing time, they were kind and accommodating as hell, and the cast of characters was priceless. my reading the new yorker made me stick out like a sore leg, but at least with all the time there i got to finish it for the first time in weeks. top notch for fun. don't go there if there are ten gunshot wound in front of you, as there often are. PS: the cop's description of this as "the final trauma center west of the mississippi" in itself was worth the day there.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I highly recommend SFGH...especially if you feel you are limited financially from receiving top care, or if you need to know where to go in an emergency. Â I recommend it to everyone, but as we all know, private care is faster, so if you have the means to choose that option, more power to you. Â Yes, you will have to wait several hours if you are not an emergency case, and yes, there will most likely be crazy people and homeless people in there with you. Â Welcome to San Francisco, and to the world of healthcare in a big city. Â But it is hands-down the best healthcare you will receive, along with UCSF, and General is sure to have paperwork on hand to scale the costs to fit your income if you are balancing on the poverty line. Â If you are a working resident who cannot afford insurance, look into the Healthy San Francisco program, where you can name General as your primary hospital and receive free or low cost assistance.The staff at SFGH are attentive, empathetic, and very skilled at what they do. Â The surroundings are the best possible given the circumstances. Â You can trust these guys, they are phenomenal. Â Their T-shirt says "as real as it gets", and they live up to that. Â I've been helped there myself three separate times, and visited many friends and family members in various stages of illness there for nearly two decades. Â Absolutely five stars, always. Â Many thanks to all who help keep it going.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: My dad's an elderly man and not a 5 year old, but the social worker Melanie Bien talked to him like one and was over familiar and talked about herself. We were helped by social worker Anna who was great and heard what happened and helped us out later. She said we should call the supervisor who was even worse. The supervisor said she took this seriously, then put us on hold and hung up. The San Francisco GH nurses were top notch and some recognize my dad which helped alot since he's there regularly. Thanks for the coffee too. I know its a tough job.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I was bombing down this hill right by leadership high school on my skateboard when I got the speed wobbles and hit a crack and stepped off my skate. Â It seemed to be no big deal...until I woke up in the ambulance. Â  Â That was no good. Â Luckily, they ambulance driver took me to SF Gen. Â They have the best trauma ward in all of CA, and probably in the US. Â All the nurses there, Yseniya, Angela, Rebecca, Armando, Leo, Carlota, Dimitry, Cristina, were all super nice and accommodating. Â Angela even gave me a tasteful sponge bath! Â It was great! Â Everyone in the trauma ward was super nice even waking me up every hour to make sure I wasn't in a coma. Â From now on, I'll be doing most of my activities with a helmet, so I don't get brain damaged, but I owe my well-being to them.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: While visiting the city, my husband had a heart attack & was brought here, & I can't say enough positive things about the care & attention we received - from the top-of-their-field cardiac surgeons to the various nurses in ICU. I was bit surprised after all the "horror" stories & derogatory commentary I'd heard about this place, & I speak from experience, having spent a good deal of time at other well-known General Hospital in the city for another unrelated family crisis. That said, here's to all the icu-cardiac care professionals at general.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: this review is strictly for the emergency room. Â i cannot speak to the quality or lack thereof of the General Hospital other facilities. Â but i did hear something about psych ward patients being released into the wilds of san francisco this past fall and that might explain the clientele at Molotov. Â Oh, snap! so when a guy you happen to think is pretty fantastic gets his face bitten off by some strange dog (a stray. Â NOT A ROCKET DOG! Â i think the dog was a golden retriever...those dogs are NUTS!), this is the place to be. Â the triage ran smoothly and patients seemed to move through with relative speed. Â speaking of speed, nowhere is it more apparent that this is SF's drug of choice. Â which might explain the nurse's having to beg people not to piss on the floor. Â le sigh. minus one star because they refused to help the gentleman with a lump on his nutsack. Â the ER workers kept referring him to a hospital in another city but he insisted he could not get there until monday by which time, "my nuts will have fallen off". Â i only know this because the man was pretty much yelling about his nutsack and the lump on it to the entire waiting room for about 10 minutes. Â at one point, he turned around to address the waiting room with, "these bitches ain't gonna help me and i've got a lump between my groin and my anus on my nutsack! Â man, fuck this!" Â if guinness gave a record for how many times a human being could say the word, "nutsack" in five minutes well then ladies and gentlemen, we have a winner. Â despite his kookiness and the fact that the lump was moving locations on his body (from nutsack to between groin and anus to mid thigh to foot okay joking about the last two), I did feel bad for the man and kinda hoped they would give him some medication. Â I mean, it's now tuesday...does he still have his nutsack? Â I worry. I bet the ER is popping off tonight as it is 4th of july (trash holiday of choice) and every moron in town is setting off bottle rockets, snakes, squiggles, exploding turtles, etc., including this bitch next door who keeps yelling, "woooOOOoooOOO!" Â in fact, if a firecracker doesn't take her out, i think i will. Â i have fantasies of heading next door with a shovel and right before i knock the bitch out, i will yell, "woooOOOOooooOOO!" Â it would be sweet street justice.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I haven't been to SF General as a patient but being a Healthy SF patient, I've had to visit their pharmacy on a number of occasions. I won't be going back if I can help it because I'm seriously afraid that one day an angry, fed-up customer is going to open fire on everything that moves in that place. This so-called pharmacy has the absolute worst staff, front and back. First you have to stand in line for ages to declare that you've arrived to pick up your meds, which might or might not be ready no matter how many days ago you called it in. If you're lucky and they're ready, you are then sent to another line to pay. You wait some more while the cashier picks and pokes around and then gives you a receipt so that you can get back in the original line and wait some more for your meds. One evening when I was there, the pharmacy tech started to hand me my meds, only to withdraw his hand from the window when I reached for them. Then, I kid you not, he turned to his co-worker and began a discussion about where he and his wife should go on vacation. I leaned over sideways to catch his eye and he gave me a dirty look. I also saw them turning away a diabetic because his medication "wasn't ready." When the man protested that he'd been coming in for three days in a row and hadn't had his medicine for two days already, they ignored him. After all, if he goes into a diabetic coma, it's the ICU or the morgue for him, not their department. In other words, lives and health are being jeopardized by these hateful people. And it goes without saying that many of them don't wear name badges or else wear them so the names don't show. That place needs to be cleaned out entirely and restaffed with people who give a rat's ass about what they're doing. The people who work there now deserve to be in jail for criminal negligence. You cannot run a pharmacy as if it were a fourth-rate bar and grill.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I think the only thing I really wanted to point out was the fact that I was misled through my phone call.. I got into a car accident a few weeks ago and I stopped by the SFGH the day after and before that, I made a phone call to make sure I knew where to go. Â I asked if I were suppose to go to the Adult Urgent Care and they told me to go to the Emergency Room instead so that's what I did.. Then I waited almost half an hour just to go in and have them tell me to go to Adult Urgent Care. Â I mean, not only was it rainy and windy that day and THOUGH the walk is not far, it's just a hassle to have to bust my ass there in the rain. Â Wait was long but what hospital wait isn't long, right? The nurses were really nice as well as the doctor so I can't complain but it's just the misleading phone call that blew me off, really.. Parking is easy to find as well because they have a parking lot too or just street/residential.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Hi! Â I am a start up entrepreneur and was in great shock after getting glass in my foot after jumping barefoot off a dock. Â I was suggested to go to SFGH and thank God I did. Â They were so professional, got the glass out and even gave me bandaid material for the recovery. Â What is most valuable is their friendly attitude and the competence of their staff.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I can't say how dissapointed I was when I stumbled into this ER after a drunken bar fight with my brother. We were chillin at Thee Parkside (potrero hill) when my bro hit me "accidently" over the head with his cocktail and needless to say I was livid! I threw him over a table and he kicked my feet out from under me and I hit my head on the floor. Lots of blood and gin.. As his apology to me he took me to the ER at General and left me to fend for myself. The intake nurse looked like she had been up for 48 hrs and was ready to flop over herself. I almost forgot about my bleeding head to worry about her for a minute. This place is a homeless encampment and just because I didn't look homeless and was asking to be hurried trough( the bars close at 2) I didn't get helped for over 7hours. Lets just say enough time to be completely sober and beginning to get hungover. They would have left me for dead if it were up to them. I thank god I had my trusty golden flask on my hip to help me through this horrible experience.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I went to Urgent Care because my knee was unstable. I was having extreme pain just walking and my knee would give out. The very rude ass doctor Aldo Gomez in urgent care kept on lecturing me saying I should not be there. He repeated it OVER & OVER. He also misdiagnosed me saying I'm fine. I ended up having surgery because I went back to see another doctor who correctly referred me to the orthopedics. Two stars because of the low cost. Otherwise zero stars.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: ok, i am sure they dont give a shit. and i get its a public hospital. i am glad we have one, so those of us minus insurance have somewhere to go. but i have had 3 horrifically bad experiences in here. one. i was retarded ass sick, had a rash and yada yada...it was pretty rough. go in. wait 8 hours to be seen. no one checks in. when you ask they are mean. everyone who is coming in after me is getting in...so i ask again. i am in really bad pain and it is 20 times more painful to sit. yet all i can do is sit for 8 hrs while passed out drunks and crackheads gets bed. nice. finally get in after they lost my file, forgot about me, said i had a room...then didnt and sent me back....i get seen. and i tell them my med history with about 3 interuptions and barely listening. someone else comes in and takes over, i have to tell the entire thing over. i tell them i think it is sickness x. (u all dont need to know my med biz) they tell me no, its sickness y. i say are you sure and ask for full bloodwork. no. they send me off with a prescription.two. i come back bc guess what, it got worse and more clearly has become sickness x. i wait 5 hours. ruder than the first time. i have a drunk crazy guy groping me in the waiting room. when i tell him to lay off he freaks out, spits on me and starts screaming. do the 3 cops right there come over, nope. they are talking. i get in and tell them about my last visit and that i am so sick now its ridculous. i say its sickness x i think and ask for tests to confirm. they do it. say no, its sickness z. more drugs. send me home. three.i am feeling like death. for real. worse than i ever felt in my life. i miss 4 days of work. go back in. wait about 7 hours. i am crying bc it is so hard to sit down. so i lay on the floor bc its that bad, a cop yells at me and treats me like a crackhead drunk. who is about 80percent of the people around me. nice. i get in there and tell them this is sickness x and they have told me its sickness y, z, etc. ask about my tests. they are botched. no communication. no calls. they just fucked up on visit 2 and oh well. i get my tests and some more tests and some more tests. guess what, its sickness x. apparently i can go on web md and diagnose myself better than doctors. they dont seem to care and i get the correct prescription and go home.here is the best part.next day i get my insurance card, i go to davies.they are nice. i am seen in 45 minutes. and i have sickness x. and i am so sick bc of it and my existing medical issues, that i get an infection that ALMOST KILLS ME. if i didnt go into the hospital and get treated properly, i could have died. my immune system is trashed. i miss like 2 weeks of work and pay.here is what kills me...not only did i say what i knew pretty much was wrong. but i was nice and patient and not a drunk crackhead. i had my medical history. i was thorough with them. i asked questions. i was treated like a piece of shit. no one was nice to me all 3 visits except one lady who worked registration. this is the saddest excuse i have ever seen for a hospital. i was actually even referred to as "that one" and not a name. or she. or this patient. they didnt even look me in the eye. i am sad that health care is this bad. i am sad people are this rude and care so little they cant treat you with respect. i am sad the people that work here dont listen to patients. i know my body. i am sad they screwed up all my labwork. i have been told to sue by a half dozen people, but that would take away shitty health care for someone else who needs a misdiagnosis. rather than spending hundreds of thousands tree lining divisadero or getting new traffic signs or talking muni shelters...can we get a decent hospital for folks without insurance. instead of looking at the internet before i leave, i can press a button that tells me when the next bus is....but i cant get a proper blood test and get better at general? seriously.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I would never choose to go to General Hospital and would never want anyone to have the experience I had there, but given that it sort of saved my life one night this past year, I'll say that yes, "I'm a fan."
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I'm writing this review on behalf of my mother-in-law who had to be admitted to SF General's ED for a broken wrist. Â The waiting room is sketchy to be sure, and I give no stars for the fact that staff don't keep this place clean. Â The floor is sticky, there was a bag of who knows what lying on the ground that no one removed, and the smell is pretty foul. Â I give three stars for the clinical staff though, who took good care of my mother-in-law after she was taken back to an exam room. Â We are particularly thankful for the care from nurse Joe Fox. Â He provided excellent care that exceeded her expectations. Â  Despite all of the other emergencies going on in the back, Joe still went to her exam room regularly to check on her and took the time to answer her questions honestly and professionally. Â I know that's all part of his job, but I know some nurses who wouldn't even do that much in a stressful environment so kudos to Joe!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Wow, the billing department here is just swell. As are the doctors who overmedicated me and then left, I woke up in the street. At five K a night, I think I'll choose elsewhere next time.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: if you are dieing go to another hospital this place totally sucks and they have a cop station in the building so after you get treated you can get thrown in the tank or get thrown in while waiting for a friends update
