Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: horrible, beyond horrible. i've came here many times because my health insurance covers it and cus it's my local emergency hospital. i hate it and i had many bad experience here. the last time i was here was because i was involved with auto accident. emergency was outrageously long. i was so scared and i had to wait. nurses and doctors checked on me, but they come back again after an hour and ask me the same shit. they don't remember who you are and they just don't care. this place is a mess. i waited so long, just to get a damn x-ray and guess what? it came out wrong and the guy that was helping me with the x-ray had to do it over and over again. thx a lot inexperience asshole! then the result came out bad, of course, so they told me to wait. i was in hella pain! then i waited so long, i was crying and feeling antsy the whole damn time because i couldn't even use the restroom and annoyed by their doctors and nurses. one of the doctor told me to stay for the ct scan (i was so scared!) then the wait is incredibly crazy, so much people in there at night. i was crying so much and they finally took me in. took the ct scan and the guy said it came out wrong, wtfuck. they had to ct scan again. i was so mad and yet bursting out in tears. the result was my neck bone has been rotated/shifted. the guy said he was not sure, blah blah. wtfuck. the doctors told me to do the mri scan after, i was like, hell naw, are you kidding? so much radiation in my body already and my bill is gona be pricey. the doctor try to say i will be paralyze if i don't see a doctor asap! i was so disappointed to the point i wanted to slap all of them lying asses. i packed my shit and left. then a few weeks later, they sent me the bill. they charged me for some shit, i didn't even get. riped! this place is so dirty and the emergency room sucks!
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: What Makes a Five Star Plus for my experience, I am not a patient of the hospital but a friend of mine is, he has insurance, he chose this hospital for a reason. Five Stars are usually associated with the "hospital-ity" Â business. Â They got it right, the ICU team and pretty much everyone I have encountered so far have been very hospitable. Â I cannot say enough of the genuinely nice and caring people that work there. Â I won't Â name names because I'm not sure you can but if San Francisco General Hospital employees read this. Â Thank You. Thank You again ICU. This is the first review I've ever written, because I really have never been so compelled to write one.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Fuck medicare. Fuck medicare. One more time, Fuck you medicare. It's because I "outgrew" the medicare system that I was forced to find some health insurance. Me being a student who couldn't afford to pay Blue Crosses' bullshit prices had to be on San Francisco Health Plan, which they make it a point to remind you is NOT health insurance. Now if I want my medication, I have to stand in one line that may take two hours just to give them my prescription paper and another line that takes uber long to pick the medication up. And even in the pick-up line, it's not certain that you will be able to pick your medicine up, often the "pharmacists" go through the bureaucratic bullshit, and you have to lobby and fight to get your medicine. It's garbage. SF General hospital, to my knowledge has never been worth the upkeep. But many like myself depend on fucking medicine (Advair for my bullshit asthma) just so I could breathe normally. I'm going to have to wait many years until I get my Masters, then find a job whereby I'd be able to afford health care and get out of this assembly line from hell. Fuck the health care system in America. You people could afford trillion dollar wars, but don't you dare make the health care system easier or more efficient Â for Americans. We don't want a big government, we want an irrational one. No wonder China is giving this country a colonoscopy. Bend over Uncle Sam, and enjoy your eggroll.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I owe this place my life and gratitude. After losing control of my car I smashed into a light pole cracking my head open. I've never seen so much blood before especially coming from myself. After laying on the ground for 5mins nearly bleeding to death a ambulance arrived. They strap me down and was about to bring me to a private hospital. Luckly I was still awake and realized I didn't have insuranced so yelled out general hospital. Well after being treated in surgery and many pain killers I recovered with a nasty scar on the top of my head. The nice people at general hospital realized I didn't have money and told me what to do to have my 20g bill reduced. In the end, my huge bill ended up to being 10dollars. These people get put through terrible things from scum of society to poor college students like me and still manage to smile. That's why whenever I drive by this place I thank God there is a place like this and people who truly care.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: ER staff rocks! Miriam or is it Margaret and Â all of the nurses and doctors were amazing. i unfortunately spent 15 hours in the ER overnight and was losing my mind from exhaustion but the staff was super helpful and super amazing. Impressed with their gentleness and kindness. Dr Borei and Chapman and another i was too exhausted to remember name of,.. I had a great experience in radiology, too two days later with super cool women who did my ultrasound. They wrote numbers and notes for me of which i lost because i got to the hospital at 3am with no sleep and proceeded to not sleep for another 15. i was a wreck.Day services at women's clinic there arent the best, i waited 2.5 after being there 6 prior hours and then just left because i dont have that much time in a day to waste after just being there for 12. They told me i needed to be seen right away as a procedure needed to be done but apparently Â not!I would give 5 stars esp for ER nurses and docs and those that came down from OBGYN to see me but four is because of the ridiculous wait at womens center only to keep me waiting in futility. I was told something different by EVERY doctor though and i did see four separate doctors during that ER visit.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: One of the nation's finest public General Hospital.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: I came here to see a baby that was born yesterday. I mainly didn't like this place because they have san francisco sheriffs being security guards here. The people working here are also kind of rude when asking for directions in the hospital. Upside there was free wifi
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: Honestly twice thats 2 times if i had not been taken to S,F,General Hosp i would not be here writeing this.Gonna give it to u all as brief as i can.1977 car accident on Bayshore Ave and Cortland.Made a left turn frm cortland on to bayshore and fell out of the car.Hit a curb?parked car?i remember nothing from the time we were makeing that left turn.Awoke 3 1/2 months later from a colma.Second time thats 2nd time i believed S,F, GENERAL.HOSP saved my life and yes i could have went to any other HOSPITAL but after that frist time who would want to if u know what i mean.OK sorry getting back to second hospital surgery i have been there other times for different reasons due to the last surgery.Was sick stomach pain didnt really know what it was went to several outside Doctors no one could help.Went to S,F, GENERAL HOSP emergency and found out i had diverticulos ?spelling i did have a piece of my colon removed there with the knowledge of my primary Doctor shes at St Lukes Hosp.And the next thing i will say its not about me but a close friend.She was haveing headaches just not feeling well but didnt know way as most of us do she had no insurance after months of going here there everywhere with no help i told her th go to S,F,GENERAL HOSP she finally did the frist visit she found out she had the size of a orange tumor in the back of her head she was taken care of Â but sadly and she did live 1 year more than they gave her God Bless you FRANCINE. YES its a HOSPITAL that u might wait u will see people of all kinds dressed up dressed down IT IS THE BEST HOSPITAL in SAN FRANCISCO
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: My 3-year old daughter took a bad fall while we were watching the Chinese New Year Parade. Â The ER staff took great care of her - they rushed her right in, were very kind and gentle to her and they quickly made her feel very comfortable as they did their evaluations. Â Fortunately, it wasn't anything too serious, but the initial doctors on call were great with her as were the pediatricians that they called in to have a second look. Â They all made what could have been a very scary and confusing experience into something that felt reasonable and effective. Â The waiting room outside the ER's a little scary and there was a brief lockdown while we were there - fortunately, they have a guard there but waiting in the ER with a 3 year old at 11pm while my husband went to fetch our car at Millbrae BART was probably my least favorite part of the whole night. Â It was nearly impossible for my husband to catch a cab where the staff told him to wait, so he ended up taking a bus with our 5-year old to BART to our car in Millbrae. Â So I guess I'd say the care inside was good, but once I was outside I felt like I was pretty much on my own and not very safe.
Hospital Name: Zuckerberg San Francisco General Trauma and Hospital

Reviews: The world needs more Adam's. The staff here was welcoming, kind, and funny. I've honestly never had a better experience in any other medical setting.

So unprofessional! I went in for a chest X Ray yesterday, was told that I will receive my results the next day. Today I called SO many times, and no one answered the phone, they straight declined all my calls, how am I suppose to get my results when they never told me anything. IF they told me to come in and grab it, that wouldn't be an issue. THEY NEVER TOLD ME ANYTHING. They just took my money and NEVER said anything about how to pick up my results. So I was suppose to call right??? PICK UP YOUR PHONE.Update: so someone can reply back to my Yelp review but can't give me a call back?? Tried calling again multiple times, no answer. AGAIN, just pick up the phone!!!

The worst and most disorganized place I've ever been to. They were extremely short staffed when I went and were complaining out loud in front of the people in lobby about how they don't want to be there. Then was told the labs would be ready within 2 days... its been 7 days and they neither answer the phone nor any messages sent on portal and the labs are yet to be shared. To cap it all off, they just tell you to go to your primary care doc. Save your self the trouble and find some other place.Update: Got ahold of them on phone this AM - they never ordered the labs and just gave me meds. Even worse - The reason provided was "we were very busy that day and you need to manage your expectations about us". Wow and just wow at the horrid attitude of this place and people. Just Avoid.

The service in person was great. Then they call me with lab results, give me a bum phone number, and I have NO WAY to get the results. I never got invited to the patient portal... am I going to have to drive back over there to find out? TERRIBLY UNPROFESSIONAL to have a full voicemail. Major red flag in a medical establishment. Especially one that wasn't busy at all. Answer the phone! Even their tech support for the patient portal has no way to contact them.
Elite 2021

Update- made a payment directly to them on March 22nd after speaking with collections for the missed co-payment, today is April 2nd and collections is still calling me. I had to call collections myself and show proof of payment because Dignity doesn't have the competence to do their job. Again, save yourself the headache and stay away from this poorly run place.

I just moved to the SF Bay Area and am in the process of finding a PCP.I had several Â symptoms of a bad cold/flu.and decided to have it checked out. Â Since I do not have a PCP yet, i went to GG Urgent Care very pleasantly surprised from the moment i entered, to the moment I left.Dr, David Rossi was very friendly, and took the time to assess my problem,'He was extremely professional and explained the tests he would be performing to make a correct diagnosis.I can't say enough about Dr Rossi---a vary caring and professional physician! :) i highly recommend him!
Elite 2021

I've had good experiences with Dignity Urgent care, so this is just an isolated incident. I went to the West Portal location for an exam on Monday, 8/9, nothing related to COVID. The folks there who helped me were attentive. My issue is that the PA who examined me was wearing a neck gaiter rather than a mask. That didn't seem appropriate. I think that it's been known for a while that neck gaiters don't provide the same level of protection of others as a mask does, and a study just released to media yesterday said that gaiters can actually be more problematic than not wearing a mask at all. I was in the small exam room within six feet of the provider for at least ten minutes, and then another five minutes after he returned from researching a question for me. Because the PA is a front-line worker, I realize he has a higher risk of being infected, and I am now concerned about possible exposure. I was wearing a mask, but it's unclear how much protection masks provide the wearer.I tried to reach the clinic or Dignity-GoHealth to find out what their policy is on neck gaiters and employee face coverings in general, and how often their clinicians are tested, but it's not possible to the clinic of Dignity's SF headquarters by phone. I understand this is a busy time for clinics, but it also seems like there should be some way to reach them to report this and make sure the PA wears a medical-grade mask from now on. Hopefully all is fine, but if a provider gets infected and is wearing a gaiter rather than a mask, they could infect people coming into the clinic. I have no problem with the medical service I got yesterday, but I do have a problem with a clinician not wearing a real mask and with not having any means of reporting this.
Awful!!!! The staffs not sanitizes their hands before or after touch my ID and insurance card and the doctor didn't use the gloves to exam the patient.
I emailed them as they requested on Yelp to follow up but no one has spoken to me about what happened
This was a positive fast experience! The staff where friendly and attentive. I definitely use again or recommend them to a friend!
Elite 2021

There was only a nurse practitioner in a white coat on site the day I went. No MD or PA. The woman was in way over her head running that place. She asked me questions that she (by her own admission) already had the answer to. She couldn't help me or give me any guidance other than to see a doctor, which is why I had gone there in the first place.

They missed a diagnosis and I ended up in ER needing emergency surgery otherwise I would have died. I went in with abdominal pain. When the male nurse ask me how bad my pain was I said an 8 to 9. He said if I was really in that much pain I should be curled up on the floor. When I said does it help that I had to cry myself to sleep, he then said fine I'll give you the 8. I was seen by a physician assistant and she told me I was constipated and to go home and take some laxatives. In reality I was having an acute episode of diverticulitis. Taking the laxatives they prescribed caused my colon to rupture and I became septic. If my symptoms had been diagnosed correctly I should have been given a prescription for antibiotics and told to go on a clear liquid diet until symptoms subsided.I spent 10 days in the hospital and have to have another surgery because of being misdiagnosed.There auto reply if we take this matter seriously please email us so we can investigate is a farce. I did as instructed have yet to get any acknowledgment from my email.
I was seen quickly and the staff was great. Â I received the care that I needed and felt that I was in good hands!
Elite 2021

This place is the worst. I've been twice now only because my normal doctor is so busy, and had the same provider, Grace. Even with appointments I've waited over an hour and a half. Grace is rushed, really unfriendly, and is argumentative over even the basic things. During a very short interaction both occasions, she confused pertinent information I provided. I've walked away with no resolution either time and having to follow up with my primary doctor anyways. Don't go, use PlushCare if you need urgent care for something simple.

Unbelievable. This clinic has a lack of empathy, I would suggest against it. I've never felt so disrespected in a clinician office.Everything started off great. Making an appointment online was easy. I checked in a little before my appointment time. Check in process was easy. I got roomed 10 minutes after checking in and vitals were taken. I was told the physician was with the person a head of me and that she was being a "few minutes". Well, a "few minutes" turned nearly to two hours !!! After almost two hours of waiting in the room to be seen by the physician on duty, I decided to walk out and leave. On my way out, the staff were just hanging out in the front, chatting it up. Not once in those two hours did someone come in to check in on me. I had to leave the room twice, in fact, to add money to my meter (a total of 3 hrs of parking is what I ended up paying for).At one point I walked out of the room to see if they had forgotten about me. I bumped into the clinician who looked like she was charting. She did say she would be with me as soon as she was done as I was next and she just had finished with the previous patient before me. But she never came. Evidentially, she skipped me and went in with another patient !!!Hey, big news flash, my time is just as valuable as yours ! The least you could do is treat a patient with a bit more respect and empathy. I have a legitimate reason as to why I came in. I will NEVER try one of your urgent cares ever again. Carbon Health is so much more efficient than you guys with a lot more compassion and empathy for patients. When I left, no one even apologized as I told the three medical assistants that I am just going to go (as were hanging out). I just made sure I wasn't going to be charged for today which the one behind the computer said she'd take care of that.UC & Dignity Health Care affiliates? Horrible way to represent them West Portal!

Front desk person was rude and apparently Â hated her job. They told me over the phone it was $130 for a vaccine. Â I came told them I was paying out of pocket Â and paid in full $130 before the service. Then a week later I got notified Â they charged my credit Â card for another $ 231. I already Â paid in full and they kept charging Â me! It was literally Â a five minute Â in and out visit they told me its exactly Â 60$ for the administration of the vaccine Â and $70 for the shot. Thats it. Total $130. And they certainly Â didn't Â do anything else in the 5 minutes I spent there. Whats worse is that the exact Â same thing happened Â to me last year at the branch in the castro. I paid in full and they started Â charging Â me a week or so later according Â to a "payment plan". I never made any payment plan, I paid in full!!! Do not go here unless you find it acceptable to pay hundreds Â of dollars Â extra for services you already Â paid for. Its happened Â to me 2/2 times so I believe Â its just how they do business. Â Disgraceful
Elite 2021

Great clinic. They went out of their way, like called other doctors at other branches to take care of a prescription that they could have easily blown off and said "I'm sorry we can't help" Everyone here truly cares. And as far as walk in clinics go, their service was faster than most places I've had appointments. 5/5 would recommend to a friend.

Response to Kurt K: No one (i.e., the nurse practitioner that saw me) advised me of your "policy" not to call with a negative result. FYI. Also, you need to take into consideration that a patient portal isn't accessible to all. I found your portal very complex and difficult to use. I work in healthcare. Thanks!----------------------------------------Went here in May 2017. Wait time is very long even with an appointment; staff seem overwhelmed with case load and work. I never received a call back about my test results, and I had to keep calling to figure out what was going on. I would probably never be back.

We made our first visit on July 30th to the West Portal branch. The online reservation was easy and the check-in process went okay.We met a NP for bone fracture possibility, and took a x-ray. The clinician and NP made it clear that the radiologist would review photos and provide the final diagnosis on the following date. At the check-out, they Â didn't provide us the receipt for our payment because additional charge might cause in a couple of days according to them.  We haven't heard anything from the team after 3 business days, I had to call them to follow up. The receptionist who picked up call was extremely unfriendly and very bossy. No customer service was made at all. It was urgent for us to find whether the injury is a bone fracture or sprains before seeing a referred doctor. It was such a waste time without knowing the x-ray result. I asked a receptionist how long it takes to get a final confirmation from a doctor and she was very rude saying "you guys just need to wait" So the promise that the NP and clinician made was definitely fell off, and it sounded like an unprofessional and disrespectful receptionist at West Portal branch made comments whatever she wanted to say. Please don't go there. Your money should be worth to get a better service!

I went in to get with my 3 year old to get checked out after a car accident during weekend on June 2019. Â We were able to quickly see a doctor and the care we received was good. Â  I paid the deductible and I thought that was the end of it. Â However, we got another bill 2 months later, Â then a larger bill 4 months later. Â I thought that was it, Â but I received another bill for $35.00 in June 2020-- nearly 12 months after the accident. Â  It's quite annoying not to receive the entire bill at once, Â and it's even more annoying when you have to call AAA to have them send you another check.

The name has changed but the care remains excellent. It's now Dignity Health Urgent Care. Simple on-line appointment, fast check-in, nice clean facility, I'm impressed. They keep things rolling but in a caring way. I met with Dr. Martin, she listened intently, ran the verification tests, and saw to it that I understood what she found. The staff made sure that my prescriptions were properly filled and I was on the way.

I've had consistently good experiences with this office of Golden Gate Urgent Care. Â The staff is customer service oriented and they've addressed my medical issues each time in a caring way. Â I use the appointment system to avoid long waits and they have been "on time" on all but one occasion where there was a bit of a wait but it was not unreasonable. Â Most importantly, the lab results come in a time efficient manner and you can call them to get the results without having to go through some endless voice mail loop. Â Very helpful!!One suggestion on the appointment system is that it only opens up at midnight of the day that you're trying to go. Â It would be an improvement if they open it up right after closing time so if you want a particular time you don't have to stay up until midnight or wait until you get up in the morning to schedule your appointment. Â It's a minor fix but since they read these, please think about that.

Service at the office is prompt and great.I came in on Dec 15 2015.Reason why I knocked off 2 stars:I was charged $85. IF I had not checked my insurance claim receipt, I would NOT have known that customer responsibility was only $50. They never called me about that.I had to call them and asked for the refund. They said they will send it to me.2 yrs later...still nothing. Called them again on November 2017. They said they will send it and it will take 14 business days. A few months later..nothing.Here we are...January 2018. I called them again. At first they denied that I called in 2017 and someone told me they will send me th e check. What an attitude. Finally they gave me my refund immediately back to my credit card that same day. She said "sorry for the long wait." Yeah, no kidding! 2 yrs for a refund!I know it's ridiculous but I wasn't gonna let an urgent care rob me of my $35! Of all places, it's an urgent care, not Chinese restaurant, so get your **** together and give patients back their money!

I had a bad experience here. 1. My appointment was lost. They could see that there had been a mistake on their end but they were not very proactive in addressing it.I had to wait two hours.2. Condition was misdiagnosed.3. Prescription not called in.4. Provider never identified their credentials.5. I wrote a letter to the manager detailing all. Â He had the provider call me and thank me for letting him know he misdiagnosed. However, no follow up from the manager to me directly. I asked for a refund. No word. Radio silence. They say they are a UCSF affiliate and thus I called UCSF to alert them and ask for help in addressing. UCSF has no jurisdiction.

I have a collection bill for $15 with no way of contacting that org, there is no working phone number. I have paid all my bills, with copies of receipts to prove it. The entity listed on the bill is Golden Gate Urgent Care. I really don't care who acquired who - I am a customer with a bill referencing Golden Gate Urgent Care, and I get no assistance from this organization. If during the buy out there were financial mistakes made, whose responsibility is that?
Great guys. Â Great care. Very short wait. Â Very attentive nurses from professional and personal standpoint. Special thanks to Ken and Lindsay. Bravo!

Ok, I deleted out of kindness my previous review where the billing department could not sort out for 6 months. Â Multiple phone calls, promises to escalate etc. Now - new issue - they sent to collection a bill for $15 ! that they have been #1 paid for already, #2 couldn't provide proper paperwork #3 I've been on hold with a customer service rep for 15+ minutes just to try to sort this out. Ridiculous. People, it's about the WHOLE service, if your admin staff sucks, you should fix it.

Steven Zhong was absolutely atrocious in his refusal to treat me. Â I went in because I was having trouble sleeping, had a terrible headache, and was having a difficult time focusing at work. Â I told these symptoms to the frontline staff (who were caring and friendly) as well as some recent meds I had been taking and they assured me they would help. Â Steven Zhong PA came in and did very little to try and understand the source of my issues. Â But instead acted as if I had some contagious virus since he entered the room with a mask and surgical cap. Â He said he couldn't do anything for me and wanted to call me a paramedic as well as the police. Â He acted as if I was mentally insane. Â My wife and I figured out on our own that I was experiencing side effects from some steroids I was taking to treat poison ivy. Â Seems pretty simple that all he had to do was check the meds I was on and possible side effects but maybe he has been watching too much of "The Walking Dead". Â Super unprofessional and downright uncaring, 2 things that make a bad healthcare provider. Â He should either learn some bedside manner or find another occupation.

Waste of time. Â I called ahead to see if they could treat my condition. Â They said yes. Â However, upon arrival, without even examining me, they said they could not treat me and would need to refer me to a specialist.Incredibly rude and disrespectful to waste my time during me here by claiming ability to perform a service that they could not actually provide.

Yesterday was the very first time for me to come to Golden Gate Urgent Care and I had a great experience! It was actually the best experience I ever had at an Urgent Care clinic!1) Very easy to schedule an appointment --- I called in the morning to set up a same day appointment. They asked what time I would be available to come and I told them after work around 6:15 pm, and they right away set me an appointment for 6:30 pm.2) The wait time was minimal --- I got there around 6:15 pm. I had to fill out the registration form because this was my first visit. It took them about 5 minutes to enter my information to the system and (not more than) 5 minutes later they called my name!3) Great location --- It's very easy to get there. It's only 5 minutes away (walking) from West Portal Station.4) Very clean and neat --- The clinic looks new! They have a very comfortable waiting room. Also, if you bring your kids, there's a "kids section" in the corner. They provide two tablets/iPads on a small kids table (and chairs) in the waiting room.5) Hours --- One thing that I like the most is ... I don't have to leave early from work (or come late to work) because they open 15 hours a day! On the weekdays, they open from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm! Also, It's great that even on Saturday and Sunday, they open from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm!6) Staff, Nurse, Doctor --- They are all friendly and very knowledgeable! Dr. William was a very nice doctor. He was very patient and he took his time to answer all my questions/concerns.Overall, I'm very satisfied and I know I will come back here again if I need to.Thank you, Golden Gate Urgent Care! You guys are awesome!

The beginning was nice, waited about 15 min walking in. I was placed in a room to check vitals from a nurse, and I've been in here for over an hour, still waiting... debating if i should take a nap... its a Monday and its currently 11:26, came in around 10... I've never waited like this at an urgent care, perhaps in an ER room. Beginning to think they forgot I'm here... I have a sprained lower back so I'm just resting on the bed, had to ask my sis to extend the parking meter time...
Elite 2021

Made an appointment at the West Portal Office and waited for 20 mins beyond appointment time to even be admitted to the exam room. Then say another 30 minutes waiting to be seen by a Dr. When I complained (politely) nursing staff was very dismissive. Don't recommend going to WP office...not well managed.

I had walked past Golden Gate Urgent Care on West Portal many times on my way home from work, so when I took a spill in the bathroom and split my chin open, I headed over right as they opened. Â I was quickly checked in and taken care of, and Sarah stitched me up painlessly. Â A week later I was back in to have the stitches removed, and Emily was very helpful in returning me to my original sutureless state.I'm so glad to know that quality care exists in my neighborhood, and while I don't necessarily hope to be in a state where I will require their services again, I will absolutely go back if I again find myself in need.

Apparently this entire Dignity Health Urgent Care business is set up to deceive. We went in for a $20 TB test, which we paid on the spot. Then we received a $250 bill a few weeks later, and it has been really difficult to get them to respond. I'm still battling with them over this completely erroneous charge. It's false advertising, lame service, and really annoying. Stay away.

I just walked to Golden Gate Urgent Care at 2395 Lombard St San Francisco, CA 94123. Â The lady at the front desk was so rude to me. She did not ask me, may I help you or any of the please words. Â She was chewing gum during the office hour. The person who are come in to urgent it's sick already. And The front desk lady was so unprofessional to assist to the patient.
The entire staff was so friendly and helpful!!I was in and out so quickly!I highly recommend this urgent care to ANYONE needing help

I needed to see a doctor on a Sunday evening. I was able to get an appointment within the hour at GG Urgent Care and parking was not a problem. In the office, everyone I interacted with was incredibly helpful and warm and human. Nurse practitioner Carly took care of me and then for the confirmation of her analysis, Dr. Melanie came in. I felt reassured having 2 confirmations on my diagnosis. I will definitely be coming back here for all my urgent needs.
Elite 2021

If you have insurance, I highly recommend you wait to see your actual doctor or just go to the ER if your issue can't wait. Â Believe all the negative reviews re. poor billing practices. Â I dropped into the West Portal Urgent Care back in Feb. 2017 and provided 2 forms of insurance. Â Now I'm getting letters in the mail from my secondary insurance provider saying that the 'lab that the West Portal clinic sent my samples to needed to first bill my primary insurance'...? Â To top it off, I received a bill from the West Portal clinic for the balance owed of $150+, and they're only giving me 2 weeks to pay? Â Of course the bill didn't arrive until recently so I only had 1 week to pay.... Â Again, I have 2 forms of insurance and rarely pay anything when I go to any other medical facility. This is so odd. The actual services were just as wonky as their billing practices. Â For instance, I called several hours before coming in and the receptionist said "no need to make an appt. as walk-ins are welcome". I come in and the receptionist asks if I have an appt.? Â Their TV screen displaying the queue also notes clients as "walk-in" vs. "appt." Then, front desk staff tell me that it's a great night, very short wait! Â Well guess what, after waiting 2+ hours twiddling my thumbs in the exam room, the "Physician Assistant" finally comes into my room and complains about how busy she is and how the other PA called out sick. Â So all-in-all I spent 3 hours at this place. Â I definitely won't be back to this location.

First time I used Golden Gate Urgent Care was last year. Since then, I've used them 3 other times. All of them were serious problems. Every time I was treated well, professional and would return in a heartbeat. Every doctor I have seen showed me they cared and wanted to heal me. The technicians, X-ray, and the nurses were caring, funny and pleasant. You have a choice, go to an emergency and wait for 12 hours to be seen, or go to Urgent Care and get relief within an hour. Plus an extra benefit, the places are bright, clean and smell good.

These guys are amazing! You can make an appointment super easy online but I've also just walked in and I only waited for about 10 minutes. Everyone who works here has such a great attitude and they are super helpful and very kind.

Okay I usually never write reviews, but I highly recommend going to this urgent care when you're in pain/ill. The place was very clean and the staff was exceptional; NP Matthew Brooks was very attentive and actually listened to me about what was going on, this man really knew his stuff and throughly explained my options. They were quick to get me in and out, and made my visit easy!
Make a reservation online and walk right in! Stitched up finger almost painless. Very gentle and professional!

BE WARNED: Â EXTRA BILLINGS...EVEN IF INSUREDI went in for a minor ear infection. Â Paid my co-pay ($20), waited an hour, and got prescribed an antibiotic. Â Three weeks later, I got an email for a unexpected "Preauthorized Payment Scheduled." Â Huh? Â The email has no details about what the charges are for. Â I stopped in to Urgent Care to ask what the charges are for, and the receptionist innocently said, "I don't know, but you can call the number for the billing department."When you call the billing department, the automated greeting states that "you will receive a separate bill for the physician, nurse practitioner, or assistant." Â Uh, why wasn't that explained during my initial visit, and why did the receptionist at urgent care not know about this practice of extra billings when I stopped in today? Â SUPER SHADY.I called the billing department, and was on hold for an hour. Â After an hour, an announcement came on asking me to call back during normal business hours. Â WHY didn't the announcement tell me that before asking me to wait for the next available assistant?My Recommendations for GGUC:1. Be upfront with people about what they are paying for, and how they will be billed.2. Put clear signs up stating that the Physicians, etc. bill separately.3. When charging extra billings, provide details about what the charges are for.4. If you refer people to your billing department, actually have people working at the billing department who can answer the phone.I still don't know what I was charged for, or if I should expect additional bills.While my issue is primarily is about SHADY BUSINESS PRACTICES, I also found out that the medication I was prescribed is not prescribed often because of common extreme side effects. Â I went to my normal GP a week later, and he was shocked by what was prescribed. Â It worked, and I didn't have any issues, but, it would have been nice to know how serious the side effects could have been.
Very friendly service from all 4 staff members I interacted with, even though I needed to visit very close to closing time. Â Much appreciated!

My experience was positive. I found medical staff friendly, compassionate and skilled. I was in and out with answers in a short amount of time. Receptionist did not seem to love having to deal with people.
What's the point of making an appointment if they don't see you for hours later? Â Needs to be a better system to figuring out how long each appt will take so they can plan better.

First visit was to get stitches on a Monday morning. I was a walk-in patient, no appointment. Wait took about 50-60 minutes at least to be called in. PA was really sweet and she did a very good and quick job. I came back today to get them removed. I made an online appointment for 12:42p and received the reminder text message to come to the clinic as my appt was coming up. I got there 15 minutes early and was asked to sign in on the tablet and take a seat. After 40 minutes I ask the front desk how long it's going to take and she asks me why I didn't let them know I was here. This first thing I did when I came in was say hi to the other women at the front desk who asked me to check in. My name was also clearly listed on the computer of checked in patients in the lobby since the time I arrived. They both seemed confused and after another 15 min I'm finally called for a total of 1 hour waiting for an appointment.I'm not one to complain but it's irritating to see them allow patients to wait when they made an appointment and most likely did so because they have commitments like work or school. It would have been nice for the staff at the front desk to acknowledge me in the waiting lobby when they realized they didn't sign me correctly instead of having their side conversations the whole time I was there waiting. 3 stars for the nurses and PAs that I was seen by who apologized for the wait and were helpful
Elite 2021

So, unfortunately I found myself at Golden Gate Urgent Care on Sunday due to flu like symptoms that absolutely crushed me this weekend. Ugh. With my head POUNDING I called over to GGUC to see if I could get an appointment asap and they happily squeezed me in without having to wait for an available appt. The nice thing about this place is you can make appointments online or just walk in. The doctor (Dr. Murphy) was really nice and understanding of my symptoms and was able to get me a prescription for headaches. What. A. Lifesaver. The reception was super friendly and got me processed in a timely manner and for that I'm grateful. It's nice to have a convenient urgent care in my neighborhood and when I can't get in to see my One Medical doctors this is definitely a solid option. If you're in the marina/cow hollow/pac heights area I would suggest this place for anyone as it was a pleasant experience.

I loved this office. Great service. Very clean facilities. The front staff, the nurse that assisted me, and the doctor that attended to me were all very nice. The doctor was very informative and even gave me recommendations to a PCP as I am new to the area. I would definitely go back.

This place looks really cute and modern from the outside but don't be sucked in by its appearance. Do not come here. Do yourself a favor and go to a GP or find another urgent care of you can't wait for an actual doctor. (I was seen by a PA-C and it took them almost an hour to check a strep test while I was there.)This place doesn't bill you like a traditional Doctor. When you fill out new patient paperwork you are required to give them a credit card right then so when they decide to charge you they can do it before you even see a bill, or get an explanation of benefits rom your insurance, or know when it's coming. I went there two months ago and I just today got a charge for $200 on my credit card. Surprise! I hate this place.

The staff has always been friendly and supportive. They work with my insurance and I can usually make an appointment within a few hours. I went in today for a cough that just wouldn't go away after several weeks. I walked out less than an hour later with X-ray results and prescriptions. I already feel so much better. This is my go-to help when it'll take days to get in to my primary doctor, and I'm not really in need of a full ER. Did I mention these people are really nice?!
Nice receptionistNice nurseNice DoctorClean and not that of a wait when you walk in.

Worst place ever. I had an appointment and I had to wait for an hour after that. After waiting for an hour the doctor came in and saw me for precisely 45 seconds. I hate this place. I can't believe a hospital like place gives you this sort of treatment.They took 100000 minutes to complete my billing only to let me know that their system isn't working. They still charged me how much ever they deemed fit by saying that the amount will be refunded if it's less than what I've paid. They're horrible and so are the doctors there. HATE IT.

I'm so glad to find out about urgent care because my doctor was fully booked. Â The staff at this location were wonderful, from the ladies at the front desk (Cheryl and another I didn't get her name), Keith the X-ray tech who did all my vitals and Dr. Martin. Â Dr. Martin was very attentive, asked questions and gave answers to all mine. Â She also gave me a breathing treatment because I was wheezing badly. Â They take walk ins and I was out within the hour. Â I was tested positive for the flu and am so glad I was able to get treatment right away. Â The reception area was clean and comfortable. Â I was surprised how big the patients/Doctor areas were in the back and so immaculate!I will definitely use it again and highly recommend it!

I came here to get my bandages redressed from a fingertip amputation injury I got from a rotating slicer at my work. The first time I went I was very scared and nervous for the bandage to come off for the first time (I had initially went to Davies ER when it happened), the doctor said she didnt want to remove the gel foam that was directly on my wound and to come back a second time in 5 days to take it off. She was very nice and gentle with how she handled my finger- I was in a panic when she unwrapped the bandage for the first time but she put me at ease by doing it slowly and gently. The second time i came was a horrible experience- I had an appointment but it took over an hour to be seen. The male doctor that redressed my bandages did not make me feel as calm as the lady that helped me the first time- he said I may have an abcess under the gel foam because there was a little pus coming out- so he proceeded to give me three of the most painful numbing shots ever in my finger- I was basically screaming and crying and writhing in my chair as he poked and prodded my now swollen finger to draw out the "abcess". After he jammed a needle into my wound many times- he said there was actually no abcess and sent me off with a simple band aid. It just seemed like he wanted to move on to the next patient and get it over with- I understand you're the only doctor but bedside manner should be a priority...  The front desk girl also asked if I needed water while I was crying and hyperventilating- I said yes- she ended up forgetting and never brought me my water and I heard her say she forgot to the other doctor outside the room when he asked if I needed anything. Unattentive staff, lacking compassion, painful unnecessary traumatic experience, and long wait time with appointment at this urgent care center. Won't be coming back.

I went to GG Urgent care for them to help me with a wound I got on my finger after 6 day stay at MillsPeninsula Hospital.It was full of blood & Pus.Have no idea how I got this wound.Hurt so badly.I had a Dr lance it after numbing it down.She is a skilled surgeon.Did such a great job.It is starting to heal already.They are very clean there.I am very happy we have this Urgent Care Facility available.Thx for great care.

I went to this location instead of the Market location because I had a horrible experience at the Market location - that review to be followed.I made an appointment online, got there early, checked in, and was seen a nurse right away.I had a sore throat and I specifically told the nurse that I wanted to get it checked outside the lab for a strep test because of my horrible experience at Market street, she understood my situation, swabbed, took my information, and was out pretty quickly. Â The visit was fine, I was told by the nurse that a nurse would be in touch with me in few days for the result.Fast forward to few days ago, when I didn't hear back in few days, I followed up. The nice gentleman who answered the phone put me on hold twice, the second hold was for 40 minutes. F.O.R.T.Y. minutes!!! Lucky I had the phone on speaker at work while I was working, otherwise I'd have to see a chiropractor for my neck!Then he sounded incredibly stressed out, and said that all the nurses are busy and that one would call me back in few hours. That was around 10 am.I understood how hectic things can get, but it was around 3 pm, and I still had not heard anything back from them. I called them, put on hold, and this time, a nice lady answered the phone. She wasn't all that nice, because all she kept doing was trying to hang up the phone. Â I asked for my result, and she told me that it was negative, and that the test was done on site. I explained to her that I had specifically asked for outside lab test, and she said that in order to do that, I would have to come back and give another culture, and repeat this ordeal all over again.I know that this is Urgent Care, and by the appearance outside, inside, and while you are there, you feel like they are taking care of you. But, the minute you leave their door, I have to be vigilant about calling the office, follow up, beg and plead for information, and send smoke signals. I mean, seriously, what does one have to do to get some help? I am not asking for above and beyond, but due diligence. Hugely disappointed, After the Market location, and this location, I feel like my best bet is to try Sutter's new urgent care program.

I apologize in advance. This is my second review, but for some reason it wasn't from this account that I have had for a while. So I went in today with my other half. This was our first time at Golden Gate UC. The staff were super friendly as soon as we walked in. Very well organized and super clean and nice. The monitors on the wall let you know where in line you are and how long your wait will be. Once my other half was called to be seen by the Doctor, I took off to the Starbucks that was very close by. My other half told me that the Doctor was very friendly and helpful. We were in and out in an hour. I would definitely recommend and use this place if I need quick medical attention.

I was referred here by UCSF urgent care because they were about to close. I was a walk in and was in & out in less than an hour. I had gotten a insect bite two days prior. My entire forearm had swollen up, was hot and I had a lingering headache. The staff was friendly, courteous and knowledgeable. The PA that saw me was informative and quite nice. I was told if my PCP wasn't able to see me within 2days to come back there for a follow up at no cost. If I have any other urgent matter for myself or my children I would definitely bring them here. Bonus: there is a Walgreens directly across the street. They also accept Insurance..

I needed urgent care for some second degree burns, and I found this place through my insurance. The waiting area is nice, with an iPad to check in and a monitor displaying the wait time for patients. You can make appointments online, but I did a walk-in Monday at noon, and there was hardly a wait. The doctor and nurse were efficient, and I was all bandaged up and ready to go within the hour. They also provided me with an awesome goodie bag with exit care documents, extra bandages, and ointments for my burns (special thanks to Karen!). (Definitely call ahead to make sure that this is covered under your insurance as you should with any medical services).

Ugh I want to like this place so bad. It's nice and clean on the inside so you have high expectations when you walk in. Granted, it's urgent care so you're most likely going to wait a while. That being said it took the front desk over an hour to get to my paper work, she was nice though. The copay is double what I've always paid at any other urgent care I've ever been to I'm not sure why this particular one is so much more expensive than every where else. The seats are good looking but easily the most uncomfortable chairs I've ever sat in + sitting for almost 2 hours= not incredibly fun.  The people I saw in back were really nice, honestly I paid a fat co pay to find out that I'm just really sick but I have to come back if I stay sick and pay another huge co pay. So that's cool. But I guess knowing is better than not? I'm not sure I have mixed feelings about it. They ended up sending me a refund for the huge co pay that I paid which was super nice but also a little sketch about why I was charged so much to begin. I would come back though. Definitely one of the better urgent cares I've been to.

I came in a day after I was denied service at another urgent care because they don't except cash as a form of payment. I came in on a Sunday as a walk in, checked in saw my name on the screen which showed I would be waiting for about 40 mins, so I let to go get some coffee and came back. It only end up taking about 20 mins before I was seen which was great. The NP that saw me was great. Overall a great experience.

Golden Gate hires competent doctors and their front end representatives are kind enough. Â But don't let the facade lure you into what I can only describe as an unmitigated nightmare. Â Golden gates billing department is staffed by complete and utter morons who bill claims to the incorrect insurance agencies repeatedly. Â Instead of doing their do diligence, they bill you for the full cost of your visit without a second glance. Â Leaving their patrons responsible for calling them and waiting 45 minutes on hold to describe to a dotard that there are different insurance companies under the label California Blue Cross Blue Shield. Â While they take their time, needing multiple calls to correct billing, Â they will send multiple threatening bills. Â Take it from me. Â This is not the first, second or third time they have done this..... Â  it has been several. Â They are the most convenient urgent care to me, and I don't like giving bad reviews. Â But they are a business. Â There is no excuse for incompetence when billing. Â I will no longer patronize their business. Â I am sick of their sh!t.

I'm just going to say it again !!! This facility, it's staff and the service....all AMAZING !! What a gift to our community !! Thank you for the wonderful caring service !I'd been dealing with cold and flu symptoms for a couple of days...escalating to a full blown upper respiratory infection. Tried scheduling appt. with PCP, nothing available online (of course, I was doing this at 3:30 a.m....) so I immediately jumped on GGUCWP website...scheduled an appt. for 8:15 a.m. ( easy and painless !!) and rested until departure time !! Problem solved !!Arrived at 7:50 a.m....doors opened at 8:00 on the dot !! Receptionist was great....took insurance card, I.D....asked a couple of questions, had me take a seat, offered water....what more could you ask for ? Cards back and 5 mins. later into exam room for vitals and prelim check by Christina...another great staff member ! Vitals taken, questions asked...all done !Christina needed to speak with doctor on duty...short...5 min. wait !And then, in walks Dr. Melanie Martin....the JEWEL in the GGUCWP crown !! I'd had the pleasure of seeing Dr. Martin in March 2015 for a similar problem and was relieved to see her smiling face again !! My exam time with Dr. Martin took about 10 mins....she ordered a test, explained process and wait time...offered water or something to drink...all this with a smile and interaction of an old friend...15 mins. later Dr. Martin returns with results...diagnosis made...prescriptions written, note for work written and I'm on my way...PROBLEMS SOLVED !!I cannot begin to tell you how many people I've told of this of this wonderful facility and its staff.Again, what a gift to our community to have access to an urgent care facility of this type !! It's clean, well lit, easily accessible, safe, well staffed....the list goes on and on !!Thank you again GGUCWP staff, Christina and especially Dr. Martin for putting the "treat in treatment"....it's not easy being sick, but you sure make it a lot easier...you're the BEST !!!!P.S. If I could give you 10 STARS, I WOULD !!!!!!!!!!!

Golden Gate urgent Care is close and convenient for my family. This facility allows you to book on line appointments at the last minute and has always accommodated our urgent care needs. In the past I had to travel across the city and wait hours to be seen and this facility has been a godsend due to a friendly efficient staff and close proximity.

Really nice place. Was seen by an MD (unlike some other centers) who was super attentive and friendly. All the staff was super nice and the place was very clean and bright.I came in here a few hours before my flight and I was seen quickly and efficiently. I'd come back here again in a heartbeat.

I went there today for a cold it turned out to be bronchitis Â yuck I called in the morning made a same day apt and was in & out in about an hour!! ! The staff is amazing friendly & knowlwgeabke the facility is very clean Â & up to date they even filled my prescription & gave me a chest X-ray and there's a Walgreens right across the street too Until I find a primary Doctor this is where I will go!
Took my granddaughter in about 5 min ago. The MA named Â Terry was phenomenal and went above and beyond her scope of duties.

I HATE dealing with any sort of shot or needle. I have a history of fainting, so I was very nervous about it going into the Golden Gate Urgent Care to get a TB test. They were so unbelievably understanding. They let me lay down in one of the rooms after I got it so I had time to make sure I was ok and not going to faint in their waiting room! ha and all was well. Then when I came in to have the TB test area checked, for some reason that day I felt like I was going to faint, and the doctor checking me let me sit next to her chair in her office while they got me cold water and talked to me while I relaxed. I did not feel like I was being an inconvenience or anything. This is exactly the type of way I always want me nurses and doctors to act when I tell them I am not good with needles and need time after to relax. On top of that I never had to wait and I was a walk in. Awesome place!

This place is very accommodating and quick services when having an urgent last min care. I am a teacher and their times work well with my schedule. I'm fortunate to only have gone twice and they were both pleasant experiences (as pleasant can be when you're in urgent care).

I had been to Goldengate urgent care once before a couple of years ago at their marina location. I found the care extraordinary and they took every caution making sure that I didn't have a more serious problem than I thought.Today was no exception, although I went to the west portal location. I've been having horrible stomach cramps that kept me up all night and I realized they weren't getting any better. I Â made an appointment for the market Street location, but received a text that they were running almost 2 hours late which meant I wouldn't be seen till way after my stated appointment. I called the West portal location and was told by the very helpful receptionist if I came in right now there was not much of a wait. So we took an Uber over there, and I found the check in process efficient and understanding given that I was in some serious pain.I only had to wait about 20 minutes to see Heidi the nurse, who was extremely compassionate and knowledgeable. She ran through all my vitals quickly, and made sure the doctor came in to see me as that by this time I was writing Â in serious pain. Dr. McIntyre was also compassionate, friendly, went through a number of questions identifying what the possibilities might be, conducted some tests and a physical exam and from those Â made his diagnosis.I was then discharged quickly with some medication, some information about possible future problems, and some advice about some over-the-counter meds I could purchase across the street at Walgreens. I can't tell you how thankful I am for both the nurse and the doctors care, compassion, and knowledge of situations like mine. Thanks Golden Gate Urgent Care - from the moment I entered to the time I was discharged I felt cared for and understood, and couldn't have asked for a better help to deal with my problem.

I was very impressed with the staff and service we received from Golden Gate Urgent Care. There was a wait but what do you want from urgent care an appointment. Well they offer those but we made up our minds to go super late and all the appointments were filled. Within about 30minutes we were discussing our issues with the Dr, who was knowledgable and friendly. The kind of Dr you wish you always went to. If you get sick and do not want to spend the extra bucks at the emergency room then head over to these guys. They do not take medical but they do take various other insurances and of course cash is king.

I was sick with flu like symptoms for a few days. I decided today to go to West Portal Golden Gate Urgent Care as I was not getting better. Dr. Don McIntyre saw me and evaluated me. He prescribed medications for me. He explained each medication to me and possible side effects. He was so through and I did not feel hurried. He ordered a urine test for me as I told him I had burning feeling when urinating yesterday, but today I did not have symptoms. He order the urine test anyway while I was in the office to be sure I don't have a UTI infection. It cane back positive so he order a medication. I was so glad he caught that and followed up! He is a wonderful, kind Doctor who listens to his patients! Thank you Dr Don McIntyre
Hours are wrong. We showed up at 9pm and the place was closed. The hours on the door show they close at 10. We wasted time and had to go to the ER.

Courteous professional staff run this full clinic, where I've been for several urgent visits: sprained brachial muscle, brochitis, GI bug. I have always been treated promptly, with respect, and thoroughly: x-rays available on-site, labs sent out: I can't recommend this urgent care facility highly enough.

I LOVE this place! They got both of my girls checked out without an appointment in a little over an hour. I thought that was great! The staff has always been very nice and accommodating. Would go here again and again when it's after hours or I can't get an appointment at my regular doctor's office.THANK YOU!

Horrible wait time. Had a scheduled appointment at at 5pm on a Sunday arrived early at 4:50 to fill out the paper work, waited 10 min to be called into the exam room and the nurse asked the questions and checked my vitals and said the doctor would be in shortly. The doctor came in around 6:55. A little more communication would be appreciated. Even if it was just "hey it's gonna be a while" I'd understand. Put in an extra star cause the doctor did the job and fixed up the problem I came in for.

Had a 2:00 appointment recommended by Dignity Health. I arrived with a stabbing pain in my abdomen. There was one other walk-in patient waiting in the lobby. I waited 30 minutes and was put in a waiting room and vital signs were taken by attendant and were not read back to me. I had to ask. The attendant threw a gown on the bed next to me telling me the doctor/ "Provider" Â might have to check me out. I was left alone for one hour in major pain until I finally stepped out to ask how long it was going to be because I had only put 2 hours on the street meter. Grudgingly another attendant looked at his computer and told me there was one other patient ahead of me. I went back in the waiting room and waited another 20 minutes. I got up and told the receptionist I wanted to cancel my appointment and provide me with proof of cancellation. While I was expressing my disappointment I watched a patient come out of a treatment room and she had already been seen by the doctor. Â I remembered her coming in the clinic 30 minutes after I arrived. So much for appointments? How man more did she see that came in after me? I left angry and sicker then I arrived. Brutal experience and a waste of time and money.
We are very fortunate to ha e GGUC so close to home. They provide Excellent care.Facility is very clean and team is efficient!I would recommend to anyone looking for quick quality care!
Great doctor ! Â  He knew exactly how to treat my asthma, without sending me to the emergency room for a treatment! Haven't had a steroid shot in years but hopefully I'll be good in a few hours!

Wowzers people. Â The nurse practitioner who saw me basically thought I was going to have a heart attack based on a mis-administered EKG. Â She urged me to take the ambulance instead of waiting for my friend to take me to the emergency room. Â UCSF ER confirmed that the EKG chart from GGUC was wrong. Â I ended up with unnecessary ambulance and ER expenses that amounted to thousands of dollars. Â Never again.

Dr martin is the best. Â The whole team is welcoming and with a Walgreens across the street it can not get any better.I had an asthma attack and the doc was thorough and gave me a breathing treatment that really helped.I always use this clinic when my docs are not around.

I am so pleased with the care I received here. I walked in ten days ago with a gruesome gash on my finger from a chopping accident. This was such a calm setting. Everyone was friendly, and they moved me quickly from one person to the next (each having a different role). They all seemed to know exactly what to do. This should be a given, but when visiting a strange place with a huge wound, one never knows. I returned tonight to have my stitches removed. Once again, everyone with whom I spoke was knowledgeable and helpful. I did not get anyone's names, and I'm not sure it matters: They were all great and seem to work well together (so you should be in good hands with anyone), and I don't plan to be a regular (so I don't need their names). I said to one person, "You are all so nice and competent!" He replied, "Well, we try to be nice, and we *should* be competent." Indeed. It is so nice to see people who care doing their jobs well. I wish we could expect the same from our federal government, but that's another issue. Thanks, GGUC!

My son had a minor injury from playing basketball and had a service today.They were very efficient and caring to my son.The X-ray did not take much time and we were done under an hour.We highly recommend their service.

This is our first time, but your office is certainly impressed us with your extremely squeky clean and comfortable environment! Â We were greeted by the most pleasant, helpful and friendly Receptionist! Â The doctor's Assistant was thorough and the P.A. R. Aguilar seemed to know what she's doing! Â I like to say definitely 10 extreme satisfy with the service, environment and treatment! Â More likely recommend to our friends/family to your office! Â Thanks and please continue doing the great job! Â Best, Â Lawrence Wu and Dennis White

I'm Aaveg Mittal, DOB (10/02/1986). I came to the Golden Gate Urgent care on West Portal a week ago, i.e. (11/24/2015) as I've been having recurrent fever for about a month now. On complete investigation by the Doctor, my blood sample was taken and the next step was to consult the doctor with the lab results. Â  Â I was told that some of the results would come in a few hours while "culture" takes around 10 days. It has been a week now and I've NOT received any results yet. My situation has been getting worse with each day passing and I've been loosing on work because of that.  Â  Â As what I understand, with each day passing the relevance of the report decreases as well. At this point I feel very frustrated as even after checking multiple times with the centre I've not given a definitive answer. I NEED an explanation ASAP on what is going with the lab and when can I get the results.

The day I went was on a Sunday which of course for any doctors office can be VERY busy. But I'm a patient person. It was a very very long wait but once they got to me they treated me the best I've ever been treated at a doctors office. It was immaculately clean and welcoming. They treated me like they had known me forever and made me feel very comfortable. Able to answer the questions I had for them as well as explaining why they are doing what they were doing and the process that was to take place. This is the place I'll be going to with all of my medical issues. And I've been to a couple in the San Francisco area. 5 Stars for a 5 Star customer service.

Went in yesterday for a lingering cough. Â The staff was quite professional. Â The PA I saw was great. Â She did a great job of doing an assessment & was very good about explaining what we could do as well as follow-up. Â She gave me two cough suppressants and it really helped me in getting some rest last night.They get only 4 stars because their initial estimate of 20" became 35" then ended up being a little over an hour. Â You do have the option to make an appointment if you don't want to wait. Â It's nice to have a facility like this in the neighborhood. Â Much easier than an ER visit when you don't have anything that serious going on.

This place was great! Clean, bright. The intake nurse was wonderfully kind and the doctor was fabulous. He actually wanted to run tests to see what was going on! For some reason that is an anomaly in healthcare.It was nice book an appointment easily online that was less than two hours away. Once I was in the building, there was an extremely minimal wait time.Lobby seats were not super comfortable and the front desk staff could have given a better explanation of what's expected on the iPad. Too rushed, I didn't hear what you said!Overall very happy with the services.

I was in the area on a Sunday morning and needed to see a doctor, but couldn't wait until Monday for my PCP. Â I was able to walk in and get examined within 30 minutes. Â The facility is fully equipped and immaculate. Â At the end of the visit, the doctor came out to the waiting area and hand-delivered the prescription to me and personally reviewed what I need to do within the next few days. Â I don't even get this kind of service from my PCP.After my visit, I learned that you can check-in online and they will text you 30 minutes prior to when your turn is up without having to sit in the waiting room for hours if they get busy. Â Unless it's a chronic issue, this may just become my PCP.

I was able to get a same day appointment with a very short wait . Nice waiting area even had iPads for children . Names were on a tv screen so I knew how many people were in front of me and how long my wait would be. It was estimated a hour wait and i ended up getting seen within 30 mins. Very easy check in process for a new patient within 15 mins with all paperwork insurance and co pay. Front desk patient registration employee was very professional , the nurse for triage was very friendly she made sure all my needs were taken care of. The Nurse practitioner came in within minutes very friendly nice guy . I was able to get a doctors note and prescription and was on my way. I would highly recommend this to anyone with urgent care needs. If they had Primary care I would prolly go to them more often. Thanks for your service , professionalism and friendliness.

Had a terrible respiratory infection of some sort. Â We don't have a doctor in SF so I planned to go to UCSF Urgent Care, where I had gone before. Â Got there at 3pm on a Monday and all their appointments were booked through closing at 8pm. Â Now what??? UCSF didn't much care, said to go across the street to the ER where the wait was probably hours. Â Looked on Yelp and found Golden Gate Urgent Care. Â Called and they said to come on in, the wait would be less than 30 minutes. Â Monica at the front desk was terrific, as was the nurse. Â Dr. Dove examined me and thought it might be pneumonia, took a chest X-ray and sure enough it was. Â Dr. Dove was really nice, very smart, and thorough. Â The place was spotless, they had state-of-the-art equipment, the staff was totally professional and very kind. Â I'd go back there for sure! Â I read Rachel D.'s review and think we must be on different planets.

I just went there, they sent my urine to the lab ! Didn't tell me anything! Even my insurance didn't know about !!! And sent a bill to my house !!! I didn't even know about ! Even my insurance!!! Terrible !

Sometimes common sense simply fails. Like when I made an appointment hours in advance at this facility, showed up half hour early, to accommodate for paperwork, and just in case, and still had to wait for over an hour past my scheduled appointment, since they insisted on accommodating every "walk-in" that was at the waiting room before attending to my scheduled appointment. When I questioned it, I was told by the receptionist that "that's how we do things"....so why offer appointments to begin with?

My first time as GG urgent care as a Patient, and what a great time it was! I booked my 1245PM appt. online with Ease. I came in and was greeted kindly and the staff is cool. You fill out the iPad chill out in the nice clean facility and then my appt. was called. Adam was by Physc. Assistant and he was rad!! Thank you Adam for being a real dude and knowing your medical business. I got some tests, a prescription, and I was on my way! Thanks guys!

Dr. Martin was compassionate toward my ongoing issue, she helped me and gave me sound advice to expedite care through my actual specialist. Â I was having a terrible flare, miserable & just was fed up with my actual specialist, also too weak to get to him that particular day. Â She helped me in my urgent need. Every time I visit this site, they are efficient, kind, and understanding. I actually end up there at least once a year, Lol. God bless them. I appreciated their assistance. I hope not to have to see them anymore this, though.

My nephew came to visit me and my husband from Mexico. He cut himself pretty badly and the cut got infected. With no insurance we were extremely worried about getting him proper care. It was also late and Â this was the only place opened. We are so glad that we found this urgent care! We received such phenomenal service. The doctor and nurse and staff were so friendly and welcoming and kind. I am truly truly grateful for the services that were provided and the care we received. And we could not believe how reasonable the price was. I would recommend this place to anyone who is in need of urgent care. You will be treated with kindness and respect and will receive excellent medical care!

I just went to Golden Gate Urgent Care for the first time. Â I had a bad finger infection and the doctor I saw, Dr McIntyre knew immediately what was wrong with it. He numbed my finger and drained and cultured what came out. The staff was great and the registration process was easy. I was seen within 15 minutes.

I was seen today at the West Portal GGUC and I'm very pleased with the attention received from Dr Melanie Martin! She was concerned of my situation and provided wonderful care! I will definitely return for urgent care needs. Her medical assistant April was very sweet and helpful! I'm very thankful I found them.

Clean facility. Wait time was short. I've been to this center both with appointment and walk in. Front desk staff could be a little more cheerful. Overall very happy with the care received. The providers on both instances took their time to explain the diagnosis and treatment.
Sarah Thebarge PA was so kind and helpful. I came in with pain my right foot and she got me in and out in no time. She was amazing!

I have a terrific primary care physician, and his staff has been good about fitting me in with him or someone else in his practice when something is urgent. So I haven't had much experience with urgent care. I'd been seen at the UCSF Screening and Urgent Care Clinic many years ago, where the waits were long and the experience pretty bad.In this case, I had a problem in my foot that caused me such pain that it just wouldn't wait for my doctor's office to open on Monday; it was either this or the emergency room, and waiting for who knows how long. So based on Yelp reviews, I made an appointment online at Golden Gate Urgent Care in West Portal. The process of making the appointment was very easy, and I was seen within a reasonable period of time of my appointment. I was seen by Dr. McIntyre, who listened carefully (my medical problem was a recurrence of a problem I've had before) and prescribed the necessary meds.Best of all, they were able to dispense the meds. The copay was higher than if I'd taken a prescription to Walgreens, but the small difference was worth it not to have to make another stop while my foot was hurting like crazy. That made a really unpleasant day a little bit easier.I even got flu shot while I was there. I was glad they offered; I had forgotten it was that time of year again.I have an outstanding primary care physician, but it's nice to know that, on weekends or in the rare circumstance where I can't be seen there, I have an easy and high-quality alternative to going to the ER with something where the ER is overkill.

Top notch service. Quick, efficient. Dr saw me on time and total time in office was less than 30 minutes.I rarely frequent doctors offices so when I do it for a reason. I stopped by today because of a lingering sinus infection. Super easy to diagnose.I am not sure I would visit urgent care for anything more complicated but for an infection is something simple and routine I would not go anywhere else

I have a bad case of Strep (I've had it before and had the stereotypical symptoms). GGUC had a page for online appointments so after a quick informative phone call I made an appointment for a couple hours later in the afternoon. I got a couple texts to inform me they were running behind (saving me time sitting in reception) and a third to inform me my appointment was in 30 minutes. Drove over, found parking fairly easily, and only sat in reception for about 10-20 minutes tops.A nurse did a strep swab and some diagnostics and then I waited maybe 10 minutes more for the doctor to arrive. Dr. Martin seemed very easy going and informed me my strep test was positive and prescribed me some antibiotics (which were reasonably priced and the expiration date was far in the future) as well as a steroid to help with the swelling. I asked her how much the steroid would cost (one time application in the clinic) and she didn't know so she opened the door and yelled over to the receptionist to ask how much it was. I thought this was more funny/bemusing than anything but it did make me glad that I hadn't gone in for anything embarrassing! Anyway, it seems like a nice place and if I ever needed urgent care again I would probably go to GGUC again.
Elite 2021

This is a great urgent care option for patients, you can make a same day appointment or walk-in. I made a same day appointment on a Saturday and when I got there I was immediately signed in and I only waited like 10 minutes in total. The RN that helped me was named Adrienne and she was very nice and efficient. I saw Dr. Martin and she was also very kind and helpful. I was able to get all of my prescriptions at the office, which was incredibly convenient and the check out process was simple. The entire visit, including my chest X-ray, was less than an hour. The quality of care given at this location is top notch and I would highly recommend this office anyone who needed a quick, unplanned doctor visit.

Been here twice this year (feb and June)for a nasty flu. Wait was short, office was clean and staff was efficient. Both visits paid copay upfront.. Had no problem there until last week..I received a collections notice last week stating an amount owed on top of what I paid in office which is fine. Called their billing department to figure out why I was sent to collections and never received a single bill. The person I spoke to said they sent out multiple bills and that maybe it was my post office's problem that my mail never got to me. Really?? And yet the collection company was able to get their letter to me. Â At the end of the conversation, I read my address to her and once I got to the city and zip, she jumped in and said "oh, that's why you're not receiving it, there was no city entered". How does one even begin to send out a letter with no city entered? Maybe a courtesy call to confirm the address should have been made before sending my account to collections.

Another great experience at this clinic today. Made an appointment online, came in a little ahead of time, checked in, and was seen pretty close to my appointment time so minimal wait. Still very clean facilities and extremely pleasant staff. I also appreciated the balance between relying on prescription medications and natural remedies.

Arrived just before their closing time on Saturday after 4 days in bed with the flu and a horrible cough that just wouldn't quit. I was a gross sick mess. I sensed if I waited any longer I'd likely end up in the ER, so asked my husband to bring me here instead. I'm so glad I did!
