Everyone from the front desk to the nurses to the doc who treated me (loved him- warm, funny, kind) were unbelievably kind and helpful. Not rushed at all, but also no long wait. Turns out I had pneumonia. They gave me a flu test, chest X-ray, and a breathing treatment immediately. They also had all the prescription meds I needed onsite which was beyond helpful. Thank you so much! Two days later and I'm feeling tons better!

I was given an appointment on the phone. The wait wasn't bad at all and I was treated with kindness. Â Dr. Don McIntyre was very personable and didn't rush. Listened to me, did an exam and gave me a diagnosis and the medications needed to feel better. Â I would definitely go here again.

Both my husband and I have used the services at this West Portal SF location. The first time, we'd gone on a long walk in a wooded area and the next day I noticed a "bite" that was quite big and ugly on my husband's leg. Not sure if it was a tick, I decided to call and get him in to be seen. They had an appointment and we were able to get in quite promptly. The team that saw him gave him some ointment, said it would disappear in the next few days, but IF it got larger (they drew a circle around it) to please return. We were in and out quickly and they were very attentive and professional. The next time my husband lost his balance on a hill getting out of our car, picked up momentum and took a fall. Thankfully he did not hit his head, but as a precaution I wanted him checked out and just walked into this facility. They did a head scan and checked him out all over to make sure. Gave us the scan on a CD to show our doctor if needed and we felt relieved. The next time was MY turn. For several days I'd lost my voice and we were going on a trip, so I was concerned flying, etc. they gave me a powerful Rx to get filled and told me to rest my voice as much as possible, drink tea with honey and get sleep! Within a few days it was gone. So for the few times we've been in need, this has been great for us. A lot of people go to the ER when it's not necessary and you can go here! We have our Medicare, so it is far less expensive for them than the ER would be. We are covered fully, so it never costs us to go to Urgent Care. To us, the ER should be used for heart attacks, knifings, gunshot woulds and auto accidents, NOT typical daily issues! And often you don't need to "run and see your doctor" for some issues they can attend to here. We will continue to use this location whenever needed. The front desk staff has always been polite and the doctors very professional.
Love GG urgent care so much! Besides the great care I've received here, the facilities are top notch. Current magazines, wireless and the ability to book a spot online!

You have no idea how many times this place has come to my rescue when I have had minor (yet painful!) ailments. They make it so easy, and I love that I've never been there for longer than an hour and a half! The facilities are EXTREMELY clean, yet don't feel sterile, which is nice.Their receptionist, Monica, has been there every time I've come in. She never fails to make me laugh and take my mind off whatever is bothering me. She is a joy. There is also a very tall Asian male doctor who helped me this last time, who was both personable and informative. He gave me something to ease my very obvious pain, which was much appreciated!I will definitely be back!

I had a great experience here. The hours are 7 am - 10 pm. It was easy to make an appointment online. I received a reminder text message 30 minutes before my appointment. Meter parking is free before 9 am. The waiting room and exam room was clean. The receptionist was nice, and I was impressed when she wiped the ipad with an antibac wipe before handing it to me. Dr. Martin was friendly, professional, and efficient. Before I left she asked if I needed a doctor's letter for work.

Such a great urgent care. Very nice and clean. Came in on a Friday morning around 9:30, waited maybe 10 minutes then was brought into a room. The doctor was a kind lady, and actually listened and was concerned for my health. Will definitely be coming back here if I have any other health concerns. Great place!
Appt today at 2:45. Showed up early 2:30 to fill forms etc. Its now 4:06 and wife still in exam room without being seen. Â  Wtf kind of "urgent" care place is this?

Had a great experience with Golden Gate Urgent Care. Staffs were so attentive and professional. Very clean clinic. I was there at 9:15 and out by 9:. Â I got strep throat. My Â Pharmarcy closed for the night, they asked me if I wanted to get the antibiotic from them. It was $20. Works out great for me. If I order at my pharmacy it would costs me my copay. I felt much better and got my voice back within half an hour. The next morning, I didn't even feel the body ache. Definitely recommend this place to everyone.

Definitely will go here again if urgent care is needed! My visit was on a Sunday around noon. Â Easy online check in, friendly and knowledgable staff, super clean facilities and though it was an urgent care center it felt comfortable and with modern furnishings and great light (weird to mention I know but noticed) Was in and out within 45 minutes, doctor was kind and a good listener, while being quick in providing careI also received a follow up call about the results of one lab and was again thankful I chose Golden Gate Urgent Care on last Sunday!

Reason for visit: Ear InfectionMade an appointment at Sunday at 11am for 1:30pm. Â Was seen pretty quickly after I filled out first timer paperwork. Â Was treated very well by the staff. Â I felt cared for because I was cared for. Â And a big 5 stars because I feel so much better just one day after my visit. Â The treatment I was given by Physicians Assistant J. Monarchi was the best I've ever gotten (most appropriate/thorough). Â I am very happy I chose to go to this facility and will certainly use them again if I ever need to

I was misbilled by the company that handles there billing. After a few back and forths we were able to correct the mistake. Since the bill was my main complaint, I have bumped up their rating. Â I would still like them to make the costs more transparent.

I've been here twice for walk-in-appointments (too last minute to schedule with my regular doctor) and both times were a good experience! I was able to be seen both times within 15-45mins (which was awesome) and out within about an hour. Not only were the ladies at the front desk very friendly and helpful, they also made sure to check up on me while I was waiting to make sure I was doing ok (which was very thoughtful of them) . The doctor and nurses were also very welcoming and really listened to what I had to say about why I was visiting and what symptoms I was having. I appreciate that they took extra time to narrow in what might be the problem. Needless to say, I left very satisfied both visits.Also, I adore their waiting room ;) Very clean, beautiful, and nicely kept.

My first time ever using any type of urgent care so wasn't sure what to expect. Very much appreciated the modern and clean offices. 5 stars for this. Wish more medical facilities looked like this. I have to double on the other comments that there's no point in making an online appointment and then still have to wait behind everyone else who came in without an appointment. I had an acute case of sciatica, so waiting for over an hour despite having arrived on time for the booked time, wasn't fun. The actual consultation was a few minutes with a fairly stressed out doctor but maybe that's the nature of Â 'urgent care' which can't equal a visit with your general practitioner. Still great to have this service available in case of an emergency!

Today i just went to this urget care with my friend who got a big cut in his right hand they told us our insurance don't work so we decided to pay by our pocket but instead of doing the treatment they have given my friend the lot of paper work but he cannot do because he had a cut in the right hand and had a lot of blood and we waited like 20 minutes but no one is there to take care of his wound. What is meant by urgent care first they have to do the treatment

I have been here twice in the past six months. I've received excellent and prompt care with virtually no waiting. Especially for after normal office hours visits (and maybe even during office hours) you can be seen so much more quickly than your regular doctor. Â Make an appointment online first.

The service received here was stellar. As another reviewer said - this is how urgent care should be.Came in to a spacious, clean facility that had a very attentive and helpful staff. Monica at the front desk made me feel at ease and comfortable, Angel was efficient at taking my vitals and Dr. Amy was lovely to chat with.No unnecessary 3 hour wait just to be rushed out like Concentra. Quick in and out. While my injury is not painless, the process at GG was. Thanks!

Dr. Martin was fantastic! Very informative and had me in and out the office in less than 20 minutes. I have been coming to Golden Gate Urgent Care on and off for five years and every time I've been there it has been nothing but a positive experience. The staff is very sweet.

The registration was quick and easy, but I've been waiting for over an hour for my appointment. I thought it would be a lot quicker based on how accommodating the staff was when I registered. I just need antibiotics and I don't know why they can't come by and say, sorry it's taking longer than usual.

Been here twice (once for me, once for my stepson), as well as to several of their other branches and could not ask for better service or care. Fast, efficient, good bedside manner, affordable and accepts insurance. This location is my favorite but I've never had a bad experience at any of them.

One of the best experiences I've ever had at an urgent care facility. My unfortunate experience of not feeling well ended on a high note with the wonderful staff along with Dr. Martin. Definitely a go-to if you're in the neighborhood.
Very impressed. Professional staff. I had to go on to an ER, but would happily come back here if need be, for somethng less serious. Nice to have them near by where i live.

My wife was sick this weekend, and we debated going to the ER. Â When I looked on Aetna to see our options, it encouraged us to seek out an urgent care instead. Â It never occurred to me that we had any in SF, and I am so glad we have GGUC!You can make a same day appointment online, and we had a great experience from start to finish. Â The space is super open and modern, the staff was nice and friendly, and the doctor and nurse were both awesome. Â Made a difficult health issue manageable, and we would both choose this over Davies any day.(Even though I LOVE the doctors at Davies and would recommend their ER for trauma and emergencies.)Thank you to everyone who took care of us today! You rock!!!

I checked my mail on 3/11 and still no itemized receipt. So now I have to call billing again and this time make sure to get the ID number of every person I talk to so I can start compiling a paper trail. I realize to some, paying the flu shot out of pocket is no big deal but I don't have that kind of extra spending money. I also don't have time to call their billing again. This is really frustrating.
This place is amazing! All the nurses and staff were extremely helpful!I definitely highly recommended this urgent care for everyone!

Our second visit here ... same great experience as the first. Â Big thank you to Dr. Meredith and the staff for their friendliness, efficiency, and medical expertise to make my 89-year old dad's visit for a cut on his forehead quick, pleasant, and painless (well, as much as stitches can be painless.) Â The online appointment process is a breeze and there was almost no wait time with an appointment.

The reason to go: urticaria, allergicI am so glad that I've tried this urgent care. I suggested for the people in a rush to not make appointment. I choose to do walk-in service because my whole body was too itchy that I can't sleep for 24 hours. Luckily I got to see a doctor in 20 mins and got some medicine for my allergy. I would say it is a very clean care center and the stuff was extremely friendly and helpful. Thank you so much.

Everyone I met here was professional and provided great customer service.There's a TV in the waiting room that displays your name in the queue. It took some time to see the doctor, but everything seemed efficient so I did not mind at all.There's a Walgreen's across the street so it made it easy to pick up the prescribed medication.

From the front desk, to the visit with the PA I experienced nothing but kind, efficient, thorough care. The facility is very clean. The PA Jozelle (sp?) was personable, and knowledgeable. Everything was explained throughout by Ken who was assisting. The staff get along well, have a sense of humor, are professional all contributing to the feeling of being in a safe & caring environment.

My first impression was that this place was easy to get an appointment, clean and comfortable, conveniently located across form Walgreen's, Â I saved $10.00 on the copayand my daughter was seen and discharged quickly. I gave them an excellent rating on their survey.However, 3 days later my daughter was crying and doubled over in pain. When I called to speak with the doctor I was told that she could not come to the phone but would call me back asap. Â After waiting well over an hour, I drove my daughter back there and insisted that someone see her soon. The doctor said that she was misdiagnosed and needed to see a specialist. Â The specialist confirmed the misdiagnoses.
These guys were so sweet. Compassionate, friendly, thorough, and professional: this is some of the best medical care I've ever received. They took great care of me.

We have been to Golden Gate Urgent Care West Portal four different times, once for myself, once for my husband, and once each for my 2 kids, first different reasons. Â I have been impressed EVERY time. I am not only a nurse manager at a primary care clinic, but I Â am also a fairly regular consumer of urgent ambulatory care having active children and an elderly, disabled mother. Â Golden Gate Urgent Care West Portal has been the best without a doubt. Â The wait times are absolutely reasonable, certainly quicker than most urgent care facilities. Â Even more important than that, the customer service and bedside manner of the staff is stellar. Â Finally, we have gotten very thorough, quality care from obviously skilled and compassionate providers. Â One last thing: I did have an issue at my last visit with getting a bill even though I had clearly paid, and when I mentioned it to the front desk staff Â (Hamed) tonight, he went well above and beyond to find out what might have happened and to help me resolve it. Â 100% recommend.

You're all the best!I was walking in they don't have any appointment available but I did not even wait for 15 minutes,they took good care of me with a positive energy,technicians,receptions,Doctor are all amazing for tonight 4/18/16.
Got me in quickly and handled my issue in a timely manner. Professional and courteous. Like them a lot

Great medical experience at GGUC! Very courteous checkin staff, Tahira is the worlds best and nicest PA and Dr. Martin is just amazing! Â They all worked as a terrific team to deliver a fantastic medical experience!
Clean facility. Friendly prompt service. Dr. Martin greets you by first name, which I found Is a detail lacking by most doctors. Dr. Martin is kind, thorough and models an ideal bedside manner.

Great service. Â Clean facility. Â Friendly staff. Â The ClockwiseMD is a great feature to figure out how long the wait is, or if you have an early morning urgent need, you can make an appointment before they open.

I was lucky enough to be seen within a few hours by making an appointment online. The staff was incredibly professional, compassionate and efficient. I'd recommend this place for your urgent care needs.

Probably one of the best Urgent Care experiences I've ever had. All the appointments were booked so I did a first time, new patient walk-in and was seen by the doctors in 20 minutes. So, if you call and they're booked, it doesn't necessarily mean they're actually busy. A lot of people had booked online but never showed so the waiting room was pretty empty. To top it off, the place was spotless and everyone was friendly.

People who are complaining about the wait times need to reconsider how long it takes to see a primary care physician or see a doctor on weekends. Given that the alternative to urgent care used to be waiting in an ER, this service is special. I came here because I slammed my finger in a car door. It turned out that it was broken. This office normally works by appointments, but they gave be a proper ice pack and some Tylenol. If I had gone to an ER, I'm sure I would have been much lower on the triage list. I waited 40 minutes. Again, had I gone to an ER, I would have been triaged behind heart attacks and the like. My boyfriend came here. He had a flu that turned into pneumonia. He used the appointment system. We waited 20 minutes. That's not very bad for urgent care.
Fantastic professional, friendly and fast service. Definitely coming back when needed.

Thank goodness this place is now open because this is how urgent care should be! When I arrived, the staff told me that they had just opened yesterday, so they were still getting settled, but they welcomed me warmly.I came in for a quick ear infection visit and was treated immediately. This might be due to the fact that they're new and not busy yet, but compared to my 4 hour wait at Concentra Urgent Care, this was golden. I also love the fact that they're open weekends and relatively late on weekdays. They even mentioned that if you arrive 1 minute prior to closing, they'll still gladly see you.The staff and NP here were all very friendly and helpful. The clinic is clean, modern, and spacious. Overall, a great urgent care experience. Will definitely be coming here for all future medical issues.
Wonderful service - I accidentally cut my arm with a knife and needed stitches. Â I was in and out in around 45 minutes. Â They took my insurance and the PA was very friendly and professional!!!

Total waste of time with this clinic. I feel like I'm wasting my time to write this review but maybe this will spare future innocent souls from similar experience I had with them. So I called to inquire about flu shot availability and was told that I and my son can either walk in or make appointment online. So I made the appointment online. Came in and was greeted by a grumpy font desk lady with no smile. Front desk lady: Â "for just flu shot, no online appointment... don't touch that ipad (their check-in system)... we don't have kid's flu shot here...he needs to go to his pediatrician... fill out these 2 forms and I'll need your photo id along with 25$ cash (me- hmmm credit card not accepted?)... we don't accept insurance (i didn't ask if they do)..." Me: "uhh ok"... sat down and filled out the forms... returned to her desk and asked "since I am paying cash upfront, i'm wondering why I have to fill out this patient insurance info with my ssn and dob?"Front desk lady: "that is what the system requires" shrugging her shouldersMe: "hmmm... i change my mind, i don't want your service"Kiddos and me then walked across the street to Walgreens to check out if they do offer flu shot. To our surprises, they do and even let me know that my insurance (already stored in their system) will cover it. Both my young son and I had our flu shots within 10 min.

This is the nicest urgent care clinic I've been to. Everyone from intake to triage to the PA (Adam) who interacted with me was extremely nice. My visit was quick but thorough, and I never felt uncomfortable. If you need to go to an urgent care clinic, Golden Gate Urgent Care is one of the most welcoming places to go.
Walk in on a rainy holiday. Â Only a hour wait, the doctor and medical assistance are very fast and professional.

I dont know if Travis is a doctor or NP but he was very friendly, comforted me with a hug and said that my heart "looked fabulous"! Made my night even though i wasnt feeling good. Forgot to give a review for my other visits this year but doctors are great. Â nurses & medical assistants were good too but not ALL (-0.5 star). I told the tech that i had an o2 sat monitor at home but wasn't sure if it was accurate coz i was staying at 86-90%. He told me im practically dead at 86.. well, no. It's just a low reading but not dead. Minus 0.5 star Â because you gotta give your px benefit of the doubt because not all are lay people, some work in health care too. Â all in all clean, hip space. Good service. Convenient location.
Fast, efficient and friendly. Everyone made me feel comfortable and the staff was amazing-kind and knowledgable.
This is my first time visit. Â They are very friendly and answer all my concerns. Â I don't have to wait too long.

Crystal the receptionist is rude and ditzy. She leaves sensitive information (i.e. social security numbers, driver licenses) on the front desk while she's away from the desk. One patient even had to come back for her ID, which Crystal left in the photocopier. For identity theft, this office is definitely the place to be...Also, I had a scheduled appointment and still ended up waiting 40 min. What's the point of scheduling appointments if you're just going to have to wait anyway?Update: they gave me another patient's prescription. Ridiculous.

Made an appointment and waited 30 still then was left in the room for an additional 30 min after was seen. The entire Time from start to finish was over 2 hours for them to refer me out... the provider was friendly but the front desk seemed like I was an inconvenience to be there.
I dreaded trying to find an Urgent Care center on a Sunday morning. I was so relieved to be able to easily make an appointment online, be seen promptly (and not rushed)!

I was sick and new to town my health insurance didn't kick in yet. I didn't have a primary doctor but went there. They were so professional, spent an hour with me easily, and at the end they even printed out my illness with some reference material. They are really really awesome. My first experience being sick in the US, and I was in safe hands.
Dr. Travis was great - personable, efficient, thorough; staff was polite and efficient too; got a same day appointment with very short wait.

I made the appointment at 7:45AM for 8 AM for a sprained ankle. I Filled out the iPad for Insurance & was in the room at 8:05. Ken, the X-Ray Tech took my history & did the X-ray. He said a Radiologist would read it in about 15 minutes. It was read in 10 minutes & showed there was a small fracture. Ken fitted me with a boot. The PA, Emily reviewed everything, gave me the X-ray to follow up with an Orthopedist & I was out of there in under an hour. The receptionist was efficient, the staff professional, and it was a good experience even though I was in pain. So much better than waiting in an ER for hours.

I've received great care at Golden Gate. I've been fortunate enough to be seen by Dr. Martin, she is an ANGEL disguised in a white lab coat. Â Last year's visit I was experiencing some alarming symptoms and Dr. Martin immediately was able to calm my nerves and prescribe the best treatment plan. Dr. Martin is extremely kind, calm, personable and very attentive, I couldn't ask for a better doctor. I highly recommend!

Excellent staff. From getting you in and out of the place they do the best of their capacity and abilities to really help you. I would recommend to come as early as possible if you don't have an appointment. They do get a little chatty in the back about their personal life, but very professional when dealing with all your needs and problems. I was always checked up on and made sure I was okay. Which is honestly a big plus! I came in feeling horrible and came out a whole new person.

I would give this place one star if not for the MD who treated me here was awesome. Everything else about my visit was terrible though. The lady at the front desk was clueless. She asked me for my credit card information even though I had already told her twice that I was paying in cash. The biggest issue I ran into, though, was the waiting time. The amount of time between the assistant taking my blood pressure, temperature, and medical history and the MD actually treating me was over 45 minutes, because they only have 1 MD. Absolutely inexcusable for an "urgent care" facility. Please, GGCU, hire at least 1 other MD and thereby improve your service!!!
Very nice and helpful staff but Dr. McIntyre is the best.
4 hour wait for a 5 minute physical . They need to shut this place down .. Do not go here terrible waste of time ..

I came here after I got a head injury, and I was worried that i had a concussion or maybe something else. Â I came in at 8:45am with no appointment, and was able to see a doctor in 10 minutes. Â She was great, and answered all my questions promptly. Â I almost don't want to leave a review because then there'll be more people waiting to see them!It's super convenient, being a block and a half away from the west portal muni station. Â They also have great hours, being open until 8pm is much nicer than the other urgent care offices, which close usually at 4-5pm.

They are really organized and quick; doctor/staff were thorough, took time to answer my questions, listened really well, and provided a nice summary of everything that happened for my personal records. Thanks guys!
Today Venessa helped me and did an amazing job going above and beyond to help us find our prescription at a pharmacy.

I can't believe I never used urgent care. One of my doctors told me about this location. Smooth, easy, liked the check in.The doctor was courteous to the point and Â addressed my problem while taking the time to explain. Since it's so hard to get into the regular doctors office this is a great option for immediate care. If you don't want to wait to long you can sign in for an appointment on line.
Great and convenient. Appointment easily set in advance - everyone there - receptionist, tech and doctor treated my 15 year old (and her parents) with respect, humor and compassion.

If you're sick, having issues, and your doctors not available, head over to Golden Gate Urgent Care. The staff is wonderful. They're kind hearted individuals who really do care about their patients. I recently had a scare and everyone there made me feel like it was just a normal visit in order to keep me calm. I'm starting to feel a lot better thanks to them. Adam you are the man! Â Thanks for everything!
Dr. Martin and the nurse (wish I remembered his name) were extremely helpful when I brought my father in with an urgent medical issue. So grateful for their help and follow-up.
Great staff, knowledgeable and fast turnaround! Felt very attended to and will definitely visit in the future for medical needs!

Overall a positive visit. Their facility is clean. The staff were overall polite and professional. I was somewhat disappointed with my length of stay prior to being shown into the exam room which was approximately 10 to 15 minutes after my appointment time (I got there early enough to fill out the paperwork etc.) and also with the amount of time I had to wait once shown into the exam room. The rad tech who took my vitals and information was good; I forgot his name. Also the physicians assistant Shawna was professional and competent.

Needed urgent care again after severe coughing, etc. for days.Actually could have gone to my own primary but Golden Gate is so much better. They take my insurance, close by and spotlessly clean and welcoming.Crystal on phone and in person is great, the back office nurse (wish I remembered her name) was great, took time to take details but was personal and professional. Then Dr Martin, who is also great, professianal but human...the best !! thorough examination then diagnosis of acute bronchitis. Anti- biotics were prescribed and available to get immediately at front desk ( with no pressure to do so, Walgreens is right across the street)All in all could not recommend more.....much better than normal medical rigmarole.

This is my second time coming to this clinic. I made an appt for my son and although the appt was not right as scheduled, we waited only a very short time considering if we went to the ER or even a regular physician. We were greeted by reception warmly and she was very helpful and accomodating. From the nurse staff to the provider, we had a very pleasant experience. Â My son has autism and even with him be cranky because he wasn't feeling well and his level of patience being low and social anxiety on high, everyone was very so nice and comforting. The west portal office staff is amazing and I will continue to go to this office and will recommend them highly to anyone.

I got sick on a Sunday and did not want to go the the ER and wait to be seen. Luckily, the urgent care was open and able to see me right away. I was not able to make an appointment, those had been taken, but I was seen after a short wait. Â The NP was thoughtful and through. She diagnosed my bronchitis and gave me proper medication. She took a chest X-ray just to make sure I didn't have pneumonia. The staff there was very helpful and courteous.

I arrived for my 3:30 appointment today 10 minutes early. I didn't have to wait long to see the nurse, but ended up waiting almost TWO HOURS in the room to see the doctor. I came in with a simple issue and once the doctor was in the room, we spent literally less than one minute together. There were also problems with my prescription, apparently some info was missing from it. A two hour wait for an issue resolved in less than one minute is unacceptable.

The wait time here is HORRIBLE. I know how long it takes to do testing. I don't know what the staff is doing for the rest of the 45 mins....They are otherwise pretty nice, but they are wayyyyy to slow at processing things.

I am very disappointed Â with my visit this time! I came in 10 days ago complaining Â of a sore throat, come to know I had an ear infection. Came in got seen checked out it was Â amazing! This time however, I was told I had to pay 40$ more than my original Â 10$ Co pay, outraged I declined and immediately Â asked to speak to a manager. Even though there was no manager Â on duty they transfered me to another location. I spoke to the manager Â who was totally Â amazing btw, and he said as a curtosy this time I will be charged Â the 10$ and will be billed the rest. That settled Â it I was happy with what was said to me, I had no problem paying the rest I just didn't bring anything Â but 10$ anticipating that's what I was going to pay. The receptionist wasPi$$ed off, slamming clip boards down, making immature Â indirect Â comments the whole 20 minutes Â I had to wait to be called. She made my Â wait very uncomfortable, I couldn't believe Â how immature this grown woman was being. Like I was taking 40$ directly from her purse or something. Simply the worst experience Â ever!

I really appreciate the staff here. They are very friendly and helpful. I also like their online appointment system. I could make my appointment in the middle of the night. The interior design of the waiting area doesn't feel like a typical clinic, and made me less nervous.

My husband came here in the summer for bronchitis like symptoms. Â His insurance is Blue Cross/Blue Shield PPO through a federal employees program. Â We were told this coverage was accepted here. Â Five months later I got a bill for close to $500.00 saying he was not covered. Â Btw, payment needed to be paid within 5 days of receipt of this bill that I received on a Friday after work. Â On Monday I called my insurance company. Â The nice man I spoke with there got the billing department located in Southern California on the phone...a 3 way conversation. Â One half hour later the billing department seemed to understand how to complete the form correctly and how to send it to my insurance company. Â Well last night (Friday, November 20, 2015) I received a bill again...same bill, no coverage due on December 1, 2015. Â With the weekend and Thanksgiving holiday that gives me few days to get this to So Cal on time but first I will call again Monday morning because I know our coverage should take care of this. Â There are just really incompetent people working in billing who do not know how to complete forms correctly. Â I will never go back here or any other urgent care in SF. Â I have visited First Med in NY that has a similar operation when in need when there and never had this problem. Â The time I would wait in an ER is less than the time I will spend trying to get these people to do their job right.Today is January 3, 2016. Â Still no resolve. Â I have been having useless conversations w a billing supervisor, Karen in Southern California. Â She has informed me that my husband's insurance company has a backlog of claims due to a change in their system. Â REALLY. Â Just in this past month our covered family members have visited our general doctor, dermatologist, ENT doctor etc and all claims get processed immediately. Â I really want to get this off my plate. Â Can the owner give me his direct email? Â Maybe we can get somewhere with this!

The medical care I received was fine. The billing on the other hand needs to be improved. Somehow, despite having insurance, my copay was $50 and I was told that once insurance sorted it all out, I'd be refunded $40 so that my copay was only $10. Well, I finally got my refund 4 months later after multiple phone calls and people who kept assuring me that it was on its way or that someone needed to sign the check or some other excuse. The check I received last week was dated for early Nov...nice. Sitting on my refund waiting for me to forget?

My recent experience with Golden Gate Urgent Care could not have been better. I have not previously gone to an urgent care, and went to Golden Gate only after reading the many good Yelp reviews it received, and the many bad reviews of the other options in the area, especially the emergency rooms. I had intended to go to a hospital emergency room for my urgent problem, but took a chance on Golden Gate. What good fortune to find it, and to be seen by their head doctor, Kurt Kunzel MD. Rather than many hours waiting in an emergency room, I was seen by the doctor within a very few minutes. His expert and caring approach put me at ease, and his treatment took care of a serious condition in a few days. I am very grateful and will return here if and when necessary.

I came here almost a year ago (twice in 3 days) and ended up needing an IV and some IV fluids. I was glad there was a place nearby I could access without going to a busy emergency room. The staff (RNs, physicians assistants, and front desk) were friendly and prompt in their care. Their online scheduling is super convenient. Fortunately it was not busy when I went (about 9 or 10am on a weekend).

I just returned from this place and am very happy with my experience. Â I got in right away. Â The front desk ladies are terrific. Â The assistant who took my history was excellent. Â And the Nurse Practitioner I saw was also excellent. Â I have an eye infection, and they gave me the choice of getting a prescription for eye drops or selling them to me right there for $20. Â It was so convenient to just buy them and leave.An all-around great experience. Â They are also very convenient to West Portal Station.

Arrived a bit early for opening, but the staff was so kind and let me sit inside and fill out my paperwork. I was seen in a matter of 15 minutes which was spectacular. My nurse and doctor were both great and immediately called in all necessary prescriptions. I would definitely recommend this care center to others. Also very clean :)

I can't express how great Dr. Don McIntyre is. He was professional, did a quick and accurate diagnosis even though my previous visit was the same diagnosis but from a PC-A. He told me the truth and what would help & not. If you ever get him he's the man to go to! But he might not be around all the time. I wished he saw me the first time around so I didn't have to revisit. Â The wait wasn't too terrible like most other scheduled appointments.

The longest wait and worst service I've ever had a facility.I made an appointment for 10:30. Â I decided to go here instead of my doctor or the clinic because they could see me same day and had appointments available. Â Also, I was told it would take only 20 minutes to resolve my issue.When I arrived, I wasn't informed until I was midway through paying that the facilities copay had gone up to $50 from $30 since my last visit earlier in the month.Then, I was left in the room for an hour with nobody talking to me. Â Eventually, the doctor finally came in and said she had walk-ins come in while I was waiting - seriously?! Â What's the point of making an appointment if you don't see me during my appointment time and you also see walk-ins or people who don't make appointments before me? Â And making me wait an hour in a shut room is ridiculous and disrespectful.In all, the doctor saw me for 3 minutes and then a nurse handled the rest of my case. Â The doctor asked nothing extensive and asked me the same questions a nurse did. Â In all, I waited an hour to pay $50, see a doctor for 3 minutes and get the worst medical service I've ever received.This place should be ashamed of the "urgent care" they provide. Â I will not be coming back to this facility.
Clean and welcoming facilities, kind and attentive staff, honestly the best Dr. Appointment I've ever had.

This place saved my life. I had a badly swollen left leg and couldn't get a hold of my primary care doctor for a same day appointment. I called golden gate urgent care and was able to get a same day appointment scheduled. Once the Dr. Tucker saw me and heard all my symptoms, he said he wanted to rule out blood clot and sent me straight away to St. Mary's for an ultrasound. They called St. Mary's ahead and let them know I was coming. As it turns out, I had a DVT and PE in my lungs. If I had waited to be seen and continued on normal activities, things could have been fatal.Also, the staff was very friendly and caring. The place is very clean.

giving "health care" a rating is hard, because working in the field of health care is so difficult. Â But some things are just not acceptable. but you can tell when a place is open just to make money vs really wanting to see patients and help people.Unacceptable items: 1. having to wait almost an hour with an appointment2. selling prescriptions when you don't have a pharmacy license3. attempting to sell expired medications4. brushing off a patient when they are talking to you and asking a valid question5. not facing a patient when they are talking to you6. talking about non-professional things where patients can hear everythingOn a Sunday morning I made an appointment on line for 10:30 and arrived more than on time. Â There were a lot of people "signed in" before me on the sheet, there is a space on there that indicates weather you have an appointment or not, Â but many Â of the people signed in before me indicated that they had an appointment and went in to see the doctor before me. Â So, I was a little frustrated that I did not get seen before those without an appointment. Â I didn't get seen until after 11:20 and then I still waited. The doctor comes in and barely does an assessment and was very quick with me. I didn't expect much based on the other yelp reviews that I read, and this is not my primary care office so I know she has no plan to get to know me. She then offers to "SELL" me the prescriptions for $20 each. Â I declined her offer because I have great insurance Â that coves prescriptionswhen I left the exam room the doctor was sitting at a computer and I brought to her attention that the number of days I needed to take the ear drops was not written on the prescription Â (which is required for the Rx to be a complete order) and I also asked why I needed to apply the ear drops in both ears if I have an infection in only one ear, and the doctor's response was "the pharmacist will write all that out for you". worst of all, she would not even turn around and face me to talk to me. I found it to be very very rude. Â She just resumes talking to the other workers about the Super Bowl and all her plans for the day.After I going to and calling 6 pharmacies in the area, 4 did not even sell the ear drops and the other Â 2 pharmacies had the ear drops for Â $65 (with my insurance) or $290 without. Â It really made me question how this urgent care could have the same ear drops for $20, if everyone else was selling them for much more. Â but I figured I would just go back there to buy themI returned the next day (Monday) and I told the receptionist that I was unable to get Â my prescription at a reasonable price and that I wanted to buy it there. Â She then starts talking to me about cough syrup, but I was there for ear drops. Â I asked her why they had a much lower price compared to the other places. Â She could not answer. Â She went into the back and I could hear her talking to the Doctor that saw me the day before. Â when she came back she stated that all the medication was expired and that she had nothing for me. I then asked her: "so, yesterday they were going to sell me expired medications?" her answer "well, we don't really think that the medication expires on that date, its still good". Â I was shocked!!!!  Â I told her I needed another ear drop prescription that I can take to the pharmacy, something more common. Â She went back and she came back with a paper and once again it did not have the number of days listed on the order. Â I asked if the doctor could write down the number of days (which is required for the Rx to be a complete order). Â Her answer was "we can't help you with this anymore, you need to go to your primary care office or somewhere else" Â I checked with the state, and they do not have a pharmacy license which is REQUIRED to sell any prescriptions. Â And they boast that they have Â UCAOA Accreditation. Â which is voluntary non required any urgent care can get this by just paying some money. It is not required and obviously doesn't insure quality of care or non expired medications, or correct prescription orders. Â  My experience was not good, and I would not recommend this place and I would not go back, ever. Â They also have a really weird picture of a couple on the beach taking a selfie, and a statue of a dog with a cheerleader outfit, it's strange.

Very professional and clean environment. I came in with an appointment so I guess the only potential drawback would be if someone were a walk-in. Unknown wait time. But aside from that, I definitely trust this clinic for future visits.

I was feeling very sick when I arrived at the urgent care facility and was immediately put at ease by Rosalind and her expertise, kindness, and respect. She obviously knew her business, and it was comforting knowing that I was in good hands. I was impressed with her ability to multi-task at the front desk and still be able to provide excellent customer service. Thanks Rosalind for making my experience a pleasant one!
I made an appt through their website and it was easy. Â This is the third time I have been there. Â I would recommend it for people going. Â The wait wasn't too long.

I've come to golden gate urgent a couple of times and my experience have been positive. I've also taken my family and boyfriend here and they love the place. They rather come here for sudden onset of discomfort than their PCP. The facility is super clean and spacious. The staffs are very nice and helpful. And they have a great smile all the time even when it's very busy. It's nice to have friendly healthcare professional treating you when you are feeling sick. I think I waited 30 mins during my last visit without an appointment. But you can always schedule an appointment. The staff is very thorough while they are seeing you.

I didn't even know this office existed until I was on the phone with my insurance company asking for urgent care offices near me. Â They listed a few other places that sounded sketchy. Â I called here, they had an appointment for me a few hours later, and I was able to wait in the comfort of my own home before heading over.The office is lovely, clean, and modern. Â The staff was very friendly and efficient and the NP was very caring. Â I normally go to One Medical, but the last time I went they sent me somewhere else for x-rays and didn't want to make multiple trips.Completely recommend this office. Â Modern medicine is amazing!

These guys were knowledgeable, friendly, and quick to serve. I was so happy with the service and treatment, and enjoyed chatting with the team that helped me. What a great group! Easy online appointments, insurance accepted, and they have a sense of humor to boot. Highly recommended!

I try to avoid going to the doctor and ER whenever I can because it's usually a nightmare and a time sink. Â I was able to put a request for an appointment in that morning. Â I decided to drive over early just in case and they sent me in right away (I was lucky, there wasn't a huge line). When the situation turned out to be more serious, they had a relationship with St. Mary's radiology for a CT Scan which I got about 1 hour later, no waiting in the emergency room. Â I had my results and my prescription about 6 hours from the time I walked in the door from Golden Gate. Â My long awaited trip to New York wasn't ruined due to what could have been a very serious illness had it not been taken seriously. Â Then just this week, Golden Gate followed up with a phone call to make sure I was ok, and clarifying the follow ups required. Â I'm quite happy with the service and will plan to use them again.

Golden Gate urgent care is an excellent facility for patients with flu, asthma, coughs , muscle pain. Kids colds and flu as well. Very nice staff and wait time is not too long. Prescriptions are written there and there's a pharmacy across the street. Great addition to the neighbour hood. I've been there 3 times now and it's always been pleasant.

We're traveling on vacation. Wife woke with a swollen eye and we checked out Yelp for nearest urgent care. This one popped up first with a convenient link to an easy to use online appt system. We called ahead for parking advice, and found unlimited parking on neighborhood nearby, just as promised. We arrived to find a spotless, modern waiting room, a friendly receptionist, and with my wife's name at the top of the appt schedule on the TV display. Filled out a couple forms and were in and out to see doc, get eye drops and hit the road within 30 minutes. Glorious urgent care experience! Thank you, Golden Gate West!

I've gone three times in the last eight months for a horrible reoccurrence of tonsillitis. Melanie and the other doctors and nurses are so kind, knowledgeable, and efficient. I'm always feeling better within 24 hours. The wait isn't bad if you sign up ahead of time online. Very very clean. The staff really make every visit worth it!
Such a nice staff! Get extremely comfortable and welcomed. Say hello to Roxie at the reception desk when you come in! Everyone is so friendly and helpful!

So far so good... I came here for urgent care when I couldn't stop coughing. I was seen by a PA (physician assistant) in a matter of minutes. They took a $50 copay and I haven't gotten any other bills yet. It was quick, to the point, got a prescription and contingent plan in case the cough didn't go away from the inhaler and cough meds. The front desk was nice, patient, and efficient. Why try to get an appointment with a doc for weeks when I can just come here.

First time visiting here as my primary doctor was out of town. Excellent overall service. The nurses were knowledgeable and thoughtful. The waiting room is beautiful with high end designer furniture you would find in a high end hotel lobby. I never look forward to see a doctor but at least they do everything they can to make it hassle free and pleasant.

Excellent service doesn't begin to describe my experience. Check in with Rosalind and Dominique was great, very professional and courteous. Very low wait time. Rosalind even checked on my car while I waited! Â Heidi (my nurse) was friendly and sympathetic. Shawna (PA) was awesome, gave exceptional care and genuinely cared about my injuries! Â Ken, X-ray tech was polite and helpful. All around 5-star service. They even provided my prescription so I didn't have to find a pharmacy. As an NP, I can be very critical, but I would recommend to anyone in need of urgent care.

My first visit there yesterday with a strep throat. The staff there was prompt, attentive, and very thorough. I thought for some reason I'd be waiting there forever (like in an actual er), because I was a walk in, but was seen no more than 10 min after filling out paperwork. I highly recommend this group. I actually have a prescription card through CVS (which there isn't one in West Portal), but there is a Walgreens right across the street otherwise so the location is excellent. They'll be seeing me again....well....hopefully not as my health gets better...lol. But indeed highly recommended.

Dr Martin & a sweet female nurse made my first experience at golden gate urgent care so fantastic. I came in with a going-on-3-day migraine and they were so kind & accommodating. They gave me an anti-nausea pill right away (thank god) & a pain-killing injection as well as a prescription for more pain meds (THANK GOD). I left there a few hours ago & I feel so much better. I don't know what I would've done without this successful urgent care visit, which by the way, I went as soon as they opened & only had to wait about 20 min (THANK GODDDDD). Thank you GG urgent care- you're rock stars.

I gave a 1 star rating only because there is nothing less than 1 star. After my last visit at this Urgent Care I swore I would never go back, the Doctor who I had the pleasure of seeing told me "I really need to get a primary care physician," which I have but it was after hours on a Friday night. Â He ended the visit by telling me I am either severely depressed, have a brain tumor or M.S. Â After a good chuckle, I made a promise I would never go back. Â Fast forward to today when my son playing on the playground caught his toe on a slide and received a pretty gnarly laceration. Â I didn't think it needed stitches but because it was received on a slide and promptly covered in sand I thought it should be looked at. Â So, against my better judgement we went returned to Golden Gate Urgent Care in West Portal, and before I was yelled at this time, I signed in as a walk-in on the iPad. Â It was very crowded but feeling confident that the reason the iPad is there is to help with registration, we sat down. Â We waited patiently as we watched his name move up the list and his wait times diminish. Â He got to the 0-20 minute wait and I waited for my name to be called to provide co-pay etc. Â Then the Â patient listed after him was called up and his name disappeared. Â I waited and asked why, and was told that they are getting a room ready so I sat back down. Â Then the nurse came and called the person who came in after us and again I went back up. Â "ma'am your son did not disappear you will be called all is fine." Then I hear a bit of chatter as the two women decide neither of them had checked us in and then they called me and started lecturing me on how to check in. Â I said I signed in on the iPad but she said that check in doesn't count and doesn't trigger any notification that we are there. Â THEN WHY IS IT THERE?!?! Â I tried to talk to her, as her voice elevated higher and higher and she ended by telling me "that is how a doctor's office works, you check in." Well we checked out for the last time and went to the ER at CPMC, we were treated like humans, my co-pay wasn't that much more than what GGUC charges, we received great care and my son waited all of about 5 minutes to be seen by someone who knows what she is talking about. Â As we left Urgent Care my son said "I thought doctors were supposed to help you, not yell at you." Â Nice work Urgent Care
Great place, clean, modern, nice people and great follow-up.Thanks!

Had to get a tetanus shot after a run in with a rusty nail. Called to find out if they could assist. They could. I was greeted by friendly front desk staff. I was seen within ten minutes of arrival. I revived my shot, my follow-up instructions and was out the door in 25 minutes. I will return if the need arises. Thanks for making an unpleasant task quick and efficient.

I am extremely pleased with the quality of care I received today. Â I fell two weeks ago and cracked two ribs. Â I was in terrible Pain. Â I finally caved in and sought help. Â Boy was I glad that I chose urgent care! Â  I saw dr. Kalie dove-Maguire. She was warm, kind and has a wonderful bedside manner. Â I was so impressed I asked if she could be my primary care physician, but alas no. Â :-( Â also the X-ray technician was excellent! Â I would definitely go back. Â I will be recommending golden gate urgent care to all my friends.

I usually don't post on yelp but after my experience here at Golden Gate Urgent Care, I felt the need to share my experience with other potential patients as well as the business owner. I came in at 7:20 so that I could be seen by a physician as soon as possible. Considering the place opens at 7:00 am. The first thing I noticed when I walked in was an empty lobby with one employee working behind the counter. I believe her name was Ronnie. I don't know if I caught her at a bad time or if it was early, but her attitude was terrible to say the least. I had a few questions regarding some information on my prescription and the way she talked to me made me feel belittled. Running a business, the owners as well as the staff should have the customers best interest in mind and should have an ultimate goal of making them feel better when they leave their establishment. This was not the case. If anything I felt worse than when I came in. The only good part of the experience was talking with the doctor. She was really helpful and sincere with my problems. If only this type of behavior was the standards for all their employees. The only reason why I gave this place two stars instead of one was because of the helpful doctor. Sadly, I will not be coming in here again.

Second time I have come to the golden gate urgent care and I have never had a bad experience. The staff is amazing, I saw Doctor William Tsu who was super professional and had me feeling better by the next day!

It's better to just go either to your regular hospital's ER or at least some ER rather than here unless it's for an extremely minor issue. Â At least at the ER one will be sure that one will be seen. Â Although we were told on the phone that this urgent care facility does treat pneumonia it actually depends on how the severity of the patient's symptoms. Â In my mother's case, however, they determined that due to her vitals showing low oxygen levels that they could not/would not even treat at all. From that point it was if she were a pariah. Â Thus, the doctor on duty burst into the exam room, alarmingly told us that he'd be ordering an ambulance immediately to take my mother to whichever hospital's ER we chose. Â He was very adamant that we leave their facility immediately. Needless to say it was very abrupt as we definitely got the message: Â My mother was a huge liability being on their premises. Â We could have just driven to our regular hospital's ER instead of wasting time at the urgent care facility had we realized it would be useless to take her there; we could have saved ourselves embarrassment too. Â Instead of my mother being treated we were all now the focus of everyone's attention from the gawking waiting patients in their lobby to the passersby on the sidewalk. Â My mother was ushered out on the stretcher in full view of everybody with us in tow. Â Thankfully the EMT's were two of the best ever.UPDATE: Â So the moron who is rating all the negative reviews with a "Funny" rating must work here. Â So sad that so-called professionals actually have childish attitudes and cannot accept criticisms.And most importantly: Â Go straight away to the nearest Emergency Department rather than to waste precious time at this (or any other) urgent care facility. Â At least the ED will definitely not be unable to or be incompetent in administering needed treatment.

I loved being able to see how long I had to wait by watching a leader board.After being triaged, I had to wait for quite some time, but the staff kept checking in on me and even offered to include me on their coffee run at one point.When the doctor came in to help me out, she was efficient but careful, and explained what she was going to do. Â This is the second time I've been to GG Urgent Care and I will definitely hit them up the next time I need help.

My doctors office was closed and my asthma medicine was not workingso I booked an appointment on-line. Quick, efficient, combination of ER and doctors office.They did a chest x-ray and EKG put me on the nebuelizer and prescription.On my road to recovery. Â Clean and less wait time. I am glad Brown & Toland recommended this Urgent Care instead of going to emergency.Would definitely utilize again if needed.Great staff from front desk to the RN, lab tech and PA

Just went here for a bladder infection, on a Monday evening, 5:40ish. I was out in less than an hour with a prescription for antibiotics. The service was great and everyone was really nice (to me personally). I didn't give them 5 stars because I heard the people working there talking about me, while I was waiting in my examination room (with the door shut) and they were outside. One woman asked another for my name, then my height (5'5"), then my weight (100 lbs), and the other woman answered and then joked that my bmi was 4 and then they laughed. I thought it was a bit unprofessional. But I would definitely come back again and recommend this place to anyone.

Overall, very good 3 visits for the boyfriend and I over the last couple weeks. A few small hiccoughs here and there, but nothing major. The nurses and doctors are great. Glad to have this place nearby. We went to both the W Portal and Lombard locations. Both are fine but W Portal also has the little village to hang out in, very nice. The only negative thing I'd say is that I wish they gave us more specific and detailed directions & info as we left, as we couldn't remember everything they told us to do/ watch for etc.

I was shocked by how extremely rude the receptionist, Rosalind, was. She made me cry! What an awful way to treat patients, what a horrible attitude. No service mindedness whatsoever. She really seemed to hate her job and hate all the patients. Do not go here.
This is the facility I can rely on when I need non emergency care while my family doctor is not available. Â The staff is friendly. Â The doctor and the X ray technician are very good.
Wonderful experience. In and out in 1 hour with my 7 year old. Professional and courteous.
Quick, in and out medical care when you need a doctor appointment on weekends. Takes Cigna, charges $50 at time of office visit (worth it). Walgreens across the street.

This location feels like our neighborhood dr's office. Love the online scheduling! We've always had prompt, thorough, and quality care. Highly recommend! We've been for stitches, x-rays, a sty, and a mild concussion.

Excellent appointment system that our family has used only for same day appointments so far. Efficient check in. Exams are efficiently aimed at addressing the urgent need. Diagnoses for our fairly common ailments (such as eat infections) were quick and prescriptions electronically sent to the Walgreens across the street (we use the West Portal location) for practically a one stop solution. The entire facility was clean from reception, play area, to exam room. Last but not least is the reception and care staff were all very nice, helpful, and efficient while solving our immediate healthcare needs.

I've been to other Golden Gate Urgent Care location but this location in West Portal was where I received excellent customer service. I was seen here on a Sunday and I can say the nurses here are very professional, take time to hear your health concerns without rushing you, really organized and they definitely know what they are doing. After being triaged, I was seen by a very compassionate provider right away who reviewed again my health concerns and prescribed me with medications that will help me feel better. This facility is also very clean, very organized, very friendly staff which puts you at ease and positive energy all the way. I was in and out within an hour. Thank you for an awesome experience!
Wow, best customer service I've seen in a long time. This place was quick and hassle-free! Would recommend going here above any other urgent care place.
Dr. Ong and the staff at Golden Gate Urgent Care, West Portal went above and beyond to make me feel taken care of.

Came here since I saw it opened and it was the nearest urgent care to me. Service is amazing, everyone is so friendly it's almost scary. Very clean and modern appearance and feel of being in there. This was also the only urgent care I've ever been to where I didn't have to wait to see a doctor, I was put in a room immediately. Convenience was awesome because although they had my medication ready on site, there's also a walgreens right across the street. Cons of this place were the lack of people, pretty awkward getting such good service by yourself. Also, the walls are very thin, even with closed doors you're able to hear about other patients, which is unfortunate. I'll definitely come here again though, due to proximity and service!

I needed some medical attention and walked in at 7:45pm (15 minutes before they close), and without complaints - GGUC provided excellent medical attention and care. The facility is brand new and very clean. I felt comfortable and at ease the whole time. I was in and out in 30 minutes with a diagnosis and prescription. Easy. Efficient. Friendly. I even got a flu shot. Dr. Martin is awesome, too!

I had an allergic reaction that came on very quickly, and I didn't feel I had time to get to an ER. The staff was able to get me in, check me out, and send me to the pharmacy for what I needed to recover. It was super scary, and they took great care of me. I am so glad they are in our neighborhood!
Great service but a little slow after being checked in and taken back to a room. That being said, I would return for future urgent care needs.

I have been a customer of West Portal GGUC for the last 4 years and I like their personnel very much, but this review is not about their personnel at all. I had the issue with GGUC Billing Department last year and it took 6 months and extensive efforts on my side to get my money back. That episode did not make me feel good about their relationship with their customers/patients. I was ready to give GGUC a second chance since I like their doctors and went to their office this Monday, registered as a walk in like always and waited patiently to give my information and pay at the registration desk just to find out from the office screen that my estimated wait time is between 6h 30 min to 6h 45 min. Gentlemen before me asked the same question and walked out. Â I was shocked by the wait time-higher than regular ER, and left the office. On the way home I drove by Dignity Urgent Care, decided to give it a try and was in and out of the office in 20 min with all lab work done and my prescriptions in my pharmacy! Wow! That was a new shocker! I was used to waiting of about 30-50 min in the waiting room of GGUC (apart from this Monday's experience), than another 30-40 min for the Dr's arrival after the nurse checks my vitals and another 10-15 min for my prescriptions after all. I have realized that all this time I could have chosen other practice where my 2h of life would not be spent in waiting. I wrongly assumed that the amount of time I spent waiting was more or less the same in every urgent care. I was so wrong. I have learned my lesson and will not repeat it. It is not ok to have your patients wait in the waiting room sick and infectious for hours. And I had occasions when I would register online, schedule my appointment, show up on time for it just to find myself waiting again those 30-40 min (so decided to stop registering online). Taking into the consideration my new knowledge of efficiently run services GGUC is not anymore on the top of my to go list when I seek medical help.
They are lifesavers. Great care and service. I really appreciated everything, especially when you are not feeling your best. Fantastic staff all around.

Upping this to three stars because the receptionist Monica is a rock star and managed to call in a favor and got my bf Â that early appointment with our pcp same week. Â Monica, you rock and I apologize for ever having doubted you. :o)

I never thought I'd be writing a review about an urgent care facility, but this place is deserving. After my friend had a mishap sliding down a banister, she woke up to find her foot beyond swollen. We headed to this location and were pleasantly surprised by the beautiful waiting room, kind staff, array of beverages and magazines, and proximity to a pharmacy. Best urgent care experience I've ever had!

After a billing ordeal that finally got settled about two years after my urgent care visit, in which Golden Gate did not seem to be able to communicate effectively with my health insurance company, I regret having gone there.

Great staff. Very friendly and for an urgent care place, the wait was minimal I was a walk-in). The doctor takes time to talk to you and will explain everything. I will definitely be back when needed. Also nice to have a Walgreen's across the street if you get a prescription. Cost was very fair (I don't have insurance).

My husband came in with a finger infection due to the fact his PCP was out of town. Â We requested our appointment online which was super easy. Although we came in slightly early, Monica the receptionist, made us feel like at home. Dr. Wu was awesome -- he and his staff took the time to make sure nothing serious came out of his injury; they actually took x-rays and after cutting his finger out, they took samples from the infection for the lab. My husband came out of it with flying colors. We most definitely will be back if either one of us run into any minor emergencies such as this.

This was my second trip here with my daughter. My husband has been here. We have referred friends here. The staff is consistently friendly. The interventions are effective. I couldn't ask for better. And my daughter was wild this time and the nurse and doctor were patient and fun.

They were incredible! I cut myself 3 hours before my flight to Canada and they got me in and out with 7 stitches and a tetanus shot in no time. I made my flight and the stitches are healing very well. On top of that everyone was extremely friendly and the place was very bright and clean. Definitely recommended!

I can not say enough great things about Golden Gate Urgent Care. They saw me within 20 minutes of walking in the door. The staff was kind, compassionate and efficient. The facility was clean as well as warm and welcoming. I will definitely refer all my friends to this place.

I had no idea that going to urgent care could actually be a pleasant experience. Walked in without an appointment on a Saturday morning, they got me in and out in 40 minutes, super quick and friendly on the administrative side, very thorough on the medical end. Everyone was caring and compassionate. Got the medication I needed right there, didn't have to deal with waiting for a prescription to be called in. Highly recommend these folks!!!

This place is incredible. I was quite ill and, as fate would have it, Dr. Melanie Martin was at the clinic to help me. I had never been to urgent care before and expected the treatment to be pretty dismissive, but Dr. Martin was the exact opposite. She was concerned, thorough, profoundly empathetic, kind, and every other good adjective you can think of. The whole staff is great here. By the amount of compassion they show, you'd swear that it was a family practice office where all the staff has known you for years. I can't say enough great things about this place, and especially about the utterly wonderful Dr. Martin.

Beautiful, clean place. I came here when I accidentally (and stupidly) sliced my thumb with a very sharp knife while washing the dishes. I didn't have insurance, so I avoided the emergency room, hoping to save $. Not a lot of people were in when I got there and Ken immediately attended to me. I was panicking and nervous, but he did his best to keep the mood light and it definitely helped me relax. I was then checked by Dr. Martin, who was very sweet and reassuring the entire time. I ended up getting stitches, which sucked, but I really felt cared for and in good hands. I was afraid I'd have to pay close to $1,000 for everything, but only ended up paying less than $400. Not too bad for someone without insurance who had to get stitches done! I was very satisfied and impressed with the service and the entire establishment in general. I would highly recommend Golden Gate Urgent Care to anyone who needs immediate medical attention.

I live in the area and just noticed this facility about a week ago. I was battling a cough for over 3 weeks and went to my primary care doctor who said my chest sounded great and I did not need Â to take an Xray or any antibiotics, just an inhaler. My coughing got so bad, I remembered seeing this facility and I called. There were no more appointments, just walk ins. I walked in at about 5:10pm. I was seen by Joselle and there was a male nurse who took my vital signs as well. They were both great. Joselle had me take an xray, all to find out I had lung infection, pneumonia. I was prescribed all the medications I needed and two days later, I feel a lot better than I have been feeling in almost a month. The facility is immaculate and very clean. The staff was very nice to me. All this and I was out by 7:20pm. My daughter went in the next day and received the same kind of service and was out pretty quickly.

The Clinic is very clean and modern and the doctors are great. The front office staff is a different story. They are rude and very dismissive. I called today to inquire about a vaccine that is and should be covered under insurance. My inquiry was quickly dismissed and I was told that I would have to pay. It wasn't until I insisted that I spoke with my insurance company and I was told I could come to there facility and it would be covered. Finally, I spoke with someone else that agreed it would be covered. Sadly, the first person either did not know or did not care, but unfortunately the attitude reflects badly on the facility. This facility is also very expensive!

Would be one star, if not for the receptionists--I went in with a broken tooth and jaw swelling, which I knew was the cause of my pain. At the moment, I'm two weeks from potentially getting hired fulltime at a new job with insurance, but until then, I literally cannot afford to take days off (it will hurt my chances of getting hired). So, I went in, hoping to get checked out and get some antibiotics to hold it off until I can actually get into a dentist. About fifteen minutes after checking in, the receptionist told me the doctor wanted to do a quick examination to see if she could even treat me before they charged me. The doctor in question was very brusque, and poked and prodded the swollen area in a way that took the pain up from a 6 to a 10, before dismissing me and telling me she wasn't going to treat me. When I asked if I could at least get examined to get a prescription for antibiotics to provide some relief until I could get into a dentist, she still refused, insisting that she wasn't going to do anything for me, and that I would need to go the SF General's clinic for treatment. She examined me just around the corner of the reception desk with next to no privacy, which was bad practice. Ultimately, the receptionists gave me both the card to their personal dentist that took care of emergencies, and directions to SF General, where they treated me without question (although they're just as confused as to why she even refused to give me an antibiotic prescription).
I received a call soon after my last visit. Â They were very apologetic and moved quickly to remedy the situation. Â I appreciated this very much. Â Excellent effort on customer service, thank you.

Came here for an eye infection and my regular doctor wasn't available. Â First time going to GGUC and I thought the visit was very pleasant. Facilities were clean and the staff that I interacted with were really nice. You can make an appt online.. Mine was at 1240.. arrived on time, waited about 30 minutes to see the PA. Total of about an hr of being there..not that bad. Would go back again if I had too.

Second time I've been here. Different doctors, great visits both times. Â Got diagnosis and meds within an hour. You can evenly go across the street to Walgreens to get meds. Med Asst. friendly, helpful. Facilities clean. Online appointment was easy. Check in a breeze.

All SFSU students must go to here instead of SFSU medical center! I had a cyst on my eyebrow, so I went to SFSU medical center since I am a SFSU student. My doctor at SFSU didn't know how to treat a cyst and he push it really hard and broke it... You know what happens, it got really bad and I had to go to different hospital as emergency. Luckily, I found Golden Gate Urgent Care and met Dr. Martin. She was very professional and explained every details about cyst and instructed me how to treat it. Also, she introduced me a surgeon because It is really bad as I have to take it off from my skin. Eventually, I paid $20 for medical consultation and $10 for antibiotic. I was very happy because I got great service with very low cost. I really recommend SFSU students and others to go here if you have a health problem. Thanks Dr. Martin!!

I went here for the first time last weekend. It was easy to get a same day appointment, I was seen on time and didn't wait long at all, everyone was very nice and had a great bedside manner. I felt like they cared AND I got great care. I have to say, this was in every way a superior experience to my primary care physician. Thank you!

I am posting here the review I wrote for the Market Street Golden Gate Urgent Care. West Portal gets five stars because they fixed a mess that Market Street made. From appointment to getting stitches removed, the entire staff here was compassionate and helpful, the whole process (appointments, check in, etc.) was great, and the care was excellent. I would absolutely recommend coming here if you have medical care that does not require a visit to the ER, but does require medical attention. If you want to know why I am recommending this place, read on. This is what happened at Golden Gate Urgent Care Market Street:I cut the inside of my thumb at the joint finger pretty badly on a Friday afternoon. Not wanting to sit in an ER for what was sure to be several hours, I decided to give one of these Urgent Care facilities a try. Golden Gate on Market Street was not far from our home, so we made an appointment (very convenient) and went down at the appointed time. The check in was easy. They took my insurance, estimated the cost, and asked for payment, which I made with a credit card. The chart that lets you know how long you have to wait meant you didn't have to sit there and wonder when you'd get in, wait the requisite polite time before you go ask the person at the front desk, etc. was great. When it was my turn, I went in, they did the check, cleaned the wound, etc., and then said my options were stitches or glue. The PA working on me said stitches are painful so he only recommended them for someone like a fulltime mother with three who's running around doing a lot of different things. I told him what my day looks like, including riding a bike to get around the city amongst other things. He said the glue would be just fine. I left about 45 minutes later with my finger glued. In about two hours, the glue had ripped and my finger was bleeding. By the next morning, it was a bleeding oozing mess. I called Golden Gate on Market and they were not really interested in helping me. When I insisted, I was put on hold until someone else came on the phone and said in an, "if we must" tone of voice that I could come down and they would re-glue the finger; it was too late for stitches. I asked if they could make an exception because the glue would not hold, and I was firmly told no. So then I asked, "What is the plan when the glue rips again?" Their response? "Well I guess you'll have to come back and we can glue it again or put Steri Strips on it." So here I am, bleeding finger, $180 lighter in the pocket, and dealing with this "don't bother us attitude." There was no way I was going back to a facility where I am marked as the difficult person making unreasonable requests. So hoping for a better outcome, and desperate, I made an appointment with the West Portal Golden Gate Urgent Care, and then I called them. I was lucky enough to get one of the nurse managers who was very nice, compassionate, and apologetic over my experience. She saw we had an appointment and said definitely come in, they could take a look and sort me out, and also she would note the account not to charge us. I had no objection to being charged again. I had insurance and they were going to have to do something to fix this mess. But she insisted. Fine. Once in the exam room, the nurse manager checked my thumb and agreed it was a mess, then the doctor checked it and concurred. The doctor said even though they don't usually do stitches after 24 hours, it was okay to do on a finger (and it was only about 28 hours since I gut it), and she would do it in this case because the finger would not heal otherwise. So, moving on, they removed as much of the glue as they could and cleaned the wound (OUCH), and then the doctor stitched the finger (more OUCH). I left with excellent instructions and all went well. I returned in 10 days to have the stitches removed. When I heard it was a PA doing it, I was concerned given my last experience with the Market Street PA who was either not interested in stitching, or not competent enough to see that only stitches would work. I was told this PA was excellent and I needed the stitches removed, so I went for it. The first thing she asked was what happened, and the second thing she asked was who glued it because she never would have glued this cut! So stitches removed. Ugly lumpy scar in place because of the delay with stitching, but finger is working again, I'm not a hand model, and the West Portal Team was great. Then I receive my EOB and discovered I only owed $98 dollars. Â So naturally, I expected a refund. What did I get instead?
