An unauthorized charge on my credit card, 25 days later. 15 minutes later I'm told that there is an overage and finance would review. The same lackadaisical attitude I received at Market Street. Hmm, you screwed up my care, you owe me money, you charge me more, and you know all of this but you'll just take it to finance for review. Not good.

I came in today having felt under the weather for a couple days. I was very happy to see how clean the facility was, how quickly we made it out of the waiting room and into a care room, how friendly and capable the nurse and doctor was, and how quickly we made it out of the place. As a bonus, we were able to play cute games on the iPads kept in the waiting area to keep us from getting bored too easily. Would definitely come again.

Where do I even begin? I was in SF last night to visit my dear friend that lives around the corner from this urgent care and attend my husbands company holiday party. After the party and while walking on Embarcadero, I fell really hard and landed right on my left patella. I had never been in so much pain in my life (and I've had 2 kids and c-sections). My husband had to carry me to get to a car so we could be seen at this facility since it was so close to where we were staying. I was the last patient of the day when I arrived. The receptionist (unfortunately I didn't catch her name) was so sweet and she got me an ice pack for my injury. I was called back within a few minutes and assisted by Ken. He was so nice and caring and then Amy arrived to administer more care. Between administering pain meds, x-rays and wrapping my knee, cleaning it, immobilizing it I was in and out of there in 30min or so. But, I felt so cared for and that I was in great hands. It's unfortunate that they closed as early as they did today because my friend needed an urgent care and was going to go to this location based on their treatment for me last night. I won't post a picture of how horrific my knee injury looks, hopefully I won't need surgery, but the staff here made sure I was well taken care of for the weekend until I can get I to see an ortho specialist. I highly recommend this facility for all urgent care needs. I wish it were closer to my house. Ken and Amy deserve all the best in the world. They are wonderful at their jobs and overall very caring people.
Absolutely best medical care in the city! I love the new office! the doctors and nurses are absolutely amazing! I seriously will go here every time I am sick. They are just the best!

This place is great! My son has asthmas and we are usually having to drive across town to get him to a pediatric ER for treatment. Now we drive 5 minutes to this wonderful place and he gets everything he needs! Dr. Martin was wonderful!

I highly recommend Golden Gate Urgent Care, it's convenient, the doctors and staff are excellent. Â My husband says he likes the care here better than his own doctor! Â In the past, making a same day appt with my doctor was virtually impossible and I've suffered through whatever was bothering me or worse, waiting hours and hours at emergency care. Â Woke up with a terrible sinus headache, wasn't sure if it was going to escalate so I made an appt within the next half hour and was in and out within 30 mins. Â A big thank you to Jullia, Simonette, and Dr. Kunzel for their excellent and professional care.

So impressed by Golden Gate Urgent Care. The entire staff were friendly from the first phone call to schedule an appointment to the PA and follow up. I called this Sunday morning and saw the PA within 30 minutes. Definitely the medical care facility to see when your primary care doctor's office is closed.
Everything about my experience at GGUC - from the moment I signed up online for a same-day appointment, to the moment I waved goodbye, and everyone I met in between - made me feel better.

I visited GG Urgent Care on a Wednesday morning for an acute skin condition, having seen the excellent Yelp reviews. Â I'm happy to say that the positive reviews are completely accurate! Â I waited only around 10-15 minutes to be seen, and received excellent care from Dr. Melanie Martin. Â She even called a few days later to check up on me. Â Even the front office is unusually nice, bright and sunny in a storefront setting. Next time I have cause to seek out urgent care, I'll return here without hesitation!

This past Sunday, I was in severe pain in my neck & back. I looked on line and located this company & location. They accept my insurance so I made an appointment. I arrived, completed the forms and they called me into a room. They took my pulse, temperature and blood pressure. And asked what my problem was. I explained to them. They left and said someone would be into examine me. She did and could not say what the problem was. She said that you have a sore muscle. Oh my. What a revelation! The exam took 10 minutes. And she called in a prescription to my pharmacy Â for a muscle relaxer. And that was it. What a waste of time, energy, money and resources. Thank goodness, I went to my doctor and after 3 minutes, he said I had a compressed nerve. I saw a chiropractor and he resolved the problem. The doctor visit and chiropractor visit was on Monday. If I were you. I would absolutely positively NOT come to this place. It is a rip off and the people do not know what they are doing. Someone should shut this place down.

I've been twice and am really impressed. Â Clean, new facility, and 99% friendly and knowledgeable. Also very little wait and you can make an appt. Â There is a women at the front desk (light hair) who is a bit short on customer friendship (like the old days, before service business's got it) but I certainly would recommend the medical facility. Â To the front desk women I suggest a smile, eye contact and a little patience. Thanks guys!

I was feeling so awful the past couple of days and a friend of mine recommended I go to Golden Gate Urgent Care. The staff was so friendly and patient. The nurses were very help and Doctor Martin was very helpful. Her main concern was making me better and gave me extra tips on how to keep from getting sick other than just using medicine. I am definitely going to recommend this place to people I know.

I had to use the Golden Gate Urgent Care's services today because I tripped while running and had a gaping hole in my leg. Â Monica was great when I called to inquire as to their hours. Â She was friendly and fun. Â When I arrived at 7 pm, I was seen in less than 10 minutes. Â Amy and Nina were a great team in washing out my wound, stitching me up, giving me a tentanus shot, and filling my prescription. Â The clinic is new and clean and hip -- and their choice of background music is great! Â Why can't all medical facilities be this great! Â Thanks to the entire team!
Great service! Â The clinic was very clean and the staff was extremely professional. I called ahead and made a appointment-- I was taken in right away! Â Well done.
Helpful, but not alternative pain meds if hydrocodone makes you ill.
Dr. Martin and all the staff are wonderful. Â Very easy to get to, not a ton of paperwork and caring, professional staff. Â Really happy they are in the neighborhood.

I came here about 2 weeks ago with horrible flu like symptoms. I was so sick I ended up fainting in the waiting room so of course was seen right away, which was probably the only positive thing about this visit. I was rushed to back and right away. Since I had been so sick an they figured I was dehydrated so they decided to give me a I.V. But is wasn't that simple after about 2 different people trying, and being poked about 5 times they had to call in a 3rd person to find a vein to put in the i.v, finally they got it in. After one bag they checked my vitals and decided I needed a second bag. During this time they never once did any blood work, my fever was going up, and my vitals were not normal. After the second bag my vein had collapsed so once again it took 3 people being poked multiple times to find a vein, but this time when they grabbed my armed they pulled it in the wrong direction over the bed twisted is and caused a excruciating pain and discomfort. ( 2 weeks later i am still dealing with the pain and can barely lift and move my arm normally). So now I am on my 3rd bag of fluids, still no blood work done, still can't figure out what is wrong with me, and now everything is getting worse and my fever is rising. After the 3rd bag they now decide I just have a stomach Virus, and decide to give me a 4th bag of fluids. I have now been here for 8 hours. I am exhausted at this point i am in pain and swollen from all the fluids being pumped in me. After the 4th bag is finished they check my temperature and vitals. I now have fever of 104! They debate about giving me a 5th bag but decide they are also all to tired and want to go home so they give me some nausea medicine tell and release me. The next morning I wake up and I can't breath, i am so swollen and in so much pain I have to call a ambulance and am rushed to the e.r and find out i had way more than a stomach virus and that I had strep in my blood, i was rushed to icu and even put on a ventilator. This urgent care could of cost me my life. No tests or blood work were ran. they just assumed. If they couldn't figure out what was wrong with me they should of relased me sooner and told me to go to the e.r instead of just playing the guessing game. I am very upset with the care i was given here. I also felt as if they were getting upset and frustrated with me because they couldn't figure out what was wrong with me and it made me feel uncomfortable as if i was a burden to be there. I will deff never be back here.

Easy to schedule an appointment so we weren't waiting in the office for hours! The office is clean, the staff was friendly and Dr. Martin was very helpful. Nice to have this medical care provider option in the community.
do not go here if you have with travel insurance. they will not treat you unless you pay them directly yourself.

This place is amazing. I could not get into my pcp and was able to see the dr there in 5 mins. Â Gorgeous facility, clean well run and amazing service. If you ever need urgent care, I cannot recommend this enough!

I would highly recommend that you do not go to this location unless you absolutely, absolutely have to. I have visited them three times now for unrelated issues and each time I left Â untreated. The first time, I was given Â antibiotics for what turned out to be a VIRAL infection (meaning the medication was of absolutely no use to me because viruses cannot be treated this way). The second time, I received a numbing shot to "drain" an infection on my finger--which actually ended up SPREADING my infection across my finger, because again, viral infections, shouldn't be treated this way--you would think a physician would know this--my doctor literally went on google to find out what infection I was experiencing. How comforting is that?? And the third time I was given eye drops for "pink eye" for what turned out to be an eye stye. The doctors here are inexperienced and sloppy (at best) in their diagnosis of their patients. Everyone is friendly but I am incredibly unhappy about feeling like I am dealing with professionals who pretend to know what they are talking about when they truly have no idea. I have come here as this location is close to my home, but I will not be doing it any longer. I urge you to find another location to avoid spending any kind of money on insufficient health service!! Save yourself the time & money!

I called the office and was given an appointment for 12:50. I arrived there around 12:35, checked-in, filled out the paper work and took a seat in the waiting room. I was finally shown in to a room at 1:30 where the nurse took my vitals and went on to inform me that it would be another 20-30 mins before the MD would show up. I was appalled as that would imply a 1 hour wait past my appointment time. I waited and waited till 2:15 at which point I lost my patience and had to threaten to leave. The MD finally came to see me at 2:30 (1hr and 40 mins after my appointment time) and was very apologetic and went on to tell me that they were severely understaffed. I do not blame him and was actually very satisfied with his examination. On the other hand, I do blame the owners who have instituted a system of bringing in patients but not staffing to appropriately attend to them. If I had known that I would be in their offices for 2.5 hrs total, I would have never gone there in the first place. (2 Stars only because the MD was very nice)

I recently moved to San Francisco and needed to see a doctor quickly. I found Golden Gate Urgent Care and could not be happier. The facility was brand new, staff was extremely friendly and the wait time was minimal. For anyone looking for a doctor fast I would recommend this facility.

I visited on the morning of the opening day at the West Portal location. Â I was told I was the first patient for their opening day. Â The entire staff was very welcoming and even offered me donut and coffee at the end of my visit. Â Dr. K was very patient and took time to address all my concerns. Â I highly recommend.

I've been a patient of Aaron Mccloud for over a year and felt inclined to leave a review given the extremely positive experience. His approach as a primary care provider is refreshing; the dynamic feels collaborative, helpful, and results-oriented. Office visits aren't rushed and he's particularly responsive to phone and email outside of appointments. Two thumbs up and a very big thanks! Hopefully this review helps another SF-resident find great care. Cheers.

Excellent doctors and care here however the administrative elements of this office are deeply flawed. They are unable to forward medical records efficiently. Have been trying for 3 months via faxes, phone calls, etc. It's a basic function of a medical office to handle medical records, but they seem to have no system in place.If you know you'll be living in SF and sticking to one doctor for a long time then I would recommend them. But if there's any chance you will be moving or changing doctors - beware! You may lose all your medical records or be unable to forward them.

I just became a patient here after leaving Kaiser (who I was with since 2007) and so far it's one of the best decisions I ever made. Â NP McCloud is the opposite of most modern Drs; he really listens, is honest and straightforward while also being caring and respectful, takes his time to get to know you and let you know him, and treats you like a relative equal--he doesn't have that "Drs disease" of ego and dismissive omniscience that I've run into so often (and especially at Kaiser). Â I am one of those patients who knows my shit, and I have run into so many situations with Drs where I have to feign ignorance and flatter their egos in order to get the best treatment--not so with McCloud. Â I felt like my input and knowledge of my own body, my own conditions and treatment options, were not only listened to but respected and considered. Â Unlike at Kaiser of course NP McCloud and Dr Hassler are free to practice without being beholden to Kaisers one-size-fits-all (and not very well) standards of care, which means they can start to effectively treat conditions that appear *before* they get severe--something that Kaiser for all it's big talk about preventative medicine will not do. Â McCloud and staff will work as advocates with your insurance company to make sure you get coverage for the right medications or equipment. Â  Even if you're not coming from a terrible practice like I am, these guys still stand far out from the average in their attitude and approach. Â I'm still in the very beginning of my relationship with this practice and decades of dealing with crap doctors still leaves me wary, waiting for the other shoe to drop. Â But so far, so very, very good

Dr. Miriam Sleight has been a wonderful provider and has treated me with compassion and an ethical approach to treating my complex set of medical issues. Even when I'm out of state for long periods of time (for family reasons) she makes sure that I have the prescriptions I need to stay healthy. I would recommend this practice to anyone seeking compassionate care from an excellent provider.

Optimus Medical Group has been my go to PCP for over a decade. I'm relatively healthy, but they have been there during any issues and concerns I have had. As I advance in age, they continue to provide, respond and care about me as an individual and offer suggestions for specialist care through their capable network. In a city, with so many people, it's a nice and welcome opportunity to have that level of interest and care. Thanks for all the current, past and continued care.

I would love to give this place 5 stars and probably would have if I had not met the nutritionist.I was experiencing constant headaches and hadn't yet chosen a primary doctor so, after reading Yelp reviews, I called this place. Â The receptionist explained that new patient visits with the doctor usually requires a month or more advance booking so, since I was in need of seeing someone ASAP, she would make an appointment with the P.A. instead. I saw Aaron McCloud who I adored (10 stars for him!). Â At first, I was scared to be examined by him because he's so clean and perfect looking (stylish clothing with perfectly polished shoes and neat hair) that I really didn't want him looking up my nostrils and into my ears since I'm sure I'm not as meticulous about up-keeping those areas as I would imagine him to be. Â But Aaron was so warm, friendly, and so easy to talk to that I quickly overcame any fear of being cruelly judged by him.So he examined me and concluded that the headaches were the result of smoke inhalation. Â He then checked to see if I had any other concerns. Â I did and after he addressed them, he recommended that I speak with the nutritionist, Margaret Davis. Â My consultation with Aaron was the most thorough and informative medical visit I ever had so I couldn't wait to meet Â Margaret. Â This is where things went down hill. Â I met with Margaret the next day. Â Margaret was the opposite of Aaron in appearance and attitude. Â She was impersonal, stand-offish & just plain uncomfortable to be around. Â She told me that it was not her job to work with me on my binge eating (something I specifically came to her about). Â Instead, she suggested that I work with a therapist and proceeded to recommend a generic (pamphlet ready!) diet plan that consisted of 3 square meals a day.What a load of baloney! Â First of all, I know that my binging is emotionally linked because I didn't start doing it until my mother (who has since passed) became terminally ill. Â So yes, I understood the importance of going to counseling to help me with my binging but she, a NUTRITIONIST, didn't feel that she should be addressing that issue whatsoever? Â She, a NUTRITIONIST, believes she can come up with an adequate diet plan to help me with my weight loss while refusing to address the issue that caused the weight gain to begin with? Â She, a NUTRITIONIST, didn't understand that because I've been a size 5 since I was 16 years old that my normal diet is probably not the problem and maybe my binge eating which began shortly before I stated gaining weight, may be the only issue that a nutritionist could address that might be of assistance to me. Â Really? Â I didn't expect her to get behind my emotional issues but I did expect some good, solid advice that addressed the issue that I was facing. Â Tell me methods I could use to help catch myself before binging! Â Tell me whether I should or should not avoid the types of foods that I tend to binge on! Â Let me know of ways that helped other clients avoid binging! Â Tell me ANYTHING that addresses the issue that caused me to NEED a nutritionist in the first place but don't dismiss the problem so that you can discuss your generic, useless plan that you had ready for me before you even sat down to talk to me. Â . Â What a load of baloney and waste of time . . .Final rating: Â go for the awesome P.A's and front desk staff but if you need help with weight loss and believe you might have difficulty controlling your eating or that you may have an obsession with controlling your eating, skip the nutritionist and consider one of these free support groups (which offer practical tips and advice in addition to support) instead:foodaddicts.orgfoodaddictsanonymous.orgBTW, my GYNECOLOGIST referred me to these organizations because, apparently, gynecologists are more well versed on binge eating than nutritionists are. Â Jeez Louise!

I feel weird writing a Yelp review on a doctor's office, but feel compelled to because I love this office so much. I have never loved a doctor's office more. Sometimes the wait can be a little long, but I feel like the level of care I always receive is top notch. When I switched my insurance from Kaiser to UHC, I found this place and immediately they found and diagnosed me with some fairly serious health problems. They're always great with referrals and their network seems to be pretty far reaching... and for areas they can't refer you to, they've always been extremely helpful in aiding in my search or at least pointing me in the right direction. The doctors and staff have always been extremely kind and empathetic and I always get the feeling like they truly care and want to help. Never have I ever had a primary care doctor that could treat such a wide array of issues nor have I had one that I actually enjoy going to see!

The best primary care physician experience I've ever had. I've been a patient of Aaron McCloud for over a year now and every time I visit, I am still surprised by how professional and helpful the experience is.Aaron McCloud sets the standard for patient care.

Saying this is the best doctor's office I've ever been to is an understatement. The staff is great and friendly, being a new patient, the whole process was very fast and easy, and it has a very welcoming atmosphere.I was seeing by Aaron McCloud (PA) and it's been the best experience I've had. He was very warm and knowledgeable, I didn't once feel Â dumb for asking a stupid question as he really seemed to be interested in my concerns.I highly recommend Optimus!

I like this place. My doctor Aaron is very patient and friendly when he explained how my neck pain might originate from and showed me possible ways to ease it. He also prescribed me extra meds to deal with my sore throat and coughing problems which lasted even after an urgent care visit.

I have to tell you that this group of practitioners keep s a very high standard. Dr Hassler found out the cause of my leg problem after an orthopedic surgeon couldn't do it. I like the professionalism and caring manner all the doctors exhibit and yay to Martin for all the jabs.I have not met the nutritionist.

IF you want to never have your phone called answered/returned and/or you want to have a staff that is unwilling to help......go to this group. Â I will never return to them after they wanted to make me go all the way to the offices for a simple prescription refill. Â Who are they kidding....bill my insurance company for a full visit for a prescription. Â I think not. Good luck.

After moving to San Francisco and beginning work downtown, I wanted to find a doctor that took my insurance and was not far away. After coming across Dr. Shawn Hassler's name in the listing something immediately felt like he was the one. And his office is two minutes away from my work. I made the appointment and went in.I received a warm welcome from the receptionist, and shortly after the doctors' Â assistant checked my vitals. The office has a very relaxed atmosphere with soothing music playing in the background, and comfortable chairs and even tea!A short time later I was greeted by one of the most warmest and hospitable men I've ever had the pleasure of knowing. Dr. Hassler is kind and patient, yet very thorough and detailed. And yeah he's incredibly attractive too! I can come with a novel full of questions and each one is answered with precision; I never leave unsure about anything.This is an incredibly lofty-sounding review, but for having never had a primary care doctor before and then finding a doctor with the best qualities I could possibly expect and many more I never expected, of course I'm gonna be incredibly excited to share my experience. He's been there when I need him, and has a great network of specialists for other wellness needs.

Working in the medical field myself, I am extremely picky when it comes to finding a physician. Â I moved to the city not too long ago and needed to find a primary care doc and I found Greg, the physician assistant. Â He was wonderful and to be honest, more thorough than any doctor I have been to.I will definitely be referring my friends and family to him.
Great doctor's office. In and out - Aaron was very attentive to my concerns and needs. I'll be sticking with these guys for the long haul.

I'm disappointed with this outfit. I came for a simple check-up, was seen by an assistant (not even a doctor) -- they screwed up the billing which resulted in a $350 bill that I couldn't convince them to adjust. Then they had the guts to send me a letter asking for a $100/year voluntury contribution to help them run the business.

This group of professionals truly are fantastic. Â They have all the technical competence necessary for truly excellent medical care. Â What makes them really special is that, like the other reviewer stated about Greg (we see him too), they really do care about you as a person. Â You're not treated as a condition or disease or an organ, you're treated like person and you are genuinely cared for. Â A lot of doctors talk about the patients they "take care of," but what they really do is just treat diseases and maladies. Â This group, however, really does take care of you.
Dr Greg Sauers is attentive and so helpful. This is the first medical group I've Â come across in California that I would highly rate....and they are humble and kind. I believe they actually care!

Parents, or soon-to-be parents, if you are considering Getzwell Pediatrics, let me tell you this wholeheartedly: joining Getzwell has been one of the best decisions we have made as parents. We have been a part of the practice for almost 5 years, and we have 2 girls. Before joining Getzwell we were part of another pediatric practice when our first baby was a newborn, and let me tell you the outstanding differences between Getzwell and most of other pediatric practices:1. If you need to help after hours or on weekends you can call and take directly to a provider. I didn't really understand how incredible this was until we needed it. Most other practices have you talk to an advice nurse hotline, which is helpful, but they can not diagnose or prescribe anything. Talking directly to a provider can save hours of waiting in a crowded urgent care clinic. 2. All 4 providers are exceptional. We have seen both Dr. Getzelman and Dr. Glynn, as well as both nurse practitioners Alexa and Rachel. All are excellent! They go above and beyond. Dr. Glynn took the time to email me some ear oil recipes for my daughters ear infection after I spoke with her on the phone. Alexa let me email her photos of my daughters rash over the weekend to make sure that the medicine was working. Dr. Getzelman took the time to email me some supplements she recommended for me personally even though I'm not a patient. Rachel has taken my call after hours and she is equally patient, kind, and very sharp. 3. You get an hour for well child appointments. This is amazing!! Most practices the providers are rushing in and out and don't have much time for questions- but here, you have plenty of time to ask about anything related to your child's health.4. No crowded waiting rooms. Have you never had to sit in a waiting room with coughing kids, runny noses and crying babies? Trust me, it can be really hard. At Getzwell they get you right in at your appointment time- I've never waited in the waiting room with anyone else. My only wish is that I could be a patient here too! Getzwell is truly outstanding. If you schedule a consultation appointment you will get a chance to see for yourself how great it is.
Elite 2021

I can't say enough about Dr. Glynn. Â She is a rare gem. Â As a psychotherapist with a deep knowledge of early childhood development, finding a pediatrician for our daughter was not an easy task. Â I had high standards. Â Crazy high. Â Since we moved from the city to Marin we have been able ti stay part of the GetzWell family by visiting the Union Street location. We adore Dr. Glynn! She is always incredibly patient and attentive to our daughter and her questions, along with ours. She is straightforward, curious, and willing to go the extra mile to get to the root of health concerns. She is always available to answer emails and attend to after hours questions and concerns. We have never felt like we are over the bridge!

We really like the service, convenience and care of the GetzWell team. When I was looking for a pediatrician, my lactation consultant said that GetzWell was the best practice in the city. I definitely agree with her! Dr. Glynn is thoughtful, personal and spends a lot of time with our child when we go in for visits. We have also used the after-hour care line and the doctors and nurses on call have been extremely helpful as well.

I would give Dr. Getzelman and her team a perfect 10 if I could!In this age of assembly line doctoring, where you get 15 mins with a harried physician who throw antibiotics at your kid, Getzwell Pediatrics is a true miracle and godsend to new and longer-term parents.Julia Getzelman has been my daughter's pediatrician for 10 years, and I am so grateful for her and her dedicated staff.In addition to being a highly skilled doctor, Julia is intuitive, empathetic, and uniquely versed in alternative treatments like homeopathy. She is patient and kind and my 10-year-old loves her almost as much as my husband and I do!We are currently addressing a health situation and if it weren't for Julia, I would be feeling a lot more worried and scared. I know she's my partner and is there for me when I have questions or just need reassurance.There is simply no other pediatrician in San Francisco who compares. She has even suggested supplements for me that have helped with a recurring health situation. I totally wish she could be my Primary Physician too! I recommend her and her practice 100 percent.and yes, you need to submit out-of-network claims to your insurance company, but...this is your kid's health! (this is one expense I would never skimp on.)

Best decision we ever made was joining Getzwell Ped when our youngest was born (he's now 5). Dr.G caught our sons sensitivity to Gluten and got him on the right track and thriving again... I have had to make countless after hour calls for croup, rashes, flu bugs and have always been so happy I have a Dr I know help me trouble shoot whatever the problem might be. Â Also Iove all the homeopathic solutions.

We have been coming to GetzWell for now 2 years. When my son was born I didn't feel comfortable taking him out of the home for his 5 day check up so I was so pleased to find out GetzWell made house calls. When Dr. Glynn Came to our home she was gentle, personable, professional and put me at great ease. Fast forward 2 years and we are still so happy and grateful we found this wonderful practice. Our son saw Dr. Getzelman for his 2 year check up and she spent an hour talking with me, taking his measurements and even allowed my son to take play breaks to help him feel at ease. Dr. Getzelman is so reassuring in her demeanor and 20+ years of Â knowledge and expertise.. No wonder she was listed as the #1 pediatrician in San Francisco in 2015! We look forward to continuing our relationship with GetzWell for years to come.

When my son was first born, we wanted to check out several different approaches to pediatrics to see what would be the best fit for our family. We took him to newborn checkups and normal exams at both GetzWell and a more traditional practice. At first, the biggest difference was the time in the room with the doctor. At the more traditional practice, the visit were exactly 15 minutes, my son was weighed/measured and we talked through "concerns" only. At GetzWell, we spent 45 minutes discussing everything from what the best diet was for infants to what types of activities would help him thrive. It felt so much more comprehensive.My son got the flu on New Years day, a very inconvenient day to need to get a hold of a doctor. He was weak, had a very high fever and was only 8 weeks old. We called the nurse line at the more traditional practice and ended up waiting hours for a response, and when the response came it was a generic "go to the closest hospital", and there was no real follow up. With GetzWell we were on the phone with an actual doctor from the practice within 10 minutes. She talked over all of his symptoms and we made a plan to drive to UCSF. She was texting with us through the rest of the night and scheduled an in person follow up with us for the next day. We felt like we had a partner in a very scary situation and knew that that type of partnership is exactly what feels right for our family pediatrician.We have been with Getzwell every since. My son is now almost 10 months old and he adores Dr. G. We are so happy with our decision to join Dr. G and this amazing practice!

We are a very happy family who have been with Getzwell for 2 years since moving to the Bay Area. Finding a first rate pediatrician was of top priority for us. As my husband is in natural health products (from a more holistic approach) and I grew up with an MD father, we knew we were looking for a special type of practice. How lucky we were to learn that Getzwell was right in our neighborhood and practices medicine in what I like to think is the "old fashioned, patient focused" way. From well-baby visits, to routine follow-ups, we get first class care anytime we need it. It's about as good as having a physician in the family, after-hours messages are returned promptly and follow-ups from the physicians after visits are routine and help to put anyone at ease. We never have to wait in the waiting room when we are there, and my son actually enjoys his visits (even when he gets vaccines). Aside from the pediatricians who are amazing, the nurse practitioner was incredibly thoughtful and thorough for the visit we had with her, and the staff are always so professional and positive both in person and on the phone. The pediatricians are always willing to work with us to achieve our health goals with our son in the ways that we are comfortable with and are happy to answer questions and advise us where we feel we can use a little extra information. If anyone is looking for a truly superb practice, I would never hesitate to recommend Getzwell pediatrics. N.B. I know there is one review that mentions that the practice is out of network or isn't covered by insurance. While the practice does not take insurance, they do help you file insurance claims to your insurance carrier should you be uncomfortable or unable to do so yourself. I had issues with my first attempts at filing claims, and after a year of un-filed claims (and having reached my deductible), I finally asked for their assistance in filing claims. While they charge a fee per claim filed, not having to do so myself (knowing now I don't often get around to it with my busy pace life) is a real relief. Yes, insurance makes me pay the lions share my own, but I believe it is well worth it. I pay for out of network physicians and procedures myself when I need them with top specialists, why wouldn't I be willing to do so myself for my child to ensure he has the best access to care?

We have been with Getzwell for about 8 years and since our son was born and our daughter was a toddler. Â We originally switched to the practice to try their whole-health approach to treat our daughter's asthma. Â Dr G had a lot of ideas about how to assess the problem from a whole body standpoint in addition to traditional medicine (which was the only approach offered at our previous pediatrician). Â Our daughter eventually has outgrown the asthma and we feel Getzwell helped tremendously through those difficult times.We moved to Marin and we still come to SF to see Dr G. Â We have considered switching to a local practice but have chosen not to because of the level of service and quality that we get at Getzwell. Â First, they really know our kids and all of their issues throughout the years. Â Second, they always (always!) provide ample time for an appointment and listen to all the questions. Â Third, they are available to respond via email when necessary. Â Fourth, when calling during off hours you will talk with one of the people from the practice (often it will be Dr G herself.) Â Fifth, they will discuss all of the things that are a part of a growing child -- emotional well being, behavioral issues, social issues, and the usual milestone markers for learning as well as physical development. I could go on and on. Â They are a part of our family and an essential part of the growth of our children. Â We are very grateful to have found them.

Care that goes above and beyond.Our family feels so fortunate to have found this practice and can't thank Dr. Getzelman and Dr. Glynn enough for the kind, personalized care we have all received. We have been with GetzWell for over 2 years now and could not be happier with our choice. Â Dr. Getzelman is attentive, knowledgeable and a great person to have parenting discussions with. My family and I have been going to Getzwell for over 2 years now and we still couldn't be happier. My two kids who are now teenagers have been patients of Dr. Getzelman's for almost 10 years. I switched to the practice when I felt that traditional approaches were too harsh and not meeting my kids' needs. Â We have been extremely happy with the practice, and Dr. Getzelman in particular. She has developed a great rapport with the kids over the years and they trust her and feel comfortable with her as they grow older and their bodies are changing, and as they are more interested in their health and wellness. It's worth highlighting that Dr. Getzelman's unique knowledge, approach and experience is exceptional, and she has single-handedly managed to help my ADHD child become "non-symptomatic." Through a process of various specialized and cutting-edge tests, Dr. Getzelman was able to pin-point my child's genetic disparities which were causing ADHD behaviors and symptoms. With an elaborate course of supplements (and not medications), overnight my child was able to focus, sit still, and manage impulses. It was remarkable, absolutely unbelievable. It has made a huge difference at school and at home. More importantly, my child is now healthy, and no other doctor or method of diagnosis would have provided or allowed us the (terrifying) insight that his brain was suffering from an autoimmune attack, which was causing the ADHD symptoms.Dr. Getzelman is well connected in so many alternative communities, for those who like to seek out alternative treatments. She has introduced us to many practitioners in SF (osteopaths, homeopaths, acupuncturists, etc.) that have helped to keep my kids (and me) healthy and thriving. Dr. Getzelman is a rare find and my family is grateful she's located in SF!

We had the pleasure of working with Dr. Sheibani during the first few months after our daughter was born. She was the doctor who did our newborn housecall, and the one we saw for our initial doctor visits. We had some feeding issues in the early weeks, and Dr. Sheibani went out of her way to help us with them - she even made phone calls to us in her car on her way home from work! All the doctors and nurses that we've met with have a refreshingly holistic view to childhood health.

Summary: Â Terrible service and sub par care provided by nice people in a clean office that costs a small fortune and is always out of network. Â Our full experience below.After reading their reviews their practice seemed to check all the boxes we wanted including a more holistic approach to medicine and vaccines.We scheduled our first appointment 3 days after bringing our son home. Â We had hoped to have him seen a day earlier. Â I asked if we could bring him to their offices, but we were told that the first visit was ALWAYS an in home visit. Â That was fine with my wife since she was still recovering from the c-section. Â A day before the scheduled appointment we were told that one of the new born screenings had come back positive for a rare metabolic disorder (citruline transcarbamylase deficiency). Â The physical symptoms include vomiting, lethargy, seizures, unresponsiveness and lack of appetite. Â Our baby had NONE of these symptoms. Â Regardless, we were told that we must get blood work done immediately. Â We rushed our newborn to the lab at 7AM the next morning (for an ammonia test). Â This was not a simple heel prick. Â The lab had to draw blood intravenously. Â  By the time we got home from the lab (around 10AM) we had received another email from Getzwell saying that the original lab slip was incomplete and we needed to have more blood tests done. Â I was furious and spoke with the nurse practitioner from Getzwell. Â I was told that these instructions were coming from the metabolic specialists at UCSF and this was their protocol. Â If it was protocol you would think that the battery of tests would be standardized. Â We were told (again) that we needed to get these other tests done ASAP. Â We were scheduled to see Dr. Glynn later that afternoon and since our son showed none of the physical symptoms we decided to wait on the extra blood work to see what she thought we should do after looking him over. Â Dr. Glynn completed her evaluation and said that he looked pretty good (still had a little jaundice), but his weight could be a little low. Â She told us that his ammonia test came back perfectly normal, but we still had to go get the other blood work done. Â She said that we could possibly wait a day to do it, but that we still needed to get it done. Â She also said that we needed to bring him in the following day to get weighed to make sure he was gaining weight. Â While our baby seemed to be in good health it was tough to hear that we needed to bring him back in for more blood work. Â We scheduled the follow up appointment for the following morning at their office on Union St. and would head over to the lab if necessary afterwards (we were hoping to be told that we did not need the additional tests done). Â We saw Dr. Getzelman the next morning. Â She weighed him and that was it. Â He had gained 0.2 ounces over 18 hours! Â Great news, although it did seem kind of arbitrary since none of us knew if he needed to pee or poop and Dr. Getzelman never asked us when or how much his last feeding had been. Â We then asked her about the additional labs and if they were truly necessary. Â She said they were necessary even though our son showed no signs of the disorder. Â I asked her to call the specialists at UCSF to make sure that we weren't missing anything. Â She tried calling but said that she couldn't get ahold of anyone (it was 10:00AM on Thursday). Â She also couldn't tell us anything about the disorder and what that would potentially mean for our son if he did have it. Â We knew as much as she seemed to after doing a days worth of internet research. Â We headed back to the lab for another excruciating experience.The next day we hoped to hear from Getzwell regarding the lab results. Â No lab results, but we did receive receipts for the in home visit, follow up appointment and membership fee. Â $780 for the in home visit! Â $280 for the follow up visit (weighing only)! Â $310 membership fee! After getting some sleep and time to reflect upon the whole experience we can't help feeling taken advantage of and being treated like a cash register. I'm writing this review 12 days after we saw Dr. Getzelman and we still have not heard from them regarding our son's lab results! Â Considering that we were made to feel that getting these tests done ASAP was imperative to our son's well being we are shocked by the lack of follow up from them. Â Getzwell never seemed to advocate for our baby or us. Â They clearly do not have a handle on "specialists" they use and defer to. Â And they certainly did not provide anything close to concierge service. Â We found another pediatrician and promptly received an email from Getzwell telling us it would be $25 to transfer our son's records and may take up to 2 weeks to complete the transfer! Â They charged our card before they transferred the records. Â After some back and forth with their office manager they sent them over same day, but only after they rung our register one more time.

Let's begin by expressing my immense love and gratitude for this clinic. We have been seeing them since my son was born (I have a review listed on their noe clinic) but the continuous and genuine care they offer cant be bought. I have called on christmas -my son had a high fever, weekends and they respond to emails almost immediately and follow up to see if everything is ok! This office will provide genuine, uninterrupted care/time. I have never been rushed or shut down to move to another patient. I LOVE them and am so grateful. We have been with Getzwell for over 5 years and are so grateful for the thoughtful and supportive care they provide. I just wish more people could have access to this kind of care as it is truly life changing. I honestly wish I could find a practice like this for myself! Thank you Getzwell!!!

I love everything about Getzwell. The care my son has received since birth from Dr. Getzelman and everyone in the Getzwell family has been outstanding. Dr. G and team are wonderful, we searched high and low when our son was born for a great pediatrician that spoke our language and cared about our child. Dr. Getzelman has been my three children's pediatrician for the past 7 years. We have been with Getzwell for nine years, and have always found the staff to be extremely kind, efficient, and thorough. My daughter Charlie received Getzwell's care during her first two years of life. Â We have recently moved away and so are moving on, but we are sad to go. I love Getzwell and feel so lucky to have them in our neighborhood. We've been with them for three years now and love their responsiveness either over the phone or email. Julia really knows our kids and provides great guidance. I couldn't recommend the practice more.

We learned about Getzwell Pediatrics when our son was 6 months old. We made the switch to Getzwell as we were looking for a more holistic approach to our child's care. We love the nutrition counseling, the delayed (if desired) vaccine schedule, the personalized approach to our son's care, the quick response time to emails/calls, the clean and happy office, and the knowing that we are in the greatest of hands.

As a second time mom, I feel more clear than ever in what we need in our pediatricians. It's been a real honor to be in the care of dr Glynn and dr Getzelman, both caring and present providers, who have gone to extra mile to assure my sons' wellbeing. Dr Glynn is often on duty at the union street location and she blends competence, compassion and a mothers insight into the care she offers. My four month old developed pneumonia, which was a frightening thing, and meant we spent plenty of time contacting our docs and soliciting their advise. She was there, via email, checkins, over weekends and eves. She fielded even my silliest questions (which were not few :). I'm grateful to her for the endurance to see it through. She and Dr Getzelman consulted closely on the case and we felt we had two smart docs in our corner, 24/7. They took the time in required and operated prudently.Additionally, my toddler loves going to their bright office, which is saying something since it not infrequently results in a shot! He like to play doctor at home with his own stethoscope and sometimes he will say to me "dr Glynn is on vacation so I'm working today".. So he does identify Dr Glynn as a special doc that he emulates, even when he's pretending.They've brought on Karmi in the front desk who always has a smile and offers tea as I come in.. And another provider is now doing reimbursement work, so they can help you make claims if that's not a task you're interested in. From the in home first visits with newborns, to a slower vaccination schedule that takes the whole child into account, and the level of personalized care, I think it would be hard to improve on getzwell for pediatric care. We feel so lucky to be there.

I signed my Son up to be a Patient of Getzwells' while I was still pregnant with him. I had so much faith that this was a Premier Practice and he would have incredible care. The first day my Son had diarrhea, I took him in for an appointment. There was no mention of dehydration, or was any real concern expressed about his sickness. While I realize a "bout of diarrhea" amongst children may happen; the after care by this Practice for close to 14 days failed my family so terribly that my Son ended up in the hospital for over SIX days. He needed to essentially be starved as he was put on complete gut rest and had to go into the operating room to have a PICC line inserted. A five-month old. Had I continued listening to Getzwell's advice: "kids get sick - can last for fourteen days", and not trusted my gut and called another SF Pediatrician, we were informed that my son was less than two days away from an urgent 911 call. I still shudder thinking about it. My Son was was considered an "extreme" case. Those are the words that the Hospital Doctors used when they looked at my Son. Yes. Extreme. He was anemic, had lost over 3 ounces in weight and dehydrated. Never once were my Son's blood levels taken by Getzwell, (or recommended to be taken). His minerals/nutrients never checked. Or his weight monitored. Very basic math tells me that if a child has recurrent diarrhea, he is probably losing weight. But more than that, he is unwell and his Pediatrician should be monitoring his case.I read the reviews below and realize, "they are not an urgent care/emergency room" but you know what, as my Son's Doctors, they are the FIRST line in a child being sick. I went to Urgent Care with my Son. I went to ER independently. I informed Getzwell as my Son's Doctors of everything going on. They did not act. They said they would get a "referral for GI appointment marked urgent." It never came and would have taken weeks. As Doctors, they have an obligation to be my child's first line of defense: do we as parents worry about a situation and escalate it or let nature run its course. I brought my Son in multiple times to see the Drs at Getzwell; I was made to feel as though I was over exaggerating when I tried to explain that my Son was very sick. He couldn't wear diapers his diaper rash was so painful from his frequent movements; upwards of 20 times a day. They recommended an organic diaper cream that you can't use on broken or irritated skin. How was that helpful? My husband and I both brought our Son in together to see Julia and spoke with her saying the care we were receiving was not up to standard for what we believe this practice stood for. She made me feel horrible and I left the appointment with her not even examining my Son. We paid $700 for these two visits [note: they've refunded the charges]. I spoke with Karmi, the office manager to have a chat about my dismay and a lack of care on my Son - the aftereffect provided no increased attention to my son's condition; instead Karmi had the audacity to call up my Son's new Pediatrician and yell at his office staff. Yes - they thought our new Doctor - who was actually monitoring my Son's case, [including, at one point, being on the phone with the OR managing by the minute, the amount of time my Son was under anesthesia during a tricky PICC line insertion due to dehydrated veins] - Â should spend his time responding to an angry office manager about a patient switch. I don't want to subscribe to the notion that they are the only holistic practice in SF. They are not. And I don't want to believe that because they recommend probiotics, that should preclude a Doctor from knowing when a baby is incredibly unwell. And they don't know. I'm writing this from one Parent to another: as a result of their lack of care, I had to watch my five month old have bruises all over his arms from IV attempts. I watched him be put in an ambulance to be taken to another hospital and then wheeled into an operating room & the doors shutting without me being able to go in. I watched my Son come out of anesthesia. I watched him have to be starved for days. And all of this could have been prevented with Doctors that took the initial proper care of my Son that I entrusted them as his Doctors to do. And a level of service they assure they can provide; and - let's be frank - charge for it. The Hospital Professionals (Drs/Nurses) were HORRIFIED at Getzwell's care of my Son. So leave with this; that's great that they can do baby well checks. Or staggered vaccines. But when children get sick, will they know how to act appropriately, and mostly will they care? I think not. And I can assure you they did not care about this "littlest patient." But I'm incredibly thankful to my Son's new Pediatricians (Dr. Oded Herbsman and Dr. Castelli) - that did.

I spent many hours during my pregnancy researching pediatric practices in the Bay Area in search of one that felt like the right fit for our family. I can say with 100% certainty that Dr. Getzelman and Getzwell Pediatrics IS that practice and I am so incredibly grateful to have found them. We took our daughter Caroline to Getzwell when she was 3 days old for her first appointment and from the moment we walked in the door I felt supported and at ease. It is not easy to make a new mother feel at ease! My husband and I truly feel like the doctors at Getzwell are part of Caroline's "team". It is invaluable to feel that way towards your child's pediatrician and I cannot imagine it any other way. The front office staff is incredibly considerate, competent and efficient. I have never once had to sit with our daughter in the waiting room. Dr. Getzelman and Dr. Glynn are both incredibly warm, well spoken and as good with new parents as they are with kids! Our baby LOVES visiting Getzwell. I would think that was kind of weird if I weren't so grateful for it. I feel like I can (and do) ask them anything and they never make me feel dumb or silly or like I don't know what's best for my daughter. They are supportive and full of good information and sound advice. Anything and everything they've ever suggested to us or instructed us on has been presented in such a kind way without the slightest hint of condescension. For this I am incredibly appreciative. I feel as though they have taken the time to actually get to know our baby. Sometimes I'll watch Dr. Getzelman just observing her during our appointments and she's suggested things we might do with her (ie start solids or certain developmental exercises) based on these observations. There is no way a run of the mill pediatric practice is going to take the time to do this. It's little things like that that may not seem like much but they mean the world to a new mom who's trying to do what's very best for her child and learning as she goes. Collectively all of these things make Getzwell far superior to any other medical practice I've ever experienced (pediatric or otherwise). I would recommend them to any parent wholeheartedly and without reservation.

We have been with Julia and the wonderful staff at Getzwell since my now 2-year-old daughter was born and I can not recommend them enough! I owe so much to Julia, not only for the impeccable care she gives my daughter but for the support and guidance she gives to my husband and I. So far, we are really in love with this practice.
