We really look forward to our future appointments with them and love having peace of mind knowing that our child is in good hands.

I trust Julia and her team 100%. Â Knowledgeable, thoughtful and caring but never judgmental. Â I know my kids couldn't be in better hands. Â Our son has an unusual chromosomal deletion and Julia, even before our first visit, took it upon herself to learn about it. Â I remember walking by her office late at night wondering why her light was still on - the answer is, she is always educating herself. Â Learning and growing. Â When we were in France and my daughter had a strange rash all over her face and the local doctor wanted to put her in isolation for fear of it being measles, Julia diagnosed her rash using the pictures I sent and recommended over-the-counter and homeopathic treatments for what turned out to be infected insect bites. Even now that we moved to Marin when I have anything unusual going on with my kids' health (or my own), I ask Julia.

I have been in the integrative healthcare field for over 15 years now, working closely with some of the pioneers of functional medicine, renowned midwives, herbalists, naturopaths, nutritionists, and bodyworkers. Â I know the real deal when I see it. Â When I first moved to the Bay, I spent more than a month interviewing providers. Â GetzWell Pediatrics was the ONLY practice I felt totally aligned with. Â From the start, I was able to engage in conversations with Dr. Getzelman about everything from nutrigenomics and microbiotica to epigenetics and preconception/prenatal interventions--at a time when no one in the general public was paying attention to things like probiotics, gut dysbiosis, or using food as medicine. Â Over the years, I have found Dr. G to be an incredibly well-informed medical professional (truly, she is always searching the horizons of medicine for things that can be of benefit to her families); a kind, present, and attentive care provider; and an astute clinical diagnostician. Â When the Union St office opened, I was so pleased that I could recommend this practice to my friends in Cow Hollow. Â Dr. Glynn, in particular, helped to care for a dear friend's premature daughter, who had very critical (and super stressful!!) health concerns throughout the first year of her life. Â This family could not have been in better hands. Â Getzwell takes the time to be a true partner in health and wellness, and I, for one, couldn't be more grateful.

We've been with GetzWell for over 4 years and with two kids. Julia Getzelman is the definition of a conscientious, caring, and invested care provider. They really practice "whole kid care" here, making sure to address not just physical health and development, but social/emotional and behavioral wellness. They are also very knowledgeable about the latest research in food and nutrition and have a refreshing integrative approach that employs the best aspects of both natural and western medicine. The hour-long appointments are not rushed, are so very thorough, and allow both the staff and families to form a relationship. I am deeply grateful for the amazing care Julia and her team have given my children over the years. One of my kiddos has severe immune issues and we have had our share of acute events with both kids. The pediatricians at GetzWell have always gone above and beyond to research, discuss, and guide us. For the longest time we have gone to their original Noe location, but since moving to the East Bay, we have gone to Union St. a couple times and it's just beautiful. Both locations are spotless, comfortable, and inviting for both kids and parents. (Yes, that's right- we moved to the East Bay and still commute to GetzWell because we simply couldn't find anything close to the care we so love and value.) My only regret is that we didn't start with GetzWell from the very beginning, but I am so glad we discovered such a wonderful and supportive resource. I truly see them as partners in fostering my kids' well being.

We just transitioned to GetzWell in the Marina after spending my son's first 20 months at another pediatrician's office. The transition has been incredibly smooth. Their office is well managed, communications are easy and timely and they always follow-up. Dr. Glynn was great at our first wellness visit, asked thoughtful questions and had a good dynamic with both myself and my son (who, I will be honest, hates going to the doctor at this point). I am so glad we switched pediatricians and I am looking forward to a long relationship with GetzWell.

Dr. G is one of the most amazing pediatricians you will find. Â Not only is she extremely bright, up to speed on the latest medical data, she is also kind and has an amazing bedside manner. When you have an appointment, you feel like you are the only patient that she has for the day. We love that there are 2 locations, Union Street and Church Street, as it adds to the convenience of the practice and appointment availability. Dr. Getzelman is also sensitive to parent's fears of medicine and treatment and takes a very supportive role and does not over medicate, this is a good thing. Â She will absolutely tell you when you need to medicate, but as with most childhood illnesses, there isn't a need for drugs. My daughter has been a patient of Dr. Gs since she was 3 weeks old and is now 4.5 years old. My daughter LOVES going to the office to see her, which speaks volumes for the environment she has created at her practice. Â  Her team helped support our journey with breastfeeding and early childhood nutrition. Â We trust her opinion with our most sacred thing in life, our child.

As a new mother with an acute awareness of the complexities in raising a healthy child, I was elated when Getzwell opened their Union Street office. Â I loved the office in Noe, but this one is much more convenient and I better understand what makes them unique. Before my son was born, I thought my choices were limited to either high volume impersonal practices on the one hand or very expensive concierge practices on the other. But, Getzwell is just the right balance, with truly holistic care and docs really interested in a relationship. I feel so incredibly lucky, they don't think I'm crazy to question vaccines or be concerned about BPA in canned goods, etc. Â Getzwell's docs are sensitive to the needs (and anxieties) of our family and have created a customized care plan just for us. Â And, I loved the fact that after delivery, they provided a newborn house call. Â Since then, I've found their services are unrushed, appointments are easy to book and I can reach them by phone or email whenever necessary. The office is beautiful, super clean and modern to top it all off. GetzWell Pediatrics is where it's at.

Recently had surgery here with Dr. Abel. He is a fantastic surgeon, but this review isn't for him.The presidio surgery center made me feel comfortable and safe throughout the entire process. The covid precautions were great (just make sure you get a test within 7 days of your procedure)..In the pre-surgery area, the staff were so caring and kind. Shoutout to Matt who went above and beyond to calm my nerves and show care.Recovery room was just as good. I never felt rushed, and felt totally cared for. I was too woozy to remember the woman who handled my recovery, but she was a kind blonde woman who made sure I was totally comfortable and prepared for discharge.Great place!

There aren't enough stars to award. Today I was given the epidermal steroid injections by Dr Ignatius. The good doctor made me feel like a friend who had come to visit as he expertly administered those dosages required to relieve what had been, for me, very serious pain. The whole staff were highly professional and what was very important to me was that they were so very kind. I've been around a long time and I can tell when kindness is a true attribute of a person. To be honest, words really fail me as I try to express how good and grateful I feel about Dr. Ignatius and the staff at Presidio Surgery Center.
Elite 2021

Great nurses who made my son feel welcome. The surgery center was immaculate and informed. I had one minor hiccup, which was not related to the surgery center itself; it was the female security who was taking the temperatures and rudely interacting with patients who were entering the building. If it weren't for her, we would have had a tremendous experience!

I was scheduled for a procedure at the Presidio Surgery Center, which is located amongst several medical buildings in the area. Â From downtown the 38 Geary stops a block away. Â The Center also validates parking in the building's garage. You pre-register online which expedites the check-in process when you arrive. The staff at the Center are very friendly. Â Upon arrival, the receptionist checks you in and takes care of the paperwork and any necessary payments. Then Rebecca, the RN, walks me to a prep room for some procedural questions and provided me the gowns for changing. Â Afterward, she returns and walks me back to the prep area where she and Trish preps me with the IV. Â During this time, you're kept comfortable with warm blankets. The anesthesiologist comes by to discuss the process for my procedure. Then my Doctor comes to see how I'm doing and reassures me the procedure will be quick and painless. During the waiting time, the nurses come to check how I'm doing and status of my procedure. Â When it's time, they walk you to the procedure room and they reassure you that you are under the best care. Â Before I know it, the procedure was done and I awoke back in the prep room. Â They give you refreshments and crackers. Â When you are ready, you get dressed and they take you to the garage where my sister was waiting to drive me home. Â The staff was very friendly and professional. Â Thanks for making my first medical procedure a very pleasant experience.
Elite 2021

My husband and I both had surgery at this location. The staff is amazing. Caring, professional, polite and treated us with such care that I am still amazed. I am forever grateful for each staff member. Presidio surgery center made our experience the best it could be! Thank you!

I had a fantastic experience during my surgery. The staff was extremely nice and friendly. They constantly checked in on my during the whole process and explained everything each step of the way. It was my first surgery ever and that made me feel comfortable as relaxed. I would highly recommend the center.

Outpatient services. Â The center is in the middle of a busy area of SF... underground parking right at the center, between Sutter St. & Post St. Â *Save your ticket, and you can get it validated. Â The staff are awesome! Â I had Dr. Field as my anesthesiologist, and Donna Chin as my Post-Op RN. Â Both were very professional, and Donna... well, she was very attentive to all my needs, professional, and kind. Â I really liked her. Â The facility itself is clean, and they get you in/out quickly. Â You can also pre-register for your surgery online, which makes the process run even more quickly. Â Highly recommend.

Having worked in medical settings for years as a physical therapist, I know something about what quality health care looks like. I was very impressed with this facility. It is clear that there are thoughtful policies and procedures in place and that they are followed. This speaks to serious supervision and high standards. Further, it appears that all the staff appreciate being able to work in a setting where high expectations are consistent. Mind you I am well aware that provision of care is now measured by patient satisfaction rather than rather than clinical outcomes. It is clear that the staff go out of their way to "be nice" but in doing so, they are better aware of patients' individual needs and act accordingly, not just parrot some scripted responses. I never got the feeling someone wasn't listening to me. Not to mention that my lumbar epidural was handled expertly by Dr. Ignatius and the nursing staff. I traveled 20 miles to get treatment there but I would travel much farther if needed to get such quality medicine.

I received surgery with Dr. Oshtory at Presidio Surgery Center and was very impressed with the experience. From the clarity of the communication to the kindness of the front-staff, to the care of the nurses post-surgery - I received great service. I would highly recommend this place for surgery. Definitely deserves a five-star rating.

I am may bias because I am working here but let me tell you why I chose this place. The most refreshing part is how much the staff loves to work here. The partnership with the physicians and the outstanding care we give to our patients. Here is where I feel patients come first, that's why I left Kaiser and joint this team of fantastic nurses and techs and physicians. I would have my surgery, if needed, here at any time! Best place to work and best place to be a patient!

Having never really had surgery other than the removal of my wisdom teeth, I was rather nervous about my operation. At every moment from the time I walked in the door to the time I was wheeled out, the staff of Presidio were courteous, professional, and comforting. I was left with the feeling that I was in very good hands throughout the experience, and I'm extraordinarily grateful for that.

After a long time dealing with big pain and going through a miserable life! I decided to have a right hip anterior approach surgery at presidio Surgery Center on May 30 2019 with Dr Robert E. Mayle ,, I'm honestly blessed I found Dr Robert E. Mayle and I'm so thankful he had the opportunity to do my surgery!! It was the best decision I ever made in my life! I'm a new man my life has changed dramatically it was a big time success!!! All that I can say THANK YOU VERY MUCH! DR ROBERT E. MAYLE AND ALL HIS STAFF FOR ALL YOU DONE!!!! For everyone out there if you are having joint problems(knee or hip or shoulder) I Strongly recommend DR ROBER E. MAYLE!!!!!!!

Top notch care. Dr's and staff are very patient with excellent bedside manner. Everyone is well educated and willing to answer any and all questions with knowledgeable answers. Very clean waiting room, although waits are not long. Nice light music and good snacks afterwards.
Elite 2021

I was very happy with this place. Â Nice, clean lobby and waiting room. Â The front desk staff was ok, not that friendly or helpful, and not particularly empathetic Â given that I was obviously in pain. Â They seemed more interested in gossip and chatting with each other than in finding me a suitable place to sit. Â That said, I will not let the inattention of the front desk staff significantly diminish this center's score. Â The equipment was very state of the art and they had lots of nice touches like comfortable pre-open room essay chairs and an easy exit from the surgery center right into the parking garage.The operating room staff was very professional.

The staff were very welcoming and made me (& my Mom) feel at ease before my surgery. The facilities and surgery room were in excellent condition. Staff from the center called me the next day to see how I was doing.
Elite 2021

Horrible experience. Don't go here. They screwed up my start time and insisted they were right and I was wrong. I had to pull it up on my phone to show them the letter with my correct start time. Very pompous attitude and no apology. You don't really want this kind of attitude on a surgery event. Go somewhere else where they treat you with respect. Â Somehow, in the medical profession they think they can always get away with this. This has nothing to do with a complication of another patient, it was a plain and simple screwup--WHICH IS FINE, but it's not okay to defend yourself and say the customer is wrong, no apology.

The 2 stars is strictly for the front desk staff. Not very friendly. It was my husbands first time ever having surgery or being put to sleep. I was told the procedure would be 2 hours and of course once it hit the 2 hour mark I was freaking out. I asked the lady nicely to see the status and if there was an update and she seemed frustrated . The 2nd time she was just plain rude. These procedures can be nerve wrecking to some especially for the ones who have never been put to sleep. The back office staff was amazing. No complaints. Dr. Roache is the best orthopedic I have came across and I have worked for orthopedic surgeons for the past 4 years. Â Clean center. The front desk staff needs to be more compassionate to the families who sit there and wait for 4 hours. If I had a choice, I would choose a different surgery center. Like I said the Nurses , Dr. Roache and the anesthesiologist gets 5 stars!

This place runs like a well oiled machine. Â They have the most talented and skilled staff of nurses and doctors who go out of their way to make your surgery as easy and comfortable for you as possible. Â I can't say enough about Dr. Robert Mayle who replaced my hip. Â The prep work prior to the surgery was extremely thorough. Â The surgery was flawless. The post op care was attentive and professional. If you're hungry the staff lets you order food from their grubHub app so the days of nasty hospital food are over. Â You can order whatever you want from hundreds of local restaurants and it's delivered to you room. Â Now that's room service!!

I want to be very clear the doctors might be very good but the staff and nurses make this place a very stressful and unduly anxiety ridden place.seriously avoid this place if you can.here is what happened. My husband had a simple epidural. Â I was told to wait and that the nurse barbara would check in with me in 15 minutes and keep me updated.she never did. Â for over 1:30 minutes not only did barbara go home early on a friday afternoon the other desk staff disappeared and i was left alone in the waiting room with no one to talk to.now i don't know about you but i was pretty relaxed for the first 15-30 minutes just figured it was normal, maybe they were busy. Â after an hour when i was told he'd be all done no big deal in 15 minutes i started to worry.seeing everyone leave for the weekend, down the hall and now no husband for over an hour and a half i got worried, wouldn't you? Â it was so stressful and all could have been avoided with the simple update that was promised. that fully his procedure was done and he seems finebut i followed up, i called and asked what happened could i talk to a nurse supervisorthey said not til monday, but the doctor would call me friday night for sure.no call from the doctor.no call from a nurse supervisor monday either.i emailed and finally tuesday the doctor called yelling at me for the complaint and saying it was the nurse union mandatory breaks that were the institutional problem not his. it was shocking to be yelled at my some ego surgeon. rather than receive what id hoped might be an apology.who do you people think you are.....take a moment think about what it might be like for someone who loves the person you are operating on and what you might feel if you were told they'd be done no big deal in 15 minutes and then and hour and half later no one was around to even talk to....you failed here not us and when someone is generous enough to share their experience so no one else has to go through this you might say thank you and just be a real person and own it.we all make mistakes we all want to go home early on the weekend but you know what, its not ok to treat people like this. Â do i think you are terrible people, no.do i think you made a mistake in communication and failed to follow up in an honest and understanding manner, yes 100%.

Dr. Savala is terrific. He takes the time to explain things to you and gives you different options to evaluate. They made time to fit me in at the last minute which was very helpful. I would highly recommend him. His staff is also excellent.

I had a steroid injection procedure last week at Â PSC and was impressed by their great service. A few weeks prior to the surgery, they contacted me to let me know that my insurance had approved the procedure. The gal was very friendly and answered a lot of detailed questions I had about the procedure. She then called again a week before the procedure to confirm the details with me again. And then, 24 hrs prior to the surgery, another staff member followed up with me to see if I had any further questions. The day of the procedure was just as organized. I arrived on time, got signed in and was immediately taken back to get going on my procedure. Once I got changed, the first nurse took me into the pre-op waiting room and got me settled into a comfortable chair while she prepped me. As soon as she was finished, my surgeon showed up and went over the details with me again. As soon as he was finished, a new nurse took me into the operating room and we started the procedure. Although it was painful, all of the staff were great at answering my questions and distracting me from the pain. I was in and out of the operating room in no time and then was wheeled into the post-op recovery room where again, two additional nurses made sure I was comfortable and kept checking on me.Although it is never a fun experience to have any kind of surgical procedure, this center almost made me feel like I was at a high end spa because everyone was so attentive and made sure I was comfortable.

Yesterday I had a medical procedure at this surgical center. Â It was an extremely professional and enjoyable procedure. Â The IV nurse was a magician. Â She started the IV in my hand and I felt nothing. Â Dr. Mark Ignacio conducted the procedure and is was so comfortable I almost fell asleep. Â After the procedure I felt great and it appears to have corrected the medical issue. Â I have been treated at many medical facilities in the Bay Area and this is the only on I would really want yo be treated at again. Â I only regret that they do not offer cosmetic surgery at this facility! Â I would give this facility and staff a 10 star rating if I could!

Everything went as perfectly planned. Â This is my second time there this year and they are still as efficient, organized, cheerful and genuinely "happy to be there" as they were the first time.No one looks forward to having an epidural in their spine. Â I had two today--without Â anesthesia.. Â ( my choice) Â Apparently, most people nowadays go without an anesthesia because the procedure really isn't that bad. Â I was in and out in 15 minutes and was able to get up and go home in another 15 minutes. Â The discomfort was minimal. Â The local that they gave me took care of any real pain.The mood in the operating room is light and as normal as can be--everyone was themselves while also being confident in the responsibilities and trust given to them. Â  We even shared a few laughs. Â I was taken 1/2 hour early today.The pre-registration, checking-in, and checking out procedures were simple and fast.The pick-up process was fantastic--they personally called my partner to tell him I was ready and then directed him to the correct parking spot, validated his ticket and helped me in the car. Â ( I didn't need help but, Â they told me that this is their procedure. I got a wheelchair ride out to the parking garage.) Goodbye sciatica!Clap! Clap! Clap!

Apparently, I will be repeating much of what has been already written here but why not? Â I have only accolades for PSC. Â From the moment I entered until the last nurse walked us to the car and waved goodbye, I felt very much at ease and cared for. Â You should know that I have been dreading this surgery for months and had all of my friends and family whipped up into near hysteria in concern for me. Â Therefore, I felt a bit sheepish sending out a group text that stated "everything went fine! Â no problems." Â I've yet to hear back. . .wonder why. Â But enough about me! Â In all seriousness, surgery is no fun, but PSC made the entire experience (I cannot even say "ordeal") manageable. Â Everyone was very calm and friendly. Â They answered any and all questions. Â And if you have any fears about surgery I can tell you that once the anesthesiologist gives you the drip you will not remember anything. Â All rather lovely, actually. Â I also must give a big round of applause to my ENT Dr. Gary Rust who made the effort to apply for surgery privileges at PSC in order to perform my sinus surgery. Â Apparently, it's a long process, but he and his office undertook it for me. Â So. . . big thanks to Dr. Rust and another big thanks to the staff, nurses, and very cool anesthesiologist at PSC. Â Fear not if your surgery is scheduled at PSC and you have the great luck to have Dr. Rust as your surgeon.

My lower back is akin to a mid-90s POS Dodge/Chrysler product. While you can always save up a little scratch and envision the day that you can kick that clunker to the curb, upgrade to a modest Japanese import, and say farewell to your mechanic, Â I unfortunately, will have to live with my lower back for the rest of my life. So I need a trustworthy "mechanic/garage". After being fortunate enough to find the gold standard in Southern California, Dr. Evangelista with COMG and their affiliated, California Surgery Center, I was struggling to find something that would at least come close here in San Francisco. I am happy to say I've finally found the equivalent with Dr. Ignatius of California Pacific Orthopaedics and the Presidio Surgery Center.I've now been to the Presidio Surgery Center twice, with another appointment on the books for early April. This facility is simply amazing. The staff who greet you and take your insurance/paperwork are very courteous and well organized. From the moment they take you back to the prep side of the center, you're constantly checked on by the fabulous nurses and medical assistants. They keep you posted as to about how much longer the wait will be, ensure that you're comfortable with a blanket fresh from the warmer and even offer noise cancelling headphones with relaxation music to ease the anxiety of your pending procedure should you need it. Once it's "time" they take you into the procedure room, I'm sure the experience could vary based on your doctor, but I feel confident and at ease that I'm receiving the best care. After they finish up, it's off to the other side of the facility for observation before they let you go home. The nurses are all very compassionate, check on you multiple times and offer juice/water and goldfish crackers (bonus!). They don't make you feel rushed and let you stay as long as you need until you're feeling ready to go. This place is so efficient, it could easily feel like you're in a processing wearhouse being shuffled along. But the staff here make you feel like you at that moment, are the only things that matters. As a nice touch they do follow up the next day to see how you're feeling and answer any questions you may have.

I had a traumatic experience here from start to finish. Waiting room is a complete zoo. People packed in with no regard for age, disability, discomfort level, type of procedure - like a cattle yard at a slaughterhouse. Staff unresponsive to questions and unconcerned about patients except to extract payment. Medical techs untrained and insensitive. When I didn't want to answer personal questions in a public place, I was put in a supply room and had to stand for this part of the ordeal. The pre-op area is crowded as full as possible - patients are put into tiny curtained stalls nearly naked and freezing cold to wait for the MD. As I was there for an epidural I was in extreme pain and very frightened. The MD expected me to walk down the hall in a paper robe that barely covered my rear and was annoyed that I asked for more coverage. It wasted his valuable time. He did and said nothing to reassure me. In the surgery room a woman held my hand and told me that I wouldn't feel anything but if I did they would make sure I was immediately made comfortable. I had intense pain right away but was told that I didn't need more anaesthesia yet. I began to moan and then to howl, but the doc didn't stop to check in with me about the pain and the woman kept telling me it didn't hurt that much. I was in agony. I told them to stop, that I wanted to leave, but they didn't listen and kept on going as if I was an animal. It was like a nightmare, a torture chamber. BEWARE ! NEVER NEVER GO HERE. They have no repect for people, only for PROFIT.
Given the necessity of my being there, it was the best team of professionals; thoughtful, caring, and competent. I can't say enough good things about everyone there. Thank you!

I just had an amazing experience with a minor surgery at Presidio Surgery Center. Â It was small enough that it only required local anesthesia so I was awake for the whole thing. Â Every person I met was smiling and ultra professional, from the front desk to the nurses to my surgeon, looking out for my needs at every turn. Â Extra blankets, giving me an extra gown to cover the gaping back of the hospital gown, socks to pad around in, asking me about holiday plans, checking in with me during surgery, I couldn't have been better cared for. Â At every step, they were checking on my identity and type of surgery, so there would never be any mix-ups. Â Actual surgery with Dr. Hiler was fast and efficient. Â All in all, it made me recover my optimism about American health care.

Positively the best medical / surgical experience you could ask for. Top-notch staff, who, from scheduling to the actual surgery, to billing, took the time to deliver a TRULY first class experience. If Yelp allowed for a sixth star, they'd get mine.

Like another reviewer, I also had issues with how they estimate and collect payment. They provided my husband with an estimate for an elective collarbone surgery that did not include materials. Then when I inquired about this, they gave me the run-around and could not explain why the original estimate didn't include this. In addition, they waited 6 months to send me a bill for an amount over and above the original estimate, then after trying to better understand it, sent it to collections after two weeks. Totally unethical and definitely not on the consumer's side. What's the point of an estimate if it is wildly inaccurate and includes everything except materials (which are ALWAYS a part of the procedure)? If they are going to exclude that from the estimate, this needs to be noted.

I recently had an epidural steroid procedure done at Presidio Surgery Center. Â I could not be happier with the experience from start to finish. Â Dr. Savala is a very skilled anesthesiologist, he took the time to really talk to me, review the MRI and he even contacted my excellent neurosurgeon, Dr. Brian Andrews to ask a couple of additional questions that came up in our pre-surgical discussion. Â Even though they "squeezed" me in to their busy schedules they never seemed rushed or inconvenienced, indeed they all were most informative and accommodating.The staff at Presidio Surgery Center was also outstanding in every way, Â I have had a few surgeries and Presidio is the MOST professional, friendly and accomodating staff that I have ever experienced. Â These included:Suhayla-Front Desk (great first impression at 7:30am)Anne-Pre-op (love the British accent-very comforting)Marianne, RN-Procedure Room-(Fun to talk and very good at keeping my mind off getting poked repeatedly with many sharp needles)Barbara- Very sweet to get me a much needed cup of coffee in recovery.I hope my spinal problem is solved and I never need to go back to Presidio. Â But if/when I need another procedure I would definitely go back to Presidio.
10+ from the moment we walked in. Everyone was absolutely wonderful. The facility is nice and very convenient.Thank you to our nurses Nancy, Litzie and Elyssa!

Presidio Surgery Center was just as I expected it - a well oiled machine that works very smoothly. Â I had several conversations with them prior to my surgery - a call about benefits and insurance coverage which was extremely helpful, calls about my medical history, instructions for the day of surgery, etc.When I arrived on the day of my knee surgery, I was greeted promptly, filled out some final forms, and was taken in to change into my scrubs and have my vitals taken. Â Next up I was in a recliner getting an IV started, and a few minutes later I was in the operating room and the anesthesiologist was telling me that I'd feel a little sting and burn - and I woke up about 90 minutes drooling and calling out my husband's name.The kindness and efficiency of the staff, along with the gestures like warm blankets, saltines and cups of water post-op to hold down the nausea, painkillers and ice packs - all added to my positive feelings. Â The post-surgery nurse spent some time with my husband going over my instructions to make sure he understood everything (since I was in no shape to understand anything) that needed to be done once I was home.I would've given them five stars but for the attitude of one nurse. Â He was clearly overworked and stressed out, but dude - don't give me attitude when I haven't eaten in 16 hours and am about to undergo general anesthesia to have some fairly serious surgery, OK?Otherwise, a very positive experience and I definitely recommend it if you need to have some minor surgery.

I thought my outpatient arthroscopic knee surgery experience was going to be like being processed through a chop shop, but I was pleasantly surprised. Every staff person from the front desk check-in babe to the nurses and anesthesiologist were all chipper and patient and attentive. It was like the Michael Minna version of a hospital experience, with no less than five people attending to me at any given time. I especially appreciated the efficiency, the heated blankets they wrapped me in before surgery, and the fact that they didn't laugh at my babbling when coming out of anesthesia (speaking Italian, asking if I could see my surgery on YouTube, calling the anesthesiologist my boyfriend's name). Unlike Michael Minna, however, I hope I never have to go here again.The only thing keeping me from giving them 5 stars is that they don't call you with your estimated copay until the day before surgery. Both in my case and in a coworker's case, we unexpectedly owed about $1,500! A huge added worry that I didn't appreciate. However, they will work with you.

I'm not a big fan of being drugged to the point of blackin out Â but when you need surgery...that's what they do!I recently had knee surgery and it went great. From the time I walked into the waiting room to the time I left, everything was fantastic. The staff was nice and attentive. They didn't stick me in a room and leave me to ponder what was about to happen for hours on end. I was brought from one station to the next in and very controlled and well planned out path to the operating room. Â I was able to meet the nurse that was assisting on the surgery as well as the anesthesiologist Â to discuss my options. Everyone was nice, professionals and made me feel good.I entered the OR and the people in there just struck a conversation as they prepped me. Before I knew what was happening, I was loaded and the asleep. I woke up an hour later feeling fine and eating crackers...not bad!If at anytime in my life I ever need surgery again, I pray it will be here and with this staff!!

First Class ExperienceMy outpatient surgery on Dec 28th at Presidio Surgery Center was about as good as surgery can get. Â I was very comfortable throughout my entire stay from check-in through recovery. Â  Â A few noteworthy things from a day I don't remember completely:* The nursing staff exuded warmth, compassion, and attention to detail. Â It's more like a spa than a hospital! Â The IV tech/nurse is so good you may not realize you just had an IV inserted!* The staff was very accommodating with my wife asking for my 2 year old son to visit me in recovery (thankfully my toddler was well behaved!). Â * The parking spot immediately outside the recovery area makes discharge exceptionally easy (CPMC Pacific should take notes on this). Â * The atmosphere is very relaxing and confidence inspiring. Â * You have a recovery nurse assigned to you, but, that doesn't stop the other nurses from checking up on your comfort level when they pass you. Â Talk about the extra mile.My actual procedure details are in my review of Dr. Yeung (ENT) @ yelp.com/biz/andrea-yeunâ¦

I had another injection here the other day and again everyone at this surgical facility was superb. Â Another painless IV insertion. Â Good choice of juices and soft drinks when you wake up too. Â And your choice of saltines, cheddar goldfish or animal crackers!And if someone waits for you in the waiting room they have streaming Netflix movies. Â They've thought of everything.

Everyone here was awesome. I had never had surgery before and I had no idea what to expect. I was put at ease by the professionalism and sincerity of everyone involved. Keep up the great job. Thank you!

What a difference your staff can make. To Dr. Lundy, Thank you for sending me here. Â I have had surgery before, but nothing like this. Â  A place that can make you feel comfortable before surgery, now that Â was a surprise. Â Call back the day after surgery from the doctor and the surgery center. The center was clean, the staff professional, what else can I say except thank you to Tamara (the anesthesiologist), the nurses Sarah,Carolyn,Mary,Tara, and Jason. Thanks for the great care.

Lovely group of people.The facilities are top notch and the staff very attentive. The warm blankets while you wait and the friendly recovery nurse who produced a diet coke were a nice distraction from the fact that I hate undergoing anesthesia.

I had arthroscopic hip surgery with Dr. Chan last week Â and so far everything has gone so impressively well. He has checked in with me everyday to make sure everything is going smooth. I felt really prepared going in knowing what I needed to have ready at home afterwards, and what I needed to stop doing beforehand. Be careful with this surgery center. They make you sign a payment installment plan right before you enter in the OR before they even know how much your insurance will pay. Then when you get your insurance settlement you figure out you over pay. They still want you to pay the whole amount and Jennifer Fox will send you threatening letter before your installments are due urging you to pay before the installment is due or else they will send you to collection agency. Money I don't owe them yet and that my insurance told not to pay as it is not due. If you can convince your surgeon to do your surgery somewhere else I suggest you do or you will end up like me, with a threatening letter for money I do not owe to them. I am hiring a lawyer to deal with them. Do not have your surgery here!

DO NOT BOOK YOUR SURGERY HERE! Â The Presidio Surgery Center has a history of unethicial and immoral accounting practices. I booked with Presidio Surgery Center in November 2014 because they appeared to be qualified and professional. Before my appointment I received a "courtesy call" from their accounting dept notifying me that I will be required to prepay my entire bill upfront on the day of my surgery. Â The account manager said she had already contacted my insurance company and CONFIRMED that the amount due to patient was $1,500. Â So I agreed to pay this amount before my surgery, and assumed the debt was settled. Â Two months after the surgery I received a bill for $1,100. Â I called and they said, "This is the balance due. Â There was a change to your scope of services and your insurance company didn't pay this amount." Â Change to my scope of services? Â I reviewed the initial scope and the final scope, and I was horrified to find that they ommitted a standard procedure in the initial scope so the prepaid bill appeared LOWER than the final bill. Â Furthermore, I called to discuss this with my insurance company, who said they NEVER EVEN RECIEVED A CALL FROM THEM! Â If I had known there would be such a dramatic difference in cost beforehand, I would have shopped around to other centers. Â Since then, I've seen several other Yelp reviewers with the same experience. Â Presidio Surgery Center has a long history of "bait and switch" accounting practices. Â Allow me to reemphasize the first line of my review: DO NOT BOOK YOUR SURGERY HERE!!!! Â I would give ZERO stars if this was an option.
I was *very* pleased with my experience there, from start to finish. Â The nurses in the OR and the PACU were *fantastic*.

Had some elective surgery here last week and was major-ly impressed by the facility, the staff and the amenities. Â Surgery is serious, but the nurses, docs, all, treated me so gently that I commented I felt like I was in a spa. Â What a great facility! Â It had none of the harsh lights, too many people, urgency of a hospital. Â Highly recommend!

I've been in and out of most of the operating rooms in this city. Â They are often an unpleasant experinece. This surgery center is a pleasant surprise. Â  Â They are very effcient and the nurses actually pay attention to you! Â Dr Savala is excellent and takes time to explain thigs! Â (A doctor who explains things? Â :)

Professional, caring, kept me fully informed about what was about to occur every step of the entire process.. Great follow up, truly a fully professional staff. Even though this is an outpatient facility and needs to operate very efficiently, at no time did I feel they were unconcerned about me as a patient. (Not just another surgery.) They even did an additional EKG on me since my last one was about 5 months old. Every action taken from admitting to discharge was explained. Best outpatient surgery experience I have had. (This was my third, with a Â prior meniscus knee repair, shoulder rotator cuff repair and now a Â sports hernia repair .) The prior two procedures were well handled,(four stars) but Presidio Surgery was truly "Five Stars"

I just moved to Emeryville and I was looking for a new dentist. My friends referred me to Total Health Dental Care. When I was looking through reviews, I really liked their holistic approach and decided to check them out. I've been here twice for filling and a cleaning. If I could, I would give them 10 stars!

I had my first cleaning here and the experience was friendly, and I had total confidence in the staff. Jean Claude was awesome and made my cleaning a painless and quick process. It's a super clean office, parking is not a problem and I have nothing but great things to say. A+++
Jean- Claudeï¼ highly recommended, he's very approachable and does great job on my cleaning.

Total Health Dental Emeryville has terrible administrative staff/receptionists. I have been going to THD for about 2 years now and it took 4 visits for them to finally send me reminders for my appointments. The most frustrating thing about this is that I would get marketing texts from THD but they couldn't send me appointment reminders...there's clearly something wrong here. My second time going to THD they helped me make an appointment to get my teeth cleaned but when I got to my appointment, they told me I would have to make another appointment/come back at a later date if I wanted the doctor to look at my teeth. Why wouldn't they just tell me upfront that the doctor wouldn't be in/who wants to have to take time off of work and go to the dentist twice?? Does THD get more money from insurance companies by splitting appointments like this?My partner also goes to THD (shame on me for referring him) and they always seem to mix up appointment times for both of us - it's not just me! Luckily I've gotten in the habit of calling the week of to confirm my appointment. There was one instance where a receptionist called my partner about an appointment he had coming up in a few days and asked if he could come in the next day because if he came in the day he was scheduled for, they would have to stay late and they would prefer not to do that...this is obviously wrong for many reasons.The only reason I haven't switched dentists yet is because of COVID (at least THD is clean), as soon as COVID clears I will absolutely be switching dentists.Oh and if you're curious why they have such a high Yelp rating, it's because they give their patients extra mouth wash and things like that if you leave them a good review... YIKES.

I have been coming to this location for years, and their service has always been top notch. While many other practices are always an administrative mess, Total Health is organized and efficient. Scheduling is easy and painless, and any insurance/billing queries are always resolved quickly and effectively.The cleanings, exams, and dental work I've had here have also been pleasant (as pleasant as dental work goes). Jean-Claude takes great care of me whenever I come in. He thoroughly cleans out my teeth and gums while weaving in just the right amount of conversation to help a person feel comfortable. X-rays and imaging are quick and painless, aided by the modern, high-tech equipment they have at the office. I've had fillings done here as well, and they're always painless (with just the right amount of anaesthetic) and done carefully. I've never had any issues or the problems with follow ups. If you're looking for a great practice in the bay area to transform your dentistry experience, I'd strongly recommend Total Care Dentistry in Emeryville.

I have gone to a new dentist that is in-network with Delta Dental after my disastrous visit with Total Health Dental Care.The new dentist has determined that I don't need a deep cleaning nor do I need 2 fillings. He said I needed a thorough normal cleaning (which I was supposed to have had a week ago from Total Health Dental Care) and to take a wait and see approach with the fillings as they were minor, and to try a prescription fluoride toothpaste. My husband was told he needed a molar removed, the new dentist has said he doesn't need any teeth removed. Beware of dental scams.Top things are:1. Useless treatments/phantom treatments.2. Shoddy work3. Inflated bills and out of pocket costs. Get a second opinion on expensive work.4. Being pressured to do 'urgent dental work 'now' by dental staff. Get a second opinion.With Total Health Dental Care, I experienced shoddy work (lack of a normal cleaning), inflated out of pocket costs (far higher than market rate for this area), and pressure to do expensive work I did not need. I cannot recommend. Please go elsewhere if Total Health Dental Care are urging you to do expensive work, and get a second opinion.And if you have Dental Insurance, please go to an in-network dentist. Out-of Network dentists are too expensive, the care is going to be the same or better, the cost will be lower. The costs of an out-of-network provider like Total Health Dental care aren't the same, regardless of what they say.
Elite 2021

Took very good care of me they had an appointment available and all was professional clean with modern equipment nice staff I just broke a tooth today and they gave me a same day emergency appointment. Very pleased.

Be careful of positive reviews because the company offers gifts if you write a positive yelp review. I ended up at THDC in Emeryville because I had a dental emergency (and naturally, that emergency had to happen during a pandemic). For all the praise people might want to heap on their competitors, those practices sure aren't interested in seeing someone without dental insurance on short notice, even if they can pay immediately. I got quite the runaround at some other practices, but no help.I had never had or needed any kind of dental work beyond cleaning before so really had no idea what to expect. I was not upsold on the more expensive procedure on my first visit (I fully went in expecting a crown to be the only solution and would have been ok with that), giving me a chance to go home and live with the tooth and see if the less expensive treatment was workable long-term. Ultimately I preferred the crown, so I scheduled the appointment. Not having any experience with getting a crown, I think the entire process went smoothly and quickly. I know that Dr. Yang went above and beyond on my case and was insistent on getting a good match with my other teeth. She rejected the first crown from the lab because it wasn't a good match, and actually made me an entirely second option that she hand-detailed. When I showed up to verify the match and get the crown put on, I had multiple options to choose from. I absolutely would not have expected that, and I wasn't upcharged for the additional choice. I have a pretty high pain tolerance, but the entire process and final procedure was pretty much painless and done with care. Dr. Yang has great chair-side manner, and I felt fortunate that she was the dentist on my case. While I was getting my crown put on, the office actually had a cancellation for a cleaning, so I was also able to get a cleaning immediately after since I was already there. I really appreciated that they offered me the slot.Overall I've found everyone at this office friendly and accommodating. I had an issue with my car right before my last cleaning and called 25 minutes before my appointment was supposed to happen to let them know I wouldn't be making it, making me That Person (and no one likes to be That Person). The person that helped me out was understanding and helped me quickly reschedule the cleaning. At the cleaning. Dr. Yang came over immediately to check on how the crown was working out and if there were any issues to report, since it was my first time in the office post-crown. I hadn't even expected to see her, so I appreciated the in-person followup.This office is convenient to me and in a nice location. No complaints.
I was impresses that Dr Amanda and Dr Yang were gentle and patient and sensitive to how I was doing. Excellent CARE!!!!

I came in for a set of X-rays and a exam. Â I had a bad feeling about what was going to be found as I had not been to the dentist in over 5 years and I was feeling very embarrassed. Â The assistant that took the X-rays was so professional and efficient she was done with taking a full set in minutes. Â Then she took photos of my teeth so I could see all the areas that needed work. Â They were professional, Kind and sympathetic to my needs and I feel this is an office I can trust to receive high quality care. The endodontist was the best I've ever had. She makes sure any procedure is painless and thoroughly explains every step. She's super thoughtful and has excellent techniques to reduce discomfort. Even after the root canal, it felt practically painless, which was a first. The staff is also super helpful and professional, especially for someone like me who often thoroughly researches and has many questions. The amenities and accommodations are top-notch. The X-rays are high-tech too, but a bit physically uncomfortable (because of the bit piece)-- though, no more so than at another dentist. They send the appointment confirmation via SMS, which is excellent, but it includes a link to the THDC office closest to you, even if your appointment is at another location, so heads up for that. Other than that, I'd still highly recommend it as top tier.

Going to the dentist can be hit-or-miss (who gets excited about going in for a cleaning?). Â But I appreciate the service that Total Health has given during my past couple of visits. Â They have a focus on holistic care and provide services that other dental offices don't (yoga, chiropractic, masseuse). Â They are all so friendly. Â Special shout-out to Jean-Claude RDH who likes getting to know you, gets your mind off the work he's doing on your mouth, making the experience much less painful. Â Will definitely be going back.

Jean-Claude was tasked with my first cleaning post-COVID. It felt like I hadn't been to the dentist in forever. But he made it easy, painless, and got my teeth looking and feeling wonderfully clean again. Definitely seeing him again in 6 months!

Great staff and great service! Â I'll be back! Â The staff is so friendly and knowledgeable. Â I normally don't like going to the dentist but I really enjoy THDC! Â  The atmosphere is very relaxing. Â I recommend THDC.

I went to this company based on the outstanding Yelp reviews and the convenient Emeryville location, a decision I greatly regret. My experience with Total Health Dental has been a nightmare since I scheduled my first appointment. When making the appointment to see a dentist for an exam and x-rays I was informed that I couldn't do this at the Emeryville location and that all new patients had to be seen at the "Welcome Office" in Berkeley, which round trip would cost me $20 just to visit, but I thought "it's okay, it'll be the only time I have to go there and my dental insurance is covering the cost of the visit." The latter would have been true if this company wasn't utterly unscrupulous. When I made my appointment I specified it was NOT an emergency and when I went into the office for my appointment I specified it was NOT an emergency, but Natalid said to sign the emergency paperwork, otherwise I would not be seen. I assumed this was for coronavirus liability, but I was incorrect.They charged my insurance $150 for the "emergency appointment" and the x-rays were another $200, which is overpriced even for the Bay Area. Now, because of these unreasonable prices, I'm forced to pay $209 out of pocket. Â I can get an exam, x-rays, and a cleaning for $99 from a nearby dentist that was voted Best in the Bay for many years, and that's WITHOUT insurance. It also turns out that Total Health doesn't participate with my insurance, Delta Dental, so coverage is Out of Network, something I wasn't informed of. Total Health also pushes hard to get you appointments for treatment immediately, so before I was aware of the initial cost for the x-rays and "emergency appointment" I scheduled a cleaning and an extraction, but insisted they provide a quote for treatment. Getting an accurate quote was extremely difficult. Natalid from the billing department gave me quotes for a bunch of things I didn't ask for, at which point I became very concerned with this business's competency and canceled the appointments. To further reenforce my concerns, on the days of my canceled appointments I was called and asked where I was. I had to inform them that I had canceled my appointments in advance with Yolanda. While this may seem trivial, it isn't. This company charges $50 for any appointment not canceled 48 hours in advance and $200 per hour if you were scheduled with a doctor, as was the case with my extraction appointment. I tried to confirm that I would not be charged these fees since I canceled the appointments appropriately, yet I did not receive a response until I posted this review. Needless to say, I will not be getting dental treatment from Total Health Dental EVER.

I hadn't visited a dentist in years (tbh I did virtually no research before booking a teeth cleaning appointment). This was a year ago during the pandemic. So many offices had really long waitlists and Total Health had teeth cleaning openings for the next week so I decided to pay out of pocket for a teeth cleaning--which btw is reasonably priced.... I paid around $500 for 2 teeth cleanings for the next year, and that also covers a root canal if I would end up needing one in the next 12 months.. Sounded reasonable enough. Â Well, I really am impressed by the care provided here.Since the beginning I have been impressed by the different dentists who have given me teeth cleanings (there are several dentists at this facility). Â My very first appointment I had X-rays done and the health of my teeth were assessed by Dr. Peggy Chuang. She gave me practical advice for my own teeth. Â At one point she also asked me " Which category do you put yourself in when visiting the dentist's office? Are you a) someone who wants to keep your teeth forever b) visiting the dentist for only emergencies, or c) wanting an instagram smile? I put myself in category A. I was thankful that she cared to ask such a practical question and wouldn't be shoving cosmetic procedure advice down my throat during future visits Â unless I was the right type of patient! Overall I'm glad there is a dentist office in the Bay Area that has a holistic outlook with reasonable prices!!! (Even affordable enough that if you didn't have insurance you could pay out of pocket for the next several years and it not break your bank! They are also mostly women run which probably explains the efficiency of the workplace.The last neat thing they office is THEY HAVE A LIBRARY IN THE WAITING ROOMS! I'm currently reading a book about herbal medicine, and will return it during next teeth cleaning appointment!

Totally LOVEEE these guys !! I've had so much work done on my teeth so far from holes , chipped teeth, cavities, root canals all built up from a 2010 dental nightmare, which kept me away from the dentist for a while, but through the grace of god I've found total health dental. Its a chain i know but HONESTLY THER're really good at every location respectful and to the point they really get it . Hope this helps ! Good luck , all love, love god !

Total dental care is very professional starting for the front desk,she will treat very nice and explain to you available options etc ,not to forget Jean clawde he is professional he did my teeth cleaning he was so smooth very careful and knew what he was doing .I would recommend this place for you during COVID they wear proper gear protection and feel that you taken take of .

This dental office is clean and professional. Great service from appointment to getting my tooth fixed. They really care and what kind of insurance you have. Also want to give a personal recommendation to Dr, Suzie Yang. She was my dentist in San Francisco and extremely happy to have her back.

Absolutely thrilled with my first experience with RDH Jean-Claude. I'm hard to numb and have developed some serious anxiety after previous bad experiences. I hadn't had a great experience at my last dentist and had a great time switching to Total Health Dental in Emeryville. Had a great experience and would definitely recommend!

Would rate my experience 10/10Jean Claude was awesome in cleaning my teeth! Very kind and compassionate about the whole process. He gave me pretty awesome tips on how to keep my teeth without stains and keep my teeth healthy.Overall, one of the best experiences I've had with dentists!

This was my first visit to the Emeryville Total Health office and as always when I have new people working on my teeth, I was apprehensive. Best dentist experience I've had. I started coming here last year, and have had nothing but positive experiences. Came in for a regular cleaning with Jean-Claude and he did a FANTASTIC job. Very thorough and fun to talk with! My sister came in the day before with him so I'm glad I had him for my appointment, too!

Love this place!! Jean Claude my hygienist and he is amazing! So friendly and I love the approach of total heath. They're all so sweet and I can't say enough positive things. Not like the cold dentist you've had before.

Jean Claude is excellent and amazing! I've never felt better getting my teeth cleaned by him, love going to him! My teeth feels so fresh after getting them cleaned he's so friendly and professional very detailed! Looking forward to coming back for sure!!
Great job there also very professional! Lovely people at Macon

Yah, this company is super shady, even if the dentists in their network are amazing. They use bait and switch on their "subscription" system to get you to pay more for services. Run, don't walk, away from these crooks. The management company keeps swallowing up smaller independent dentist practices and ruining their reputations.I went to see Dr. Alison and he pulled out my broken tooth, quickly and without a fuss. All good. I was then immediately corralled into the billing office for an intense 45 minute sales pitch. Yup, while bleeding profusely from a brand new hole in my jaw, with a mouth full of gauze, I signed up for what sounded like a great way to get free cleaning, x-rays, AND massage, AND nutritional advice, for a measly $30 per month on my credit card. Â Since I'm self-employed and can't afford dental insurance, I really wanted to address my lack of regular dental care so it seemed like a really great thing, and I scheduled a cleaning right away. They were pushing me really hard to get about $2000 worth of below-the-gums cleaning, and I repeatedly had to explain that there was no way I could afford that, but a regular cleaning would be great.Well, I got that cleaning, not from Dr. Alison but from a really really young thing that probably did a great job (what do I know? I'm not a dentist). I left happy, and didn't have to pay the usual $275 or so because I'd signed up for the $30/month subscription, right? Right! Awesome.For some reason, though, a couple of months later I got a bill for $300, which was pretty confusing. Calling them about it got me a receptionist, who just couldn't seem to get the accountant on the phone. Wow, surprise!tl;dr : I'm still getting bills from them for this mysterious $300 that they claim I owe them, and today on Yelp I see that the exact same thing happened to someone using a dentist in their company in Oakland. The exact. Same. Thing. I'm going to file a complaint with the Better Business Bureau and find another dentist.I feel bad for Dr. Alison. He's a great dentist, and he was referred to me by a friend who he's helped a lot. I hear from her recently that he's very unhappy with the relationship with Total Health. I wonder why.

Sharing an update. I was initially disappointed with my experience in trying to schedule an appointment for cleanings and xray. After sharing my experience on yelp, I received a call form the office to schedule an appointment. I have to say my experience in the office was quite pleasant. Everyone was friendly, and my appointment went as planned. I was in and out in about an hour. This location is convenient for me so I will continue to come. This dentistry fosters "whole health" so they did some untraditional things like take my blood pressure and schedule me a for a free massage. Its pretty cool for a dentist to do that! Also a pretty cool tidbit: the doctor makes his own mouth wash and its quite tasty!

I moved and was looking for a new dentist. I really like you can schedule online and the office is very nice. When I booked online as a new patient they didn't also schedule a cleaning, and there was no option to add a cleaning so I assumed it would happen at the same appointment, if did not. I see the dentist every 6 months, but they tried to tell me they needed to fix 4 fillings that weren't good enough and I had one cavity. How can I go from my last appointment 6 months ago with everything is fine to needing 1500+ in dental work? If they struggled to fix the filling they would either leave it or give me a crown, if you can leave it, then why do you need to fix it? Why risk messing it up and then needing a crown? I was there for an hour and a half and I didn't even get a cleaning. I felt they were very pushy, trying to get me to get unnecessary services. When I said I would think about it think about it, the dentist came back and was more pushy. I didn't want to schedule a cleaning and the receptionist tried to get me in as a place holder appointment and we could reschedule even though I said I didn't want to make one. I had to just walk away. The worst part for me was when the dentist wanted me to floss for her, since she didn't believe me I flossed. It was all very performative and felt very patronizing. I don't go to the dentist to get talked down to, if you think I need to floss better, say that, don't talk down to me.
Love this place! I get great service from the receptionist to the RDH, Jean-Claude, every time. I like that they remind me of my upcoming appointments with emails and texts. I highly recommend!

Dr Alison's practice has been bought out by total health. Nothing but one problem after the next after trying to get a single crown done. Poor dental service and disorganized staff forced me to take multiple days off work for their incompetence.I have emailed my response directly to the owner. I think my review says everything I want to say.

The staff at Total Health are incredible! Everyone was super welcoming and thoughtful. It had been a long time since my last dental visit, and everyone made me feel comfortable. No judgment at all. The X-rays, consultation, and cleaning were professional and speedy. Hardly any wait at all. Shout out to Jean-Claude, who did my cleaning, for being so efficient and easy-going. I'm excited to come back!
highly recommend Jean-Claude RDH!! he's really nice and genuinely wanted to get to know you and cleaned my teeth so well!

Jean Claude came in and gave me a deep clean after a year of no cleaning. Came in and talked through my current dental state and gave tips on how to keep my teeth healthy. Very professional & personable, even completed my cleaning faster than I expected. 5/5 would recommend.
Love coming here for my dental appointments! Big thanks to Jean-Claude for a great experience!
Just got a really thorough cleaning, teeth feeling slick and fresh. Everyone here is very kind, helpful, and especially patient and clear in communication. Very happy to return here every 6 months.

I love this place!! Â They care about the patients and were able to get me an appointment super quick. Â I had my bleach done today and the price was also super fare. Â I'm gonna make my boyfriend come here too!!

I love this place! Everyone is very knowledgeable, friendly, and accommodating. It works perfectly for me too since I live in the neighborhood so I'm very happy to have such a great dentist office nearby.
I had Jean Claude as my hygienist. He was very personable and we had a nice chat. Cleaned my teeth really well and followed up with estimates for recommended treatment. Overall great guy

Been a patient for a lil over a year now, I usually come in for cleanings but got a filling done today. I was in and out in under an hour. The staff is always so friendly and greets me by name and treatment was pain free!

I highly recommend the the Broadway location. Dr. Cassidy and Monica did an amazing job, and I'm comfortable moving forward with more more work at this location.The staff are supportive funny and very efficient. It's my first time laughing out loud with the nitrous! My first visit was at Emeryville, closer to my home. The patients who've been going there for years say great things. I had an abscess and experienced inefficient staff who show minimal respect, empathy or patient care. Â Took three weeks and many lapses in follow through for them to refer me to the awesome Broadway office for surgery. Emeryville also charged me 65% upfront when my plan actually covers 80%, then told me I was not scheduled for surgery. Â If I was not in so much pain, the buffoonery at Emeryville would have been a good comedy sketch. Go to Broadway or one of the professional practices.

I had a wonderful comprehensive treatment here. Amazing hygienist who explained every detail of my care! Very kind staff and great experience from start to finish. Love this office and the overall attention received

The dental hygienists and dentist are very nice. I have had bad experiences with dentists office shaming you previously, but they have always been nice and give constructive feedback that helps you take care of your teeth. I have always had a great experience at this dental office. I highly recommend it. Also, they have this mouthwash that's great!
Jean-Claude was wonderful, very informative and thorough cleaning. I will be coming back! (:

Wow! I had come to dr Allison's office here a year ago and came back again confused to see a complimentary acupuncture, massage and nutrition consultation sign and an awesome new holistic vibe with teas and books etc.I just wasn't sure if the place had changed or I just had a crazy failing memory suddenly so was a bit starstruck in the moment... total health is the real deal though! They make an organic mouthwash and cbd lip balm too with samples!great place to go Anna, Jean-Claude, Maxine were all greatly helpful too!
I got my deep cleaning from Jean Claude PDH. He's really friendly and makes sure you have the best experience.

Staff is super friendly and emphasizes holistic health in addition to dental hygiene. Danelle and Maxine were wonderful. They did an amazing job. So lucky to have this dentists practice so close to my home.
Great ambience and staff. spa like environment which makes it a lot relaxing to visit to the dentist.

Haven't been to the dentist in 7 1/2 years and this office was super friendly. Jean-Claude was professional and gentle with my long-forgotten (but not disregarded) teeth and gums and kept the conversation entertaining.
Came in to get a deep cleaning and jean-Claude was amazing, very gentle and quick! Highly recommended!

Had my cleaning done by Jean-Claude RDH. It was painless and timely procedure. I thoroughly enjoyed all of the staff members and personally like this Emeryville location more than the berkeley/Oakland location. Less busy and warm support!

Great, quick and efficient! Jean-Claude was great at cleaning and got me out on time!!Just as an update (8/20/19)I went to get another professional opinion at another dental office as I got weird vibes, and was notified I do not three root canals that this office recommended I do urgently. They give free mouth wash to trade for yelp review. The team is friendly but way overpriced for the work they do ...(First review to get the mouthwash) The whole team was AMAZING! I had a phobia of the dentist and so far so great!.
First time here! Had a cleaning with John and a quick filling with Dr Web. Procedures are quick! Maxine was also very helpful! Would definitely come back again. Recommended!
This place is great. Staff is friendly, happy and efficient. I'll definitely keep coming back!
