I just had my first appointment this morning! I was a little worried because it had been about five years since I'd been to see someone. However, everything was super efficient, and everyone was super nice! Shoutout to Jean-Claude for an awesome cleaning!

My 5-star review of Dr Allison remains unchanged - he's still the best dentist ever. Unfortunately the office itself was recently bought and is now the exact sort of corporate-feeling place I prefer to avoid with medical care. Gone is the independent family business with the personalized care; suddenly it's hard even to get through to a human, and harder to get a callback, even on a message we left in the middle of the night when a tooth broke, asking for a callback in the morning. This lack of a callback (most just asking for appts) has happened 5 times already and Total Health has only been in charge a few months. With medical care increasingly faceless and impersonal, I loved this remaining holdout. I'm staying for Ana's and Dr Allison's dedication and expertise, and if they ever left I'd follow them anywhere, but Total Health - meh. Same ol', same ol', right down to the annoyingly cute outgoing messages.

I normally hate going to the dentist but they have a very approachable atmosphere. All the staff are incredibly nice and friendly. My cleaning was done quickly and I'm super happy with all the work I had done here. Also being able to make crowns in house saved a lot of time and an extra trip to the office!

I'm pretty sure this place will be selling Pizza's Â soon. This place is not the same and there's no affiliation with Dr Allison! The office manager is incompetent and she doesn't care about the patients. They spoke bad of Dr. Allison's work and they made him out to be some kind of crook. Please don't waste your time or money with this place. I wonder if the people that work here are certified to do the job they're performing!

Everyone here was so willing to help me feel comfortable after a not so great past dentist. They were friendly and explained everything well. I even felt confident enough scheduling a future appointment. Thanks!

Dr. Allison sold his business, and it's now not the same. Â IF you get Dr. Allison, you'll get excellent dental care. Â But the customer service end of things is really lacking. Â The office is now part of a big conglomeration of dental offices with one main switchboard and office. Â SO, back before this happened, they answered their own phones, called you right back, and everything was great. Â Now, you call and listen to an overly cute phone message, you press the appropriate button and leave a message, and they don't call back. Â It's really a shame. Â Dr. Allison is a great dentist, but I fear that the service is going downhill. Â I gave 3 stars to give them the benefit of the doubt, but will lower it if nothing changes by my next visit.
Jean-Claude strikes again!! Another excellent cleaning experience w him and I so look forward to more appointments w my new favorite hygienist!!!

Dr. Allison is the best, most professional, reasonable, caring and compassionate dentist that I've been to. Â They have a state of the art and modern dental facility and he is a full service dentist. Â My experiences have all been favorable.

I just started coming to THDC and I love it. It's a great location and a friendly and helpful staff that are always willing to accommodate. I had my cleaning by Jean-Claud RDH and he always does a great job! I really like all the dental care products they share with you because it does feel like well-rounded care.
Total health care is amazing!!! So nervous about coming in today as it's been 3 years. Everyone is super nice and gentle. 5 stars :)
My favorite dentist - they treat you like a whole person here, are skilled and take their time with you. Highly recommend!
the staff takes the time to really be patient with you and understand what's happening with your tooth & gum health. All so personal and polite!

I have been with Dr Allison and the old crew of oral hygienist for 12 years and was very happy until he sold the business. I told the new oral hygienist that my old hygienist had a particular way of cleaning my teeth due to sensitivity. The oral hygienist offered local anesthesia to numb my sensitivity but I refused as I never had to use it in the past. Also, she accused my old hygienist of being negligent for not using the "gold standard," (a machine that removes tooth plaque rather than just using periodontal scalers). I proceeded with the "gold standard" anyway as I was there and I was due for cleaning.Before the procedure began, she asked what I did for work, but due to her being disrespectful to my past experience and condemning that there is only the current gold standard method, I decided to keep my interaction short and gave her a short answer without further going into details. Would my work experience relate to my current dental treatment anyway? Then she quickly assumed that I did not want to talk and therefore said, we do not need to talk.As the teeth cleaning procedure proceeded mid-way. She left and had a conversation with the office manager. The office manager then came to help her document my receding gum line measurements and all other documentation. But out of the blue the oral hygienist stated that "I REFUSED oral hygiene teaching." The manager nodded and stated that she will also document that without assessing the scenario to begin with. I may not want to talk about matters that do not relate to my dental health but to automatically assume that I refuse teaching of oral hygiene? Seriously? If my work experience mattered to your assessment of my health history, maybe as a healthcare professional you could have kindly stated a reason for your question. At this point, I was really upset as I proceeded quietly with her way of cleaning my teeth. I would at times become uncomfortable and started gagging during the cleaning but that was as much response I had to her way of teeth cleaning. When I became uncomfortable, the oral hygienist would give up not cleaning those areas and assume a measurement of my molar without further assessment or asking some other technician or doctor to help.The company promotes a spa experience that uses alternative methods to make the customer feel comfortable, but the experience was not measuring up to the advertisement. I am bringing my business somewhere else.
Jean-Claude was great! Super thorough and had great recommendations. Cleanings are generally no fun, but this was very smooth and pain-free.
Jean-Claude gave me a great cleaning, Dr Allison was punctual and friendly. Great staff.
Great experience with the team as a new patient today! Jean-Claude was excellent for my teeth cleaning, very gentle and thorough and friendly. All around highly recommend!

Awesome Place! Love their holistic and natural approach. Its's not everywhere you can get a massage at your dentist's office either, haha. They have a super friendly team, welcoming me warmly from the get-go. Definitely recommend! I signed up for their yearly membership, it's like having the benefits of dental insurance for an affordable price. Shout out to Jean-Claude for an amazing experience!

First time here, couldn't have been more awesome. Dr. Sara(h) was very easy to talk to, quick, and efficient. She is awesome. Got two fillings in like 30 minutes. The office manager was also amazing.Love this place will be coming back again and again.
Came in for a quick and easy filling! Thank you Dr Pacheco for helping me be relaxed.
Super nice people! Fast and professional. They took care of my broken tooth and scheduled me for further treatments! Highly recommend them!
Jean-Claude provides excellent service and is very detailed when cleaning your teeth! He is very personable! I recommend him as your go to person at Total Health Dental Care here in Emeryville.
Jean-Claude did an amazing job on my cleaning. Very considerate and gentle. Very diligent.

Dr. Allison retired without letting patients know. I got no welcome or notification that a new doctor had taken over the practice. When I went in for a cleaning, all strangers. According to my insurance, I was seen by a new dentist, but I have no clue who that was. So, ignore my old review.

Disclosure: This is my own personal experience that I want to share so that people can hopefully learn to ask questions and inquire when procedures are pushed unto you.I went in for a general cleaning. After the xrays the dentist told me I had a little sliver of tooth which was a remnant of my wisdom tooth removed 10 years ago. It hadnt bothered me all these years and no other dentist has even mentioned it before. I was told about it and initially I declined his offer to remove it. The dentist essentially said that its an easy procedure, 5 minutes, single cut, and will heal in the next few hours. After awhile he finally convinced me to do it. I went to pay my copay and was handed a bill for over 100 dollars. I wish he would have mentioned that it was considered "surgery" and that while my insurance covered 90% of the procedure that I was going to have to pay more. The worst part is when I came back a several months later and they billed me for the "surgery" again and told me it was because I paid the estimate and that didnt cover the actual cost.

I had a great cleaning with the hygienist and the assistant was very nice, it was comfortable and he recommended things to help with my sensitivity. I also made a complimentary appointment with the acupuncturist before I left. Thanks total health I had a great visit.

I waited a few months before leaving a review. It helps in providing a more relevant feedback. Initially you may have a lot of pain, or you may be happy a procedure is over.I called Dr. Allison's office to make an appointment. A wisdom tooth had caved in. I was given an appointment within a week. His assistant, who is very kind, took my X-rays. The doctor gave me options for treatment. I had teeth cleaning, filling and wisdom tooth removal done at his office. I referred my wife who was also happy with the services provided. What I like the most is that you don't get pressured to have multiple things done. Dr. Allison gives you professional opinion and leaves the ultimate decision up to you. His staff are also very helpful in providing feedback on the amount of remaining coverage. Dr. Allison seems like a guy who you would go out and have a drink with. His colleague, Dr. King, carried out the tooth extractionis also an awesome guy.

Office staff at Total Health Dental Care was super attentive and welcoming, Favela at the front was very knowledgeable and answered all my questions with precision. Dr. Sara was great too, I will definitely be returning for all of my dental needs.

I've been looking for a holistic dentist since moving back to the Bay and I'm super pleased to have found Total Health. The staff is incredibly warm, friendly, knowledgeable, and made my first visit a breeze. It was a pleasure to meet Dr. Sara - I'm grateful to have a knowledgeable, professional, and trustworthy dentist. I will definitely be recommending their care and service! Thank you again Total Health.
Got teeth cleaning from Jean-Claude. Â Quick and painless. Â Nice staff. Â No wait. Â Parking.

First time coming to a dentist in a VERY very very long time. I came in because I saw good reviews and well, to be honest the clinic itself looked from pictures (yes I judged a book by its cover!). So glad I did! Sara is the most enthusiastic dentist I've ever come across. She's personable and has social skills wish is refreshing. All her recommendations were honest and not at all forceful. I'll be coming back for some more minor work and am encouraged to actually look after my teeth. Also, staff is super kind and sweet, including the nurses. P.s. Try the mouth wash!!

Dr. Allison Is Best Dentist Ever Has Over 20+ Years Experience And Does Great Job , I Would Recommend This Dentist Office Too Everyone , Hard Too Find Great Dental Work And Price Are Very Fair And Have Payment Options, Out Of SCALE 1-10 Would Truly RATE This Dentist Office A 10+ , Customer Service Is Great As Well And Place Is Kepted Very Clean !!! Very Happy With My Experience Here !!!!!!!!!!!!

Dr Allison retired after 30+ years and sold his practice to this "holistic" practice. Â It is literally 2x the price but I continued because I live a few steps from the office. Always have a good experience getting clean ups and check ups here. Top notch dentists and hygienists. Jean-Claude is great and keeps my teeth fresh
Jean-Claude was super friendly and did a great and fast job. I'll definitely be back for another visit. Thanks!
Best teeth cleaning around! And if you need some new mouth that will keep your mouth nice and healthy, hit these folks up!

This office has a great feel to it! The receptionist was super friendly and thorough when explaining their philosophies around holistic health (which I love). Then the rest of the staff took great care of me, always checked in to make sure I was comfortable, and made my overall experience positive! And that's hard to say about a dentist appt...

1st time in over three years where I have been in a dental office and I had an overall amazing experience. Upon arrival, the receptionist were welcoming and helped me fill out the paperwork. The office is on the 2nd floor which somewhat confused me but not too hard to find. Anna took good care of me as she took all of my X-rays diligently; she was gentle and super thorough. Then Jean Claude completed my dental cleaning; he didn't make me feel bad for not seeing a dentist in years. He held great conversation while making me feel comfortable and was still very efficient with the cleaning. My teeth have never felt better and cleaner. I originally came in for pain due to my wisdom teeth and nothing irritated it further which was reassuring in their practices. Overall great experience and I will be coming back as a regular!

Omg ! Let me start off by saying this is my new dentist and I'm in love ! They are so caring got my teeth back to looking GREAT ! I love the employee especially Susan Â she rock ! She made my visit so relaxing and comfortable! Also Dr Pacheco my hat goes off to you and your work you did in my mouth ! See u guys on my next appointment

Very courteous and professional team including everyone from the front desk staff, to the hygienists, to the dentists themselves. I needed x-rays, a deep cleaning and a few fillings done. Every appointment was set up quickly and conveniently, with complete transparency about what my insurance would cover. All of my appointments went off without a hitch. Dr. Martinez did and amazing job. My front tooth was broken and I was unable to move forward with a crown so luckily enough I got a temporary filling and it looks amazing the best work I've ever had.

I've been seeing Dr. Allison for a long time. The recent changes with Total Health Dental Care have been amazing. The high tech equipments and new friendly staff. Still glad to see the familiar faces like Patty who's been amazing and helpful.

Went to him for about 8 years. Good front desk--a rarity. Have sensitive teeth and he has given me gas. It genuinely hurts to have a standard cleaning and the other ones look at you funny. Very nice mellow bedside manner. I would trust him with more difficult procedures. Another good dentist said he has 'good hands' which i think means good at procedures. After bad experiences at western dental and another oakland dentist I am grateful for Dr. A. Also there is parking right in front!
I recommend him to everyone, from the cashier at my local grocery store to my roommate's parents. This man is a magician.

MY FAITH IN HUMANITY HAS BEEN RESTORED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!A little background..i had visited another dentist prior on a groupon because I did not have dental insurance they charged me extra for fluoride that Dr. Allison told me was unnecessary for me and also informed me that I needed 6 fillings, the cost (even with a discount for paying cash) OVER $1200I did not get any work done and left, in my head knowing that there was no way I could have that many cavities since in my 35 yrs on this planet I have only had 3 EVER!!!LET'S GET TO THE GOOD STUFF about the wonderful Dr. Allison....Parking was a dream, I walk in an am immediately greeted and given the normal paper work to fill out. I return it to the desk and I don't even have time to pull out my phone to entertain myself when I am called to the back...WOW Quickest waiting room experience to date!!!! A very nice assistant took my X-rays, then lead me to my exam chair to wait for the Dr (which I assume will be at least 30 min or more) I blink and my Dr. is there and ready to get down to business! Again I am pleasantly surprised.After the exam Dr. Allison tells me everything looks good but I have old fillings that will need some maintenance... AND we can do it today no problem I'M IN SHOCK AND AWE.... Pinch me I am dreaming.So i do NOT have 6 cavities???? WOW WOW WOW... Shame on the previous dentist (i yelped them after learning of this new information)I have never been so happy to visit a dentist in my life.... THANK YOU Dr Allison for being one of the good guys!!!!

In and out! Efficient and straightforward. P at reception was friendly and answered all my questions patiently, A who took my X-rays was really sweet. I think this is the first time in a while a dental office hasn't tried to sell me something I didn't need. Dr. Allison was clear, calm, friendly but not overly talkative or naggy, which I appreciate.

I feel very lucky to have found Dr. William Allison, actually through these Yelp reviews. I haven't been to the dentist in an awfully long time, so needless to say there was a lot of work to be done. I was terrified, shaking and crying coming in. I came out (and in for my 2nd appt) so grateful that he is so good at what he does that I was in no pain whatsoever. Recalling those numbing shots from my teenage years, it was enough to rip my eyeballs out. But with him it was all shockingly painless. And I say this as someone with a lower pain tolerance. He was attentive and listened to my concerns, and discussed everything with me. The helping staff was also so great at making me feel comfortable and explaining everything to me. I'm so happy that I'm healed :)
Love Dr. Allison and his crew. they've been my dentist for many years, and I've referred many family members and friends there. No hassle, no nonsense, minimal pain :) and always very pleasant.
BEST DENTIST I HAVE EVER HADHonest, fair prices, gets you in quickly, does great work. I can't recommend him highly enough

I'm a happy patient! Â Uniformly top notch treatment from the receptionist to the hygienist to Dr. Allison himself. Â No up-selling or recommending unnecessary treatments; just good, solid, competent dental care from experienced professionals. Â And my care there has been the most pain-free I've ever experienced. Â Highly recommended!

I have been a customer for over a decade and i love him. Â Deep personalized service. He knows all his customers and cares about you. I also love that he doesn't push procedures you don't need. Â I have had 2 dental emergencies in the last month and he took me in right away and solved the problem. Â Other dentists make you wait days.

Ten things I would rather do than go to the dentist: 1. Â Open a gay bar in Tehran.2. Â Chop off both my legs.3. Â Spend the day at Ikea. Â yelp.com/biz/ikea-emeryvâ¦4. Â Have a threesome with Rosie O'Donnell and Barbara Walters5. Â Be a passenger in a minivan in the middle of Critical Mass with an elderly driver inching forward and yelling, "get out of the road you punks!"6. Â Have dinner with Chris Daly.7. Â Give myself a vasectomy.8. Â Blind myself with an ice pick.9. Â Listen to Tom Shane telling me over and over again why I "have a friend, in the diamond business."10. Move to Orange County.But if I have to go to the dentist, Bill Allison and his staff make it as pleasant as possible.

Update: I did receive a very nice call from the Dentist himself, so they are good people who care about their patients, but I'm still pretty peeved about missing out on work and my $15!I would give this place no stars if I could. Unfortunately, I'd hate to jump the gun, since I didn't even get to SEE the dentist for my appointment.I made my appt. for 1:20pm. I arrived at 1pm, you know, get there early, take care of the new patient paperwork etc...and be on my way for a simple teeth cleaning.It was a hard road to get here, since I had to make a special trip out to the inner sunset on a Saturday all the way from Oaktown via public transit just to pick up my x-rays for this appt. Did I mention I had to pay $15 for said x-rays for the rush job? Yeah.So I sit and wait. And wait. 45 minutes go by and then I get some x-rays done. Oh yeah, my x-rays weren't even good enough. And I wait. I wait some more. I think I've read just about every People magazine in the joint and know everything about Michael Phelps and Portia and Ellen's wedding now.It is now a full 90 minutes since I've walked in the door, and my teeth have not been cleaned. The dental hygienist was nice enough, but to leave me sitting in a room for almost an hour, when I have no idea or hope of getting my teeth cleaned, really is bad business.If I had all day to sit, sure. I don't mind waiting. It's a Monday afternoon. Those with insurance usually work, like me. I had to get back to work. I chose this place specifically for its close locale to my office. This is what I get for trying to make things easier for myself because I don't have a car.I'll make a note to myself and listen next time I want to wander away from Dr. Jang. Sure, he calls me a carnie and has weird TV commercials, but he's always been prompt, has the best dentists and I always get free stuff and hugs from them.I can't speak for Dr. Allison himself, but my first experience with his office will probably be my last. I'm pretty sure of it. Now I just have to get my x-rays back!!!

This guy is old school in that he has a 'work ethic' (WHAT!??), doesn't have a fancy website [if any...I couldn't find it] , not a prime-donna, too 'important' to sit for 10 minutes to work on you... doesn't Â make you come back several times if you have more than a thing or two that need to be done...he sits there and does it....NOW., until it's done. Â He doesn't cheap-out on the novocain...my face was numb for hours BUT, I didn't feel a thing after deep cleaning, several filling AND a crack in a front tooth fixed Â He's calm & matter of fact. Going to the dentist can be like going to an auto mechanic. They can tell you what is wrong and fix the problem. Either way I would not really know the difference as I do not know how to put in a crown, nor do I know how to install a catalytic converter for my car (never know if I am supposed to use or, or nor here). They get the job done honestly and do not tell you need to refill your fillings every few years just to make a few bucks. Yes, a dentist I went to a few times when I was in college in Davis did this to me and my out of pocket was around $500. Bottom line is William Allison is an honest dentist and I recommend him. I was referred to Dr. Allison by a friend who knew that, as a grown man, I fear the dentist and am not affraid to say so. Â Dr. Allison's staff is awesome. Â He was very relaxed, not loud, and effective at working gently. Â The whole procedure took (tops) 5 minutes. Â **Since my first visit, I've been back a second & third time for more work. Â Dr. Allison continues to be as gentle as before. Â I had a crown replaced and at the same visit, he did a repair to a chipped tooth. Â Today I'm going in for a deep cleaning. Â I think I'm turning into one of those people that looks forward to the dentist!**If you fear the dentist, MAN, woman or child...or you're looking for a new one, Dr. Allison and his staff are just for you. I've been taken care of by Dr. Allison for well over fifteen years. The fact that I keep going back is probably all you need to know. Absolutely blown away and happy as can be!! After battling a nasty sinus infection for over a week, I caved and tried to get an appointment with my GP. We didn't end the call until Dr. Rudy was totally satisfied that all my questions were answered and I'd gotten everything I'd paid for. The medical profession treating me like a human being? How amazing and wonderful that feels! Â :)We decided a course of antibiotics was in order, and twenty minutes later I was picking up my prescription at the pharmacy. Problem solved!! Total cost: $100 for the consultation (about the same--or even less--than a visit to a doctor's office) and about $25 for the meds, without the usual hassles and long wait times. A customer service agent even called to confirm my appointment beforehand and to make sure I was totally satisfied. Sweet!! Â :DNo hyperbole: Plushcare is just how healthcare SHOULD be. Fast, efficient, no-nonsense treatment and care without the hassle or bureaucracy or long wait times, plus knowledgeable and professional doctors who genuinely treat you as a PERSON instead of a number. I absolutely love this service, and I'm definitely going to keep using them for my run-of-the-mill healthcare needs. Best of all, they accept insurance and confirm it right there on the phone--no BS or double-talk, no up-selling or service charges, no "just one more thing" attempts to get you to sign up for a credit card. If Plushcare were a woman I'd marry it in a second!Plushcare might not be your best choice for serious life-threatening illnesses (you'll want to visit the ER for severe problems), but for things like sore throats, sinus infections, and other various frustrating and annoying conditions Plushcare is #1 in my book. Thanks SO MUCH to Plushcare and Dr. Rudy, my new favorite doctor!!

I found out about this through a medical question I asked online. It almost sounded too good to be true, but for $99 and to not have to leave my house in the pain I was in was amazing. I called to verify the address it was sent to and I was in the right place. I explained that this grocery store has no pharmacy (so where did my prescription go...?) and as far as I know, this brand doesn't have pharmacies at any location. I was told the grocery stores themselves would have to update their website/listing and it would be updated with Plush. Confused, I gave the person the information for the pharmacy I usually use and they sent the prescription there (this pharmacy was not on their interactive map but the brand logo was at the bottom of the page). The prescription was called in and I had the medications about an hour later. Overall, I would definitely recommend this service, however, I would also recommend some updates on the website so people like me aren't driving from city to city looking for where our prescriptions went. Pay the $99, and just verify the pharmacy ahead of time.

I came across PlushCare while searching for urgent care options in Oak Harbor, Ohio. I was not necessarily looking for treatment during my call. Instead I was primarily calling to determine whether I needed immediate medical care for a set of symptoms that could have possibly related to a serious medical condition. I tried getting in to see several local doctors with no luck that day, so this seemed a convenient and viable alternative. The scheduling process was easy (though be aware that the time zones on the schedule may be for CA time and not your own) and I received a call promptly at my scheduled time. So far, so good.But what REALLY amazed me was the quality of the interaction between my doctor and me. He listened carefully and didn't rush me at all. He asked questions directly related to my specific concerns. Once I finished presenting my symptoms and concerns, he asked great questions. I've noticed often that doctors do not pick up on nuances or listen carefully and end up jumping to conclusions instead.After I finished sharing my symptoms, Dr. Wantuck summarized which of my symptoms concerned him and which did not. Since I was trying to evaluate how serious my symptoms were, this was extremely helpful. He was sensitive, compassionate, and I could tell that he was taking my situation seriously.Being candid, I will say that I had a high level of skepticism about the online doctor experience. I questioned the credentials of the doctors that would provide service this way, and didn't expect such a satisfying, professional experience. I have recommended PlushCare to many friends and family since my first experience and will certainly use the service again in the future.

But she called back precisely at 10:00 AM, and proceeded to listen very carefully to my girlfriend's problem and requirements and prescribed the exact medications she needed. The only thing I would advise is to double-check the pharmacy that you are going to pick them up, because there are so many pharmacy chains within a particular area (this was San Francisco) that we actually went to a pharmacy which we thought was the one but it was the actually the same chain but a couple of blocks down on the same street. Not a big deal but just be careful of the exact location where the prescription was sent. 2 thumbs up!!!

Wonderful care.Woke up in the middle of the night with a UTI and was googling 24 hour urgent cares.Up popped Plushcare and I made an immediate appt. for the morning.Doctor called right on time and was able to help me very quickly.He even emailed me a coupon and my medication was 1/2 the usual cost.I can't say enough good things about his demeanor and how he took the time to listen.I liked him much more than the doctor I had when I had insurance.I was a little hesitate at first because I'd never heard of Plushcare before but they have won me over.

Outstanding experience with Plushcare! I had a minor infection requiring a trip to the doctor. Great online scheduling and fantastic availability. I was able to schedule an appointment for today even though I booked after 5 pm yesterday. I got a quick onsite X-ray to augment what was done at Zuckerberg General Hospital, and received a super helpful assessment and answers to all my questions. I was in and out in less than an hour.One helpful criticism is that the online onboarding form -- after you book your appointment -- is not super intuitive. I thought there was a bug in signing my releases. It was my own user error coupled with a poor error message. You have to sign the form AFTER acknowledging both releases. Other than that very minor thing, everything was exemplary. Even that UX issue is minor considering what other practice allows you to even fill out an onboarding form before you get to the office?Another thing people should be aware of. This is an extremely efficient office. So you aren't necessarily going to start right off seeing Dr. Dickinson. I saw Breiana Brady, PA-C and thought her care was well educated and reasoned from extensive experience. Had I needed more serious intervention, I'm sure Dr. Dickinson would have gotten involved. This is great for keeping costs low and service high. But it would be important to mention it if you were looking for a second opinion or another provider after seeing a different Orthopedist.
Wow, what a great place. Made an appointment online and got in the next day. Staff and doc pleasant and thorough. Clean, efficient and competent.

Very friendly, informative and efficient staff. I saw Dr. Dickinson for a severe upper/mid back pain. He was very thorough with the exam and ruled out nerve related injuries. With that knowledge, he didn't request any imaging, which saves me $$. He was also very patient and detailed-oriented when explaining and answering my questions. Some muscle relaxant was prescribed and I'll be doing a few sessions of physical therapy. It was a very pleasant experience overall. Their uninsured visit price is $225 but I was billed $129 with my insurance rate -- it might be a lower co-pay with a low deductible plan.

I originally came to this business for a second opinion, but they've moved up as my primary due to the quality of care I've received from Dr. Dickinson and the ease of doing business with Urgently Ortho. Â Dr. Dickinson is great at both listening and explaining situations and option. Â It's also great to have the option of being there in person if necessary, but skipping that and doing telehealth when in person isn't necessary. Â So much less time wasted driving, parking, and waiting in waiting rooms. Â Depending on the situation, I've been using telehealth for about 5 years and I can't recall having a better experience.

Never been more thankful for Urgently Ortho than I am this weekend. I slipped and twisted my ankle yesterday afternoon. No break, no fracture, but confirmed I tore some ligaments. Recommended I RICE (rest, ice, compression, and elevate), and wear a boot--which they had on hand (so no waiting for an Amazon delivery or going to a pharmacy).I highly recommend the Urgently Ortho team!

We got a same-day appointment to assess a sports-related injury for my daughter. The whole UrgentlyOrtho experience was efficient and pleasant. Their website appointment system was not working, so I called. Â After calling several times, I left a voicemail and was finally called back a few hours later. I recently twisted my ankle quite badly on a slippery pool deck...in Sri Lanka. I ended up cutting my trip short, and once home, Urgently Ortho kindly squeezed me in asap. Amazing. I was in and out of there within 15 minutes with a brand new cast. Staff was awesome and check-in was a breeze (all through iPad). Happy this was so speedy! Thanks :)

Urgently Ortho exceeded our expectations! Beware of the surly office manager here. She literally just offended my client who has obvious cognitive impairment. Convenient, Professional, Efficient and Reasonable. I am extremely grad I found then on YELP. As I was driving to ER after a zip line accident with broken elbow on Saturday afternoon, I yelped to see if there were any other alternative to spending all afternoon at ER. Some damage cannot be undone. Â In retrospect, I really wish I hadn't gone to Urgently Ortho, and since I picked them based on reviews here I feel obligated to write this.My examination experience at the clinic was decent and I think they'd be fine for minor incidents. Â However, if your injury calls for an MRI, I do not recommend this clinic.Unfortunately, Urgently Ortho chose to partner with a disreputable imaging center (2-star average on Yelp at 160 reviews, with tons of horrifying stories) that they also delegate insurance matters to. As a result of their incredible incompetence, it took two weeks after I was seen to get insurance preapproval and finally get the MRI done. Â That required me having to personally make multiple follow-up calls to the imaging center, my insurance company, and Urgently Ortho to get the required info passed and things moving along.It turned out I tore my meniscus, which has a very short time window in which it can be effectively repaired through surgery. Â Naturally it takes time to also find a good surgeon and get surgery scheduled. Â This delay has had a devastating effect on my chances of healing, damage is that is irreparable and could have been easily avoided. Â (My insurance approved the request within 2 business days once they had the complete information requested).On top of that, the poor image quality resulted in a misdiagnosis of my torn ACL. Â This made me opt for a much more intrusive type of surgery than what was called for by my actual injury, and which has repercussions I will suffer for the rest of my life. I understand that these business relationships are commission based and are important for the bottom line, but if it were me I would put the patient's best interest first and pick a better business partner.

I Â want to revise my review because I may have been unfairly critical. The group at urgently ortho was very apologetic and submitted my MRI request to Cigna 3 times and they finally agreed to cover it. So I would say they were very strong advocates on my behalf. Also never use Cigna health insurance since they make you run around in circles for weeks before you can actually get procedures approved!

I am so grateful Urgently Ortho exists. Â I got in an accident while in Mexico on vacation. Â I came back to San Francisco looking for an Orthopedic doctor to look at my situation ASAP. I can't say enough nice things about Urgently Ortho. I saw both Dr. Dickinson and PA Brady for severe plantars pain. They worked with me over 3 months (!!!) to get me to a virtually pain free state. I needed to see an orthopedic specialist to get a note by Monday. I was excited to see this clinic was open on the weekends and accepts my insurance. Scheduling the appointment online through zocdoc was painless and so was filling out the online intake form. This saved time sitting in the waiting room filling out a stack of paperwork and can be done at my convenience. Liu and the staff are very friendly and you can tell are committed to the whole patient experience. I'm glad I found this clinic and I highly recommend it!

Had a bad fall and showed up without an appointment. They squeezed me in between patients during a full day. Broken wrist was confirmed, they had me splinted and referred to an orthopedic surgeon in less than an hour. I really appreciated their kindness and flexibility while I was in quite a bit of pain, and I highly recommend them.

Don't waste your time with any other urgent care clinic for any of your orthopedic injuries. I went to two clinics in the morning before Urgently Ortho, and neither of the first two could help - the first didn't do any imaging or have any crutches on site, and the second didn't have crutches in my size (I'm a 5'4'' female, so pretty freaking average!). Scheduling my appointment at Urgently Ortho took minutes online and I came in the same day, got a full physical exam of my knee, got the crutches, and anti-inflammatory prescription I needed in less than an hour. Updated to 3 stars from 1 star. Got a call back from the COO the same day this original negative review went up. Ephram called me a day or two later from his vacation to apologize that I had slipped through the cracks. The team had did their very best to remedy the situation. Apparently they had an x-ray technician that walked off the job and had been under water since then.

Got smashed bombing a hill and a couple days later decided to see a doctor. First visit was to a nearby urgent care, who after x-rays referred me to Urgently Ortho who'd made room and squeezed me in. I had a strong pain on my knee, it was Saturday and I needed to see a good doctor on the same day. I'm so glad I've found this clinic, I drove two hours and it was worth every second of the drive. Dr. Dickinson was very sharp and went straight to the point, very knowledgeable. I really recommend this clinic for the high professionalism and ethics from the staff Â to the doctors.

I have nothing but good things to say about Urgently Ortho. It was an unexpected experience and I am so glad for it. Urgently Ortho was everything you would WANT in an Urgent Care experience. I sprained my ankle a week ago and was worried that it may have been worse than a sprain. Dr. Dickinson was very considerate helping me with a severe pain I had with my big toe. He listened very well and was also well informed on to handle my issue. It was also great that he called to check on me the next day. Breiana, the PA-C helped me to confirm the diagnosis of my problem and made sure that the Dr. Dickinson was informed of the urgent need to help me out. Instead, I went to Urgently Ortho at around 7:30PM and was on my way home by 10PM. Great knowledgable group of people.

The team at Urgently Ortho are professional, and really make you feel like more than just a patient. I separated my shoulder playing rugby - wasn't the first time. These guys have seen it all before and their experience really helped ease my nerves. Thing I liked best is their availability. I wasn't sure if I needed to see a specialist. But when my condition worsened, they were available at short notice. No queues or hassles. Definitely recommend.
I echo the other 5 star reviews here. Solid experience all around. Just go if you need the services they offer.

Thank you Dr. Dickinson and team for patching my leg back up after my first and last ski run for this season. Love the ease of scheduling appointments online, patient portal app showing all appointments and meds, and the reliable and caring attention you provide 24/7. Highly recommend to anyone needing an orthopedic consult ASAP in San Francisco. Returned from Tahoe and saw doctor the next day.

This place is brilliant. Â I hate going to the doctor, even more when it's because of an annoying injury (I mean, what injury is convenient though?) and because of all the surprise medical costs seemingly associated with urgent care / emergency visits. Â However, that was not the case here. Â After an accidental slip on some stairs last weekend and a week of stubbornly limping around, I finally caved and decided to find someone to x-ray my foot. Â  I called them and they were able to check my insurance to see my coverage and get me in right away. The doctor took his time, was very no bs, and mentioned it was a new business, so I wanted to leave a review to cheer them on. I think this is a great business!

I suffered a knee injury (a serious one which I did not know at the time). They were open late, and were free to see me right away, while others were closed. Took and xray and suggested I take an MRI. Gave me crutches and a knee brace which helped with the discomfort I was feeling then.Once I found out the bad news of my knee injury from them, they were incredibly professional, and recommended next steps to start my recovery, and answered all my questions.

Story: Due to an injury I occurred while playing soccer, went looking for an orthopedic urgent care clinic in the Bay Area on the interwebs. Was pleased to find this new place Urgently Ortho. As an athlete and all around active person in general, I appreciated the connection between urgent care and sports medicine. Not only pro's at what they do, Urgently Ortho have a great mission and so far I could not have asked for a better experience. Thank you Liu & Ephraim.Office: Clean, up-to-date (modern/advanced tech), and location/hours make it easy.Staff: Understanding, direct, and informative.Advice: If you want the best care in the Bay Area, go to Urgently Ortho. Urgently Ortho has great hours, including nights and weekends. Â It's easy to get an appointment (they keep their schedule open for walk-ins or same-day appointments). Â Unlike an urgent care clinic, though, you can continue to get treatment from the same staff through your recovery.I just finished a series of appointments around my shoulder having been dislocated. Â The staff was always friendly, professional and helpful. Â I would definitely recommend them to others.

Update 2: They followed up with me saying the extra charge was an accident and would refund me the money. Though I'm not sure if they would've noticed the extra charge if I didn't, I do think it was an honest mistake and they did follow up to correct the issue.

I worked with two people at Urgently Ortho and both were great. They diagnosed my shoulder problem, explained it all to me, fixed what they could, and referred me to PT for the rest. Very pleased with the whole experience and the rest of the staff at their office.

Urgently Ortho is and has been amazing from my experience with them treating my Jone's fracture! The first day I came in, they were able to X-ray my foot immediately. I went in for multiple check-up appointments in the two months I was in a boot and cast, and they were great about always addressing my concerns (i.e. flying in a cast, getting me a waterproof cast, etc.). Dr. Dickinson and PA Breiana Brady always took the time to explain to me their thought process in detail, which was really reassuring. Their other staff are all wonderful too.I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who needs orthopedic care!

My experience as Urgently Ortho was extremely positive. The staff was very helpful, kind and understanding. It's the kind of place where you just feel taken care of the second you walk through the door. The team communicated with me in depth every step of the way, which really eased my fears. I walked in afraid due to my pain, and they put me at ease right away. They did detailed testing of my body, strength and range of motion, listened to my symptoms and concerns and also performed imagining of my body from several different angles. The specialist walked through each and every image with me, explaining anatomically how I looked. I knew at that moment that I had chosen the right place. They care about what they are doing. They took their time with me to make sure all of my questions and concerns were answered. They recommended me a solid treatment program following my appointment. I would hands down recommend them to anyone of my colleagues, family and friends .

Urgently Ortho is incredible. Convenient appointments, top notch staff, high tech office. After a thorough examination, the doctor took the time to explain my condition, give an overview of next steps, and answer my many questions. Highly recommend for an ortho injury.

Called in to see if I could schedule a same day appointment on a weeknight and was surprised to find immediate availability. Injured my knee somehow playing soccer the night before after experiencing a week of stiffness in it and within minutes, Breiana was able to diagnose my injury through a comprehensive review. Got x-rays done the same day and getting an MRI ordered ASAP to follow suit with the appropriate action plan.Great location as it is pretty central in the city and has clean and modern office facilities. Would highly recommend anyone to stop by for whatever injury needs!

I had an unfortunate experience of rolling my foot in my garage. I heard a "pop" and immediately thought I broke my ankle. I had planned to go to the emergency room at Saint Francis Memorial Hospital but they were very busy and asked me to make an appointment as they had other more serious injuries they were treating at the time. I came across Urgently Ortho through a Google search. They were close to my home. I called them and they said they could see me in a half an hour. It was Sunday and I had an Orthopedic Surgeon ready to examine my foot in half an hour. Off I went and glad to find out they are located on the ground level - easy access from the car as I was now on a 4 wheel scooter and not able to walk or go up any stairs. The office is clean, airy, bright, and the check-in process was a breeze. Everything is DIGITAL check-in on an iPad. You can even take your own selfie and upload your photo for your patient file.Dr. Dickinson greeted me immediately and did a thorough examination of my foot. He suspected it may be broken due to the location of the swelling and pain. After a few XRAY's it was confirmed that I had indeed broken my foot in two places. He immediately fitted me up with a boot and explained in great detail about "next steps" to recovery. I was super impressed with this office and felt VERY lucky to have found him. He gave me a prescription for the pain and while my friend was filling my prescription I got a call from the emergency room saying they "they were ready to see me now". I told them I had found a Sports Orthopedic Surgeon specialist and had already been seen.I will continue to see Dr. Dickinson because I believe he is the best. I Googled him and he has quite the experience as a Sports Orthopedic Surgeon. His demeanor is soft, kind and sweet. He will answer any questions you have and takes as much time as needed. If you have an injury such as foot, ankle, knee, hip, shoulder, wrist, hand or any other joint issues please make an appointment to see Dr. Dickinson. You won't be disappointed. I highly recommend this business.

Who would have thought a visit to a doctor's office could be such a wonderful experience? As someone only in town for a few days, seeing a traditional orthopedist was not an option. I was pleasantly surprised to find Urgently Ortho. From my first phone call to set up an appointment, through to check out, it was smooth sailing. I asked ahead about the pricing. I found it to be quite affordable, especially considereding the fact that you are seeing a specialist. The office itself is beautiful, clean, and conveniently located. Upon arrival, I was seen immediately, being told the appointment would take about 40 minutes (which was accurate). The man who checked me in and took my vitals was very knowledgeable. He seemed genuinely interested in what I had to say. I was impressed by my doctor Brianna, who was charming, relatable, and confident. An accupuncturist joined in on my appointment as well, offering valuable insights. Brianna gave me a prescription and a plan of action, and all three of them gave me enthusiastic personal recommendations for an upcoming trip to Asia!You can't beat this level of care and convenience. Thanks Urgently Ortho!

When my mom hurt her knee over the weekend, we were about to go to the ER, but then found Urgently Ortho on a whim, and I'm SO glad we did. Â  Â  The hours are super convenient, customer service is top-notch, office is new, clean and check in was a breeze. Dr. Dickinson is a great Dr.--I'll be recommending Urgently Ortho in the future!

The staff here is incredible. Everything you want when you are in serious pain- kind, patient, gentle, and on the ball. I went in late Friday night w a torn meniscus and a knee that popped out. They took x-rays and did a full exam and explained the next steps without scaring me;) Each one who works there was clearly chosen for a reason. The Dr. gave clear instructions and I felt more taken care of immediately than at a regular hospital.

My husband called me during an evening run where he "forgot" to wear a headlamp, having tumbled over himself due to a pavement crack. Â It turns out he broke a bone in his elbow, and I was able to be a hero by finding and depositing him at Urgently Ortho (someone still had to go pick up the kids). Â We plan to move our son to this practice, as his "big name" ortho person does not have the bandwidth and may have missed a diagnosis recently.

One of the most pleasant and efficient visits ive been to! The front desk was very punctual, inviting, and caring. I came in for a consult/exam due to a knee injury and thankfully i had a positive prognosis. Would recommend to any who have any orthopedic injuries!

This was my first time at Urgently Ortho. I was feeling some lower back pain and wasn't sure who I could talk to. Thank goodness Urgently Ortho was there for me! I made an appointment online and then received a phone call from the receptionist confirming my appointment and following up with me. Great customer service! I was freaking out since I never had a back issue but she was very nice and professional. I left knowing I have solutions for my back pain. Thank you Urgently Ortho!

As a repeated offender for knee injury, I am really glad to have found this place. Due to a knee injury (that popping sound) from playing tennis, I was not able to walk or bear weight with my right knee. While I was weighing the ER or other urgent care options, this came up in a yelp search and fits exactly what I need. For what I have, going to the ER would mean hours of wait and $$$$$. Â - they are on street-level - you know how difficult it is to walk in crutches, not to mention climbing stairs.- the appt started and finished on time.Obviously not looking forward forward to another injury, but now I know where to go!

I injured my finger & after a month of it still hurting, decided I needed to see a doctor. Â I found urgently ortho in a google search, because I wanted to go somewhere other than a hospital where there would be both an x-ray and a doctor who could diagnose & help fix an injury. Â I highly recommend this one-stop-shop if you find yourself in need of an orthopedist & don't want to wait a long time for an appointment or have to sit in a hospital for hours.

One of the best experiences I've had a doctors office. Easy to book an appointment in advance.The office was clean; the staff was professional and efficient. The PA and Dr. are very experienced and clearly identified the issue with my partially torn chest. They provided an MRI referral and follow up appointment in 2 weeks. Very efficient. Would recommend to anyone in SF.

As an active person, I recently developed Plantar Fasciitis in my left foot and needed to see someone quick on a Sunday (flying out on an intl trip the following week).I found Urgently Ortho and frankly, was blown away by their short notice availability, service, professionalism and expertise.The office is sleek/modern and the staff was welcoming with a genuine desire to help solve my issue.I highly recommend them for any orthopedic issues and will definitely be going back for any medical needs.

I went in for a knee injury, and they were able to take a same-day x-ray and give me peace of mind right away! It took a couple days for insurance to go through, but they were very helpful and professional throughout the whole process.

Had a pretty nice wipeout on my bike today. Hand felt weird and wanted to know for sure that there was nothing major wrong. I was seen by a PA who was very nice but said i looked fine and lucked out after a bike accident. I went to a sports medicine doctor who told me I tore my ACL after 10 minutes of evaluation. A MRI confirmed that I had tore my ACL. I feel compelled to write this review because my family took me here because of the rave reviews but I feel that their quality of care could be improved.

Every major city should have an Urgently Ortho! Â I got great medical service in a modern environment with friendly staff when I had sudden and unexplained shooting pain. Â My nurse's hotline recommended I go to the ER, but I felt that was overkill. Â At the same time, I didn't want to ignore the pain for too long and wait weeks for an Ortho appointment. Â Urgently Ortho was the perfect in-between option to deal with an urgent pain issue that didn't quite merit an ER visit. Â You can feel confident that your issue will get professionally and competently addressed at Urgently Ortho.

My boyfriend and I had made a weekend trip up to San Fran this past weekend, and unfortunately coming down a flight of stairs I broke my ankle. We google searched Urgently Ortho and made an apt online which literally took a minute. Thank you Urgently Ortho for giving my boyfriend and I the most accommodating experience.

I was up in SF with friends and I took a spill on a bike. Â I just happened to be near their location so walked in. I was surprised on how clean modern the place looked. I didn't feel like I was at any sort of "Hospital" or urgent care. The staff was inviting and knowledgeable. Apparently, the office is new but everyone there has years of experience elsewhere. I felt like I was in great hand and I would definitely return, but lets hope I don't need to. Haha!

I had a bad fall yesterday and went to the CPMC Davies emergency room. I really didn't want to go as I knew what type of experience it would be and sure enough they lived up to their poor reputation. Beyond a bad experience, I also was misdiagnosed as having no fractures. Still in pain this morning, I came across Urgently Ortho. Making an appointment was easy. Initial patient setup was a breeze and I was seen right away. After reviewing my x-rays and taking the time to actually evaluate my injuries, they suggested one more x-ray. That simply involved going to another room where it was quickly performed and evaluated. Needless to say, that's where my fracture finally showed. I was in and out in under an hour (compared to four at CPMC) at a fraction of the price and with a level of care that can't even be compared. I will be having my follow up sessions here.

These people helped me during a day that was practically nightmarish. Hurt my knee and was scrambling to find someone who would examine it today since my previous employer's insurance expires this coming Monday. Not only did they schedule me the same day, but it was the best orthopedic experiences I've ever had (I've had several knee surgeries, so I've been to many). They listened to my entire situation before examining, and the first doctor brought in her colleague to give me an immediate second opinion. After examining me and giving me a diagnosis, they're trying to get me seen for an MRI before my insurance expires. That's an incredible amount of care for a 7:30pm appointment on a Friday. I don't know what I would have done if it weren't for these people--simply amazing during an incredibly stressful time.

Went here today for a painful foot sprain. Who knew orthopedic urgent care was a thing? It was super convenient to be able to see an experienced specialist and have access to x-ray machines on a weekend. And I also appreciate not being exposed to the typical viruses of a normal urgent care waiting room. (Our family has been sick enough this winter from everything going around preschool). The office is brand new (it has only been open for 2 months), the doctor was nice, listened patiently, and answered all of my questions. Glad I saw someone post about this on facebook, because I think the office was too new to show up on my Yelp/Google searches for Urgent Care w/ x-rays.

I was working out in the gym when I started feeling knee pain while doing squats. I've been trying to squat heavier weights so I wanted to be careful I wasn't doing something bad to my knee. The entire staff at Urgently Ortho was professional and helpful, and their doctor's office very comfortable. I would definitely recommend Urgently Ortho to others!

I went to Dr. Dickinson at Urgently Ortho last week after a knee injury, and the experience was very easy. This place is fantastic. Dr. Dickerson was very professional, knowledgeable and friendly. Very easy to get an appointment on a Saturday. I didn't know it existed until we were referred by the regular urgent care place down the street, because these guys specialize in back, sports and other orthopedic issues. I received high quality care and referrals. The practice was also beautifully designed and had lots of high tech tools.

I had a lower back injury that had been slowly feeling better and better until I re-aggravated it a few weeks ago. The pain was so bad that it took 20 minutes to get out of bed in the morning. I then came across Urgently Ortho which is only 8 blocks from my home. I would highly recommend Urgently Ortho to anyone!!!

The absolute worst. They were useless and offered little to no care. You likely wont see a Dr. You will probably see a PA who will simply recommend physical therapy without listening to your concerns or injuries. Â Even after being told about the sound of feeling of bone on bone and the exceptional amount of pain .... the suggestion? Physical Therapy. Never come here!!!!

If you need to see an ortho, I would highly recommend Dr. Ephraim Dickinson and Breiana Brady! Â They are absolutely knowledgeable professionals with excellent bedside manners. Â I came in for bilateral shoulder pain that had been lingering for a while and Dr. Dickinson was able to diagnose my problem and gave me great instruction to get me back to my normal workout routine. Â The whole process from scheduling/paperwork/follow up was smooth and excellent. Â Thank you Dr. Dickinson for your help! Â Props to rest of the staff too. Â Liu, Megan and Pat are consummate professionals and make you feel very welcome!

As a long distance runner I have had plenty of injuries: ankle sprains, knee tendonitis, and IT band syndrome. I've tried other doctors, but they didn't specialize in sports injuries and didn't know how to fix my problems or how to prevent them from coming back. The group at Urgently Ortho were the first who actually understood my injuries and what caused them. With their evening hours, visits were very convenient given my busy schedule. Dr. Dickinson worked with me over many weeks, monitoring my progress to make sure everything healed correctly. Because of Dr. Dickinson I was able to quickly return to running pain free! I highly recommend Urgently Ortho!

Wonderful addition to the San Francisco medical community! HIGHLY RECOMMEND. My experience could not have been better from start to finish. The coordinator I spoke to on the phone was polite, helpful and secured a same day appointment for me. When I arrived the front desk staff was friendly, professional and ensured I was comfortable while I waited. The physicians were fantastic - thorough, efficient and so nice. The entire visit was pleasant and seamless and the space and equipment is brand new and very clean. I was so pleased with my experience that when my boyfriend suffered an injury later that same day we returned to Urgently Ortho and they squeezed us in just before close (8pm every day - another plus). I have told anyone that will listen about my extremely positive experience at Urgently Ortho and will continue to do so.
It was really easy to make a same day appointment. I was seen promptly and everyone I interacted with was very helpful and professional.
Amazing urgent care experience!! I just landed, realized my toe was swollen, and was able to get in and out in 30 minutes. Great staff- friendly, expedient. Facilities were clean, warm and central.

Just visited for an injury I got while traveling abroad and they were so lovely. First, I could book same day. Second, they saw me right away when I arrived; when I went to golden gate urgent care another time, I had to wait for 2 hours despite having an appointment. This time I was seen right away. Third, everyone was very friendly and warm. Fourth, I got a straight up story and didn't experience any sense of "up selling" - they weren't trying to get me to do procedures I didn't need. Highly recommend.

The staff was very professional from the second you walk in. Dr. Dickinson is really knowledgeable, experienced, a great listener and really answered all of my questions about my injured shoulder. The place is clean and modern. It's open 7 days a week and late, which is such a bonus!

Same day appointment!!!!! The place my doctor recommended has a month wait for an appointment and I found urgently ortho on yelp. They were in network too and incredibly affordable given I have a high deductible plan. The doctor was great and I'm certain my daughter will be dancing again in a few weeks. Best place for urgent sport injuries!!!!! Super helpful and nice staff too.

About a month ago, I fell down my stairs and thought I just sprained my ankle so I didn't go to the doctor. Fast forward to last weekend, it was hurting MORE than it had been and my friend convinced me to go get an xray - problem is it was Saturday, and my insurance is Kaiser, but I didn't want to wait for hours to get seen so I looked up Urgently Ortho's number. Â I had checked them out on Yelp when I first fell but decided to go on my vacation without seeing anyone about my ankle. I also have a health savings account and high deductible plan, so sometimes it's not much more for me to pay out of pocket, and I get seen quicker somewhere else. Â I called Urgently Ortho around 3pm, spoke to Liu who is the founder & COO (and wearer of many hats because he also checked me in AND did my xray!), told him my story, he told me how much it would be and I said great, how soon can you see me? Â Their last appointment of the day on the weekends is 3:30 and it was open, so he took some basic info over the phone and I hobbled to my car to rush over there. Â I got parking right in front, finished signing in (via Ipad!), and then he took me right back for a quick consult with Dr. Dickenson, got xrays, the doc reviewed them, told me the good news (NOT BROKEN!!!) and even went over the xrays with me, suggested I start PT right away, gave me a copy of my xrays, and I was home by 4:15pm. Â Everything was quick and painless from first phone call to exit, both Liu and Dr. Dickenson were super nice and professional, the offices were modern, clean and convenient to my house (and to Kaiser if I had to go there after all!). Â Sure beats waiting at Kaiser all afternoon! Â If I ever need to see an orthopedic specialist again (I'm so hoping I won't but...) I would definitely consider coming to UO over Kaiser especially if it's on a weekend (UO is open 10am to 4pm!) or after hours during the week (open till 10pm M-F!) and I would recommend them to others as well.

I broke my foot in early November of 2019, and had gone to Dignity GoHealth's urgent care the next day per referral through my school, USF. Based on my status as a full-time student and on the lower socioeconomic side, the GoHealth clinician referred me to Urgently Ortho for follow-up exams and X-rays since their service is both eco friendly complemented with quality service. Both of my follow-up appointments fared superbly quick and easy, but not rushed, as well as plenty of engaged care from the front desk staff as well as the doctors. They always allowed time for any questions I might have and were upfront about cost and insurance providers' coverage. I thought my insurance, Student Aetna, wouldn't cover their service so I opted to pay out of pocket on the first visit. But they had insisted I tried to file the service through my insurance just in case-- and it turned out they did! So I actually got some money back from the first appointment. Really great service all-around :D

I have been to this urgent care clinic twice for pain in my wrist and foot and was very pleased with my overall experience. I was able to book same-day appointments on the weekend for problems that I didn't have time to get checked out during the busy work week. Their office is clean and modern, staff is friendly and professional, and check-in process was easy and paperless. Dr. Dickinson was extremely knowledgeable and a great listener. Both times I was seen immediately and in and out within 30 mins - very refreshing considering I generally dread going to urgent care centers because of long wait times. Highly recommend this place!

They made availability on short notice after I slipped and banged my hip while other doctors couldn't find an opening for at least a week. Â Fast, friendly and accurate diagnosis that was thoroughly explained and let me get back on the slopes ASAP.

The most Pleasant Staff and very efficient. Â I like the way they had plenty of appointment options and when I arrived at the appointment it was quick and easy. I hope the treatment helps that has been ordered.

This place was not only immaculate and very technologically advanced, they were also empathetic, efficient and incredibly helpful. Â I broke my foot on a Saturday and was in and out of their office armed with all of the equipment I needed for a speedy recovery within 40 minutes. Â Zero wait and no emergency room drama! Â I would 100% return and will recommend Urgently Ortho to my friends and family. Â What a genius idea!
Quick service. Nice and competent staff. They took care of me. Dr. Dickinson is super nice.

Urgently Ortho is amazing! If you have an ortho emergency, go here for sure. I read in some reviews that you see a PA rather than the doctor in some cases, but she is incredible! I tore my ACL and went in right away. I was extremely swollen, yet she was still able to deduct that my ACL was likely torn. They took an X-ray right then to ensure no bones were broken. Next, they had me get an MRI from RadNet. I saw in another review that the MRI place was terrible before and was amazed that they had switched partners so fast based on patient feedback! RadNet was fantastic. They were very proactive and got me scheduled within 2 days. They called me again to let me know there was a cancellation so I got in even earlier, and on a Sunday! Super nice staff, quick, and efficient. After the MRI, the Urgently Ortho team scheduled me right away to read the results. Dr. Dickinson was fantastic. He spent a very long time with us answering all of our questions and going through all of the options. I couldn't have asked for a better team to work with. I've felt very well taken care of and would highly recommend Urgently Ortho to anyone!

My PT recommended that I go here since my hip was acting up after a recent fall... she was concerned I had a hairline hip fracture. I was super appreciative when I called and the receptionist wanted to be sure they could possibly help me figure out my issue... she asked the doctor and they said they could help me figure out what's going on. I made an appointment for later that night. When I arrived everything was super clean and nice. The receptionist was warm and helpful. I was offered water 3 separate times. The X-ray technician was super nice and concerned about my comfort. Both doctors on staff sat down with me and talked me through what they thought was going on with my hip. Their bedside manner was great. They listened and were very helpful. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone who needs an ortho in a emergency situation or any situation. It hands down schools the ER. They even do peds (which is awesome to know, since I have two kids)!!

I am visiting San Francisco from the east coast and had a reoccurrence of a meniscus injury in my knee. I was able to schedule my appointment at Urgently Ortho a day after a major holiday easily and the online check-in/patient portal made it a quick and convenient process to integrate into their system. I was also impressed by the high tech medical equipment they used to gather my vitals and that they use for X-Rays, etc. The administrative staff and Doctor who worked with me went above and beyond in answering my questions and attending to my needs. I was in and out of the office without a long wait and was reassured that their billing team would assist me if my out-of-state insurance presented any obstacles in coverage. I'd definitely recommend this service to others who need urgent care with an orthopedic speciality. It was very helpful to have an urgent care appointment with a provider who could accurately assess my knee injury and had extensive experience with this particular type of injury, as opposed to the type general practice urgent care physician who I'd seen when I first had the injury and put me in a leg immobilizer inappropriately because of lack of deep-field knowledge. Overall, I give this service a five star rating.
Elite 2021

This review is for the Child birth center. ALL the personnel at the child birth center LOVE their jobs, and this is evident from the care they provide. My wife went into Labor at around midnight and we got to the hospital around 1 am. We were checked in right away by the nurses. Sarah Bartulis and Corey helped deliver our baby. Their bedside mannerism and care giving during labor and delivery were truly EXCEPTIONAL! I would give them 11 out of 5 stars if I could. While coming out our son ended up swallowing some meconium. The team swooped into action clearing the airways and helping our newborn breath. He ended up in the N-ICU overnight. Dr Ahmad and Dr brunei put us at ease by patiently answering all our questions. The nurses in the NICU were AMAZING. Being 1st time parents they gave us a lot of info about baby care taking and putting us at ease. Imalda Â and Claudia took care of our baby around the clock. All in all a truly great experience. The staff in the childbirth center took good care of my wife and son and made our stay as stress free as it could get. Â We are glad we choose this birthing center which has a truly exceptional staff. I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a birthing center.

Not a good experience in the emergency room. I got to give this to nurse IMELDA GONZALEZ from NICU she's so nice and angelic. We trust her with our baby and of course the rest of the NICU staff. Doctor Bruni and Nurse Imelda answered all our questions and concerns we are forever thankful to them and the rest of the staff

This Hospital is horrible Can't understand how it is related to Saddleback Hospital Nurses are rude you have armed rent a cops running around in circles We are still here no communication with nurses or doctors if you can avoid this place do itDay 3 mom going home still the most rude hospital staff ever Also they have the most idiotic security gaurds ever and there armed

Yes indeed it is a beautiful facility but I wish the staff would have focused more on customer services.I will not go into all the details following my knee replacement surgery however I felt that the hospital was in a BIG hurry to get get rid of . United Health Care told me I could stay an unlimited amount of time. My hospital stay was one night. Â This proved to be a major problem because I ended up in the ER. I had a miserable Emergency experience at this hospital. Like most people, I am not one to run to the emergency room for fun. Especially during these difficult times (Covid). After a long, painful night, due to a significant infected wound/rash on my back and leg, I decided to admit myself to the ER @ 10 am. I was scheduled and seen by Dr.Douglas E. Dennis. Immediately the Doctor looks at my sores and my condition and states, "These wounds are not infected; there is nothing wrong with you at all. These wounds look perfectly fine." I had to beg and argue with the Doctor that they are infected, and based on basic medical research, I should be on an IV with medicine (for Bacterial infection). At the end of the conversation, Dr. Dennis did nothing but made me suffer from my pain for 1 hour with no pain killers. At the same time, a Meth addict in the ER room was getting the red carpet treatment. Screaming and Cursing for hours. Throwing items around with not one single security guard present or being called to remove her from the facility. All of the medical staff members maintained this meth addict in the ER room while pushing me to go home and telling me that there is nothing they can do for me. Soon after being ignored and dismissed, the Doctor came back, discharged me, and sent me home. I had to bother my dermatologist on a Saturday night for a virtual appointment. Right away, the Doctor states these wounds are infected. These wounds are obviously infected. What did they give you? Were you given any antibiotics or ointment for the infection?? Â NOPE!!!I can't believe that the Doctor disregarded this infection and did nothing about it; it's unbelievable that he is an ER doctor and knows that an infected wound can lead to a severe illness.If you need emergency medical attention and are being taken to this hospital, PLEASE PLEASE stay away from Dr. Dennis. Ask for another Doctor of staff. You will not regret it. But If you are high and a meth addict and overdosing on drugs, this hospital will take care of you. BUT IF YOU HAVE AN ACTUAL EMERGENCY, THIS HOSPITAL WILL DO NOTHING AND SEND YOU HOME WITH NOTHING OTHER THAN ADVIL. Memorial Care, please do something about Dr.Douglas E Dennis. for your patient's sake. Unless you don't care, who lives and dies.
