No beds!! Â Go to a real hospital like Hoag Newport Beach. Â The staff were rude and am in pain.

I am writing this review in hopes that those who excel in their field are awarded the proper attention, recognition and a thank you from a couple that has lived through several decades of medical treatment. Â This reaches out to the hospital, surgeon, nurse, lab technician and the valet attendant.Over the years there has been significant advancements in noninvasive treatment and it is apparent that MemorialCare has kept up with these changes. Â Places like Hoag in Newport are nice but paying for parking and the distance to get there has left me with the option to select this facility. Â Fountain Valley Regional Hospital is closer but ever since TENET healthcare corporation took over, cutbacks are wreaking havoc to the facility and the morale of the staff Â are in a downward spiral. Â Sure the waiting times have gotten longer due to the medical population doubling in size since the Obama administration, but that is no way to assess the service being rendered by a physician or by their team. Â  After 3 hospitals and 6 visits to the ER facility in the last 9 months, I believe MemorialCare has come on top. In particular, I want to recognize and thank Dr. Yee from the ER department and Gary, the RN from the imaging lab (sorry Gary, didn't catch your last name). Â Dr. Yee is calm, cool and collective under intense situations especially when unruly family members are literally screaming for attention of their loved ones. Â Dr. Yee's ability to perform successfully probably lies in his ability to assess and prioritize treatment quickly. Â As for Gary, your understanding, patience and kindness was very heartwarming. My wife Grete and I thank you very much for going out of your way to help us in time of need. As for the other team members of this facility, overall performance was definitely 4 stars. Â I will try to remember your names and recognize you but my old age as crystallized my ability to retain and retrieve information. Thanks DOC.....
This review is for Dr Dena Amr. She was a wonderful doctor has a great bedside manner and takes the time to explain everything. I would highly recommend this hospital and Dr. Amr.
Dr. Hargove is an amazing oncologist. Thank you so much. I remember you talking about Cachexinol and how it helped Cachexia patients, aka waiting away. thank you

Here in the ER with my 83 year old father who leads an incredibly active and healthy life. For almost the entire 24 hours he has been in the ER, we are being told there are "no beds available". 22 hours and no beds. Oh, he gas CONGESTIVE heart failure and low functioning kidneys. He is also AFRICAN AMERICAN and I honestly don't Â believe this hospital cares if he lives or dies. Same story for 22 hours.He is an American veteran. No respect.

This review is specifically for the Physical Therapy office at 18111 Brookhurst, Suite 2400. Last Thursday, my wife went to see a doctor at MemorialCare for neck pain. After receiving a referral from the doctor, we contacted physical therapy. We were happy that they had a same day appointment since we were already there, but then were informed we could not be told how much it would cost, their insurance person wasn't there. So instead, hey gave an appointment for the following day. After arriving and asking, how much the treatments would cost, we were told, our insurance person wasn't there. So my wife asked, could someone call us and tell us how much the sessions would cost. During the 15 consultation, the therapist recommended six sessions. When checking out and trying to schedule those appointments, we were informed that they had no appointments available for over 10 days. A week later, when we received the call from John the manager of the facility, we were informed the 1 hour consultation (which again, took about 15 minutes) would be $315, $300 of which we would have to pay, because of our deductible. When I protested and recommended we only be charged maybe a half hour, although sympathetic, he said no, they had things they had to do for the appointment, such as figuring our the insurance (?). When I asked about cost of future appointments, they were also $315, which (with insurance) we would have to pay $60 In closing, how is it that to see a physical therapist even with insurance can cost three times more than what it cost to see the doctor that recommended the therapy?

This review is for the OBGYN department and the birthing department (labor & delivery & postpartum care).I had been going to Dr Tran, Denise Castellanos, Corry Ann Varner, and Dr Ruiz. At each appointment prior to my labor they each made me feel at ease about my pregnancy and listened and answered all of my questions. I would recommend any of them. I would like to give a special shout out to my favorite nurse, Kim (I believe she is the main nurse for Dr Tran). She is one of the nicest, sweetest people I have ever met. My due date was January 14. I was admitted into Labor and Delivery to be induced on January 21. Long story short, I had to have an emergency C-section. I was exhausted and terrified. The L&D nurses, Summer and Ginger helped me so much. Dr Tran and a huge team performed the C-section (January 22, 2019). She did a beautiful job, everyone says it's the best they've ever seen. I was wheeled into the Postpartum unit where the team of nurses helped us for our 5-day stay. To be honest, my memory is a little hazy. I was a nervous, anxious, exhausted emotional wreck. There are so many people to thank: Heather, Minette, Michelle, Toni, Alli, and a bunch I cannot remember (I'm truly very sorry. I remember everyone's faces and what they did for us, but I don't remember names as well). Everyone tried to help calm my fears. As a first time mom I was unsure of myself to do anything correctly. Everyone made me feel like I was doing a good job. No one made me feel incompetent or unprepared. Everyone listened to me and cared for me during our stay. Everyone was really kind and thoughtful. I also want to thank the hospital staff in general. You hear about how awful hospital food was, I actually loved mine, so thank you to those that made the food and brought it to us. Thank you to the cleaning staff. Thank you so much to the lactation consultants who made it so much easier to breastfeed after they showed me different positions to try. I loved this hospital. I'm recovering, mostly recovered 100% physically and mentally. My baby is healthy and wonderful. If I have another baby I will be delivering at this hospital again. Best care you could receive.

I come here for serious stays about 4-5 times a year for the past 3 years. The emergency room does great with being efficient!! It's a small lobby but they also have additional seating outside under a tent or in a different room. The nurses on the oncology unit are a hit or miss, the aides are very sweet though. Three stars because not every stay has been filled with awesome staff. We come here because one of the best oncology doctors are contracted with them. Don't get confused by the elevators, especially at night and this goes for all hospitals, it's mega creepy if you don't remember where to go. Security here is very nice, easy going and helpful. I've only had one experience with the valet where the guy was genuinely lazy and didn't want to help us. It was valet next to the emergency room too! Prick. To enter the hospital, you have to go to the maternity unit - it's been like this for as long as I've been coming here. The doors won't open automatically for a certain time, so you have to stand in the cold until security notices you. Parking gets REALLY bad during the weekday, if you have an 11am-1pm appointment here, you may end up fighting people for parking spots. They have a small cafe in the Pavilion building but it's only open until the afternoon. A lot of restaurants can be found all around the hospital if you have to stay here overnight and it's right next to the 405.

I gave birth to my baby girl here just a week ago. When I came to register during my pregnancy, I made sure that the center was aware that I had a service animal, and that my plan was to give birth vaginally. Because of this I had few problems coming in with my dog and support group (max of 3) when it was time.I came in during the night shift and worked with a wonderful RN named Lori. My dilation was just right for an epidural and the doctor was quick and efficient. I slept through the rest of my labor and delivered my baby with my service dog present in the morning. My dog gave her a good feet licking once we were done with sweet skin-to-skin contact and the vitamin K/eye drops.Our two night stay was lovely, though meals were mainly just for the mother with one extra meal for guest per day. Nurses were on point, though we did have a snag with one nurse that had a terrible experience with a pit bull (the same breed as my service animal). She'd ask us to crate my dog before she came in, even while she was performing a task on my legs (deep pressure therapy).The center was sure to send a doctor over, as well, to brief me on risks of PPD (post-partum depression) since I was considered high-risk. I really appreciated the care and offer of resources based on my insurance and medical history. Huge shout out to their lactation consultant, as well. Coincidentally she was also named Lori! She helped start my baby on breastfeeding and pumping. She's quite magical!

Great experience at Orange Coast! Â Staff are kind and friendly and truly care. Â We know our baby is in the best hands. Â Our experience has been filled with Exceptional nurses who provide a high degree of care, experience and compassion!

I am not sure about the service with their overall of all facilities, but with their Emergency department, they move things along swiftly and efficiently, friendly service, short wait time. We were in and out in less than 1 hour.
This has been the most painful and heartless place I've ever been and hopefully I will never go or be ask by any of my many doctors asks suggesting it

The doctors and nurses at orange coast memorial are the best! Dr Mehta performed my 2 births which turned into c sections and I ended up hemorrhaging blood with my 2nd about an hour later. Dr Mehta rushed back and I had a complete blood transfusion and hysterectomy and if it wasn't for Dr Mehta, I would not be here! She literally saved my life! I don't think the end result would've been the same at many other hospitals. The nurses and anesthesiologist are amazing as well. The hospital tops other like Cedar Sinai & Kaiser for sure!!
Elite 2021

While all doctors and experiences are different, I understand it is important to occasionally have positive reviews of negative situations. This is no truer than when reviewing a medical practitioner, as almost nobody solicits their help when things are going "wonderfully".My newborn son was potentially afflicted with a life threatening illness, and the staff at Orange Coast ER was overwhelmingly supportive of his needs (almost everyone...there is always at least one exception at every medical facility:)They addressed hus situation, saw him immediately, and even assisted in arranging his transfer to a different facilty, that was determined to better suit the needs for his condition. Often money and ego can get in the way of a patient's best interest and care, and whether my positive review is the outlier, or the negative ones are, I believe that the people at Orange Coast ER put the needs of my child ahead of their own. And he might only be alive because of that selflessness and quick action.As long as you have doctors and a nursing staff who understands the needs of the patient outweigh their own, you will have excellent care at Orange Coast ER. And that was, at least, my experience and especially my family's experience with Dr. Yee :) If Dr. Yee is working the ER, you can be assured that you will get the very best of care possible.

This is for my mother's stay on the surgical unit, 3rd floor. She fell and broke her R hip Wednesday night, was taken to the ED and stayed there until she went to surgery on Thursday afternoon about 3pm (at least they got her a hospital bed). That was understandable, if she went upstairs she'd have less attention than when down in the ED since her hip was unstable and painful pre-op. Once upstairs post-op most everything was OK she states, but the discharge process left A LOT TO BE DESIRED. She was told she'd be moved to rehab at 1:30pm on Saturday but not one nurse or CNA came in before the ambulance came to transport her to help her get ready to go. Luckily I'm a healthcare provider and knew how to help her get washed a bit and dressed, and transfer to the bed-side commode...but I wasn't an employee...I wasn't getting paid to do that.After I had her dressed her RN comes in and says, "Oh, they told me I have to change her dressing before she goes." REALLY? you didn't know that until the ambulance guys got there? Delayed her leaving and subsequent admission to Hoag Newport Beach for rehab.I've been in healthcare 35 years and still can't believe the CNA didn't ask her all morning on Saturday to wash up....the laziness. My mom is Â 83 and has only been in the hospital 2x and maybe she didn't know she HAS TO ASK if she wants to wash up. After all, she fell on Wednesday night and it is now Saturday...think about how she feels? That's all I wanted to say.
Elite 2021
The care I received was wonderful. They even gave me a gift card for being ontime to my appointment.

From start to finish the care for my elderly father was the best experience so far. Even though he was making a mess due to a catheter leaking : had to deduct a star because as their daughter I had to hunt down assistance . I would feel bad if any other geriatric patients had to come here by themselves. Another suggestion would be to have more available interpreters. I had to speak to the attending physician about my fathers results due to the the language barrier. Other than that I cannot thank them enough for improvising for exam rooms on peak hours.

Looking for a general surgeon? Dr Dena Amr is amazing. She is so caring and provides quality time and attention to every patient. She responds in a timely fashion and is very patient and understanding. 5/5 stars!

This review is for General Surgery Unit: I was brought in by ambulances from St. Joseph Hospital late Monday night, Alex the night RN was very kind and attentive to my needs, I was in so much pain and completely bruised on one arm, because the nurses at St. Joseph's had a difficult time trying to start an IV (I am what you call a Hard Stick). Alex, got it on the first try! The rest of this review if for my PCA: Nora & RN: Stephanie. Stephanie was my day nurse the two days I was hospitalized. Even though she was busy, she always made time to answer my questions, (this was my very first surgery and I was extremely nervous). She was very thorough, very patient. PCA, Nora was amazing, very hands on, always coming in to check on me post-surgery, always making sure, I was comfortable and I had gone on my walks and had ate. Thank you ladies and the rest of the staff at Memorial for taking care of me!!

Worst Emergency room that I've been. I waited more than 3 hours to get out of it with blood test and ultrasound results. They just forget that you exist and if you ask anything they will say "I'm sorry, I can't do anything". It is better to drive more to go to a better hospital than to come here and wait forever! And NO, warm blanket doesn't help with anything.

Avoid the ER!!!I recently visited the ER due to a potential head injury. Â They immediately took me into a ER curtained room where I sat and waited for over 2 hours. Â I left against medical advice because I hadn't been addressed and the ER wasn't even busy. Â They still proceeded to bill me almost $600 just for sitting there and leaving without being consulted. Â Absolutely terrible service and definite scam as they knew if they had me wait in the waiting room they wouldn't have been able to charge. Â Awful that they would take advantage of patients in this way.
I am happy with my new primary care physician, Dr Vinh Nguyen. He is very dedicated and take his time to talk to patients about medical concerns. He has a brilliant career ahead of him.
Lisa from cafeteria is amazing, she went out of her way to help my family and I. Â Best burger I had. Great customer service. Thank you Lisa and Cristel

What an incredibly clean facility. My daughter was in for Gastric Surgery and I was extremely impressed with the cleanliness, communication, the work ethic, and the professionalism of the whole staff including the volunteers near the waiting room keeping everyone informed about their loved ones. The quick response was incredible whenever my daughter needed anything. The staff worked like clockwork and I was very impressed.

This review is to compliment all the Memorial Care Emergency Room Staff and the people who we pass before we see a receptionist,nurse and Doctor or specialist.These Â compliments are for the maintenance staff Â (waiting room,drinking fountain and restrooms,remember!),also for the extraordinary (staff Security Guards) secure feelings and peace of mind while getting out of your car,wondering will it be safe ?Give compliments to the professional security guards (Kellum and others),who show genuine natural compassion towards you and your love one's Â and sick family members who need medical treatment at The Orange Coast Medical and E.R. Hospital,located in Fountain Valley,Ca.First impressions sometimes Â guides the human being, and in making a choice and i normally observe cleanliness and attitude,as well as "Natural Compassion when asking the Security Guard for directions to E.R. or what are the visiting hours ?So stop your whining about egos and give compliments to those who prepared this 5 star Hospital for whatever brought you there for medical treatment,life is short so enjoy the roses as you journey through life okay...Thee CounselorBy the way Memorial Care Hospital,I am saying thank you for those who have lost their Human compassion......

I am scheduled for a ct scan. Â I was worried about the barium I need to drink before the procedure so I called the radiology department and told them my fears. They said the doctor would call me back. He called me in less than a half hour and explained everything to me. I think his name was Dr. Wong. Thank you Dr Wong and radiologist department I'm not worried anymore

On January 22nd 2019, I had a double mastectomy at Orange Coast Memorial Hospital. The two surgeons, Dr Amr and Dr Nguyen we're awesome! Same with the pre-surgery & recovery nurses. Â I spent one night and all the nurses that took care of me were the best!!! I am very happy with my oncologist Dr Hassan. And my gynecologist Dr Meagan Moore is the BEST! Orange Coast breast center continues to be a huge help and they have been so helpful and efficient.

My husband required emergency services last month and the hospital has complementary valet parking, which was nice since it allowed us to focus on getting treatment instead of circling for a tight spot. The emergency staff was very efficient in getting us in, in addition to being friendly. The emergency doctor was knowledgeable and gave treatment as fast as possible in order to get pain relief to my husband as fast as possible. She also gave insightful advice on how to choose the best doctor for follow up care. We were in and out within an hour and a half, which included testing, examination and treatment plans.

I went to ER couple of months ago here, was the worst experience in my life. 1st off I am an RN I know the ER can be crazy but this was out of hand!! I was given Zofran in the BR for my nausea=wrong!!! WTF kind of nursing is that??? What if I didn't know what Zofran was, I would not just take something right before I am about to give you my urine sample!!2nd- the wait was ridiculous but I understand that it happens...3rd- No allergy band placed on me4th- they bring me finally back to sit in a wheelchair, I saw a total of 4 different nurses and they discharged me from the wheelchair. On top of that MD gave me 2 diff prescriptions Â one was different than what he said he was prescribing, Â I didn't need that particular one but come on GET IT TOGETHER!! Your supposed to be a magnet hospital??!!
Elite 2021

I came to the emergency room here recently and was under the care of Â Yulie Park, Megan Blades, and Jennifer Oman. The care I received was above and beyond, thorough, and the doctors, PAs, and nurses all showed outstanding patient interaction skills. I felt safe, truly cared about, and left there with an ease of mind that I was going to be okay because of the doctors who treated me. I've been to many emergency rooms, and I can honestly say this is the best one I have ever been too and where I will always come back after the care I received there. Thank you so much to the amazing women who cared for me, you deserve to be recognized for your outstanding patient care.
Specifically for the Breast Imaging centerThis place is very good! They are polite, friendly, never pushy or put out because they have another patient... I would recommend anyone to be treated here

Once again, you disappoint me. Sending me to collections, after I continue to make payments, and I have paid more than half of my surgery bill. It's only been 4 months since my surgery!!! Collections? Really???That hard up for money, Greedy!Guess I have to go to Hoag now.

I had to use the ER the past couple days due to my Heart issues and even tho the ER rooms are undergoing construction I have the best nurses today. Helen Nguyen, Anh Vo, Marirose Gaviola, and Katrina Dauo. They all were completely WONDERFUL and so professional. Â Thank you again for such a present stay. Thank you all again. Sincerely Roger M.
Best ER EVER! All the doctors and Rn's are Phenomenal!! I recommend it if you have an emergency
I am in the ER and have watched the staff from the front desk to the nurses go above and beyond for each patient!!!!!!!! So grateful. I am so impressed and wanted make sure the good stays in yelp!

This place is a criminal organization! They will bleed you out of every cent they can by inflating their prices to the insurance companies. Once they finish their vampire tactics with your insurance company they will come for you. As a patient you cannot step foot into the facility without cash, that's right cash. If you can't bring them $5000 or $6000 cash they will cancel your procedure with only 1 days notice. You cannot make payment arrangements with them because like payday loan places they are predators. Memorial Care will extort you because of your health. They should change their name to We Don't Care. Stay away at all costs.
Five stars for RN Vinh L. He was compassionate and patient, and took his time to answer any questions we had. He helped make my dad feel comfortable and was great at providing patient education.
The staff and facilities are great. Â The ER isn't the best place to go but between getting admitted immediately and new facilities was nice. Thank you Memorial Care for taking care of my mom
Elite 2021

I went to ER with several pain in my upper back at 04:00 am. After admitting me in ER bed, I stayed more than one hour without being seen by a doctor. I asked the nurse any pain relieve, but she answered me rudely saying we are busy and there are cases sicker than me and I have to wait. Â I waited more time, but no doctor came to see me, and my pain was aggravating while I was shut down by curtains. I was in pain.When I informed the nurse when I would be seen because I had severe pain, she answered me again we are busy and no one knows when the doctor would see me. At this point I had to leave and seek medical help else where. The ironic thing is that: they were only interested to have me sign that I refuse treatment?

This is a very bad hospital one doctor told me to shut up I would not come here if I was dying and if they were the closest I would rather die I will never come here again. Take it from me, I have major health problims.

I have senior parents that have had to be treated at O.C. Memorial Hospital 7x in 2016 alone. Thank goodness they are doing well. Unfortunately, I am here today with my dad and have bit my tongue all this time for speaking my mind about the hospital staff. I see the same EMT's & RN's always having a social hour. They gather in a group talk, talk loudly about their social lives, eat bananas whether on break or not on the ER floor. It never changes everytime you come here. They look at you as if you're intruding in their space. So unprofessional! Patients have concerns and lots on their minds. I realize being in the medical field and working long shifts can take a toll on you but seriously, do you think you could conduct yourselves with professionalism and a bit of understanding for others who may be going through a difficult time?

This is the most screwed up hospital I have ever been to..took someone here..went to one building thinking it was the hospital then had to go in a shuttle in the rain to another building a ways from where the admitting was..absolutely Unacceptable. .this is at 5:30 am rain and coldWhy can't they have it all in one place..I will never recommend this place to anyone

BEWARE! Please please please avoid this ER if at all possible. Here's my story -After 3 months of fainting, trying to figure out the cause on my own, and my sister (who's a PA) hounding me constantly...I finally decided to go to the emergency 2 days after fainting 3 times...I came in with slurred speech, blurred vision, chest pain, feeling confused, and dizzy. After checking in and telling them my symptoms I was never offered a wheelchair to help prevent me from falling -- in fact I was asked 3 times to come back to triage and then walk back to the waiting room...without any help! On the 3rd call back the doctor asked me a few questions and without even examining me told me it was anxiety and that he'd run some blood panels and then send me on my happy way with anti-anxiety medication. I let him know that while I was stressed in that moment that it most definitely wasn't anxiety or an anxiety attack (I've had those I know what they are!) I was sent back to the waiting room where I called my sister and told her what they were saying...I was so upset, I haven't been to the emergency room since I was 15 and it felt like such a slap in the face to have my concern discounted by this doctor.Thankfully, my sister and her husband called the Director of the emergency room and they threw the most amazing bitch fit and my concerns were finally being taken semi-seriously. But it makes me question what if I didn't have that amazing and knowledgeable support? The doctor gave me some BS line of "we don't usually see people your age with symptoms like this" as his excuse for the way he had previously treated me.I was later admitted to the hospital where I had sub-par treatment. I had multiple non-sustainable vt (which were not documented anywhere in my chart by the nurses and I have pictures of to show my pcp when I see her next week). I had insanely low blood pressure that dropped even after they gave me 2 bags of fluid and was discharged the next day without any solution and was simply told I should drink more water and increase my salt intake. WTF?! Such a waste of time. I'll be making sure I get to Hoag next time I have a problem come up.

My mom was admitted here after heart valve replacement surgery @Hoag on 8/17. Story another day. Anyway, Thursday 8/24 she was taken to ER at 10 am. She needed to be admitted. What time was she taken upstairs? 9 pm!!! What hospital does this??? 11 hours in an ER curtained room. Â The nurses in telemetry are pretty good. Typical check in, take vitals, then out. Â  Biggest complaint: Â Semi private room. She was next to bathroom in room. Eating dinner -- nurse empties other patient's pee and poop while she eats dinner. Are you kidding me??? That's gross!!!  Â  On her 2nd re-admit she stayed in ICU for 2 nights. Staff there is stellar!!!!!!!The on-staff Health Officer Janet Â is super nice. Â Overall, hospital is clean. Nurses are kind.

My mom has several surgeries/stays here; each time the staff has been wonderful! It is a clean and well staffed facility. The nurses are attentive and kind. The ER is very efficient at getting patients seen.

Do NOT come to this emergency room. I have severe RA and woke up with a leg that would not unbend. I was in so much pain and so unable to walk I had to be taken to the ER via ambulance. I waited hours which was fine, it's an ER that happens. Here is what ISNT fine. Everyone who saw me told me I needed an MRI, but no such test is available in the ER. Memorial care has an imaging center open 7 days a week, no biggie, I'll go there. Well yeah, no. No Doctor in this system would write me an order for an MRI. They insisted I wait days and see my PCP even though I have fancy PPO insurance so that wasn't a necessity. So I need an MRI but no one will let me have one, but they did let me have HUGE quantities of opioids. Apparently an MRI is a terrible dangerous thing, but handfuls of opioids and two shots of the strongest opioid possible is nothing. All so they could bill for more visits. Smh. Never again.

My review is based on my visit to the ER yesterday. I almost find it difficult to put into words the incredible experience I had. From the moment I got there I was treated so well and everyone I came in contact with was so professional yet kind. They made me feel so comfortable and the doctor was very patient and thorough in trying to figure out my discomfort. I'm so impressed with everything about this place and those who work there. This place really cares and does everything possible to help you. Dr Brian Rhee is the best! What a great doctor! I just want to thank the whole staff from last night! This is how every ER should be.

Went here two days ago for extreme nausea and diarrhea. It was my second trip to an ER in a few days. The first was to Fountain Valley Regional where they admitted me for observation and really did little to diagnose me. If you would like to know about that experience read the review I wrote. The Orange Coast ER was packed but they are so organized and efficient it is amazing. They were so crowded that they were putting people in the halls but they did not neglect them. The nurses were great and the doctor, John Lee, was wonderful. He determined what he thought was as causing my symptoms, gave me a dose of medication and a prescription and then to my absolute surprise called me the next day to see how I was doing! I can't say enough good about this experience but I can assure you this is my ER of choice in the future.

Horrible place. NO Parking even on slow days. Disorganized, nobody gives you a straight answer. The orderly in the waiting room checks you in quickly since he has a TV program to watch. Avoid at all cost. I cannot emphasize enough what a mess this place is. It's under renovation. The waiting room for the ER is in a tent in the parking lot wtf. 3rd world care is better than this. You have to Â go up the elevator walk across to the other building take the elevator down to the bottom what do you think the morge and there is a waiting room. The guy there is just sitting on his desk watching TV. Â We got here at 10:30 AM for a hip replacement surgery that takes two hours it's now 8:30 PM and he still isn't done. What a mess!

I intially came here in the beginning of the week due to an itching problem that had started in the middle of the night after finishing Tamiflu that an Urgent Care has prescribed for me elsewhere. After a week of finishing Tamiflu, I started developing this itchiness all over my body. I came into this ER to address this problem the first night. However, I also disclosed with them how I was also on Rifampin. But being on Rifampin, I was already being on watch by the OC Health Agency. Instead of looking into the issue that was concerning me that night, the Dr kept talking over me & saying that I HAVE TB. I don't! I kept on telling him that & after ALL the tests that he did for TB, it turns out I DONT HAVE TB. But that didn't solve my problem. He let me leave with my itchy problems without even saying anything about it and diagnosed me something else that I DONT ACTUALLY HAVE. Prescribed me another set of antibiotics that only made the situation worst. Now my whole body is covered in hives & my whole face is swollen. I went back there again to the ER in the middle of the night because my situation only got worst Â even after steroids from an Urgent Care. Saw a different Dr that night and he was more attentive and caring to my situation. However, after giving the appropriate things I needed for my current situation, I'm still not getting better as I'm typing this out right now. And I'm frustrated because I've been skipping work & I feel like this could've been dealt with earlier at the initial time here.
Elite 2021

I just had to update my review because I recently took my mom to the ER. Â She was having back and chest pains and they saw her very promptly. Â Her nurse was very attentive as was all the ER staff. Â She was kept under observation for 24 hours and every staff member was friendly and helpful. Â I highly recommend this hospital and am so glad it is nearby.

I have been at Orange Coast Memorial as a patient multiple times - once when my teratoma was diagnosed, once for a biopsy, once for my pre-op checkup, and once for my sternotomy. Each time I encountered a wonderful team of staff and felt I was in safe hands.After my surgery the nurses checked on me regularly to make sure I was comfortable and that I had everything I needed. Even the hospital food was great - I remembered having salmon with rice one day, ribs with mashed potatoes the next. A friend of mine who worked at another hospital couldn't believe it - she said the patients' food at her own hospital looked barely edible.One of my night-shift nurses, Debbie in the Cardiology wing, comes to mind as being absolutely exceptional. She answered my calls quickly and was always very courteous and professional. When I still had my chest tubes, she carried my drainage systems with me to the bathroom and back. I also had a great physical therapist, I wish I remembered her name. As a whole, the staff was incredibly professional and helpful. Orange Coast Memorial Hospital far exceeded my expectations of what it's like to be at a hospital.

This review is for the emergency department. I have used this ED for years for all of my families emergency medical needs. Â Yesterday, the dismissive attitude of the staff and physician, and the disrespectful way my family was treated was horrible. The physician did not listen to our concerns about my granddaughter and made my daughter feel like she was wasting his time. I will not use orange coast memorial for services anymore. I am a current hospital administrator and this behavior should not be tolerated. Â There is no way that this physician has good scores. This needs to be addressed and corrected. Customer service training is needed. Care is costly and there are many options to choose from. Convenience of proximity does not cut it. I will drive further to a center that cares about people and respects patients needs.

PLEASE READ BEFORE YOU BOOK ANY APPOINTMENT HERE.I came here because it is close to my work. However, they billed me for EVERYTHING. I have excellent insurance which never cost me anything for my yearly mammogram, but not this place! I received 4 different bills that they claim are owed and not covered. They called it a facility fee, radiologist reading fee, exam fee, and doctor fee. Unfreken believable. When you call their billing dept, they are prepared to take all these bogus charge calls and have total attitude. VERY disappointed in this place. BE WARE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
This ER and hospital saved my dad's life. Suffering from heart failure they had him in a bed, on IV, CT scan, ultrasound and xray within 30 mins. Caring, smart nurses and doctors.

It happened to be the weekend of my daughters ballroom competition when she got sick and in the middle of the night we walked from the hotel to the ER!It was very clean and pleasant smaller ER! We got great service: nurses were very friendly and made my girl feel safe at 3:00 am.We were seen by the doctor within 15 minutes and knowing that we were visiting staff tried to help us as much as possible. They even found 2 doses of antibiotics for her to take before we would get home!Thank you!

Never been there. Always went to Hoag. When paramedics took me there I recognized the RN in the ER. She crawled in my gurney with me and hugged me for a long time. You can't buy that care. Sandy needs an award! They went out of their way for me. Hoag wrote me off. Too many heart attacks, bypasses, stents, pacemwakers, kidney cancer and more. Sandy and the Doctors didn't treat me like they needn'tBother with me. Sandy fought for me and wouldn't give up on me. After nuclear stress test, ultra sound and x Ray they found enlarged heart. Only memorial care orange coast medical center would ever do that for me. Thank you Doctors, ER team and everyone else. They took the time to explain everything and made me feel like they really cared. I'm no longer using Hoag! Hoag has gone down hill and people like Sandy have made me feelLike I stand a chance! Sandy literally saved my life when no one else would bother!

People don't usually want to be at the hospital for any issues however I've had to spend quite some time here with medical issues. I've had to spend time here because for family issues. The security team are by far the most amazing and caring team I've ever encountered. The security guard Dennis is extremely caring and compassionate and it's so evident in their service. Doctors and nurses are kind and so knowledgeable. The oncology unit is one of the best I've encountered. Really made a difficult time easier to deal with!! Oncology unit one of the best!

I had my daughter here 3 months ago and everything was great! This is the second (and last) child I gave birth to. My first child was born at Saint Marys hospital in Long Beach 7 years ago and BY FAR my experience at Orange Coast Memorial was the best! All the nurses were lovely, the Doctors were great. Everyone was so informative. I absolutely gained an immense respect towards Doctor Leathers who was in charge of giving me the epidural. She was so informative and nice! The woman who gave the epidural 7 years ago at Long Beach Saint Mary's was a complete bleeeep! Overall very happy with the services thank you!

My OB, Dr. Yen Tran, delivered my baby son on 8/23/18. It was an amazing experience. Dr. Tran made me feel absolutely comfortable throughout my entire pregnancy and during labor. Her medical assistant, Kim, is always so sweet and so caring! Kim just doesn't take my vital signs but makes sure my experience was going well. You can tell Kim is genuine and connects to you in a personal level. Had the best experience with these two by my side throughout my first time being pregnant. All my questions and concerns are always addressed in person and thru my chart. I can't express enough how lucky I am to have both Dr. Tran and Kim. My husband and I felt comfortable from our very first visit. It can be nervous picking out an OB/GYN but we made the best choice. Dr. Tran and Kim, thank you for making us feel important and not just another patient.

I got really sick mid June and spent way more time here than I had ever spent in a hospital in my entire life. It got pretty depressing I had to say, even with my mom by my side the second time I was hospitalized. Nonetheless, the staff here made both of my stays durable and even somewhat enjoyable. The nurses and the aids are amazing, accommodating, patient, and were always encouraging. I was in both Surgery (I believe that's what it's called?) and Telemetry units, both of which were great! I only had one nurse that made me wait 15 minutes when I really needed to pee (I was too weak to stand up on my own). The rest of the stay was pleasant (depressing but pleasant). Yes you DO get depressed after spending 20 days in the hospital (5 days the first time, 15 days the second time). Overall, I hate this place because I don't ever ever ever want to go back to any hospital again, but if I have to, this place is it!

BEWARE!!!!!! Before you decide to go to Orange Coast Memorial for any procedures, example, to their imaging center, they do not bill their procedures as a normal outpatient imaging procedure. They bill as a service through the hospital with your insurance will apply your deductible even if you're covered at 100% anywhere else. Usually I have my procedures at Hoge imaging Center and decided to go here because I was told by my doctors that they are less expensive, well that's CRAP! Because now I have a $300 bill because of their billing system. And I was told there is nothing they will do to correct it issue.Only go here if you want to walk away with an unexpected bill at the end!

My mother had to be admitted and stayed 4 nights. We had a great experience here Dr were great. But most of all her nurses were all 100% on helping her and coming right away. I want to give a special thank you to Adriana her day nurse she was kind, and always checking in even when we didn't need her. She took the time to help us understand what was going on also. So grateful for the experience. My mother said the food was great! If you have to stay hopefully your on the 3rd floor with the nurse crew up there 100%

This review is based on my recent C-section experience with Labor & Delivery. Â This was my first time using this hospital and I was NOT impressed...Firstly, the nurses are pretty relaxed around here. Â Compared to Fountain Valley hospital, it would appear that the nurses at Fountain Valley do 10 times the work as the nurses at Orange Coast. Â I truly feel bad for the Fountain Valley hospital nurses after seeing how easy and relaxing it is here for nurses at Orange Coast. Â You can hear nurses chit chatting to each other, telling each other how to plan their days because this and that patient are being discharged etc...It is a very nice and relaxing environment. Â It would appear that Fountain Valley hospital have 20 times the amount of patients than Orange Coast hospital....So I had a C-section and OMG I really did not like the female Egyptian anesthesiologist that they have here. Â That lady kept talking to other nurses about Egypt and all its glories, yet when she performed her numb medication on me I was truly in pain. Â Then she proceeded to cover my entire mouth and nose with the oxygen mask which made me feel like I was suffocating and I literally thought I was going to faint before the C-section surgery even start. Â Then after seeing me turning blue/purple or whatever color I was in, she then removed the mask and left it open at my nose area so I could breath. Â Then, the other doctors had to remind her to do her parts because she neglected them...In addition, her accent was so thick I could barely understand 5% of whatever she said...Let's make it clear that this is a non-profit hospital. Â I do not know if that is the reason for them being stingy on supplies. Â They don't give newborn any personal newborn items like Fountain Valley hospital e.g. pacifier, some towels, some baby items...They Â don't give you anything unless you ask for it. Â They also seem to be trained on pressuring you to breastfeed in an extremely demanding manner almost like forcing you to do so. Â Every time I asked to use a breast pump, the answer was, "why do you need it?" Â "what is it for?" Â "No, you don't need that" "breast feed, breast feed and breast feed is what baby needs" Â They are lucky that I am not against breast feeding but their forceful ways of telling people to breast feed is extremely annoying, out of line, and it's none of their business to dictate on that matter. Â If I had no life, no job, and all the time in the world to breastfeed my kids, that would be a dream come true. Â Unfortunately, I also have to go to work, and my employer don't give extra time for me to pump, and also I can't bring my kid to work with me so I can stick out my nipple for them to suck on demand so it would not work out the ways the nurses at Orange Coast seem so passionate on about forcing people to breastfeed. Â You need to learn to practice what you preach before you preach it otherwise you just sound stupid, got it?

I delivered my baby at OCM at had the best nurses I could have possibly have! Â So helpful and answered many of my questions and made me feel so well taken care of! Â Nice work OCM Labor and Delivery nurses and Post Partum nurses!

Had my beautiful daughter delivered at this hospital June 2017. Nurses (all but one) were fantastic, lactation consultants were so incredibly caring and eager to help. Â My biggest complaint is against the anesthesiologist. We can't remember her name but she was older and had a thick Russian accent. She was absolutely horrible!!! I don't know how she has a license but she needs to be REMOVED!!!!! She failed to administer my epidural properly and had to reinsert the needle THREE TIMES all while yelling at me to keep still (which I didn't BUDGE in fear of any nerve damage) and respond loudly. So she inserts the needle way too far to the left and I yell that it hurts to the left, then she inserts too far to the right and again yells while sighing loudly as if I'm a nuisance. She gets it on the third try finally after I'm sobbing. Both my husband and sister were asked to remain outside, they were horrified hearing her yelling. This is my second child and I can very well say this epidural was and is the worst experience of my life. On a side note, I now have sharp back pain at my epidural site that doesn't seem to be going away even at 7 months postpartum. PLEASE do yourself a favor and run the other way if you see this lady coming to give you an epidural!! She will literally ruin your entire birthing experience. Epidurals should NEVER be that painful nor should it be redone THREE times!! AND you SHOULD NOT HAVE BACK PAIN AT THE EPIDURAL SITE POST PARTUM! We had an amazing anesthesiologist at Kaiser for our first, the doctor was quick and precise, I didn't even know they inserted the epidural! She was done in a few minutes and no complications after! That is how your experience should be!!! On another side note: if you plan to get an epidural at this hospital, make sure to have the right nursing staff assigned to you also! We had a nurse who was older and very "experienced". She was very pushy about giving birth naturally and not needing an epidural. She gave us her two cents on how babies should be born without anything. That moms need to withstand the pain. That she did it naturally and all our parents did (not my mom thank you very much). She was great at disregarding any of my pain (I'm a silent laborer) and was rather quick to say it was in my head. After I finally got an epidural she was pretty adamant that I would not feel anything even though I very heavily felt back pain. I was able to move my legs easily and control my labor even with an epidural, she said that that was not possible and was in my head. My sister had to advocate for me the whole time, very exhausting.
Elite 2021

I have been going to there for the last few months and i have been very happy with the service. Everyone is very nice. Everyone makes Â sure that understood all the paperwork i signed. And they made sure i understood my instructions. A big thanks to Michelle E. King and aisha hill and brandy. You girls are exceptional and outstanding. Â You girls make memorial stand out and proud. Â The last gal i saw was michelle and she made sure i had my phone numbers i needed to call my doctors office. She offered my water and offered my mom coffee. That was very nice of her. I know for a fact these three gals work hard and work with a beautiful smile. If anyone is having surgery or a procedure at this hospital, then i can assure them that they will have excellent service and will be well taken care of. Thank you so muchLots of smilesPaula chavez

On September 29th, I brought my husband to the hospital for severe vertigo. As a nurse, I know that vertigo can be a symptom of a stroke and felt due to how severe the symptoms were, it needed to be checked out. My husband was unable to even stand up and had to crawl to get to the car. He was brought back immediately and underwent several tests. While in the ER, he became bradycardic which I noticed, and the ER nurse did not (his heart rate went down into the 30s and he lost consciousness). She thanked me later for noticing his heart rate was so low. Really? They decided to admit him for further testing. He was admitted (or so we thought) to the Telemetry unit so he could be on a monitor. He had a brain MRI and an echocardiogram which came back negative. Flash forward to an almost $5,000 out of pocket bill...... the reason the bill is so high is because we were billed as if my husband was under observation status which is equivalent to being an outpatient. Thus, the insurance pays less and the patient pays more.Not once did anyone tell us he was an observation patient. Nothing in our paperwork indicates he was an observation patient. According to California law, every patient is to be notified of observation status in writing and this did not happen. Now my husband is being informed by the hospital that he must track down the doctor that made him an observation patient and have him change it to "admitted". He has called the doctor numerous times with no reply. We are extremely unsatisfied with our experience here. The patient should not be asked to chase down a doctor to rectify the hospital breaking the law. I hope this post helps another patient prior to this happening to them. Here is the link to the All Facilities Letter from the California Department of Public Health on Senate Bill 1076 that stipulates that hospitals must notify patients of observation status both verbally and in writing: cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CHCâ¦

The nurses twice now have tried to disagree with the doctors orders. While I sit there suffering I had to hear the nurses discussing their opinion on the Â treatment i should receive. Both times i had to threaten to call the doctors in before they miraculously remembered what they ordered. They're the most uncaring hospital I've ever been too. The doctors are no better the nurses , as I had one send me home while I was no better condition then when I came in. Worst hospital on the planet.

When I explained that I came to the ER because I had severe pain behind my knee (probably due to a herniated disc on my back), the receptionist rushed me to give her my id, and at the same time told me to fill out a form, and at the same time she asked me for my social security number. I was in pain and overwhelmed. When I told her "one thing at a time", she gave me a big speech. I was pretty uncomfortable because I had to tell my medical history in front of all these people sitting less than 2 feet away in a crowded room behind me. The waiting room is very small and if you value your privacy, this is not the right place for you.When they brought me back to the "patient room" actually it was a bed in the corridor with a bunch of people walking around the patients. The doctor looked at me for 1 second and said my leg did not appear swollen, then he lift my blouse and examined my spine. I thought this was very unprofessional. Dr Denis seemed to be trying to get rid of me, making me feel badly that I came to the ER. But I think this is a scam. They admit a lot of people, and probably short staffed, the doctors get rid of people quickly in order not to work overtime. Although I am in my 60s Dr Denis did not even check my heart or the back of my left that was extremely painful. If you are not bleeding badly don't bother going to this ER, they will see you for less than 2 secs, charge your insurance company for the work they actually did not do.

I'm using my husband's account to write this review. Â I came into the ER on a Friday late afternoon with a broken, dislocated wrist. Â I was seen immediately. Â Dr. Yee was the attending MD. Â He was attentive and reassuring. Â All of the staff (radiology, EMT, RNs) were efficient, skilled, and polite. Â I feel fortunate to have been cared for so well.

Anyone who says anything other than this is a great place to get medical care is probably a chronic whiner to begin with! I never need hospitalization and the three times I have had to go through these doors for myself or anyone of my family members has been a refreshing and relieving experience. The employees, the doctors, the nurses and especially the admissions people are fantastic. Most of the bad reviews I see here are from people with independent doctors that just don't understand procedures and policies or who are completely oblivious to what their medical coverage is. MemorialCare is always there to help. Try that with other hospitals in this area --

It's now been over two years since I went to orange coast memorial hospital for my conjestive heart failure So glad that I landed there! I was treated like I was someone special. But that' just the way they treat everyone. Thanks to everyone and a shout out to Dr Hoang P Nyguyen and DR Sanjev M Patel who continues to take care of me. Knowing that I have your support makes a big difference. I just Love everyone at Orange Coast Memorial.

I'm in the ER with my mom right now. Â We drove over from los alamitos which was a 5 hr wait. Â This ER is super efficient, Â got mom in right away, Â  got her medicated with antibiotics and they are sending us on our way all in a matter of 2 hours. Everyone here is extremely competent. Â If a family member or myself have to go to ER again, Â we will definitely return here!!
Elite 2021

Labor and delivery review: I was induced then had a c section so I was in the hospital for a week and we had several nurses helping us. Â Diane was the most helpful nurse after baby came and we really appreciated all her help.Each nurse was helpful along the way but we got a lot of conflicting information. Diane was there to get us settled and send us home and helped clarify the conflicting information so she made us feel more calm as first time parents. Â Thank you!

Had to use the emergency service for an evening injury. Â Was dreading the whole process, but was pleasantly surprised by the helpfulness of the staff during registration process- perhaps it helped that the ER wasn't swamped at the time. Â Wanted to recognize the friendly nurse and technician staff during prep, but also the ER doctor Kim Tan Nguyen. Â She was very competent, confident, professional yet personable. Â She treated my wounds with care (sutures) and was sensitive since was facial injury. Â  Thank you Dr Nguyen and OC Memorial.

First I went to Saddleback who improperly scheduled me for a mammogram, I was there for an MRI. They were rude and I left crying.Then I went to Hoag who had the tiny, long tube machine and they send you an head-first like you're in a coffin with your back smashed up against the top of it. I'm not a large woman and it was very scary. Frankly, I had a panic attack. I wasn't able to do the procedure at all. I asked them if there was an open MRI for the type of MRI I was having and they said no. I did my own research and found Orange Coast memorial. Thank God because they have a much bigger opening so you feel less scared and it's a shorter machine so your head can be out. I didn't have a panic attack, the procedure was 20 minutes shorter than Hoag's would have been and the staff was absolutely fantastic. In fact, the radiologist even called me on my way home and gave me the results of my MRI. I'm just so pleased and so thankful that I found them. Anyone who needs a breast MRI or with claustrophobia- absolutely must go to this facility Â The machine is top-notch and the staff is way better than either Saddleback or Hoag.

If it was possible I'd give this place zero stars. Portions of the facility are seriously out of date but hey, maybe some people like sharing the bathroom while they're bleeding/sick/etc. Compared to the care I received when I was with Kaiser I felt like this was substandard. My concerns were ignored and brushed off as being "normal" but landed me back in the ER and ICU within 24 hours of discharge. Just find another hospital.

I had the worst experience giving birth to my second child here. First of all, the nurses are not accommodating idating at all. No one helped mE to the bathroom Â while I was on an epidural, no one listened to me, etc. speaking of the epidural, they made my whole top half of my body feel numb instead of my bottom half. When I expressed my concers they said it was because I was anxious and nervous probably. Which wasn't true. I asked to get it taken out but they Â failEd to do so until another nurse came on duty and realized I was not okay. I couldn't breathe, I couldn't focus, I was bad. Then when it came tome to actually push, nnoone was around. My husband asked for nursees multiple times and the nurse said "if she needs to push then she caN push." Meanwhile no nurses were in the room. So I guess I was supposed to deliver my own baby. As my baby was halfway out, the dr on hand (in case your dr doesn't make it) was cracking jokes trying to get me to look at her coming out and waving her hand everywhere. Not quite the position I wanted to be in with a bunch of strangers around me. It was the most embarrassing moment. Â Once I got settled to the new room to recover, I got checked maybe twice the whole two days I was there and it was so hard to get a damn Advil. They do not tend to you, they do not care, & they have no common sense. Stay away and go somewhere else. This whole experience was dehumanizing to me. My daughter went to the ER Â with abdominal pain. Â  She was seen right away. Â DR DE HAAS was so nice and thorough. Â My daughter had to have an emergency appendectomy and was taken care with the best of care.

This review is based on the ER. Â It took 3 hours to complete the visit. Â Not bad, but definitely not good. Â Worst thing was they let us sign, pay and go home.Had to stop and get something to eat and before I received our food my wife gets a call from the ER saying that they forgot to give her a important shot and that she should come back. Â The Dr. said he would have it ready when she arrived. Â So 20 minute drive Â and we are there again. Â There is a new lady at the desk. Â She is rude to my wife who just received some pretty bad news. Â I dont bite my tounge often. Â After waiting a half hour I was about to lose it. Â The shot wasn't ready and it was over an hour of additional waiting time. Â We have great insurance. Â I'll take my business elsewhere next time. Â Hope this place gets nothing but nonpayers.

I had my right hip replacement on 6/25/18 and it cost me over $6K. Â The 27 hours I was allowed to stay in the hospital was fine no complaints there, when I went to discharge I requested a certain home health company as I work for them and the charge nurse continued to insist to write paper work up for their in house home health company (to continue to make money from me). Â My nurse had to go back to charge nurse 4 times during discharge to get things right.I paid $1500. the day I went into the hospital and July before I even received a bill I sent a $ 350.00 payment, I continued to for multiple months and then I started getting calls from the billing department stating to me to increase my payments to $575 a month or they would send me to collections. Â I had to sell some things and put some of it on a high interest credit card but paid them off. Â 3 Days after mailing in the final payment I get a call from someone in the billing department asking me about the $3K balance and I stated I mailed it in already and what I had to do to get the money and the individual stated the $350 a month was plenty and who did I talk to, yada yada yada. Â A little too late now. Â Griselda Gonzalez from patient financial services was not reasonable to work with and I am not happy and will not recommend this hospital. Â You might get what you need done but then unreasonable people representing the hospital in the billing department haunt you until you do something drastic to pay them off. Â Amazing how $350.00 a month is not a reasonable payment for a debt a little under $3K.

This Medical Center is clean and easy to get to. They offer free valet parking which is great considering the parking lot is usually full. While appointments to see a gynecologist for my well-woman exam were not available for months, I was able to book an appointment with a midwife who conducted my well-woman exam and answered many questions for me about changing my birth control method. I saw Denise Castellano to have nexplanon implanted. Again, the appointment was very easy to make and very quick. She is such a sweet woman and does an amazing job explaining everything and walking you through what she's doing step by step. I swear this lady gave me a hug when she came into the room for my appointment! If she still around by the time I'm ready to have children, she'll be my go-to, since she's a midwife and works at the hospital just across the parking lot. This facility and their Urgent Care on Beach Boulevard are my go-to for medical care. I have only lived in California for 3 years and can't say I've experienced more professional care anywhere else.Oh and for those complaining about cost, my nexplanon cost me a $50 copay and $5 out of pocket... Please check with your insurance provider before receiving medical treatment and complain about cost. It's ridiculous everywhere, but you can't fault the doctor or facility, talk with the insurance company.
Brandon was great. Very knowledgeable. Insightful addressed all of concerns. Very happy would highly recommend.

On Friday I sprained my ankle late in the evening and had to check in the ER because it was severely swollen with bruising. I expected my wait to be much longer because of course a sprain ankle isn't really an "emergency" top of the list priority. I got in and out within an hour or so with an x-ray taken to make sure it's not fracture. Each person I met was so great. Dr. Hubert Wong was caring, quick, and informative. The triage nurse Tony was so patient even though he was approaching the end of his shift. Wes the Rn who rolled me to get my foot x-ray by the technician- both were so cheerful and great. I've been admitted to the ER quite a few time in the past so I have to say this is probably the best experience I've had for the most insignificant reason. Thank you all so much for what you do!

Excellent service and doctors. I did not have to wait extra and everyone was so friendly. The gynocologist was kind and ordered all the hormones I wanted in order to make sure my body is functioning at an optimal level. She suggested medication but did not force them upon me. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for decent medical service and care.

I actually had a good experience with this ER years ago when I had a kidney stone. Sad to say my last visit, about three months ago, was a nightmare. I was coerced into going to the hospital by a doctor I saw at Edinger Medical Center. Much to my surprise they wheeled me over to the ER and not a hospital room. Â At first I thought it was part of the check-in procedure. Â Instead of being checked in, I was stuck at the ER for six hours!The male nurse that was assigned to take my blood messed up three times. Â He finally had to call somebody down from the lab to do it. The x-ray guys were fine, but probably unnecessary. Â Another nurse ran an EKG on me even though Edinger Medical had just performed an EKG thirty minutes earlier. Â After six hours of sitting in a bed and being completely ignored, Â I asked to be signed out. Â At that point another nurse told me, "You can sign out but we have a bed waiting for you. And your insurance might not cover this visit if you leave." Â I told her she was six hours too late.Three months has gone by since then and nobody ever called me with any results on the tests they performed. The doctor that admitted me from Edinger Medical finally called, but she didn't give me an update. The whole experience was a total waste of time. Â I would never go back to that particular ER.
Another great cardioversion success thanks to Dr Patel, Dr Tuan Nguyen, Lindsey, and Tammy their duties exceed above and beyond also very friendly and nice.
The emergency room staff were awesome . They have a family of dr. and nurses to take care of your needs . Â My favorite was Dr Yee I felt like he really cared without setting judgement on my pain.

I was seen in less than 10 minutes here, friendly and compassionate staff, they tried to offer me Xanax and Ativan for an anxiety attack I had but they were very respectful and understanding when I declined. Free parking in tge parking structure, I spent less than an hour in here total and got the right referrals necessary. Highly recommend OCM ER over anything else in the immediate area. It gives UCI and Hoag/St. Joe a run for its money. Level II Trauma Center with double the beds and an ER tripled in size coming soon too

Rudest call operators ever. I go to the the women's center for ob/gyn and they are not rude at all. The biggest complaint I have is the way they treated my aunt in the hospital. She doesn't speak English but there were many of us to help translate. She was told by racist nurses that she was so depressing to them and such a burden. My aunt was having hemorrhaging and just had a dangerous fall from her bed. Everyone in the family was invited to see the other lady (patient) but the nurses were upset that there was more than 2 visitors for my aunt (my son and I were the extra visitors!). I was flabbergasted on how they had the audacity to treat my aunt with such disrespect. My aunt is really sick for crying out loud! I am a part of Memorial and am seriously thinking of switching to some other medical group. This place use to be amazing...really is a disappointment now!

My dad see's an oncologist here who is amazing Dr.Vu. His staff is amazing, so polite and helpful and everyone seems to genuinely like their job. Imaging staff also same! Everyone from the valet to the shuttle driver, the volunteers, registration clerks; best customer service ever!

The Emergency Room staff was great. I was admitted to the hospital & treated like a VIP. Everyone I had contact with was so caring & attentive. I had several broken bones & everyone took such good care to make sure I was as comfortable as I could be under my circumstances. This is the only hospital I will ever use. In fact, the ambulance Â was going to take me to another hospital in Fountain Valley and I requested Orange Coast Memorial. Thank you to all the staff and doctors that treated me on January 25th of 2018.I had surgery on my hip & the rest of my stay was uncomplicated. The staff and doctors at Orange Coast Memorial Hospital are the best.

I just have to commend the staff in the ER. My wife brought our son into the ER because he fell off the monkey bars at school and had a hole in his lip from biting through. So I was thinking this would take forever because I've gone to other ERs before like Fountain Valley where I had to wait hours before anyone saw me.I was met with out nurse right away Kelly who was very attentive and he even brought me coffee when I told him how tired I was from working all day. The PA who helped us was super quick too stitching him up. Also one of the guys who helped clean up my son his name was David was super gentle and patient I couldn't believe that my son didn't even cry! I can't imagine going to any other ER now and I will tell everyone in my family that this is the only place they should be going to

This review was sparked by the discovery of our "case manager's" failure to keep our conversations discrete and in confidence. Shortly after our son was discharged from the NICU, we found out that our "case manager" had told our NICU nurses regarding our conversation about a transfer to a different hospital. First of all, we only asked if this was an option since we did have some issues w/ the NICU. We never proceeded to take any major steps or even discuss major steps w/ her. Never the less, these conversations were supposed to be confidential. Â We also found out the nurses were offended by this. I don't blame them, but they shouldn't have known in the first place. Thinking back, it did feel like we weren't as welcomed there. Now we know why. We found this very unprofessional. On top of this, we had a minor issue w/ her when we first delivered. She had a hard time working out the details of my wife's breast pump. Calling her back 3 weeks later for updates, she didn't even know who we were!You may want to know what was so bad about our NICU stay that we wanted a transfer? There were a few issues, none that we weren't able to work out. Â Not going into details and not naming particular nurses... Most of the issues were regarding noise level. At times it was very loud. Some nurses louder than others. There's a color-coded led light noise monitor which didn't seem to deter them. But we did talk to the head nurse and things were much better afterwards. This would have been a non issue had we only stayed for a week or two but our poor boy was born very early and our stay spanned well over.I'll conclude by giving them some praise. Don't get my previous statements wrong, there were soo many great nurses here. They all played a key role in our son's development and early discharge. In the day shift, Pat whom cared for my son most of the time was very good. She was very gentle and experienced and always made us felt welcomed. Eva was also a top tier nurse although my son didn't have much opportunity with her. In the night shift, there were a handful: Reesa, Mai, Sharline, Nen. And last but not least, our delivery nurse Deena was such a delightful nurse, very gentle and warm.

God is Good and I was blessed to have such caring and genuine care today especially from the PA in the ER, Christine, Alexandria my nurse! THANK YOU SO MUCH! I have never felt so much care from a Emergency Room, I usually feel uncomfortable because of my autoimmune disease GOUT with my joint pain being so bad, but she made me feel very comfortable and understood every part of my condition. Having GOUT is an ongoing battle and unfortunately I feel that some medical care facilities make me feel uncomfortable like I'm just looking for medication. My condition is real and I have never expressed so much gratitude for a ER until today! Even if I get an attack in LA or far away I will always hope to come here to this hospital or I'll just wait to come back home to OC. Thank God there are still real caring people in the medical field because unfortunately it's not always like this! I appreciate this so much! God Bless Us All! Thank You -Jason Dayap

Not really happy with the customer service received here by the staff. After my mom came out of an extremely long procedure, not one nurse or Dr. Had the common decency to tell us she was okay or how it went. After they failed to provide any closure we were called to visit her in recovery. Still no update. Upon arrival at recovery, we were told only one person could go in there. The nurse was VERY rude. I highly suggest you schedule your surgery elsewhere. I'm fuming with anger. No one should ever be treated in such manner when there family members life is on the line.Day two and I feel the need to post an update: I walked in to see my Mom. Two nurses were standing around gossiping about a patient who had requested anxiety medication and laughing. Apparently this is an everyday occurrence judging by other people's yelp reviews. This is really disturbing as their main job is to tend to the patients concerns without judgment. I can not state it enough, DO NOT COME HERE. I can't wait to get my Mom out! This place is ran by a bunch of chickens with their heads cut off.

My wife has had 2 surgeries here and we couldnt be happier with the level of care.Nurses are awesome and attentive. The doctor she had was also above awesome and we are both happy with the care she has given ( Dr lei).Now for the bad . Parking! When spaces are clearly marked for patient parking and delivery companies and emplyees take those spaces it adds stress on people coming to get medical care. I hope management will take notice and correct this abuse. Other than that we appreciate all the hospital staff and what they do.

*** No lines?!?! ***I've been here a few times and the ER has been wonderful! The wait has been minimal and the care excellent. Quick, efficient, and quality medical attention is how I can describe my visits here so far. Maybe I shouldn't jinx myself by making such statements on a post. It might draw longer lines in the ER. Â But why not share a positive experience :-)

Absolutely HORRIBLE! This review is solely for the Emergency Room ONLY!! I had a medical emergency and chose this hospital, since it's close to home and my pain management specialist's office is located in the main hospital building. First off...the ER staff! The females were too busy gossiping about a nurse and sharing her pictures off her social media page to one another. They were loud and obnoxious! Then the triage nurse was so arrogant and opinionated. She was an older white woman, with bright red and short hair. She really upset me, but since I was feeling awful I decided to wait. She provided me with a cup for a urine sample. I walked into the restroom and was immediately disgusted. The floor had blood and so did the toilet. You would think a hospital would be held to higher standards and know about how biohazard blood is. Once I was called in (four hours later) the young man that escorted me was walking extremely fast and he never made eye contact. All he said was, "take a seat, someone will be with you shortly". I took a seat and I waited and waited, until finally...the doctor showed up. I was shocked, because from my experience I always talk to a nurse before the doctor. Anyway, I wasted my time. The doctor said that although I was extremely ill, he could not treat me because I already see a therapist for my condition. What a waste of my time and insurance money. No one ever treated me, nor did they even test my urine. I've never had such a horrible and negative experience at a hospital before.

This is the worst experience ever. Â Checked in yesterday for minor discomfort. Â Waited all day for a doctor to show up. Â Now it is 5 and no sign of her.Never go here unless you have free time to lay around

After my review in Yelp, Customer Service contacted me, she apologized and said we are here to help you. Â I can't believe what a change it has been! Â They are working with me and giving me a payment we can afford. Â We want to pay our bill, we don't have an 800 credit score from not paying our bills. Â When a major medical issue hits you and you can't work, you soon run out of money.Thank you Jario for working with us.

my 81 year old Mother, Marta Tamasy was a patient on the Telemetry Unit October 1st- 2nd.I was under the care of the following staff:Kim VuNina GonzagaJessie GonzalezHaylie TranShe received the highest quality of professional, outstanding care at a time that she was scared and needed the best medical, and personal emotional supportive care possible. I would like these people to be recognized, and wish to express my appreciation for the outstanding care my Mother Marta received. Orange Coast Memorial Medical Center has set the standards for outstanding medical care, because of personnel like those listed. Again my most heartfelt Thank You

My mother arrived to the ER and later was admitted for additional observation and care. My 4 stars is based on the customer service and clear communication I received for my mothers care. We were not given the same courtesy at another neighboring hospital.I know everyone will have a differentâ experience at any hospital, depending on their medical circumstances, the staff, and other factors that are uncontrollable. There were small petty things that could've been improved, but whats most important is that the staff did an exceptional job in thoroughly and efficiently diagnosing the culprit that lead to my mothers needing hospitalization. Im grateful to the nurses, doctors, and staff at OCC for treating my mom with dignity and care that all patients deserve.
I've had excellent care from Dr Reitherman in the Breast Center. The support staff in scheduling and insurance coverage have also been great. I recommend OCMMC

This Medical center is easily accessible from the freeway. Â  I come to see a doctor here and had an easy time finding parking.. and if it happened to be busy, they offer FREE VALET parking... NICE! Â  Starbucks on the 2nd floor... but it's more like a coffee shop that serves Starbucks coffee... they don't have any of the flavored fancy drinks and it's cash only. Â BOO!

Great job with imaging services once again! Â Scheduling appointment was easy, plus technician was on-time, friendly, and competent. Â My only issue is having to be poked more than 1 time for IV. Â However, that has to do with my veins rolling around like they sometimes do -- not easy for anybody to handle.Would definitely recommend.

Save yourself a lot of money and headache, this place is a big financial rip off! If you really want great service and quick turnaround time on blood work and x-rays, CT scans, MRI, go to Irvine Urgent Care, they are just like a hospital without the financial burden and wait time. I spent less than 2 hours in this emergency room and received insensitive care by a doctor/staff who seemed to be in a rush to just get you in and out without consideration for your health. Next thing I know my bill was $4,500 and all I had done was chest xtray, ekg and blood work, and yes, I had insurance! Memorial care...more like we don't care, we just want your money.

My elderly father received great care and attention from Dr. Yee. Nurse Lauren was very patient and comforting in a difficult situation.In addition, my Father who was visiting from out of town cannot stand waiting for anything. They did a great job of not making us wait an unreasonable amount of time.

Unfortunately, I was in a car crash where I fainted behind the wheel. Luckily I was in heavy traffic and only hit the median. Was taken here and kept overnight. Staff was AMAZING!!! I was treated with respect and felt cared for. Did a full workup to make sure my heart was ok and it was. Now just have to figure out why I faint so much

5 stars!I came into the ER today for severe knee pain. I seriously don't know why this place barely has 3 stars. Everyone was so helpful & accommodating! My doctor was Yulie J Park, PA. She really knows her stuff in regards to what is where on certain parts of the body. A really sweet nurse, Jennifer, was very careful, patient & understanding about my hatred of needles for the shot in my arm for the pain (it was either that or in my butt; NO thanks!).
