What takes this place over the top is the incredible nursing staff. I especially would like to give recognition to my nurse Mirette, she honestly went above and beyond her call of duty. You know you have created a special bond with your nurse when you are saddened by knowing that you will miss her when you are discharged. I would also like to recognize nurse Sheila who is a breastfeeding guru. I did not get the name of all the other nurses but they were all AMAZING!! Thank you ladies for loving your careers and transmitting that love to your patients. To top things off the lactation specialist Lori was wonderful and very well informed. We love the Center for Childbirth at OCMMC! P.S. The food service people are extremely friendly and all of my meals were great.

Horrible! Just horrible... I had an appt at radiology at 1130... Showed up at 1015..it is now 1230 and still haven't been seen... Anyone seeing radiology is usually fasting so no consideration for that!

This review is only for the ER Doctor that was supposed to assist me. Â The rest of the staff was very professional and kind. Â I went in because I was extremely dizzy and having chest pain. Â Before the Doctor even saw me he sent in a Nurse to give me meds for anxiety because he said I was having an anxiety attack??? I refused to take the meds because I was told they would make me sleepy... how was I supposed to tell the Doctor what was going on or ask questions if I was sleepy???? Once the Doctor was told I refused the meds he decided to discharge me without doing anything... not even a CBC!!! Â I left in tears and in worse shape than when I went in. Â The only thing I got out of this visit was a very large co-payment bill.

This facility is so clean (much much cleaner than FV Hospital). The staff is super friendly. The nurses are awesome and knowledgeable. Special thanks to JANICE ROGERS, RN. who is the nicest and the most patient nurse I've ever met.
I called twice and they picked up the phone and hung up and then someone finally answered the phone and they were so rude.. She couldn't even answer my question

My Mother had surgery here on Monday March 19 2018 overall her stay was good all the staff and nurses etc were very friendly and helpful.Hospital was very clean and they have free valet parking til 7pm.... when we got to the pre op waiting room there was an employee that gives u a card with a # on it to track the progress of the surgery on a big monitor with checkmarks to know if your loved one is in pre op then surgery then post op then to a room and can receive visitors..they also have wifi and hot spot and charging stations and complimentary fruit infused water...the nurses will also call the pre op waiting room and let you know when you can come back the only problem with this was that after 1 pm there was no longer an employee to answer said phone and after several un answered phone calls and everyone wondering about patient updates I started answering the phone! getting around the hospital was like a maze! we had to go up one elevator then down another elevator through long hallways to first get to pre op room! after a little exploring we found a much easier and shorter route to get where we needed...right next to the pre op waiting room is a small cafeteria i had read the reviews and everyone said cafeteria was great NOT !! It was small food looked all dry and gross there was only like 3 hot food options which they serve for breakfast and lunch no variety they have a small salad bar and prepackaged sandwiches NOT IMPRESSED!! Eat elsewhere or pack your own lunch...

I'm so grateful with all the staff in this hospital. I mean everyone. from Doctors to nurses. they're so sweet, professional, always smiling. all my nurses was American, Philippines, Spanish and Vietnamese. they all so amazing. I just want to say thanks a lot to everyone. big kisses and hugs from the bottom of my heart.

My daughter got hurt during a softball game and couldn't walk. It's 11:30pm on Friday..... Worse case scenario right ? No, this place is awesome. Super busy but in and out in about an hour. X-rays, meds and a thorough consult. Thank you! Nightmare avoided !

I made an appointment with them for a genetic test and i was waiting for more than a month(maybe 2) to see the counselor.However, couple days ago I got a call that due to some unforeseen circumstances we do not currently have a genetic counselor available to see you!!! and when I asked for another appointment I found out that there is nothing available until September which is 3 months!!! so she suggested me to call my doctor to find some other place ! I cant believe this and I am so pissed off!I got another appointment from another hospital. but i still have to wait one month and that's not my fault!
Was very happy with the service I was seen straightaway when my daughter was having seizures very nice stuff and Nurses
I'm giving this hospital for 5 stars! Cos the RN(nurse) are very nice and friendly! Joenie and ginger they are the best RN!

I just wanna give a shout out to the nicu nurses they were a big help with our baby boy. They answered all of my wife and I' s questions and gave us suggestions we wouldn't have thought of. The nurses were friendly and funny. Wouldn't deliever anywhere else.

In feb. I had an amazing experience at this hospital, I wish right now I could write a review about that great experience, but after the stay i just had i am sickened by the quality of care of that i received from basically two specific providers that I cannot. Â I went to the ER with a complex that was 7 cm large (avg size of an ovary itself is 3-5 cm) in terrible pain, and they admitted me to the hospital. Â Everyone was kind, they did not give me any food because i think that they were assuming that i would have surgery to remove this extremely large cyst. Dr. Charles Moniak decided not to (which was not the problem or even the reason i'm writing this review, even though i am currently still in terrible pain, have to go back to work tomorrow with this 7 cm cyst, and nothing was resolved after spending two nights in the hospital). Â I am writing because he sent me for an ultra sound so he thought that i wasn't in my room and I heard him yell to a nurse "GREAT, why do i always get the chronic pain patients?.." He asked him how often I was asking for my pain medication like I was there seeking drugs, and didn't even bother to see me before the ultra sound so the tech was looking for my gall bladder which was removed almost 10 years ago. Â Then when I saw him (which was only for around 5 minutes just so he could tell me that he wasn't going to do it he was very rude). Â I'm 27 years old and i have been struggling since I was 12 years with both endometriosis and PCOS. Â I understand not wanting to deal with me because i am a complicated case, but to yell something like that in the hallway of your work place is COMPLETELY and utterly inappropriate Â The only thing that I can say that was good about this experience was that the pain management doctor was very efficient and checked back on me at least three times. Â I only saw the OB once, and i only saw Dr. Lala-Reddy when they were going to release me. They also said that they were going to monitor it for the next 6-12 weeks, and i'm not really sure how because I have had Dr. Lala- Reddy as my primary care physician since my original surgery and she hasn't checked back on me once about anything.
Very good care, fast service, small hospital. I frequent there too much due to migraines, the staff are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Highly recommend.

Worst parking ever. Â They offer free valet, but some people would prefer to just park themselves rather than waiting for an attendant to go get their car. Â Some of the staff are friendly, but the majority of the staff seem not to care much about the patients.

I got sick at night on halloween but I waited until to see my primary Doctor after that he sent me to hospital I do have to 2 hospital to go 1/ Fountains Valley Â 2/ ORC Then i choose Orange Coast Memorial .in front office you will see two Ladies ( never smile) Â I'm waiting, waiting until my turn in ER room all the Nurse and the Dr very sweet Â , they check me everything and find down i had virus in my stomach i stay there until 9.30 they move me to the room and the first night one little Nurse take care me her name Jenny very very sweet ( i'm so happy she take care me 2 night) and one young guy name Humberto Cervantes and the Â day 4 i met i more Nurse She sweet too her name Jane . Usually i never post anything on yelp but this time i think I should I wish all the team always lucky happy and successful I wish two my sweetest Nurse have a lot patience love you guy more and you too HumbertoWish you guy have a wonderful Thanksgiving

If I could give a negative star rating, I would. Â Avoid the Emergency Room!!! The ER doctor (Nguyen) could care less about your medical history, scheduled surgeries, or about the letter your PCP wrote about the rare medical condition that you were born with... Â he told me I was fine. Â Good to know, I will let my transplant doctor know.
I got them transfer me to Lisa. She has helped me to resolve my problems very quick. Thank you.

READ THIS CAREFULLY before you decide to send your loved ones here. My father had some issues with his stomach, couldn't eat, sleep for at least 2, 3 weeks. Â He was so weak to a point we had to send him to Orange Coast ER room for the first time. They asked him couple questions, then sent him home with some stomache medications (!). About a week later, Â he felt worse, so we sent him back. All they told us was: "you brought him back on time, thank you". They kept him there for 3 days, gave him some blood tests, and ran IV. Then they transferred him to West Anaheim Medical because "he's a little stable now so we will send him there because it is closer to your home". West Anaheim detected him with severe Hepatitis, and referred him to USC for possible liver transplant. And a month later, we received a bill for 10k dollars for 3 days stay, with no operations, no private room, no sense of urgency from the staffs, waste of time, and almost cost his life. Feel free to send me messages for additional info or questions if you're in the same situations with me.

I went to the ER with severe pain in my chest. The nurses and doctors talked to me condescendingly and the doctor didnt even introduce himself and became angry when I didnt understand what he was saying because of his speech. He said I had pleurisy and tried to send me home with norcos so I refused the medication with nothing. Pleurisy can be an indication of a blood clot in your lungs and many other life threatening illnesses. They did not test me for anything, later an urgent care doctor confirmed that they should have tested me for anything life threatening. She did a basic test on me and diagnosed me with Costochondritus within 10 minutes. Â I just got a bill from this hospital $2000 that I will not be paying because they did nothing.
Such an amazing staff. So friendly and knowledgeable. I wish I could say same for outside specialists though. Seems like they have their own schedule.

Clean hospital the staff is professional I had a over all good experience. Only unavoidable problem was my roommate was a little on the crazy side & post-op that's the last thing you wanted to deal with. When your in pain & want to rest your roommate has no consideration. It could have been worse..

Wonderful Staff! Â I had to have surgery two weeks ago and was so impressed with the whole team from admission, the team who prepped me and Post-op care. Â They were all so kind and sweet and funny. Â Thank you for the excellent care and my surgeon -- Dr. Atif Iqbal.

My mom is 82 yrs old, she was having trouble breathing for about 1 week. I decided to bring her to the Emergency Room, thank God I did, she was diagnosed with Pneumonia and has been here for 1 week. Her progress is great, all thanks to the staff. From the Doctors, RN's and Assistant RN, the care and Love they share with my Mom is overwhelming and beyond there obligation. Although she is still hospitalized, I feel comfortable that she will recover soon. Special thanks to Cynthia who has taken extra effort in assisting my mom with her needs, and the Priests that visit and pray for her almost daily. God is Great !!!!!

I went to the ER last night for an allergic reaction. I never would have thought to come here because they seem so small. I'm so glad I went. The waiting room was a bit small. I would have given it a 5 star but the front desk people weren't very pleasant. I don't understand why they are so rude. There were two of them and never once did they smile. I'm already having a bad day, do you need to make it worse? If you can make it through the gatekeepers you'll love the nurses and the doctors behind the curtain. The doctor quickly came by to shake my hand, introduce himself and told me to make myself comfortable. The process went pretty quickly. The nurse was an adorable man that did everything right. Joked and told me stories to help calm my nerves. He got my iv vein on the first try. Checked on me every 10 minutes. I honestly couldn't have asked for better service. I wish I could give them 5 stars but they need to do something with the front desk people.
Good Emergancy Room always clean staff is helpful and always take great care if the patients sadly not a place you want to go but if your there your in good hands

I have had both hips replaced at this facility and I have nothing but the finest praise for the staff and the facility itself . Doctor Anatole Podolsky was my surgeon for both operations you couldn't be in better hands, he a is a very professional and knows his field.A big thanks to the doctor the staff and everybody that was both times.

Once again, I received nothing but exceptional care during my stay at the Center for Childbirth delivering my second child. This time around, my L&D nurses Joann and Ann were utterly sweet, knowledgable and just overall very attentive. My labor was progressing very quickly, and I found myself much more nervous this time around. Joann took her time in helping me ease my fears and fully explained everything that was going on. My recovery nurses Dianne, Char and Shelly were all wonderful and sweet as well. Although I'm an RN myself, they never took any shortcuts in explaining what they were doing. I noticed that they strictly followed protocol such as performing hand hygiene before and after patient care, cleaning their stethoscopes before listening to my baby, and they each scanned my wristband every time medication was administered. As a prior nursing student, I've witnessed my fair share of nurses taking "shortcuts" before, but none were taken here. The Center for Childbirth really needs more than a 5 star recognition in my book.
Just want to say the last day I had the best RN ever. Her name was Greta Gonzalez on the surgical floor. The night before I left I had a RN named Ken I didn't like him at all.
The best labor delivery hospital around. The staff was awesome. Took care of all the needs of the family. Thank you staff you guys do an awesome job.

I have been so pleased with Dr Conner and this hospital. My child was 2 weeks early due to a leak. I ended up needing to be induced. The whole process went swell here. I expected worse and was extremely concerned and had anxiety. The staff that attended me was the best. I had many nurses bcuz I was in for 3 days. All were consistent on service and information. They walked me thru it all and that helps SO MUCH. As for Dr Conner, she worked hand in hand with the nurses and checked up on me at the hospital to see my progress. She was totally up front with me and suggested the epidural due to my narrow pelvic. I took her advice bcuz duhhh...she's the educated doctor! I took the epidural and a few hrs later I had a natural birth. I was told another Dr would be delivering my child. I had no problem with it bcuz I mean hello, at that point I couldn't choose. But Dr Conner, she stayed PAST HER SHIFT just to deliver my baby. That made my just love her even more. AMAZING WOMAN I TELL YOU! The staff as well. I couldn't have chosen a better hospital. Thank You Doctor Conner & Orange Coast Medical. You are the BEST!! Keep it up!

I went to the ER here for food poisoning and I have to say they were very quick and kind to me. I cried when I came in and everyone spoke very soft and gentle to me and took good care of me. The doctors and nurses asked again and again is there anything else we can do to help. Bad reason to go to the hospital but very nice staff.

I came to the emergency, I was dizzy, I couldn't stand up that they put me on wheelchair, the doctor w sow me, he wanted to give me injunction for the dizzy..I said I don't like injunction..then the doctor came to me ,he was mad and threatened me that if I don't take the injunction..he will discharge me,,,he was road.. then I said I will take tablet instead of injunction, which in five minutes he ave me tablet and discharged me, I couldn't getup ..I was still dizzy... I force myself to get up and stayed on the wheelchair for a long time... I was shaking feeling cold..and no body care.. because I discharged.. there was one nurse who sow that.. I remember his face.. but I don't know his name..It was a horrible experience.. I wish somebody take action about this doctor!

Well thought I'd post. Because of blood clots I've been hospitalized many times so I have a lot to compare. I got there and was in a bed within 5 minutes. Talked to a doctor and had meds in a half hr. Well see about discharge. One bad thing is they never close curtain all the way. When people walk buy I feel like im in a zoo.

Prior from my dad's surgery I heard from a previous patient "this hospital is no good, they always keep you in longer than you need to"So I had already had a bad taste with this hospital My family had a horrible experience with Orange Coast Memorial hospital . My father went in for Low invasive robotic heart surgery 3 weeks ago and passed away 11/25. I felt like it was necessary to write a yelp review for anyone considering to go/ or send a family member or loved one to this hospital for robotic heart surgery.My dad's surgery: The complication started during anesthesia, the anesthesiologist made a mistake and punctured my dad's lung /coronary sinus Â - Â this caused too much damage to his system to continue with original procedure Â so then they had to go forward with Â open heart surgery and open up the chest .The doctors Â didn't realize my dad had internal bleeding in his lung until they completed the heart surgery and closed him up. My dad went into shock but they didn't know why . They had to reopen my dad's chest and drain the blood in his lung.The internal bleeding was caused by the puncture- they Closed my dad's chest again and then my dad went into shock for the 2nd time . His heart, lungs, had been damaged causing his system to fail including kidneys . The doctors then put my dad on life support having him on 5 drips to support his blood pressure , balloon pump for his heart(tubes coming directly from his open chest) ventilator for his lungs so that he can breath . His kidneys failed completely . We were shocked and our entire family was greiving seeing my dad suffer in pain on life support and knowing that the doctors "messed up" on him. Over a course of 3 weeks my dad was in ICU- each day there was progress so we had hope . The nurses were sweet and attentive to my dad (except crystal who dreaded our visits on her late shift) Â my dad had to get dialysis treatment because his kidneys stopped working . He was unable to eat because he had an infection in his mouth from all the antibiotics. He lost strength and could not get up. He passed away 2 days ago . My dad came in to fix a valve in his heart and now he had damaged lung and kidneys? It didn't make sense to me. Even though I am glad the suffering for my dad is over - I am very disappointed in all the mistakes the doctors did that costed my dad his life. We all know going into any surgery is risky - but I feel like for my dad's particular case he was not in the best hands and I would not recommend this hospital to anyone .

Just started going to OCMMC the last year, had several procedures here..and every time it has been great experience and friendly staff, doctors...ect....great hospital. ..Don't miss Hoag at all. Was worried about the switch, but, happy to have new hospital! !

Had a child here September 12 2014. I thought the name of the maternity ward was silly. The staff was great and put my mind at ease as I had to go back to work 5 hours later. The nicu was great. Dr. Laporte was great.

I went to the ER for a really bad cough that made me feel I could not breath. I got seen fast the staff was awesome, and my nurse CJ was very helpful and made me feel comfortable. The doctor was very helpful and knew how to explain everything in detail.

Just did my pre op for surgery next week. My amazing pre op coordinator Michelle King made sure that I am completely prepared for everything. She made me feel extremely comfortable about asking questions as well as making sure I had her contact info if there I had additional questions I forgot to ask. I was made to feel more like family than a patient. Kudos to Dr.Russo and his team for hiring great support staff in his office! Dr. Russo was also great-excellent bedside manner. Looking forward to my surgery next week being in such capable hands.

I have been to this facility several times for appointments and procedures...everyone is always friendly, professional and go out of there way to help with directions...You don't have to ask...if you look lost, they will help direct you and even escort you all the way to your destination......Beth Hambelton did this for me and I was very appreciative!...Later that same day, a housekeeping employee (sorry, I didn't get your name) assisted me with directions, again, escorting me to my destination......This type of personal assistance really helps to create a feeling of well being and comfort to people who may not be feeling well physically and helps to build trust when bringing in family members that require care......They have free valet parking and are freeway close...Starbucks on the 2nd floor...

My mother in law had her first knee replacement surgery here yesterday and it is just an amazing experience for her. Through out the process from the complimentary valet parking, to the super friendly staff checking her in, to moving her to a different wing to the anesthesiologist to the surgeon, it was just delightful. The follow up is literally every 20-30 minutes. The amount of care and compassion provided is just amazing. We HIGHLY recommend it if possible. Again the staff has just gone above and beyond and they have been just super accommodating, nice not just to the patient but even the family members. Seriously even the security guards and check in volunteers. Just lovely. We will likely be here for the second knee thankfully.
I went to emergency tonight and everybody was very professional and very friendly Especially Dr John Yee
No complaints, was treated for a few days here at this location. Â My car was in the parking lot the whole time.

This review is for Dr John L Yee, MD and Scott (not sure of his last name) who was my RN. Â I made a trip to the emergency room this past week and they made my trip very pleasant, well as pleasant as one could be. Â They had a great sense of humor and were both very knowledgable. Â They took take of me as quickly as they possibly could so I didn't have to spend more time than I should have in this situation. Â Dr Yee followed up 24 hours later even after I was release and in the care of 3 other doctors. Â I would have to say I was very surprised about the call and definitely would recommend both of these guys to all of my family and friends. Â That was the only good part of my visit :)

What a terrible staff at this hospital. Just like the people of Orange County to feel entitled and be disrespectful in any situation. I'm so tired of California and this hospital just puts the cherry on top.

Where do I start? For the most part the nurses have an idea of what they're doing but they're pretty careless. I won't make that statement unless I had concrete evidence. I have a sister who's a nurse anesthetist who was with my dad in the ICU and now telemetry. My dad had a stroke. First, the admitting worker simply couldn't read the insurance card. An RN in the emergency room comes to the family and states that we must provide cash or a check in order for him to receive treatment. WTF!!?? SERIOUSLY!!?? Some professionalism that was. In this era an inmate receives medical treatment faster than a good citizen? Not only that, on the way to an MRI the tech took my dad around the hospital looking for the MRI room on top of that this idiot tech made him get up and walk to the MRI after a stroke. Coming back to the emergency room, no one was notified and my brother had to go let the nurse know that he was back in the emergency room. Waited in the ER for 14 hours before being admitted to ICU. No professionalism was shown towards us in that unit until they found out I was a police officer, my sister a nurse anesthetist, and my brother a respiratory therapist. At first they treated like we were little kids and didn't know what we were talking about. Yet my sister has more schooling and knowledge than those nurses in the whole unit. The neurologist Dr. PARK comes in and checks on my dad, does a little range of motion exercise and walks out, said something everything's resolved. WTF is resolved? He had a stroke for crying out loud. An internal medicine by the name of Doctor CHIDAO NGUYEN later in the day comes in and does exactly the same thing. Asks some obvious questions and walks out. I asked dumbass Dr Nguyen what was the result of the echocardigram he said he'll check and ends up leaving the unit without saying anything to the family. We had to have a nurse call him on the phone so one of us could speak to him. Another great sign of professionalism. Transfers up to the telemetry floor, nurses again Dr Dumbass Nguyen comes and does the same thing. Shift changes. Nurses were going to give my dad some medication, sister questions it, nurse can't justify and said they're following the doctor's orders. Some new medications were on order to be given last night to my dad yet they were not part of the discharge orders. How does a doctor order new meds for a patient one day and send him home with completely different meds to be taken everyday? So we're waiting in the room to speak to a doctor regarding discharge, my sister notice a first degree heart block on the heart monitor. The telemetry nurse completely disagrees and begins arguing with my knowledgeable sister stating that it was sinus rhythm. My sister requested a printout of the reading and the nurse brought it to her and realizes that she was wrong and agrees with my sister. Tries to get the dumbass DR careless CHIDAO Nguyen on the phone, doctor yells at the RN and says he doesn't want to care to talk to anyone on the phone and for us to wait for him to get to the hospital to talk. So the wait starts, about 30 mins later, the RN in charged of my dad for the day comes in and states that there has been an error with the insurance. Asks us if anyone has come in to notify us of the situation. We're completely blindsided and asked what situation? That dr dumbass Nguyen was never suppose to see my dad. All his orders has be disregarded and can't be followed. As we sit here on the telemetry floor waiting for the case manager to come and speak to us, we're completely in utter shocked of the professionalism this hospital along with its staff has shown. Sense my complete sarcasm? The RN states that she will try to get a hold of the case manager hoping that this individual has not gone home. I'm in complete frustration. As the rest of this day plays out, I can't see things getting any better. If I can give this place a negative star rating or even a zero rating definitely count on it.

What a great experience from early morning check in to loading me in the car to go home. I had a total knee replacement (Dr. Gibson's handy work) and I have to say the entire staff was great! especially the Maria's-RN and assistant 10/14 night shift. Everyone was a solid 10.

I would highly recommend Orange Coast Hispital. I was in their hospital at two different times this year . I received excellent care from the admissions staff all the way up to the nurses and physicians. The CNAs, the nutrition dept and janitorial staff were professional, friendly and consistently asked if they could do anything else for me. When one is ill and anxious and has to put oneself into others's hands, it is a comforting feeling to know that the people you have to trust to do right by you are professional, competent and compassionate.L. K. M.

I stayed here 5 days. The check process was effortless. They didn't make it time-consuming with paperwork. I think there were only a few I had to sign and initial, which took about 5 minutes. After that I was admitted.All the nurses I had were wonderful, helpful, kind, and so willing. They really try to make the patients comfortable.The food here was better than what I expected! And the portions were quite fulfulling too.Overall, great experience. I would definitely come back.

Don't believe the estimated labor and delivery cost of around $5k to $6k they give you during the hospital tour visit. My wife had a normal delivery and the cost was over $11K. Epidural is a separate charge of $1k. I talked to a few people and this is consistent. I don't mind the cost but be honest.

Best Urgent care around!I came here last night after a ball game with a gash on my chin, the receptionists greeted me right away and gave me towels and cause for my scrapes. I was inside the Urgent Care room within 10 minutes!!I got 5 stitches and was in and out within an hour and a half, I will definitely be coming here again!

On 2-5-14:Can one ICU RN ruin a hospital stay? Â I don't know, but this needs to be told. Â My dad's seven-day stay for open heart surgery was successful. Â The surgeon, anesthesiologist, the Nurse Practitioners (especially), and almost all the RN's and aides were exceptional. Â I will try to name them: Â Dr. Lam, surgeon; Dr. Jameison, anesthesiologist (wonderful); Chris, NP; Mike, surgery intake nurse; Ginger, ICU RN (!); Jennifer. Telemetry nurse (over and above!); Telemetry nurse Justine; Pinky, Telemetry NP; Sue, NP; Laura (?) NP, ICU nurse Tim; Â and some I have forgotten their names. Â Caring, warm, tender with my sweet dad, Â I found them attentive and communicative and responsive to my dad's needs. Â In general, I hold nurses in esteem somewhere around saints and angels on earth. Â These mentioned above were no disappointment. Â He is a gentle man and deserves this. Â That being said ...ATTENTION NURSING SUPERVISORS:Unfortunately, my dad's second day post-op he had ICU RN Kristen on 2-5-14. Â At the outset I found her cool and aloof, but I wasn't concerned with that at that moment. (Just take care of my dad!) Â It's hard to put this in words, but she seemed distant and observing as if she were in a school lab or something. Â  She then began removing tapes from my dad's body and was oddly standing ramrod straight and just watching him react in pain, as if it were a science experiment or something. Maybe she didn't know what to do here. Â  She removed a tube from my dad's neck, and we thought my dad would pass out from pain and yelling. Â This was his worst moment the whole hospital stay. Â  She just stood there looking at him. Â  There were terrible marks and bruises and assaults on his neck skin which I took pictures of. Â She was only mildly observing my dad instead of speaking to him to calm him or reassuring him this would be over soon or some comforting words ... NOT forthcoming from this nurse! Â She brought orange juice to my dad when requested but made it clear she was not happy about it. Â She did have plenty of time for high-energy eye contact and plenty of flirtation with my married brother. Â I am sure she works hard for her looks so she can wear the tight scrubs, but this is not the environment for that. Â Her behavior was inappropriate and not the professional level we found everywhere else in the hospital. Â I would chalk that part up harmlessly to her personality but for the weirdly cold, unfeeling, and seemingly out-of-body and only borderline competent care for my dear father. Â Should this unprofessional girl be in ICU?
Jackson the Imaging Aide for Radiology is just a real stand up guy. Also, amazing patient care. Can't say enough good things about this facility.

My family loves this hospital. They have excellent care and amazing staff working together. I recommend this hospital to everyone. I had my daughter here 9 yrs ago and I have had other surgeries here. My dad had to have a pace make replaced from what another dr did wrong in Texas and they fixed him here. My mother in law was at Anaheim regional where they messed her up and orange coast memorial fixed her absolutely love this place and all their staff.

We had great experience until my mother was moved to room one of the worst I have ever seen in my life to the point that I start it expecting her to be on some kind of drugs she use very bad obscenities she was very rude and she also at 09:50pm came to the room to give my mother antibiotic and the she was ripping things that made her bleed and when I point it out to her she answered me in such a way like how dare I asked and she said that the blood was there already and then I showed her that blood was dripping from her hand so she start it ripping the tape needle and mad it even worst. Very bad but I'll wait to hear from someone as we usually receive great service here and never had to deal with such a bad experience but I will not stay quite about this please contact me if you have any question

I delivered my baby here, and the nurses were all so kind and helpful. I had been dreading my hospital stay leading up to it, but once I was there, it was really nice. Each nurse was truly delightful, I felt so at ease with any questions or requests I had. By the end of my stay, I found myself realizing I would miss having all of the help, but confidant in myself from all of the info I received.

DO NOT GO THERE! This place scares me to death. I'm sure my father would have died if I hadn't been there and if we hadn't left. I found the nurses asleep at night. You could hear one of them snore. Most of the Asian nurses told me they didn't speak English when we asked for help. I talked to them and they would just stare at me blankly. Dad sat in soiled diapers for hours. I had to change him and he was so embarrassed. They never bathed him even though we kept asking. No water. His pain was out of control and they refused to call the doctor. The call lights rang forever. It makes me sick thinking about it. Dad says it's the worst place he has ever been. We will be filing a complaint with JCAHO. How are they accredited at all? Other families told me the same thing. God help us if we ever have to go there again. I wanted so bad to call the news station and let everyone know. I hope this helps you not go through what we did.

this hospital truly cares for the patients! i only give it less than 5 stars due to the fact that it took over 20 ER 911 calls until they realised that i had a severe GI problem, and i kept getting kicked loose at first with them calling it food poisioning or stomach flu! how many times in a week can you have the stomach flu? well, now that the dr finally figured out it was a rare condition known as cyclic vomiting syndrome as well as gastroparesis, i was finally taken seriously! i must say, the nurses would see me coming in by ambulance over and over, and i'd have them running to my aid to help! it was just common misdiagnoses with my condition that caused the delay in admissions. once they realized i was extremely ill, they gave me excellent care, brought in the best doctors, i was on medi-cal and i still got top doctors! this hospital has everything! most of my doctor specialists are at this hospital. sadly, i don't live in the area, but i almost went back there the other day due to the lack of proper care i have received in LA County! i still remember Sandy yelling"dakota!" one of my many nicknames, as well as the miracle child, bionic woman, love child, etc. they truly get to know and care for you! best drs in so. california!

This is a review on Labor & Delivery! Â I had an amazing birthing experience at this hospital and I am so glad I decided on having my son here instead of at Hoag. Â Everyone took such great care of me and made me feel like I was a family member that they were taking care of. Â Joanne Â and Leah were my nurses and I couldn't have asked for anyone better. Â Joanne was there for me while I was admitted and had a million questions and fears. Â She never got annoyed and answered all my questions and made me feel totally comfortable. Â When I found out she was going home at 7pm and my new nurse Leah was coming, I got really anxious. Â But Leah was amazing too, like an old (but young) friend. Â She totally put me at ease and worked with me to get my baby in the right position so that I could have a vaginal birth. Â She seemed genuinely happy for me that I got to have the birthing experience I wanted. Â She knew how scared I was to get a catheter in recovery so she even came over to do it (even though that wasn't her department), just to make me comfortable. Â And it didn't even hurt. Â She brought her bubbly nurse Allie with her which was also amazing and the 2 of them had me cracking up! Â Dr. Lena delivered my baby and everything went perfect there too. Â In recovery, Yoli and Kim took great care of me. Â Mama Charlie even recommended letting the nursery nurse watch my son so we could get some much needed sleep and Tess and Kim did that for us. Â We were so grateful. I actually cried when I left the hospital because everyone took such great care of me and I was just so grateful. Â Thank you all for taking such good care of me :)

Amazing Neurosurgeon Dr. Nguyen! He saved my dads life and I can't thank him enough. I will always have a special place in my heart for the ICU nurses as well, they really cared for my family as one of their own and as a nurse myself, I'm truly grateful to have excellent care provided for my family when my dad had his craniotomy post SubHematoma. Great staff, and Dr. N is the best in his field! I'll never forget the crew here. Thanku everyone again.
Brand new hospital. Only here for husband's procedure. He got great care and nurses were super friendly and informative.

Dr. Thang Nguyen always keeps smiling. Anytime you contact him, he explains the procedure very carefully. He makes you more hopeful and love life. The first time, on May 2016 he already helped me remove the tumor behind the left knee and the second time on August 2017 he took out a "seborrheric keratosis" on my right hand. Both cases are perfect. I 'd like to recommend him to everybody. Also, he has a friendly staff, especially Huong, that makes you more comfortable.

My fiance had a cardiac ablation here a few weeks ago. While I can say the nurses in the Cath Lab & ICU were amazing & respectful, the nurses on floor 1 were inappropriate & perverted. Upon moving him to a regular bed, he began to bleed from cath site in groin area. They exposed his genitals for 25 min and 3 diff nurses during this time touched, moved his genitals around with no explanation or intro to who they were. There was 7-9 nurses standing at foot of the bed staring at his genitals the entire time, including the visitors for pt next store, due to curtain was never closed. After he was bandaged and covered, the crowd began to leave. Then random nurses came in and lifted blanket to look. When the 3rd nurse walked up to lift blanket, I covered his genital area over blanket and yelled, "No! The nurse just checked him and she's not even out the door yet! No!" The nurse disregarded what I said, continued to lift blanket and said, "I want to see" with a big smile. We are in shock, hurt and angry. We have complained to the CEO, director and a few others there. Nothing has been done. Patient modesty & sexual misconduct is something this hospital is not aware of.

Out of all the ICU's, ERs, hospitals, etc. in Orange County (Kaiser facilities, Hoag, UCI...) Orange Coast Memorial has the best nurses/RNs/docs...I've been here every day for the past week- my mom had open heart surgery and is recovering very well- thanks to the caring workers. The doctors really took their time with her to explain every little detail. They were very informative, supportive, and caring. A few nurses that weren't on duty or working in a different area noticed my mom's name on the schedule and took the time to say hello to her and made sure she was doing okay. This made me so happy to see she was in good hands. They really strive to build a relationship with their patients... they don't just do their job because they HAVE to.This was the most nerve-wracking moment of my family's life. I'm forever grateful for the team who helped my mom- from the first day she entered the ER, to the surgeons, to ICU (RN: Mike I. is awesome!), to telemetry (all the nurses rock!)... my mom's life was literally in their hands and they saved her from the dangers that could have happened. I pray for a great recovery for her.

My Daughter had a slight fracture in her middle finger from getting it stuck in a bike chain, we brought her to the ER here because her medical insurance had not transferred yet. we got in right away and Everyone, I mean everyone, was extremely nice here and took excellent care of her being she is only 3 years old. They explained things in kid terms and made sure she felt right at home. One of the gentlemen even brought her a stuffed bear and she cuddled it the entire time. I appreciate the excellent service we always receive here.

I went to the Emergency Room for my first time on 7/29/17, very early in the morning. Â The two girls at the window that took my information were very friendly, professional, and caring. Â When I was called back to wait for the doctor, Heather was an angel, very helpful and reassuring, and made me relax. Â Dr. Yee is very knowledgeable, has a very calm demeanor, and answered all questions that I had. Â If I ever need to go to an emergency room again in the future, I will definitely be back. Â In the event that a friend or family member needs immediate medical attention, I will definitely recommend OC Memorial Medical Center. Â Thanks to all! Â You are a truly amazing team of professionals.

This review is strictly for L&D (labor and delivery). I have had all 3 of my kids (2002, 2004, and 2010) there and would not go anywhere else. It was a great experience each and every time. The nurse with the curly hair is awesome!!Staff was very attentive and helpful with everything that I needed. 2 out of 3 times I had a room to myself which was awesome because hubby could stay and help with the baby. When I did have to share a room the staff was great about trying to keep both sides pretty private (well as much as you can with just a curtain separating you!!)Food was OK. Breakfast was the worst meal of the day but lunch and dinner options were fairly decent. All in all it was a really good experience delivering here. The only thing I really did not like was the shower because the water pressure was AWFUL. After giving birth all I wanted was to take a nice shower and it's hard to enjoy with just a dribble of water to wash your hair. Would recommend to any pregnant friend for L&D!

Had to take a friend to emergency on a Friday night and wow..... we were in at 940pm and out by 1045pm. I couldn't believe how fast it went.. the staff was pleasant and sweet and they had a lot of patients too... it may never happen again but it deserves to be told! The only drawback was the waiting room was quite small.. maybe that's a deterrent?? Hey...it works!

A few weeks ago I broke my knee cap and came to Orange Coast's emergency room followed by surgery to put my knee back together. Â From the moment we arrived in the ER to the day I left the hospital after having surgery, I was very impressed with the entire team at Orange Coast. Â The nurses, doctors, physical therapist, aides, chefs - literally everyone was AMAZING. Â They listen, are compassionate and treat their patients like royalty. Â Also, my hospital room was pristine, spacious and quiet at night. Â That's definitely a first!! Â Bye bye Hoag and Hello Orange Coast!! Â I have never been treated better, am healing well, and will always choose Orange Coast for my family's care from now on.

I've been admitted to the telemetry unit here four times now. Â Until lately the staff was very friendly and helpful, and many still are, but they are now hiring for ethnic language skills instead of nursing skills and things are going downhill. Â Its the luck of the draw. Â The noise level at all times of day and night is huge - overwhelming. Â Visitors are allowed to stay all night (more than one in a room) even when the room is shared with another patient. Â I felt like a zoo inmate as this man kept walking by me and staring at me (I ain't no man). Â My frustration level with the sleep deprivation is so great that I will not go back there. Â Do not expect the telemetry unit to have any "quiet time" except maybe between 1:30 a.m. and 5:00 a.m.UPDATE - A FEW WEEKS LATER. Â 3/18/14Well, since I posted that review i have been incarcerated in the telemetry unit two more times and there has been considerable improvement. Â The halls are quiet most of the night AND day. Â Excess visitors seem to have disappeared. Â Sleeping at night has become a possible thing to do. Â So I have upped my judgement to three stars instead of two. Â I have no doubt I will be back in the telemetry unit again and have the opportunity to see how well the new deal holds up.
One of my doctors is based out of this hospital and i need to come quite often. its a very convenient hospital to navigate. One of my favorite things is the complementary VALET service.
Had a friend go to ER for asthma attack. Doctors were rapid to respond and relieved anxiety and restored normal breathing. Thanks OC Memorial! I Geller

I applied for a job here back in Sept. I called back in early Nov to follow up on my application. I got a call back from a recruiter wanting me to come over for an interview. It was scheduled the weds the week before Thanksgiving. I called back the week after Thanksgiving to follow up on my interview. I called HR, a lady who rudely told me to call the recruiter. I called the recruiter and he told me to call HR. I was being tossed around like a hacky sack. Before this happened, I left numerous voicemails to both the HR & the recruiter. No callbacks. They only one that helped me was the receptionist. Very nice lady. I called back this morning and was told to call back at 3pm. So when I call, the rude lady in HR tells me that the job I applied for has been given to someone else "more qualified". Ok I get that. Why did I not get a call back of them telling me that in the first place. According to career-advice on monster.com, "As for a company that never follows up with you after an interview-- even to say "no thank you"-- that could be a sign that something is wrong with the company. Smart employers know that treating candidates as well as customers is the right way to do business." Yes, I believe something IS wrong with THIS company. Very unprofessional of them. They only professional employee is the receptionist.

What an amazing ER staff!! We took my mom here for treatment and everyone with which we interacted was lovely. Kind, courteous, helpful... I can't say enough about what a wonderful experience we had, especially given the very stressful situation. I would recommend this ER to anyone who doesn't want to be treated like a number!

The Emergency Room here should get an award for the RUDEST nurses. It's pretty rare that the doctor is nicer than the nurse, but our emergency room nurse THERESA, had the attitude of an eleven year old - rolling her eyes, sighing, making snotty remarks - I couldn't help but wonder why she picked that profession, and even worse why someone would hire her to take care of people.The Doctor on the other hand was amazing - accomodating and patient.

The staff here were the nicest, most helpful people I could have possibly Â hoped for!I gave birth to my little girl here and after speaking to other moms who gave birth at Hoag, I will only go to Orange Coast! Even though Hoag has the great private rooms with the ocean view (which the patients never get to see), I would happily give that up for good service.The nurses and doctors were so attentive. Even when I called a nurse to help me learn how to burp my baby at 3am, the nurse on duty was an absolute doll! The lactation nurse offered me her cell phone number and instructed me to call her even though she would be on vacation. It's not just the nurses and staff in recovery, either. I had amazing people attending to me in Labor & Delivery. The anesthesiologist had a great (if you like dry humor, which I do) bedside manor. My hubby brought in donuts to thank everyone but it really was not enough for all that they did for us.
Elite 2021

The Orange Coast Memorial Patient Care Pavilion (18111 Brookhurst Street Fountain Valley, CA 92708) is an extension of the Orange Coast Memorial hospital.I spent some time as a visitor in the ER, Intensive Care Unit, and Surgical Care sections. I was impressed with the services and quality at this hospital. Â It's clean, nice A/C engineering, rooms are not cramp (particularly single bed room), the TV has more channels and Â different features, public wi-fi, the equipments are more current, and I bet the food tastes better than at other hospitals. Â The service is great and each time you get discharge from one section of the hospital, you get a survey in the mail. Â Overall, I was really happy with the staffs and my stay here.

I've been lucky enough to have never been in a hospital or need surgery. Until now....Apparently I'm a good patient who recovers quickly and a wimp who can't handle pain all at the same time. I'm a complex girl.When somone gives you a clicker that pumps morphine into your IV, use it....don't try to be a hero.So my three day stay at Orange Coast Memorial was a big success and I'm really glad it's over and I'm all better. Â It's a small facility in comparison to other hospitals. Â The well manicured grounds, and hospital rooms with sliding glass doors and balconies give it the feel of a hotel more than a hospital.The OR room was cold and sterile as it should be. One of the last things I remember was hearing someone drop something and say "oh-oh" but I was knocked out too quickly to panic about it. Â As far as I can tell, I don't have any instruments floating around inside me so I guess I'm good.The nurses and staff that took care of me were great. Very attentive and came immediately when I called. A special shout out to the night shift nurses who helped me get out of bed to pee, they saw a whole lot of Monica P. You are brave souls indeed.The respiratory therapist guy who visited my room daily was a riot and kept making me laugh while I had that vapor filed mask on. Then he left his card in case I needed to contact him with questions "of a respiratory nature". Â Not sure what he meant by that, but no one else left me their business card. I can't review the hospital food, I was on a liquid diet. I heard their cafeteria was pretty good though. Â Minus one star for the poor design on their televisions. Â A tiny TV hooked to a swinging arm that I could never get near my bed and only got three channels....good thing I had a lot of morphine.

I strongly advice not giving birth here. My son was born premature. I went to the hospital, and only a nurse examined me. I was 9 mm dilated until the doctor discovered my son was breach. I had to listen to the doctor yell at the nurse in the hallway for her mistake. A doctor should have examined me sooner than when I was almost ready to deliver! After this incident I was wheeled into a surgical room and told I was going to have Â C-section. I wanted to be knocked out during this procedure. The medical staff guilt tripped me into the upideral. I was uneasy about this, and told them. When the obgyns cut into me I felt everything. It was the worst pain ever! Then after they pulled my baby out, I was gassed and thought I was dying. It was the most horrifyingly experience ever! Afterward the staff was very accommodating and nice. The hospital took wonderful care of my baby. He required two weeks in the ICU. This the two stars. But the staff should have respected my choice of not wanting to be awake during this procedure.

This is truly the worst hospital for child birth. Â I thought this might be better than the others in the area. Â  The nurse did me harm during exam with her big ring on her finger. Â They did not allow me to move around or even go to the bathroom. Â I can not have water but ice. Â They tight my belly down with machine all night had nurse by my bed to tell you lie down do not move. Â You tell them you do not want this and that they will be angry and said you should have got a dulla and had a birth plan. Â Their food tast terrible like from the can. Â This is truly hell on earth experience. Â I never experience anything like this mentally and physically. Â I should have report the nurse to the police right away.

Over the last 3 months I have visited this hospital 3 times. First time was when I delivered my daughter. Amazing experience, C-section went great and I was out in 3 days. Second time, 3 weeks after delivering my daughter I had a vaccine reaction and was admitted for 3 days. Third time, my daughter had gas pains and I thought she was dying (yea, I am a newbie). All three of my experiences, the care was consistently top notch! And coming from a nurse that says alot (and no, I do not work here) Nurses and doctors there were very attentive and support staff (dietary, CNA's, ect) were equally as caring. Thank you and hopefully I wont be back too soon!

About a year ago, I was required to stay 2 nights to recover from my surgery. I was expecting to find myself with a roomie when I woke up from my surgery but I was pleasantly surprised to see that I was alone and absolutely relieved that I can bitch and moan to my heart's desire. I am absolutely cranky and totally a bitch when I am in pain. The nurses were attentive and very kind. Whenever my morphine drip could not provide me with instant relief, at the press of a button, a nurse comes in and soothes my pain with other methods of pain management. The bed was uncomfortable but I wasn't expecting much from a hospital bed. I was in pain, I'm guessing even if the bed was plush and absolutely comfortable on normal occasions, I would have still not liked it when I am in as much pain as I was.For the fact that they catered to my whim and patiently handled me when I am cranky and about to throw up and still smiled at me at the end of the day, I give this fine establishment a 5 star.

This is based on my experience going to the ER a day ago. I went in with abdominal pain wasn't sure if it was gastritis or my gallbladder since I already had a preliminary diagnosis from an urgent care doctor I saw earlier but I couldn't take the pain so I decided to go in. I thought the wait was going to be extreme like it was at Kaiser I waited over 6 hours to be seen and all they did was do bloodwork, an ultrasound and give me a diet to follow plus adviced Zantac OTC and later received a $1,200 bill. Here I waited about 2 hours or less. Everyone from the admitting desk to the nurse and doctors were nothing but exceptional!! From the first nurse that helped me to a room and was concerned that I was in pain so she did what she had to do to get me my pain meds to the 3 different doctors I got to meet during the shift changes which by the way they didnt give up on finding out what was wrong with me they ran every test they had to. The the surgeon and anesthesiologist I got the pleasure to meet were great as well! Yes I ended up having surgery and I couldn't have asked for a better team to manage my care!

Try to come in ASAP. Â It looks as though the workers are in the back drink tea and eating crackers. Bring a book, down load games to your phone. Â Or bring a pillow cuz it's going to take awhile even if it empty.

So let me start off with saying hospitals scare the crap out of me. I came here recently when I had to take my boyfriend to the ER. Everyone was super friendly and making small jokes. It made it a lot easier to be there.My boyfriend ended up getting admitted but I couldn't go visit until after I got off work at around 10 pm. They still let me in and even though I got lost, they helped me find where I needed to be.

Best hospital I've seen in a long time. And I've been to a few. Most of them suck (you listening, Fountain Valley Regional? Cause I'm talking to you!) The staff here at OCMMC is amazing, always smiling, always helpful.. Â They really seem to like where they work: and happy employees=better patient care! If I ever have to go back to a hospital for any reason, I'm coming here. And, when I have to wait longer than anticipated for my scheduled procedure, the doctors come out and explain why. And the reason is legit, because they were called into an emergency. No, I don't like to be kept waiting. But I like knowing that if I'M the one with an emergency, they'll treat me right away. That's what GREAT doctors/hospitals do.
Elite 2021

I went for a breast examination this morning and was greeted by friendly receptionists. I was taken in timely and was all prepped and ready by the very nice technician at about 8:15. She came in and told me the doctor was running late, I understood, it happens. Turns out, he ended up being :35 minutes late. He came in and spent no more than :2 minutes with me and did not even apologize for his tardiness. He seemed like he could care less. I do not recommend Dr. Richard Reitherman if caring and punctual are traits you seek in a doctor.

This is a review of the Maternity and Childbirth Center of Orange Coast Memorial. My wife and I had our beautiful baby boy delivered here, by cesarean section on 12/2/16 and our delivery doctor/OB was Kevin Khai Tieu. Â Everyone at the hospital, from the security staff at the doors of the maternity center, Nurse Assistants, RNs, pediatricians, and doctors, provided us with an absolutely wonderful experience. Â Everyone was extremely helpful and informative from start to finish. Â Our pregnancy and delivery was uncomplicated and the staff was great at making us first-time-parents feel comfortable. Â I appreciated the care and friendliness the staff showed for all of the guests we had; we had perhaps 16 or so family members that visited, with many staying in the room with us at various hours. Â We were especially touched by the care we received by the weekend RN, Katie. Â She was absolutely lovely and very quickly, I felt she was part of our family. Â When we have our next baby, we will choose Orange Coast Memorial again and we both really hope Katie can be our RN again.

My sister is delivering here .. already having a bad experience with her nurse unbelievably rude seriously . Ginger is her name I believe didn't even let me walk in when she started yelling at me and talking to other nurses to please help her explain to me .. like if I was stupid ... I'm Mexican not ignorant nor stupid .. racist much .. horrible !!!!!!!

I go here for lab work only. Â I've been very impressed with the lab. Â It's never too busy and I get in and out quickly. Everyone I have worked with at the lab is personable and has made the experience pleasant. Â I have been going frequently, so I'm really getting a good feel of the business.The lab is on the second floor across from the cafeteria. Â The hospital has free valet, but if I go close to 4pm, I don't need to use.

I'm writing this review from a visitor stand point I have never been admitted here. My grandmother recently fractured some bones in her back and was taken here. She is having a couple other complications with her health and has been here for over a week now. I've gone to visit her 3 times, on one of the occasions it must have been around 7 pm and when I got there I asked the nurse how she was doing and the response was "she's is stable.. but I actually just got here so maybe you should call back in the morning" okay.... I call the next day the nurse answers and tells me they will call me back,never did. Now today I called her room a couple times with no answer so I call the nurses desk and they said she just got back from surgery. WHAT, why is there such a lack of communication !? I've asked multiple times to be called if anything had changed with her health and I had to call them several times just to get the news..and now before I wrote this review I got told to call back in 20 minutes once her nurse logs onto her phone. It really is just troubling I shouldn't have to hunt people down to get a straight answer ! ... clean hospital though.

I got billed over 5,000 for a MRI. Now I'm responsible for almost 1,000. Orange Coast Memorial charges a ridiculous amount.....I tell everyone not to come here for any services. They bill 3 times more compares to St, Joseph.
Elite 2021

I delivered my first baby at this hospital.I cant complain about the staff or how everything medically went.However, billing Â side SUCKS. STAY AWAY!!!!I was wrongly billing for 2 stress tests and they failed to correct it even though my insurance and my OB office has provided them with all the necessary information.Yet, they decided to send me to a collection agency in less than the legal time to collect.On top, they created another issue regarding a breast pump, which I did not authorized.All the information it needs was provided to them and yet no response.I am not the type to waste my time on bad reviews but for this I have formally complained because they have incompetent billing staff and they wasted sooooo much of my time to fix this.Again, STAY AWAY from this hospital!!!

Was given a referral to see orthopedic surgeon . Dr. Trong look at my x-rays & said I needed surgery. I asked for cortisone shots, he gave me the worst injections ever if you don't want surgery stay away he just wants to cut. It's just about the money $200 for Cort or $30,000 for an operation . Don't kid yourself Â he is not interested in your needs. Stay away from this guy. I'm sure there are better ortho dr. In there network

I just got discharged today. I delivered baby number 3 here this week. To be honest, I was a little hesitant to deliver here because I, along with my two sons, were born in FVRH. However I decided to give OCM a try, and I'm glad I did! Patient care here is excellent, all the nurses in L&D as well as the Postpartum nurses were full of information. My last two days here nurse Mirette took care of me. She went above and beyond helping me out, and was full of knowledge. I'm really glad this hospital is local in FV, we need more great places like this!

i would not recommend this hospital.i was there on 10/20/12 for ER visit. its now 03/01/13. Â 6 month later, I am still dealing with the mistake they've made. Â they billed the wrong insurance company, after many phone calls and still had not fixed it. Â what a mess.

Thank God for this Hospital because my husband and I just drove from Long Beach Community Hospital to Long Beach Memorial Medical Hospital ER's to here. This ER was empty,clean, the help was great, and they took me in to see a doctor within 5 min after filling out this little form. I saw Melissa who was a very nice doctor who spoke to me very kindly and very informative of the procedure she was going to do. It was easier than I imagined the procedure was going to be like and she was done within 5 or so min of starting :-)Thank you Melissa for helping me out and being so nice The only bummer part was when I was waiting for my Discharge papers, it took me an hour to get out of the room and that was because one of the lady's forgot to tell me after giving me some paperwork I had to sign off for that it was the discharge paperwork I was waiting for and that I could not leave because she told me to wait there til I had goten my discharge papers. I was just happy to have been taken care of and everyone of the staff there were very nice.i recommend this ER

If you don't have any other choice, otherwise do your research and find a more competent group of health care professionals.My mother-in-law had her gallbladder removed based on the fact that he said she had multiple stones in her gallbladder. Â Dissection of her gallbladder afterwards found no gallstones. This surgeon had provided us with misinformation in order to fulfill his contractual duties. We called the hospital to complain. They said to speak with the surgeon himself because he is not their doctor, he is just contracted to use their facility.Perhaps the hospital should be more selective in signing out their contracts to safeguard against issues with the Department of Public Health and the Medical Board.We confronted the surgeon and asked him some very candid question but he could not provide any straight forward answers. Â Apparently the referring MD and the surgeon failed to review the final test result the night before the surgery which indicated that the absence of stones. Whether it was their failure or intention, it just shows how you cannot trust those MDs there.

Terrible parking. Â  Highly recommended to use the Valet service! Â  The cafeteria food was surprisingly great. Â  Â  The service and staff were very good. Â  Â The initial registration and wait time sucked like nearly all doctor offices.

I gave this one star as wouldn't let me rate 0. Â Actually give it a -10. Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  First of all I want to say I would die before I went back to this hospital. Â Went to er with stomach and chest pains. Â While in er for 10 hrs was treated ok. Â Then finally transferred to a shared room. Took all kinds of tests thinking it was my heart. Â Went for a stress tract and the cardiologist took one look and said she can't do this. Back upstairs to room. Â Was to late to take scope test to check my esophagus so set up FO the next morning. Â Tests done, some guy that worked handed me a pic showing I had esophagitis, inflamed esophagus and ulcers. Â Took the dr. 8 hrs to come to my room. The when doctor did come said I told you during the procedure, I was totaling under how could I remember. Asked when I could go home he said any time. Â Mind you I couldn't eat or drink anything without pain. So I said, what home to die as I was surviving off IV. Â The whole time I was there could never find a nurse. Â After mutable times telling everyone it huts to eat or drink they kept bringing me food. Â My dad finally had to call hospital admin and whomever else to get any Attention. Â  Then dr came in, to check after couple days coughing and sneezing without mask. Â I guess they needed the bed so was gonna send me to nursing home, no way. Â Funny all of a sudden my throat said try again and I got a whole bowl of soup down. Â I said I'm out, felt abused. Â Don't know if they are understaffed or what but service is HORRIBLE. Incompetence in this hospital is all they have going for them. Â Never nerve go here unless you are ready to die.

This place is completely a shame.My son cut his thumb so we took him here to get some stitches.Guess how much 3 stitches that were put on in the hallway Cost?...$1,647....are you kidding me????My insurance actually paid $1,247 and now they are trying to bill me for the remaining $400...REALLY, for 3 stitches that were placed in an unsterile area (the hallway).This place will completely take advantage of you...DON'T GO HERE unless you want to be ripped off.This place doesn't even deserve 1 Star.I am going to file a claim with the State Insurance Commissioner and District Attorney for unethical billing practices.If you have had the same experience as me, I encourage you to do the same thing.God help you, what it will cost you if you need more than 3 stitches.

I was a patient at Long Beach Memorial for lung surgery and Â was surprised at how wonderful all the staff were. I can see why they are a magnet hospital. The R.N.'s there are top notch. Then I came home and ended up with air trapped in my lung and ended up in E.R. At Orange Coast Memorial. Though their E.R. Was so busy they got me to radiology in record time for them to put in a chest tube. The radiology dept. was fabulos and within a half hour my tube was in. Then I had to spend the night and I was amazed at how nice and knowledgeable the nurses were. They too should be a magnet hospital. I was very impressed!
Took my daughter to the ER and the entire staff was fantastic. Very professional and caring.

This hospital is the absolute worst. My wife had to have surgery here. When we got there, they wanted cash to pay the anesthesiologist. No one bothered to tell us about his in advance. The amount of money they asked for was more than I had on me and more than the daily limit that my bank allowed for ATMs.I had to call the bank and request an increase in my daily limit while time ticked away. Then I went back to the hospital's generic cash machine,which still wouldn't give me what I needed. So I had to get in the car and try to find the nearest Wells Fargo branch that had a cash machine. It was early and the bank was closed.I got the money, drove back to the hospital, and paid them. This might be a good point to mention that the only place to park the car was a lot that was about two blocks from the hospital. There's one closer, but it's always full.After the surgery, my wife was still about 3/4 under the anesthetic, but they put her in a wheelchair and released her. She told them that she felt nauseous and asked to stay longer, but they said they couldn't let her stay because she needed the room.Next, I had to drive home to Irvine at about 30 miles an hour because any faster and my wife was going to throw up in the car. I practically had to carry her up the stairs to our house because she was still under the influence of anesthesia and was barely conscious.There's more that I can't go into, but if your doctor says you need a procedure at this hospital, DON'T DO IT!!!! Go anywhere but Orange Coast Memorial Medical Center.
It was a bad experience. The cost was a rip-off. Long waiting time for the procedure. Dishonest and unhappy staff

Let me start by saying WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! we had our second child here and let me just Â say the doctors and Nurses were AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! ALL OF THEM. I didnt have one complaint from anybody. Everyone is super helpful Â and very nice. It felt like I was staying in a 5 Star Hotel........NO REALLY.....5 STAR........and this is the husband talking........lol...........If your lucky you can stay in the other bed that is in the Hospital room and you get the same Â AWESOME treatment.........(YESSSSSSSSSS)...........AGAIN GREAT JOB!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! cant wait till I have my third baby Â .............
Over priced hospital!! I went to 2different office to get ultrasound and one office charged me about$900. And memorial office charged me $2500! Never going here again.

Great service! I took my mom into the emergency and everyone was very considerate, explained everything to us. She was admitted to the hospital and they were very detail oriented asking all the right questions. They even have Sunday service for my mom and when I look lost one of the nurse notice and ask me if I needed direction before I had the chance to ask, I found my way thanks to her. Overall this hospital is way better than the other ones around here. Thank you for your existence!
Clean, takes long at times but good service when you finally do see a dr.
April 1st was the day my son was born here at OCM. I'm thankful for the doctors and nurses that helped me birth my son to this new world. I will never forget this place, thank you guys

My mother had surgery last week and our first contact was with woman at table that takes your insurance card. She was not polite at all. Coming in for surgery, a person is already feeling nervous, I feel that there needs to be a more welcoming person to ease these feelings at first point of contact. It may be a bad day for her, so I will give her the benefit of the doubt. My moms day nurses; Helene, Taylor and Amelia were so great and made my mom feel so comfortable. We need more staff like this working in our hospitals. It makes a huge difference in Customer service and the way a person is made to feel during difficult times. I am only giving 3 stars, because I am here again for my husband's surgery and the same woman that we first saw when walking in that took the insurance card and identification is here again with the same bad attitude so early in the morning. I hope this is something that will be improved.

A trip to the ER is never planned...and I am very appreciative of the attention and care received at Orange Coast Memorial. Â In a busy setting, the doctor and nurse team were on top of my care and did not leave me wondering if I was forgotten. Â They were very professional and efficient at all stages. Â Madeleine, my nurse, gave me clear, concise follow-up directions....made me promise....then smiled and said 'I care about you and my patients'. Â I never doubted it.
I wont come back to this hospital again. I have been sitting in the ER waiting room for almost 5 hours now with my wife and 4 month old daughter. The complete lack of urgency here is disgusting!

I'm not sure about nurse Kelly in emergency room. He was rushing to send us home and pushed the wheelchair fast. Another nurse ran after him to hand him medication he forgot to give in the emergency room. Â He even argued with the other nurse that he had not forgotten anything. He gave the medication without checking the order.

I'd give zero stars if I could. My husband went to the ER there due to horrific pain on the right side of his face..He had not been sleeping, he was in agony...went to ER because he could not wait to go to the doctor. We have a $50 co-pay with BCBC for an ER visit. He paid his $50 at Â the time of his visit and we got a bill for $236.70 because the incompetent doctor, Robert Realmuto, said it was not an emergency. We have spoken to them on many occasions and they refuse to have it corrected. My husband ended up having surgery to remove one of the main salivary glands at UC Irvine by an ENT surgeon because he had 2 very large stones in it that was causing all of this pain...Dr. Realmuto did not see this and diagnosed him with a headache. I have explained this to many people who I spoke with and they said they would call Â me back but they haven't EVER called me back. They refuse to own up to their mistake. Stay away from this mess. You will get HORRIBLE treatment from terrible ER doctors and you will be screwed when it comes to billing.

Sitting here and waiting for Dr. Fletcher to come in and sign a release form so my mom can go home, but it has been more than 6 hours and nothing is happening yet... So it makes me wondering are doctors nowadays care more about how many patients they can see, how much they need to make, or is it the hospital managements problems that they have really broken policies toward all their contract doctors...? Â Do they really put their patients first or $$$? I hope this comment will get to them, either the managements or all doctors, that soon will make them think again about their work ethics... I guess that day will come when they are in a patient bed themselves... Until then, i wish them well, so what I have been commenting and thinking about them will be proven wrong.

I was at Orange Coast Memorial hospital between 1/13-1/15. The facilities were very clean (pre op, post op) and everyone I came across with at admissions, pre and post op were very friendly and helpful. Special thanks to the RNs Diane, Ken, Kathy and Hazel and their assistants Joselito, Â LaKiesha and Robert for taking very good care of me. My surgeon, Dr. Russo and all his office staff were amazing as well. Dr. Russo is very professional, knowledgeable and has good bed side manner. The surgery went great and I didn't have any complications. If I could go through the process again, I wouldn't change anything.
Just had a procedure at the surgical center. Really great staff - it was easier and less stressful than having my teeth cleaned. If I ever have another procedure, I hope I can come here.

I usually love this hospital, but what I witnessed today made me disgusted. An elderly woman came in convinced she was having a stroke. They asked her for a urine sample and her husband panicked when it was fire engine red. He took his concerns to the LAZY heavy set blonde at the counter, she dismissed him and said go by the door someone will be with you. As his wife got worse he then again proceeded to explain to the lady at the counter his elderly wife was getting worse. She makes a face and walks back to get him a bucket for his wife...who had no complaints of vomit or nausea. point blank, the front counter service was HORRIBLE and had no consideration for these two elderly patients. She told them 40 minutes ago they would be called in and to wait by the door...there are still waiting while she is on the phone laughing and giggling..while the man is trying to comfort and calm his wife.

this review is for the emergency room. The nurses here are completely UNPROFESSIONAL.
