for my 400th review ill share a story....so last year i found a ovarian cyst that was mighty small at first (around 3-4cm). the first "doctor obgyn" i went to in upland looked over mee & my cyst for a good 9 months or so and she let it grow and grow with constant ultrasounds and nothing elsethen i decided to get my 2nd opinion w. Dr.Moore (her office is located @ the OrangeCoast Memorial Medical Center....the building in front of the hospital) Â i started going to her and she was not happy with my cyst although i was TOLD previously...that it could shrink... it was growing disturbingly large and making me ache like none othershe sent me to get 3d ultrasounds, had me get ca-125 tested for ovarian cancer and worked quickly to get me back to "normal"eventually BECAUSE the previous idiot took so long to take any action(it became 16cm) i had to forego laparoscopy (using small incisions and cameras) and had to go for the full on surgery ( think caesarian) i was scared SHITLESS i mean seriously i sleep like a baby every nite and have the thickest hair but once i knew i was heading towards surgery i stayed up for days and my hair was falling out in clumps...i was terrifiedday of surgery i walked right into the waiting room of the hospital. Â (the previous day i did all my presurgery junk & a bloodtest so i could just walk-in the day of)i got changed and i was told to lay on the bed with heat pads all around me to keep me warm while i answered a series of very annoying repetitive questions.... i was SERIOUSLY scared of the IV but the doctor who inserted it did it perfectly and i felt no discomfort...soon after that i got to say byebye to the parents and off i was pushed into the operating room which i dont even KNOW because i blissfully knocked out before theni then awoke SCREAMING PROFANITIES at the top of my lungs i swear i was in some severe pain thats when the nurse next to me instructed i" push push push the morphine" and soon i was highhh like a kitesoon after i was rolled into my room and from then on the nurses did the best to take care of me...nights were HORRIBLE because i could hear heartmonitors and people screaming in pain but the nurses were there to keep me okay. Dr Moore also visited me daily to see how i was doingthe nurses helped me start walking again despite my insane pain....fetched me my medication.....redid my IV.....chatted with me to make me feel normal again....removing the urinary catheter was SERIOUSLY the only part when i wanted to kill a nurse even tho 2 of them had me down and my mom was holding my hand...that was seriously horrid....but we all know that was a blessing hahahahaat the end i cant say i ENJOYED my stay cuz REALLY 2nights 3days in a hospital is not fun at all...  my back was acheing from that dang bed (it wasnt uncomfortable but u try laying for 3days straight) but they did everything to try to make me comfortable... they constantly adjusted it for me and kept massaging my feet to keep from clotting and getting bloated & the nurses even brought me a breathing tool to keep myself away from pneumonia...but i still am super grateful for the care and service i received @ orange coast memorial...the RNS, the CNAs, the volunteers were all amazing despite the evil acheing Â beeyotch i was beingid recommend this hospital to ANYONE (yea yea parkings a beeyotch but keep circling or park across the street or the structure a lil walking wont kill ya PLUS if ur coming for surgery like me in the mornings there was PLENTY of parking only time its really difficult is for regular dr visits) PLUS they are making it all nice and pretty with their new construction so i bet it'll be better then it is nowbtw food i was given was NASTY but um i dont think nething would have tasted good @ that momentHOWEVER the parents had really yum breakfasts in the cafeteria im grateful for that
Have been going to this medical center for many years, they have very good customer service and my children's pediatrician is very patient and nice.

Im writing this under my boyfriends account the experience we both had here at this hospital. First off I would like to say the hospital is amazing but the anesthesiologist dr truong who gave me two epidural had a very bad attitude towards me and I was in so much pain I still was thankful and calm towards her. The first epidural hit only for two hours and wore off and even though I clicked the button for more MEDS and it did not work and gave me bad contractions. I kept advising her it didn't work anymore and while she was doing the epidural she would make comments that I was a little big and short and it was hard for her to work with me. Honestly I was in soo much pain I just wanted the pain to go away. The second time she removed the epidural and did it over. Once she stuck the needle again in and Out trying to find the right spot she would make sounds like she was frustrated. And STILL REMIND YOU I WAS CALM AND THANKFUL TO HER. But this time when she shot the meds in my back it hit my neck and the upper part of my back like a sore feeling that make me say ouch and she responded everything I do to you, you complain that's why I'm scared to work with you. Can anyone tell me who the hell says that to someone like your the fucking professional and your telling me I complain well hello im in pain and again let me tell you epidural only hit for two hours again and I felt all my contractions after that. I begged my dr to help and my boyfriend was worried he saw that I was not okay the anesthesiologist had to put me to sleep. This is the first birth I gave and I can say I am traumatized. Â  Â  ----------------Why im giving this a four star because the nurses on the recovery side was the sweetest to me. Everyone heard how bad my labor was and they were so helpful to me especially Merritt, Karen, and Lisa they are the best nurses ever they made me enjoy my stay and took soo good care of me I cannot thank them enough for all there tlc they showed me. They honestly need an award or a raise because my boyfriend and I truly are thankful for them they even made my nightmare labor turn into just a relaxing break that I needed. And also NICU Mrs. Joyce and Donna took really good care of my daughter while she was in there and giving us tips on parenting and im so happy with them. I can say if I ever now decide to have another baby and giving birth I would just make sure I have a professional anesthesiologist work with me who is caring and loving not a rude unhappy basically looks like she did not like her job type of female. Other than that I really like the food here and it is a really nice hospital. Hope I didn't scare people as much because I am traumatized but then I look at my daughter and I can't be more happier than ever to have her healthy and beautiful

This hospital is awful. I had heard many people say this before, but until I had to go there I didn't really get it!!!The emergency waiting room was full and people waited for hours. This afternoon an ambulance took my 90 year old mother to the ER at Orange Coast Memorial Hospital and I arrived about 15 minutes behind her. Â I went to the ER and asked about her and was told to wait a few minutes. Â Half an hour later I went back to the desk and told them I wanted to see my mother. Â She has dementia, is easily confused, gets paranoid and worried, and I knew she wanted me to be there with her. Â Also, I was unclear as to what was wrong with her and, if it was serious, I didn't want her to be alone if she was dying. Â They gave me no information on her condition and told me I had to continue waiting. Â Then they informed me that she hadn't even been taken to a bed and was still on a gurney in the hallway. Â For some reason they seemed to think it was unreasonable to have me wait with her. Â They got mad at me when I asked if they were refusing to allow me to see her. Â It got very frustrating because they wouldn't take me to her but they kept saying they weren't refusing to let me see her. Â I said I would call the police if necessary and that is when they decided to call security on me. Â Then they informed me that she was in "ultrasound" and that there are no visitors allowed there anyway. Â I am pretty sure she wasn't in ultrasound. Â I left before security came because I knew it would just be some guy with an authority complex who was going to tell me to sit down and shut up. Â After he returned home from work, my husband went over to the hospital to find out what was going on with my mother. Â He said she was upset, confused, worried, and paranoid and everything one would expect from a woman who was left along without her family. Â My husband had to insist that staff help her to the bathroom as she wanted to pee. Â The staff told him originally that she could just pee in her adult underwear. Â He found this undignified and insisted that they help him to the bathroom. Â I am surprised they didn't call security on him. Â I don't know what level of care this hospital thinks it is providing but the front office staff in the ER were rude, abrupt, and lacking in empathy. Â How much kinder and simpler it would have been if they had just let me go sit with her while she waited to see a doctor. Â I tried to get her out of there but her insurance plan won't approve another hospital. Â Now my goal is to make sure she never goes back there.

My mother is currently admitted due to cardiac issues. The admitting physician appears to have the core physical issues under control. However, my mother has issues with depression and anxiety, and she has been crying intermittently, because she is so weak, that she can barely rearrange herself in her bed. She needs a sitter to be with her continuously, and she needs her antidepressant medication, which apparently wasn't communicated to the ER physicians when she was brought to the hospital by EMT personnel. Last night, I watched my mother repeatedly in a spiral of crying, breathlessness, despair, while the nurse tells me that she cannot get a doctor to call back and prescribe an antidepressant -- and, that no sitter is available, because they don't have sufficient staff to cover patients other than those who are combative. So, I end up HIRING someone to sit with my mom, because like most people, I have to work in the daytime, and I cannot be sitting with mom 24/7. This is outrageous, in my opinion. Hospitals typically charge up to $5,000 per day or more for care, and I'm forced to shell out $25 per hour to hire a private caregiver to keep my mother reasonably comfortable. Moreover, the day before this occurred, a hospital nurse called me and asked me to bring one of my mother's prescriptions to the hospital because THE HOSPITAL DIDN'T HAVE THE MEDICATION IN ITS PHARMACY! I have a fair amount of recent experience as a hospital patient, in several different facilities. My care was magnitudes better than what I'm observing at Orange Coast Memorial. Maybe this is the status quo of medical care for the average person, and I was just more fortunate with the care that I received while hospitalized. The health care system is broken. And, it's not Obama's fault. The system is overwhelmed and understaffed, and there's no effective means of making a timely complaint, because the physicians are in control, and everyone else involved must simply wait on their authority and availability.
It taught me to know about a hospital before taking a loved one to. Thank goodness for Hoag Hospital. If you need a ER Hoag GO TO HOAG

The only reason I have created an account on Yelp is to hopefully keep others from the awful experiences I've recently had with the Orange Coast Memorial Center. I am currently 6 months pregnant and was experiencing heavy bleeding which to me warranted a trip to the ER. The people in the ER were helpful although there was not much they could do other than put me in a wheelchair and take me to Labor and Delivery. When we got to Labor and Delivery I was given a room and the most awful nurse I've ever had to deal with. I have no issues talking with someone with broken english as long as they are patient with me. This woman got irritated with me when I asked her to repeat what she was asking me. She was very forceful and actually cut me when trying to examine my cervix. I was unaware a nurse was even allowed to examine that far! I was in this hospital for 5 hours and did not see a doctor once. All I had was this awful and rough nurse. I'm not sure if it's just me but considering I'm 6 months pregnant I would imagine a doctor should take a look to ensure I am not going into premature labor. This is also the hospital where I am supposed to be giving birth! Will I have to deliver the baby myself? Or will a bimbo nurse be floating around to hurt my baby too?I was discharged and told to see me doctor 2 weeks from now. I left the hospital with a huge copay, no answers as to why I was bleeding, and cut private parts. Needless to say I will be calling human resources this week. So please, do yourself the favor and go somewhere that will actually have a doctor that will see you and nurses that will care for you.

I came to visit a dear friend. Â Everyone was courteous and kind. Â If I had questions, they were answered in a friendly, caring manner. Â Polite and genuine. Â I personally do not like hospitals - but if I had to be at one, I would consider this one. Â Hopefully this won't be the case...

Back in January 2011 I had some Gastrointestinal Surgery here and was admitted for two days to recover from the surgery. The surgery went perfect, no issues or problems. The stay at this hospital was probably better than most. I had a private room, this is what happens when you pay full 'Pop' for a medical procedure because you no longer have insurance. RN's were great and attentive, NA's the same, the Surgeon actually came by the next morning and visited, his PA's visited as well too! I had really no issue with the Staff, in general. The only three issues were: 1. Why do Hospitals find it necessary to start all their noisy work from 10:00 pm to 5:00 am right outside your room. Hospital - Patient Recovery - Quiet. Nope not here.2. The Bed sucked - Hard as granite.3. The Floor Supervising RN at the time of discharge spoke so little English that I had to keep asking her to repeat the instructions and I could not convince her that I already had all my medications that morning prior to her interviewing me for discharge. She made me take all the Medications again, which I just kept in my mouth and spit out after she left. I had to get my regular RN back to explain everything to me again. Oh and my RN told me that EVERYONE has problems with this Nurse...The Doctors, and all the Staff, no one can understand a word out of her mouth! But I only had to deal with her for two hours and then I was out of there!I guess if you have to stay in a Hospital, private ones are the best and paying full 'Pop' out of pocket for everything gets you the best care they can give.

Judging by the reviews, it seems the ER is competent at taking care of emergencies but in my experience, it's possible to wait many hours without a doctor giving any diagnosis while watching doctors, nurses and many staff standing around talking, sharing cell phone photos, discussing their hair/makeup and generally doing nothing. It's very frustrating when you are with an elderly person who needs to eat and is in a lot of discomfort. My mother was put in a bed in a hallway jammed next to countless people as they were wheeled out to surgery or to be admitted. We had a "drive by" doctor who would walk by us while yelling out jokes to my mother about her possible condition. After 4 hours, I finally got the doctor to talk to me and when he told me how he was going to treat her, I had to beg him to look at her hospital record to show him that his treatment was not possible. Â I am still disgusted with our experience and I am writing this to tell yelpers that if they can wait to see their personal doctor and avoid the ER, maybe it's best to do so.

I have been to this hospital 3 times. Each time I stayed overnight, with the last one having stayed 3 nights and days.I had surgery on my knees here. My surgeon chooses this place to perform the majority of his surgeries and he is an amazing doctor, I trust him completely.The staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. Any time I had pain, they took care of it as quickly as possible.The hospital is clean and hygienic.The food is often very delicious but can be dry or gross if you are stuck on a special diet. They try very hard to make it not the common hospital fare. The paramedics who brought me here the last time and my guest have both stated that the cafeteria food is amazing. I was not able to try it, since I was the patient all 3 times.They have t.v. with movies, computer games like solitaire, and about 20 channels to entertain yourself with.The beds are as comfortable as can be when you are stuck laying in them for extended periods of time.I highly recommend this hospital to anyone who wants quality care.

Took my Mom to emergency last night, EXCELLENT CARE! Â From RN Hope in emergency to Carmen on the 3rd floor after admission. Â Next day dealt with RN Carla, RN Katherine and Dr. Hannah. Â My parents refuse to go anywhere else. Â Always OC Memorial! Â Love them, they are angels.

This hospital is so amazing. Seriously. Every unit is awesome. I volunteered here when i was 16 since i want to be a nurse and get the feel of the hospital setting. Everytime a family member is sick they go to this hospital. I have never ever had a negative experience here and neither has anyone else i know. My friend was diagnosed with cancer due to a dr here finding lytic lesions in her femur. They saved her life. She is healthy and free of cancer, High Grade Fibroblastic Osteosarcoma thanks to this hospital. Thank god. I've been here a few times. Since i've been lucky enough to be healthy all my life. They are a model hospital. Thank you to all the OCM employees and all that you do, you guys are too dope.
This hospital is the best, doctor and nurse is care for the patient and super nice, friendly.

I had the most dangerous fish poisoning last week and my husband drove me to the emergency room of Orange Coast Memorial in FV... I was actually in a pretty bad shape; couldn't move or talk, severe cold sweats and almost losing consciousness. Â Two clerks at the front desk checked my blood pressure and said that I need to wait in line until somebody will call and take me inside the emergency department. Â My husband asked if doctor can see me because I was in a very bad condition. Â He was screaming for help, but it was completely useless. Â All I remembered that I couldn't even hold myself in a wheelchair that they gave me and was loosing consciousness periodically. Â These two clerks at the front desk didn't pay any attention, and only could say "You have to wait your turn"!?! To make long story short, I haven't died... In an hour, I felt that I am back to reality, thanks God, and we just left... without getting any help at all. Â All I can recommend to people who have real life threatening situation - CALL 911 and arrive to hospital in ambulance; it's the only chance to get some help right away. Otherwise, you can die in the emergency room without any help, can stop breathing, etc. Â I used to like this hospital, been there and had a lot of help from nurses and doctors before. Â But the situation with the emergency room where people sit and wait just freaked me and my husband out. Â We understood that you won't get any help unless you stop breathing. Very scary, isn't it??!!!

I can't say enough about how wonderful the physicians and staff were to our family when we were there for our grandson's birth. And it wasn't just us. Everyone being treated was received the same compassionate and thorough care that our daughter and grandson did.
My 93 year old grandmother was just treated here and released. She had emergency surgery and is doing fantastic. I am so thankful for the wonderful care she received. Thank you!!!

Very bad care and not a good doctor . Attendant did not respond well. I hated my visit here.
I really hate this place. No good care by doctors. Did not like their service at all
After you get past the fancy white spaceship interior, you realize the service is super overpriced. They charge way more than anyone else. I  hate having gone to this place.

So....where do I start?? I have been seeing Dr. Riley since I was 22, and I am now 42, so...20 years! I have gone from being straight out of college kid with my boyfriend, to getting pregnant, and having 4 kids with Dr. Riley. She is exactly the OB that I would want, if I were to think about what I would want in an OB: intelligent, funny, no-nonsense, and a quick thinker. Â With my first baby, I experienced a scare while pregnant on a road trip with my husband. We were in Colorado, and at the time, the pain I was experiencing made me think I was having a miscarriage. Having never been pregnant before, I was terrified. We went to the local ER, and got on the phone with Dr. Riley to figure out what to do. After careful questioning and talking to the ER Doctor, she determined that it was more than likely my appendix that was about to burst, and she asked the Dr. to take my appendix out. She told me it would be ok, and was calm, collected, and told me she would see me as soon as I returned. I had the surgery, it was indeed my appendix, they took it out, and my baby (4.5 months pregnant) was fine. She went on to deliver that baby (girl) and 3 others smoothly and without any issues. Each time, her humor and knowledge made me always feel like I was with a friend: someone I knew who cared about what was going on with me, and who know how to steer the crazy process of pregnancy. When it came down to my last baby, the 4th baby she delivered in 6 years, I told her I wanted no epidural, natural birth (which I hadn't had for the rest) and after a couple of hours of labor, I went with an epidural. Thing is, once the epidural kicked in, the baby was ready to show up 20 minutes later. Dr. Riley was called and she rushed to John Muir from her office to make it just in time to deliver. She laughed and encouraged me while I yelled obscenities, and I cried and was so grateful when I held our last baby girl. She has always been comforting, kind and wonderful. MaryJean, who has been with her forever, is equally as kind and efficient. I would never consider going to anyone else for this most intimate and magical experience. I look forward to seeing her every year for my checkups, and I can't recommend her highly enough. Seriously. Love.
Skip this OBGYN. Â Do yourself a huge favor. Enough said here. The other negative reviews are right on the money. Â My rating is -1 star. ZERO.

Do not go to this doctor. You can't teach empathy and genuine caring. She has neither in my experience. I reluctantly shared a symptom I have, and she laughed/scoffed, saying she never heard of that. I was stunned speechless, embarrassed. A year later I explained I'm still having the symptom, she once again insisted she's never heard of anyone having it. (Instead of saying something like, "That must be difficult. I'm not familiar with that but let me research it.). Very dismissive. Turns out it's not an uncommon symptom, I learned after one google search. Who needs a female GYN who is dismissive of symptoms and makes you regret even asking. She doesn't remember key components of my case, today I told her gently how I feel like I'm a new patient every time in that respect. She responded defensively, saying she'd "had a very, very, VERY bad day and *I* need to remember I'm not the only patient she sees" (!). Made me so uncomfortable, I asked if my procedure should be rescheduled.

Worst Dr. I had ever met. I'll be short with my story. Worst OBGYN in the area. I only went to Dr. Riley one time and it was a Very unpleasant experience! Her office staff is unfriendly. The assistant is nice & friendly. First off, she needs to update her pictures, as she has young photos displayed & really is a much older woman! She is very cold and unfriendly and gives off a fake vibe. She is judgmental. When I asked if test results could be picked up/or mailed her answer was an automatic no. She has a big ego. Â Will Not Ever Return Here and you should consider other people too before ever going to her!

What a horrible experience. Im in the first trimester of my first pregnancy so things are scary and new to us. Everything was very planned and we started trying for baby on our honeymoon. Needless to say since it was planned I have been tracking my periods and ovulation religiously. Going into the appointment based on my last period and the date we believed we conceived (on the honeymoon), I thought I was 6 weeks and 3 days pregnant. First we covered some issues I had with my cervix pre pregnancy which was a diagnosis of cervical dysplasia that has since been treated by a naturopath and I no longer test positive before. She didnt believe that I had cervical dysplasia in the first place because she couldnt see it in her system. I told her everything was a blur when I did the tests and I was back and forth between county and planned parenthood so she may not be able to see the records. I have the paperwork at home showing the diagnosis but whatever if she doesnt believe me. After covering health history she told me she wanted to do an ultrasound. I never would have thought they would need to do an ultrasound so soon when I had zero complications and was only thought to be 6 weeks. I wasnt comfortable with it but my husband told me to trust the doctor. I asked if there was any risk factors and she said there was zero risk factors for ultrasounds. Im not sure if I believe this but I guess women do them all the time so I finally gave in. When I consented she condescendingly told me that she didnt have to do it if I didnt want too. At this point I just wanted the appointment over so I told her to go ahead. Once she did the trans vaginal ultrasound the first thing she noticed is the sac didnt appear to have anything inside it. She immediately points it out and says it looks like Im having a miscarriage or am going to have one soon. She tells me I can either wait for it to happen naturally, medically induce it or surgically remove it. My husband and I are both sitting there trying to hold it together and understand whats going on and she continued to go on forever about how to remove the sac. She mentions that she has had 3 miscarriages and she understands how I must be feeling. After all this she then tells me "or maybe your numbers are wrong and you are only 5 weeks pregnant". She then points out that the ultrasound machine says that Im 5 weeks pregnant. So which is it? Is the baby dead or am I 5 weeks? Why bring up miscarriage at all if the machine says Im 5 weeks? She then has the nerve to tell me that my due date would be 9-11 and thats not a very good birthday (as if anyone delivers on their due date but either way how tacky!). After this horrible experience we decided to not return and found another doctor. We ended up seeing the baby at our next ultrasound!

Can I just say how happy I am that my sister referred me to Dr Riley's office? Dr Riley and the nurse or assistant that helped me are genuinely kind and friendly and make you feel at ease without really trying. You are not just another number at this office and you really get the sense that they care. I am surprised at some of the reviews I've seen here...my experience was nowhere near what the negative reviews mentioned. As someone who is particularly sensitive about poor customer service and rudeness, I experienced nothing but attentiveness and caring. Thank you Dr Riley to you and your staff!

This has been such a frustrating experience I want to rip my hair out.I got a recommendation to go here since my last Gyno retired, and my prescription for my birth control was running out. I just needed a refill. Her schedule is booked, and I had to schedule two months out. Long story short, I missed my first appointment. The appointment is two months out. Not ONCE did they call and tell me that they still needed a referral for my appointment by my physician. I don't know this, is this known knowledge? Two months to by, and I get there, I'm missing an important lab for my class, and they tell me after I sat doing paperwork for ten minutes they can't see me. They need a referral. ARE YOU SERIOUS. I am missing class for this. You couldn't have told me in these TWO MONTHS PRIOR??? I rescheduled. I am almost out of my prescription at this point I am desperate. Two months out, in APRIL. They call me today "you need to reschedule." No! Jeez man! I'll go to another doctor that has better communication.

I am so surprised by the negative reviews. I have had such a great experience here from the entire staff. Front desk is fast and friendly, nurses are all very sweet and knowledgeable and Dr. Riley is awesome. I am due soon and feel 100% taken care of.

I've been with Dr. Riley and her team for over a year and the birth of my first child. I was referred to her after a horrible experience with another OB/GYN. I don't know where to start but I've had the worst experience with Dr. Riley. I've only had two appointments with her and both times were terrible. Very unhappy with multiple experiences with Dr. Riley and her staff. Â She was recommend to me, because i'm new to the area and found out I was pregnant. I had emergency surgery at John Muir by Dr. Riley. I had never met her before or heard of her. After surgery, I never spoke to her but briefly for about 30 seconds. The first thing, was my pain control post surgery. Right out of surgery, she ordered me to have oral narcotics. I cried and told the nurse I could not take them, but "that's what the doctor ordered". So naturally, I threw them up. So in top of being in excruciating pain, I was forced to throw up pills before she'd give me any dilaudid. Ridiculous and horrible. But I would say the absolute most unbelievable and unprofessional thing was when I went in for a follow up a few months later, Dr. Riley accused me of insurance fraud upon my first meeting with her. You see, I did not have insurance at the time of the surgery. But apparently John Muir had an old (really old) policy in its records for some reason. So basically she was outraged that she did surgery on me when I was uninsured, she flat out accused me of lying and telling the hospital I had insurance when I did no such thing, the intake records easily prove it. I was too busy dying in the absolute worse pain of my life and internally bleeding to commit fraud, I did not have that much focus to go out of my way to trick you Dr Riley, so sorry.I could not believe it. I have never had such an unprofessional doctor in my life. She continued to accuse me of lying and going on about how upset she was that she was bothered in the middle of the night to do surgery on an uninsured patient. Like wow lady. Just wow. To say those things to a patient is just, insane. So yeah, I would recommend skipping this woman if you're looking for a gyno. She also has no idea how to treat endometriosis and will only want to put you on Lupron, which thank God she was horrible to me because it made me find an endo specialist in Los Gatos that knows how to treat my condition and treat patients. So it worked out in the end. I do thank her for doing the surgery and not removing my ovaries, and would have gladly set up a payment plan with her since her bill wasn't outrageous in comparison to the rest, but now she can get in line with the rest and wait for my medical bankruptcy. She can keep her yuppie BS.

Ok, this place is averaging out three stars only because NP Amy gets a solid 5 stars. She is spot on with her customer service, very empathetic, just a lovely person. I know that sounds like such a small thing, but I know they offer this service and basically rely on it to get my appointment time right. When I got there they confirmed my phone # with me - I changed my number with them 4 years ago and for some reason they had reverted back to the old one. Next was that my appointment was running late; I understand sometimes people run late, so after waiting 30 mins beyond my appointment time I shared with them I had a meeting at work at needed to be out the door within the next 30 mins, did they think it was feasible for me to be seen and out the door by then. Finally as I am waiting in the room and NP Amy is about to come in I hear one of the receptionists come running up to her to let her know I'm in a rush. I mean, at least whisper so I can't hear. Considering my appointment was at 10, my next meeting is at 11:30 in Berkeley, Â I've obviously given up hope of making it.I just found my interactions with them left me ruffled. Why can't Amy get the support she needs on mornings like this when she is obviously over booked??

Dr. Riley has been my OB/GYN for 15 years and delivered the second 2 of my 4 children. I so appreciate Dr. Riley's professionalism, care, kindness, and attentiveness. Zero bedside manner is how I would describe Dr Christine Riley. I've never had a doctor treat me so rudely. Awful! I wouldn't recommend this this doctor to anyone who works or has a life. Her office called and canceled my appointment 3 times. Â It must be nice to make your own hours, unfortunately, I don' have that luxury.

I have been a patient with Dr. Riley for 3 years now and I think she is a great doctor. I would recommend to anyone. She is extremely tentative to your need when you have an appointment with her. I was recommended to Dr. Riley when I was 30 weeks pregnant and had recently moved from Los Angeles. Â I met her NP, Amy during my first appointment who was very sweet and gentle. DON'T GO HERE. THIS PLACE JUST WANTS YOUR MONEY AND DOES NOT CARE ABOUT YOU. THIS IS A WARNING TO ALL MOMS OUT THERE! I was pregnant and had a miscarriage in my first trimester. Did not care, nor guided me about my diet and she said we will talk about it in my next visit. My second visit was with her nurse (not even with her) due to a yeast infection. I asked if I can see the baby, she said no. Well, I miscarried 4 days after that day, after their refusal for me to do an ultrasound to see if the baby is okay. She said there is no reason to think that the baby is NOT ok and I just need to relax! WHEN I DID, I LOST THE BABY! When I started bleeding, they said you cannot stop a miscarriage! I felt helpless, lost and was so heartbroken. I kept thinking if only Amy allowed me to see the baby that baby, who knows if that would have made a difference. Maybe she still has a heartbeat and I needed to rest. My story doesn't end there. We went to ER since my bleeding happened on the weekend and as anxious parents, we need to know if the baby will be okay. That Monday we saw Dr. Riley, her first statement was, why did you go to the ER? She kept on and on about how a miscarriage is not an emergency. Are you fre@king kidding me?! To you it's not, because obviously you don't give a shi@t! But when it is your own life and you want to know if that child is safe, of course if it is a damn emergency and we are paying for it so who cares! The next visit was even more worse. I brought my son with me during the checkup. I didn't have any choice and it was the only available appointment they had. Dr. Riley snapped and said, you know what I cannot work like this. I cannot work when your son is all over the place and you cannot control him.. etc. I snapped back and I said, well I didn't have a lot of choice so I have to take him with me. And I said, I already paid you for your service, so I don't know what you wanted to do about that. (I CAN'T BELIEVE I HAVE TO SAY THIS TO HER! HER NERVE FOR INSULTING ME!) She mellowed down after that but man, she is the coldest doctor I have ever met. It is as if she is not a woman, let alone a mom. Who the hell does she think she is to talk down on women as if she is way better. When I miscarried, she said she had 3 and she knows it is a bummer. That's all she said. In my head, just because you already went through this, doesn't make our pain less real or our needs less important. The more you should be understanding, compassionate and the more you should ensure it doesn't happen to us. SAVE YOUR BABY, DON'T GO HERE. Even my husband said, the doctor's a bitch! So heartless!

I have been a patient of Dr. Riley's for only 6 months and so far, me and my husband LOVE her. She is straight forward, funny, tentative and caring. Â I would recommend her to anyone.Her NP Amy is awesome! So sweet and makes you feel so comfortable.The office staff is also great! Overall, love this office!

Dr Riley was my OBGYN during my first pregnancy. Â After seven appointments she still didn't know my name and by the seventh month she still asked me if I was having a boy or girl. Â She always acted like it was the first time she had seen me. I understand that she sees a lot of patients, but having a baby is a pretty intimate experience and you should not feel like you are at a drive up window at McDonald's. Â I knew that I should have changed Drs pretty early on but I didn't because I kept thinking things would get better. Â By the eighth month I knew she was not the right Doctor for me but it was too late. Â I had a feeling that she wouldn't be there for the delivery and I was right. Â The morning I was admitted she called in sick and a different Dr delivered my baby. The next morning Dr Riley visited me in the hospital. Â I felt like it was more of a formality and putting a check in a box than a caring visit. Â Even though I tore pretty bad during delivery and was in a lot of pain, she did not do any kind of examination of me and she gave me no instructions or advice. Â When she left my husband and I turned to each other and laughed. Â We were both thinking the same thing - first - that her visit was a complete waste of our time and second - that it must have been a criteria that she had to visit in order to get paid. Â I did some research on how she gets paid because I was pretty upset about the situation. What I found is that she gets paid a package price regardless of whether she delivers your baby or not. Bottom line - if you care about having a trusting relationship with your OB go to someone else.

I was a patient of Dr Riley for several years and I would not recommend her to any patient that gets worried easily. Â If you are seeing her for just normal GYN visits she is just ok. Â However if you need a kind, loving, caring doctor keep on looking. Â Since she is a solo practice she will not have the time to answer questions and concerns. Â Her staff doesnt bother to tell you that your insurance most likely wont pay for it. Â Leaving you a nice large bill to pay off.

They don't come any better than Dr. Riley! Â I was lucky enough to be referred to her after moving to the Bay Area, and she helped me through all the craziness of back to back pregnancies. Â She has a wealth of information and is very knowledgeable, something I greatly appreciated as she calmly answered the never ending list of questions I seemed to always have in my hormone-induced state. Â Than you Dr. Riley!

I had recently moved to the area and was referred to Dr. Riley by a friend. She is a competent doctor but I would not recommend her to others. She is not particularly understanding of the anxiety that goes along with high risk pregnancies. And most importantly she refused to return my phone call after the birth when I had some difficulties breastfeeding. A lactation specialist suggested I take a medication that needed a prescription. When I called Dr. Riley to discuss she did not take my call and had her receptionist call me back to say that Dr. Riely did not believe in prescribing "X" medication. (which was not even the one I wanted to discuss!). Long short, she refused to discuss the situation at all and had a non medical staff member deliver the message. I did and I like her. However, I refuse to support that business so I will be going elsewhere.

I had a year of seeing several problematic primary care doctors (after my wonderful doctor retired). Finally my cardiologist said he would contact Dr. Kwon's office on my behalf, to see if I could be taken on as a patient. Well, his high opinion of Dr. Kwon is now my opinion. She is great personally and knowledgeable professionally. I recommended her to two of my friends, who also go to her, and they have the same high opnion of her.

Do not go to this facility. Â I went to dr kwan, and for one appt, I was charged $300. Â I have a fancy ppo health insurance plan and never was I charged this much for one appt!!! Â When I called them they were not willing to budge on how they billed me. Â They billed me for an advanced visit, even though my appt was only 30 min. Â Very frustrating

Just another "all in one" establishment pretending to deliver care.Went to Dr. Kwon for a routine check-up. Ended up discussing another preexisting condition most of the time. Little to nothing was done in terms of a routine check-up.Got a blood test ordered. Guess what? It only tested items for the preexisting condition. NO lipid panel. NO blood sugar.Dr. Kwon actually says she usually doesn't bother testing for these, since if you are young enough she is only going to recommend diet and exercise anyway....but personally, I would like to know if I am pre-diabetic etc...So...I had to ask Dr. Kwon for another lab order for lipids and blood sugar. Â I had to wake up early again. Skip breakfast again. And get blood draw AGAIN!To make things even worse, Dr. Kwon prescribed a medicine that made things worse, and a simple over the counter solution solved it. Really wish I had just done things on my own.So in the end:1. I did not get the physical I asked for and had to pay $25 for an "office visit". None of that was explained to me. Just the usual: We bill you for what we feel like after the fact.2. I had to get my blood tested twice, each time there was another $25 copay3. I am out $75 in what should have been a completely covered routine yearly physicalSutter Health (and Kaiser too) like to put on the face of being progressive medical establishments, but to me, they now represent textbook examples of what NOT TO DO in medicine.How are we meant to take care of our health, if all you do is take blood pressure, temperature, and chat with us at physicals? Even a lipid panel and blood sugar are not enough in terms of diagnostics, but Sutter Health will not even order these. What about liver enzymes, thyroid, and other important biomarkers? I rarely shout on the internet, but:IF YOU CARE ABOUT YOUR HEALTH AND PREVENTING DISEASE, PLEASE GO ELSEWHERE!

Came in with stomach pain, she said "I don't know what it is, maybe take some ibuprofen", billed me $350 for like a 5 minute conversation. Dr. Kwon is a great primary care Physician. Very pleased with her and her staff. I recently had a physical as well as pre-op with Dr.Kwon and found her helpful
Dr. Kwon is awesome. Kind, patient, and knowledgeable.
Dr. Kwon is a wonderful, caring physician. Â My family and I have only had positive experiences with her and her staff.

Dr. Pickle is, without hesitation, one of the best family doctors around. She combines deep clinical expertise with a holistic view of a patient's life, making sure each facet is in harmony. Definitely a great doctor to have by your side as you navigate life!

Dr. Pickle is amazing best dr I ever had and I'm keeping her! She actually listens to me and that's unfortunately hard to find! What a horrible, horrible "doctor"! Â She completely disregards your previous medical history (incl. tests) and insists it is all "in your head." Â Extremely strong pusher of psychiatric meds. Very bad experience. Front office was disorganized. I was clear what I wanted to accomplish with my appointment when I made it. Amazing doctor. She listened to my concerns, was very personable , super competent, and Â up on the latest clinical literature. Â If my family lived in SF I would ask them to see Dr Pickle as their PCP.

Have really enjoyed partnering with Dr. Pickle on my health concerns. Â I find that she is not rushed and takes a measured approach to healthcare - she only prescribes when absolutely necessary. Â Her office is conveniently located close to mine in the financial district.

I strongly advise that you chose another doctor. I was using modest amounts of coffee, alcohol, and nicotine to kill the time while confined to a chair with a badly damaged ankle. When the ankle healed I stopped all 3 simultaneously and suffered the expected withdrawal symptoms, and on the 4th day I was still experiencing an uncomfortable feeling of dread, so I called the terrific Dr. Jonathan Lee, hoping to get a mild sedative prescribed to cool my brain off for the last couple days while my body adjusted.Dr. Lee wasn't available, but Dr. Pickle took me on short notice. Instead of the half dozen Valium I was hoping for, she ordered an expensive ultrasound for me and prescribed 90 doses of Gabapentin, which got me stoned (remember I was trying to purge) as well as an evil drug called Naltrexone, which freaked me out , and Clonondine (probably the only one I needed), which she then told me not to take. She also suggested vaping cannibis.The ultrasound was ostensibly to check out for liver damage, but it had already been examined during a colonoscopy/endoscopy 6 months before and found to be okay.Lastly, she called me in for another session in which the largely spent talking about my diet although I have access to a dietician from my health care provider and I eat well, anyway. A complete waste of time, but that didn't stop her from scheduling a one hour appointment, for no evident reason, which I canceled later.By the time I got wise to her, Dr. Pickle had managed to rack up bills to at least $2,000, mostly paid by Medicare (I'm 66) and Blue Shield, but still over $500 to me, and I'm a very low income social security guy. I've never sued a doctor before, but I will file a Small Claims action against her as well as a complaint with the California Medical Review Board. I really think that I was considerably worse off after Dr. Pickle's treatment than I was before. Gabapentin just stupefies you and is very habit forming, Naltrexone is used for drug addicts and alcohol abusers, of which I was neither. Look 'em up on Wiki.I opened up a Yelp account just to warn people about Dr. Pickle. I gave her a chance to explain her bizarre treatment, but she has declined to comment. I'll take the opportunity to praise Dr. Lee and Dr. Robert Elston, the gastroenterologist who scoped me and examined my liver, and Dr. Marina McGiver, who first diagnosed the anemia which lead to the feinting that first caused my injury and pointed out a bad mistake I made trying to self-treat myself. All will get 5 stars, but if you like getting stoned and freaked out by prescription drugs, fasting, taking tests normally used for pregnancy, wasting time, and paying exorbitant bills, look no further than Dr. Lara Pickle!

just moved here from Florida and had hard time finding a new doctor I have several health issues and finally found dr pickle, outstanding service from staff and she has a great manner and well suited to handle complex situation's, spent all the time needed to put together a solid plan, I spent two years in Florida finding a great doc and was afraid I would not find a great one here I would highly recommend anyone to see her and to visit the office they make you feel better and treat you well always

I absolutely love coming here. The staff is always kind and caring regarding all matters. Doc Thompson and his staff are most kind and quick. Doc looks me in the eye when he talks to me,, and asks a bunch of ?????????s and than listens for as long as we need. They always get me in quickly. They used to be dismissive about stuff, but their nurse practitioners have changed and Mary Lynn is amazing and attentive. If it was possible to give them zero stars I would. Their billing department is a mess. They sent a bill twice to an address I haven't lived at for 3 years to which I never received. I have seen many medical providers throughout my life, and Mary Lynn Martin at Midtown Family Medicine is by far the best. First, appointments are easy to get, and it is not unusual for an appointment to last 30 minutes or even an hour. Second, her follow-up is second to none. I have received call backs as late as 7 p.m. Third, she is collaborative in her approach. She genuinely wants to know what I think, what is important to me. She is willing to consider whatever research I have found on the internet. Most importantly, I believe she really cares about me as a patient. I've had other practitioners that cared...when I was in front of them--but out of sight, out of mind. Not Mary Lynn Martin. Sometimes a few days after I have seen her, she will call, saying some version of "I've been thinking about your issue, and I wonder if we might try...." If she doesn't know the answer to something or is unfamiliar with an issue, she will say so, and then she will try to find the answer. I used to work at a medical school. We would have been thrilled to have someone like Mary Ann on our faculty to model and teach exceptional patient care. A really amazing person.

Midtown Family Medicine has a giant lie, in bold face, on its homepage. It says, "At Midtown Family Medicine, OUR PRIORITY IS YOU, our patient, not just your ailment." That is a lie. This doctor's office is a wreck. Â A coworker recommended that my boyfriend go here (to Dr. Thompson) since it was close to the house and my own doctor is a 25 minute drive away. Everyone in this office is fantastic! Â I've been seen by both Marcy and Dr. Thompson and both are incredible personable with great bedside manners. I had not given 5 stars previously only because I hadn't been seen by anyone in the office besides Marcy. Â I recently was seen by Dr. Thompson and he is equally as fabulous! I just relocated here from another state and had 2 scripts to fill, plus establish a PCP, and a couple acute issues. Dr. Danielle was absolutely amazing. If I could I would give 2 different ratings. For my husband, they are wonderful. Dr. Chapman could not be more helpful and willing to explain everything. RUN. Don't even think about it. I don't care how close it is to you. I don't care if it takes your insurance. Just no. You can read even MORE bad reviews on google reviews. I"m not wasting another minute of my time with this place. I felt a moral obligation to warn others though.

If I could do zero stars, I would. Â Do not go here unless you have 3 hours of your time to waste and to be told nothing while you are here. I see Dr Bollinger and I love her. She takes her time with you. I don't go often and she always reminds me I need to do my pap and gives me once over just make sure I don't have any obvious conditions. The reason I knocked of a star is because sometimes the wait can get a little long but this is probably a product of the time she takes with her patients so I can't gripe too much. I won't go anywhere else and I'd follow her anywhere.

I have been coming here since my days in high school, college and now Â through my adulthood. I'm 32 years old and been coming to Dr. Scott Kuennen. He builds a relationship with his patients and does an excellent job with his practice. He's very nice, listens to what you have to say, need, asks questions to make sure you are okay and he makes sure his patients are current with anything medically needed. I highly recommend this place. It's clean, fully staffed and has an online check in (paperwork, anything personal needed updated) for faster service before day of arrival. Nurses are amazing and makes one feel comfortable just before the doctor walks in. If you need a place for yourself or family, Dr. Scott Kuennen is who I highly recommend.

I work at a competing clinic in the city, so keep in mind giving a good review here doesn't help me in the slightest. But in all honesty, nothing, and I do really mean nothing would get me to switch to a different clinic short of this place closing its doors. Our entire household goes to this clinic. I see Dr. Delaney, fiance sees Dr. Chapman, and mother is now going here instead of KU Family Medicine, seeing Dr. Bollinger. However, EVERY doctor we've seen when our normal doctor isn't available has been nothing but professional and courteous. Just don't go in expecting the unrealistic.We actually drive further to go here, and for good reason. The doctors and all the staff are hands down the best. Now, some people on here have made the valid complaint of wait times. There are times where you will be waiting a while to be seen, but this is a very busy clinic (for good reason). Arrive early because you have to check in and complete paperwork, bring a book or a well-charged cell phone. People who are truly sicker will generally be seen first, this is the way medicine works! Same goes for being stuck on hold for the triage nurse. They are only one person, and they can only help one person at a time. It sucks, but the alternative is going to urgent care or the ER, which is usually a lot more expensive with a lot less care and compassion.There is full lab available on site, as well as radiology. There is a nice, well decorated and spacious waiting area with a dedicated children's area. Every time we've gone, the only time someone who arrived after us and went back before we did truly was in need to be seen first. When I had a serious issue with my stomach and bowels, I was seen that night and was able to see my doctor and get a plan of action set up, leading to being referred to an outside specialist. The staff always finds a way to try and get you in, and save for a few very human mistakes on getting a medication or two called in properly, have been completely wonderful to deal with!Now to address the naysayers... About the wait times, EVERY single time I have been here, the wait has been short. There has only ever been 2 times I had to wait more than 15 minutes in the lobby. Once was on my first time there due to filling out new patient paperwork (amazing... that takes time people...) and the other was for an injection nurse on a Saturday when the flu was going around the clinic and they were very short staffed (medical workers get exposed to everything and get sick too!). Each time, I was amazingly still in the back within 45 minutes.. and I've honestly never seen people wait longer than 30 minutes to be called back when I've gone there with family and waited for them to come back out. Even during the times when the lobby was completely full. You wait a long time, tell the front desk staff, because something has gotten lost in the shuffle. Communication is key.As for waiting in the room, yes, there are times where I've waited in the room for a while. But working in medicine, I've learned that people demand an hour of attention during their 15-minute appointment. They will come in with 1 complaint on the appointment and give the doctor a laundry list of issues the second they walk in the door. This means every other patient will be waiting. Doctors/nurses do not have time machines. If every patient does this, everything WILL run behind. At a certain point they HAVE to cut you off to see the next person. It's only fair to everyone.Calling for refills... you want a refill placed, yet you ignore the very clear message that states that if you need a refill, the PHARMACY has to be the one to place that call. Again, the standard operating procedure in medicine. Yet are surprised when you call and they don't refill it for you? Appointments... the phone very clearly also give you your number in line. 8 people ahead of you for the same department? It's going to take a little bit of time. People take time to schedule. it also takes time to find an appointment that works for both parties. That is why you are on hold. Arrived past your appointment... yep, you need to reschedule. Not their fault, it's YOURS. Period.Rude staff... I've never had a poor experience from the front desk staff, the doctors, the nurses... anyone. And I have personally apologized to them for people that at times are some of the rudest people I have ever seen in public. I have personally seen a patient cuss out the receptionists' over asking for their name and date of birth (which everyone is required to ask for in medicine to ensure we are working in the right chart). Respect given requires respect received.Lab result calls... Everyone in our household always seem to get their results called back. Also, it's easily accessible online through the portal at any time of day.tl;dr- OUR FAMILY LOVES THIS PLACE!!! You might have a small wait occasionally, but don't go after work or on a Monday morning/Friday evening.

Look somewhere else!All of the doctors that I have seen here have been great and the evening/weekend hours are convenient, but many of the auxiliary supports are a real pain.I have never been called back or seen a doctor at my scheduled appointment time. But glitches in the system mean that critical prescriptions are sometimes not approved without additional calls to both the clinic and the pharmacy. I don't believe the medical staff is to blame, but this has been a repeated issue for months and the staff has not been informed of a timeline for correction of the issue.Their automated call system is cumbersome and time consuming. Once again, automation might improve service in theory, but does in fact. Today I waited on hold for only a few minutes. This is the exception rather than the rule. Holds on the phone often last for an indeterminate period of time and sometimes the system circles me back around to the beginning without ever speaking to a human.To reiterate a positive point, the doctors and most of the nurses I have seen have been knowledgeable, accommodating, and friendly. But the rest of this clinic's issues make visiting more of a hassle than it's worth.
